data.md: The celestials and the great Rishis were all filled with joy and they cheerfully sang the praise of Indra. Then the celestials mustering together began to kill all the Daityas who grew dejected by the death of Vitra.

data.v: ते वध्यमानास्त्रिदशैस्तदानीं; समुद्रमेवाविविशुर्भयार्ताः । प्रविश्य चैवोदधिमप्रमेयं; झषाकुलं रत्नसमाकुलं च ।।
data.md: Struck with panic at the sight of the assembled celestials, they entered the fathomless ocean, full of fishes and alligators. They (the Danavas) assembled together with pride began to conspire for the destruction of the three worlds.

data.v: तदा स्म मन्त्रं सहिताः प्रचक्रु;स्त्रैलोक्यनाशार्थमभिस्मयन्तः । तत्र स्म केचिन्मतिनिश्चयज्ञा;स्तांस्तानुपायाननुवर्णयन्ति ।।
data.md: Some among them who were wise suggested some courses of action, each according to his own judgment.

data.v: तेषां तु तत्र क्रमकालयोगा;द्घोरा मतिश्चिन्तयतां बभूव । ये सन्ति विद्यातपसोपपन्ना;स्तेषां विनाशः प्रथमं तु कार्यः ।।
data.md: In course of time they made the fearful resolution that they should first destroy all persons' knowledge and ascetic virtues.

data.v: लोका हि सर्वे तपसा ध्रियन्ते; तस्मात्त्वरध्वं तपसः क्षयाय । ये सन्ति केचिद्धि वसुंधरायां; तपस्विनो धर्मविदश्च तज्ज्ञाः । तेषां वधः क्रियतां क्षिप्रमेव; तेषु प्रनष्टेषु जगत्प्रनष्टम् ।।
data.md: "The worlds are all supported by asceticism, therefore lose no time to destroy asceticism. All those men who are on earth endued with ascetic virtues and with the knowledge of the precepts of virtue and that of Brahma.

data.v: एवं हि सर्वे गतबुद्धिभावा; जगद्विनाशे परमप्रहृष्टाः । दुर्गं समाश्रित्य महोर्मिमन्तं; रत्नाकरं वरुणस्यालयं स्म ।।
data.md: Then they made the ocean, with the mountain, like waves, the abode of Varuna, their fort.

data.v: समुद्रं ते समाश्रित्य वारुणं निधिमम्भसाम् । कालेयाः संप्रवर्तन्त त्रैलोक्यस्य विनाशने ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : Living in the ocean, the abode of Varuna, the Kalkeyas began their operations for the destruction of the worlds.

data.v: ते रात्रौ समभिक्रुद्धा भक्षयन्ति सदा मुनीन् । आश्रमेषु च ये सन्ति पुन्येष्वायतनेषु च ।।
data.md: They began to devour in the night in anger the Rishis (they found) in the hermitages and in the holy spots.

data.v: वसिष्ठस्याश्रमे विप्रा भक्षितास्तैर्दुरात्मभिः । अशीतिशतमष्टौ च नव चान्ये तपस्विनः ।।
data.md: Those wicked-minded Daityas devoured one hundred and eighty Brahmanas and also ascetics in the hermitage of Vasishtha.

data.v: च्यवनस्याश्रमं गत्वा पुण्यं द्विजनिषेवितम् । फलमूलाशनानां हि मुनीनां भक्षितं शतम् ।।
data.md: Going to the sacred hermitage hermitage of Chayavana, frequented by the Brahmanas, they devoured one hundred Rishis who lived on fruits and roots.

data.v: एवं रात्रौ स्म कुर्वन्ति विविशुश्चार्णवं दिवा । भरद्वाजाश्रमे चैव नियता ब्रह्मचारिणः । वाय्वाहाराम्बुभक्षाश्च विंशतिः संनिपातिताः ।।
data.md: They thus acted during the night and during the day they entered into the sea. They devoured in the hermitage of Bharadvaja two Brahmanas of subdued soul and of Brahmachari life, living on air and water only. In this way did the Danavas one after another (invade) all the hermitages.

data.v: एवं क्रमेण सर्वांस्तानाश्रमान्दानवास्तदा । निशायां परिधावन्ति मत्ता भुजबलाश्रयात् । कालोपसृष्टाः कालेया घ्नन्तो द्विजगणान्बहून् ।।
data.md: Being intoxicated with prowess of arms and their lives nearly run out, the Kalkeyas destroyed many Brahmanas.

data.v: न चैनानन्वबुध्यन्त मनुजा मनुजोत्तम । एवं प्रवृत्तान्दैत्यांस्तांस्तापसेषु तपस्विषु ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, the Danavas acted in this way towards the ascetics in their ascetic retreats. Yet men could not discover them.

data.v: प्रभाते समदृश्यन्त नियताहारकर्शिताः । महीतलस्था मुनयः शरीरैर्गतजीवितैः ।।
data.md: Every morning people saw lying on the ground the dead bodies of Rishis who were emaciated for living on frugal diet.

data.v: क्षीणमांसैर्विरुधिरैर्विमज्जान्त्रैर्विसंधिभिः । आकीर्णैराचिता भूमिः शङ्खानामिव राशिभिः ।।
data.md: Many of those bodies were without flesh or blood. without entrails and with limbs separated from one another. Here and there lay heaps of bones like heaps of conch-shells.

data.v: कलशैर्विप्रविद्धैश्च स्रुवैर्भग्नैस्तथैव च । विकीर्णैरग्निहोत्रैश्च भूर्बभूव समावृता ।।
data.md: The earth was scattered over with the (sacrificial) contents of broken jars and shattered ladles for pouring libations of ghee and with the sacred fires kept with care by the ascetics.

data.v: निःस्वाध्यायवषट्कारं नष्टयज्ञोत्सवक्रियम् । जगदासीन्निरुत्साहं कालेयभयपीडितम् ।।
data.md: The universe, being afflicted with the terror of the Kalkeyas and being destitute of the Vedic studies, of the Vashats and the sacrificial festivals and religious rites, became very fearless.

data.v: एवं प्रक्षीयमाणाश्च मानवा मनुजेश्वर । आत्मत्राणपरा भीताः प्राद्रवन्त दिशो भयात् ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, when men began to perish in this way, the survivors fled for their lives in all directions.

data.v: केचिद्गुहाः प्रविविशुर्निर्झरांश्चापरे श्रिताः । अपरे मरणोद्विग्ना भयात्प्रानान्समुत्सृजन् ।।
data.md: Some fled to caverns and some behind mountain streams and springs and some through fear of death gave up their lives.

data.v: केचिदत्र महेष्वासाः शूराः परमदर्पिताः । मार्गमाणाः परं यत्नं दानवानां प्रचक्रिरे ।।
data.md: Those among them who were bow-men and heroes cheerfully went out and took great trouble of find out the Danavas.

data.v: न चैतानधिजग्मुस्ते समुद्रं समुपाश्रितान् । श्रमं जग्मुश्च परममाजग्मुः क्षयमेव च ।।
data.md: Failing to find them, for the Asuras had taken shelter in the bottom of the ocean, they came back to their homes greatly aggrieved.

data.v: जगत्युपशमं याते नष्टयज्ञोत्सवक्रिये । आजग्मुः परमामार्तिं त्रिदशा मनुजेश्वर ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, when the universe was being thus destroyed and when sacrificial festivals and religious rites were all destroyed, the celestials were filled with great afflictions.

data.v: समेत्य समहेन्द्राश्च भयान्मन्त्रं प्रचक्रिरे । नारायणं पुरस्कृत्य वैकुण्ठमपराजितम् ।।
data.md: Assembling all together with Indra in their midst, they consulted with one another out of fcar. They asked protection from the increate and exalted deity, Narayana.

data.v: ततो देवाः समेतास्ते तदोचुर्मधुसूदनम् । त्वं नः स्रष्टा च पाता च भर्ता च जगतः प्रभो । त्वया सृष्टमिदं सर्वं यच्चेङ्गं यच्च नेङ्गति ।।
data.md: “O lord, you are the creator, the protector and the destroyer of the universe as well as of ourselves. It is you who have created this universe with all its mobile creatures.

data.v: त्वया भूमिः पुरा नष्टा समुद्रात्पुष्करेक्षण । वाराहं रूपमास्थाय जगदर्थे समुद्धृता ।।
data.md: O lotus-eyed deity, it is you who in the days of yore assuming the form of a boar raised the sunken earth from the sea for the benefit of all creatures.

data.v: आदिदैत्यो महावीर्यो हिरण्यकशिपुस्त्वया । नारसिंहं वपुः कृत्वा सूदितः पुरुषोत्तम ।।
data.md: O foremost of Purushas, assuming the form of Narasimha (half man and half lion) you killed in the days of yore the ancient and greatly powerful Daityas, called Hiranayakashipu.

data.v: अवध्यः सर्वभूतानां बलिश्चापि महासुरः । वामनं वपुराश्रित्य त्रैलोक्याद्भ्रंशितस्त्वया ।।
data.md: There was a great Asura named Bali, incapable of being killed by any crcature. Assuming the form of a dwarf, you exiled him from the three worlds.

data.v: असुरश्च महेष्वासो जम्भ इत्यभिविश्रुतः । यज्ञक्षोभकरः क्रूरस्त्वयैव विनिपातितः ।।
data.md: It is by you that wicked Asura called Jambha who was a powerful bow-man and v.ho always obstructed sacrifices was killed.

data.v: एवमादीनि कर्माणि येषां संख्या न विद्यते । अस्माकं भयभीतानां त्वं गतिर्मधुसूदन ।।
data.md: Your acts are like those which, O slayer of Madhu, cannot be counted. You are the refuge of all who are afflicted with fear.

data.v: तस्मात्त्वां देव देवेश लोकार्थं ज्ञापयामहे । रक्ष लोकांश्च देवांश्च शक्रं च महतो भयात् ।।
data.md: O god of gods, it is for this we tell you what is our present trouble. Save the worlds, the celestials and Indra also from this great fear.

data.v: इतः प्रदानाद्वर्तन्ते प्रजाः सर्वाश्चतुर्विधाः । ता भाविता भावयन्ति हव्यकव्यैर्दिवौकसः ।।
data.md: The celestials said : All the four orders of creatures increase through your favour. They propitiate the dwellers of heaven with the offering of Habya and Kabya (sacrificial libations to the gods and oblations to the Pitris).

data.v: लोका ह्येवं वर्तयन्ति अन्योन्यं समुपाश्रिताः । त्वत्प्रसादान्निरुद्विग्नास्त्वयैव परिरक्षिताः ।।
data.md: Thus being protected by you and freed from troubles, people through your favour increase depending on one arrother. Now this great fear has overtaken the people. We do not know by whom the Brahmanas are killed at night.

data.v: इदं च समनुप्राप्तं लोकानां भयमुत्तमम् । न च जानीम केनेमे रात्रौ वध्यन्ति ब्राह्मणाः ।।
data.md: Thus being protected by you and freed from troubles, people through your favour increase depending on one arrother. Now this great fear has overtaken the people. We do not know by whom the Brahmanas are killed at night.

data.v: क्षीणेषु च ब्राह्मणेषु पृथिवी क्षयमेष्यति । ततः पृथिव्यां क्षीणायां त्रिदिवं क्षयमेष्यति ।।
data.md: If the Brahmanas are destroyed, the world will be also destroyed. If the world is destroyed, heaven itself will be destroyed.

data.v: त्वत्प्रसादान्महाबाहो लोकाः सर्वे जगत्पते । विनाशं नाधिगच्छेयुस्त्वया वै परिरक्षिताः ।।
data.md: O mighty armed lord of the universe, let not, through your favour, people, protected as they are by you, meet with destruction.

data.v: विदितं मे सुराः सर्वं प्रजानां क्षयकारणम् । भवतां चापि वक्ष्यामि शृणुध्वं विगतज्वराः ।।
data.md: Vishnu said: O celestials, I know the reason of the destruction of all creatures. I shall tell you all about it. Having your mind freed form anxiety listen to it.

data.v: कालेय इति विख्यातो गणः परमदारुणः । तैश्च वृत्रं समाश्रित्य जगत्सर्वं प्रबाधितम् ।।
data.md: There are a fearful class (of Danavas) wellknown by the name of Kalkeyas. Placing Vritra at their head, they devasted the Universe.

data.v: ते वृत्रं निहतं दृष्ट्वा सहस्राक्षेण धीमता । जीवितं परिरक्षन्तः प्रविष्टा वरुणालयम् ।।
data.md: Having seen Vritra killed by the greatly intelligent deity of one thousand eyes (Indra), they entered into the ocean) the abode of Varuna, to save their lives,

data.v: ते प्रविश्योदधिं घोरं नक्रग्राहसमाकुलम् । उत्सादनार्थं लोकानां रात्रौ घ्नन्ति मुनीनिह ।।
data.md: Having entered the fearful ocean full of sharks and crocodiles, they (now) kill the Rishis at night with the intention of exterminating all creatures.

data.v: न तु शक्याः क्षयं नेतुं समुद्राश्रयगा हि ते । समुद्रस्य क्षये बुद्धिर्भवद्भिः संप्रधार्यताम् । अगस्त्येन विना को हि शक्तोऽन्योऽर्णवशोषणे ।।
data.md: But they cannot be killed, as they have taken shelter under the sea. You should therefore find out some means to dry up the ocean.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचो देवा विष्णुना समुदाहृतम् । परमेष्ठिनमाज्ञाप्य अगस्त्यस्याश्रमं ययुः ।।
data.md: Having heard these words of Vishnu about the drying up of the ocean, they took the permission of Parameshti (Brahma) and went to the hermitage of Agastya.

data.v: तत्रापश्यन्महात्मानं वारुणिं दीप्ततेजसम् । उपास्यमानमृषिभिर्देवैरिव पितामहम् ।।
data.md: There they saw the high-souled son of Varuna, of blazing effulgence, waited upon by the Rishis, as Brahma is waited upon by the celestials.

data.v: तेऽभिगम्य महात्मानं मैत्रावरुणिमच्युतम् । आश्रमस्थं तपोराशिं कर्मभिः स्वैरभिष्टुवन् ।।
data.md: Going to the high-souled and undeteriorating son of Mitra and Varuna (Agastya) Seated in his hermitage as a man of ascetic merits, they sang his glory by reciting his deeds.

data.v: नहुषेणाभितप्तानां त्वं लोकानां गतिः पुरा । भ्रंशितश्च सुरैश्वर्याल्लोकार्थं लोककण्टकः ।।
data.md: The celestials said: You became in the days of yore the refuge of creatures when they were oppressed by Nahusha. Deprived of his heaven's affluence, he was thrown down, a thorn of the heaven as he was, from the celestials region.

data.v: क्रोधात्प्रवृद्धः सहसा भास्करस्य नगोत्तमः । वचस्तवानतिक्रामन्विन्ध्यः शैलो न वर्धते ।।
data.md: That foremnost of mountains Vindhya being angry with the sun, suddenly in the days of yore) began to increase its height, but he has ceased to increase, as he could not disobey your command.

data.v: तमसा चावृते लोके मृत्युनाभ्यर्दिताः प्रजाः । त्वामेव नाथमासाद्य निर्वृतिं परमां गताः ।।
data.md: When darkness covered the world, creatures were oppressed by death; but having got you as a protector, they obtained the greatest security.

data.v: अस्माकं भयभीतानां नित्यशो भगवान्गतिः । ततस्त्वार्ताः प्रयाचामस्त्वां वरं वरदो ह्यसि ।।
data.md: O exalted one, whenever we are beset with danger, it is you from whom we ask for a boon, for you always grant the boon asked of you.

data.v: किमर्थं सहसा विन्ध्यः प्रवृद्धः क्रोधमूर्छितः । एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं विस्तरेण महामुने ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : O great Rishi, I am desirous of hearing why Vindhya (mountain), made senseless with anger, suddenly began to increase its bulk.

data.v: अद्रिराजं महाशैलं मरुं कनकपर्वतम् । उदयास्तमये भानुः प्रदक्षिणमवर्तत ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : The sun between his rising and setting went round that king of mountains, that great golden mountain named Meru.

data.v: तं तु दृष्ट्वा तथा विन्ध्यः शैलः सूर्यमथाब्रवीत् । यथा हि मेरुर्भवता नित्यशः परिगम्यते । प्रदक्षिणं च क्रियते मामेवं कुरु भास्कर ।।
एवमुक्तस्ततः सूर्यः शैलेन्द्रं प्रत्यभाषत । नाहमात्मेच्छया शैल करोम्येनं प्रदक्षिणम् । एष मार्गः प्रदिष्टो मे येनेदं निर्मितं जगत् ।।
एवमुक्तस्ततः क्रोधात्प्रवृद्धः सहसाचलः । सूर्याचन्द्रमसोर्मार्गं रोद्धुमिच्छन्परंतप ।।
data.md: Having been thus addressed, the mountain, O chastiser of foes, desiring to obstruct the path of the sun and the moon, suddenly began to increase its bulk in anger.

data.v: ततो देवाः सहिताः सर्व एव; सेन्द्राः समागम्य महाद्रिराजम् । निवारयामासुरुपायतस्तं; न च स्म तेषां वचनं चकार ।।
data.md: Thereupon all the assembled celestials came to Vindhya, the great king of mountains and tried to dissuade him from what he was doing. But he did not heed their words.

data.v: अथाभिजग्मुर्मुनिमाश्रमस्थं; तपस्विनं धर्मभृतां वरिष्ठम् । अगस्त्यमत्यद्भुतवीर्यदीप्तं; तं चार्थमूचुः सहिताः सुरास्ते ।।
data.md: Then the assembled celestials all went to the Rishi living in his hermitage, that ascetic, that foremost of virtuous men, the wonderfully powerful Agastya; and they told him all.

data.v: सूर्याचन्द्रमसोर्मार्गं नक्षत्राणां गतिं तथा । शैलराजो वृणोत्येष विन्ध्यः क्रोधवशानुगः ।।
data.md: The celestials said: The king of mountains, Vindhya, giving way to anger, is obstructing the path of the sun and the moon and the course of the stars. O best of Brahimanas, O greatly exalted one, except you there is none who can prevent him from doing it.

data.v: तं निवारयितुं शक्तो नान्यः कश्चिद्द्विजोत्तम । ऋते त्वां हि महाभाग तस्मादेनं निवारय ।।
data.md: The celestials said: The king of mountains, Vindhya, giving way to anger, is obstructing the path of the sun and the moon and the course of the stars. O best of Brahimanas, O greatly exalted one, except you there is none who can prevent him from doing it.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं विप्रः सुराणां शैलमभ्यगात् । सोऽभिगम्याब्रवीद्विन्ध्यं सदारः समुपस्थितः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : Having heard the words of the celestials, the Brahmana went to the mountain. Going there with his wife, he spoke thus to Vindhya.

data.v: मार्गमिच्छाम्यहं दत्तं भवता पर्वतोत्तम । दक्षिणामभिगन्तास्मि दिशं कार्येण केनचित् ।।
data.md: "O foremost of mountains, I wish to have a path given to me by you, as I intend to go to the southern country for some purpose.

data.v: यावदागमनं मह्यं तावत्त्वं प्रतिपालय । निवृत्ते मयि शैलेन्द्र ततो वर्धस्व कामतः ।।
data.md: O king of mountains, wait till I return, you can then increase your bulk as much as you like."

data.v: एवं स समयं कृत्वा विन्ध्येनामित्रकर्शन । अद्यापि दक्षिणाद्देशाद्वारुणिर्न निवर्तते ।।
data.md: O chastiser of foes, having made this agreement with Vindhya, (he went away) and up to the present day the son of Varuna (Agastya) has not returned from the southern country.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथा विन्ध्यो न वर्धते । अगस्त्यस्य प्रभावेन यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि ।।
data.md: Thus have I narrated to you, as you asked me to do, why Vindhya does not increase its bulk on account of the prowess of Agastya.

data.v: कालेयास्तु यथा राजन्सुरैः सर्वैर्निषूदिताः । अगस्त्याद्वरमासाद्य तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ।।
data.md: O king, now hear how the Kalkeyas were destroyed by the celestials when they obtained their prayer from Agastya.

data.v: त्रिदशानां वचः श्रुत्वा मैत्रावरुणिरब्रवीत् । किमर्थमभियाताः स्थ वरं मत्तः किमिच्छथ । एवमुक्तास्ततस्तेन देवास्तं मुनिमब्रुवन् ।।
data.md: Having heard the words of the celestials, the son of Mitra and Varuna said, “Why have you come? What boon do you solicit from me?” Having been thus addressed, the celestials said to the Rishi.

data.v: एवं त्वयेच्छाम कृतं महर्षे; महार्णवं पीयमानं महात्मन् । ततो वधिष्याम सहानुबन्धा;न्कालेयसंज्ञान्सुरविद्विषस्तान् ।।
data.md: O "high-souled one, we desire this act to be done by you, namely to drink up the ocean. Then we shall be able to kill these enemies of the celestials, known by the name of Kalkeyas, along with their followers."

data.v: त्रिदशानां वचः श्रुत्वा तथेति मुनिरब्रवीत् । करिष्ये भवतां कामं लोकानां च महत्सुखम् ।।
data.md: Having heard the words of the celestials, the Rishi said, "So be it. I shall do what you desire and also that which would be beneficial to the world."

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा ततोऽगच्छत्समुद्रं सरितां पतिम् । ऋषिभिश्च तपःसिद्धैः सार्धं देवैश्च सुव्रतः ।।
data.md: O vow-observing man, having said this, he then went to the lord of rivers, the ocean, accompanied by the Rishis who had become successful in asceticism and by the celestials.

data.v: मनुष्योरगगन्धर्वयक्षकिंपुरुषास्तथा । अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानं द्रष्टुकामास्तदद्भुतम् ।।
data.md: Men, snakes, Gandharvas, Yakshas and Kinnaras followed the high-souled (Rishi), with the desire of seeing that wonderful feat.

data.v: ततोऽभ्यगच्छन्सहिताः समुद्रं भीमनिस्वनम् । नृत्यन्तमिव चोर्मीभिर्वल्गन्तमिव वायुना ।।
हसन्तमिव फेनौघैः स्खलन्तं कन्दरेषु च । नानाग्राहसमाकीर्णं नानाद्विजगणायुतम् ।।
data.md: They then all came to the fearfully roaring ocean which was as it were dancing with billows made by the winds and was, as it were laughing with masses of froth, created by the dashing of waves at the mountain cave. It was full of different water animals and birds.

data.v: अगस्त्यसहिता देवाः सगन्धर्वमहोरगाः । ऋषयश्च महाभागाः समासेदुर्महोदधिम् ।।
data.md: The celestials, the Gandharvas, the great Nagas, the greatly exalted Rishis, all came with Agastya to the great ocean.

data.v: समुद्रं स समासाद्य वारुणिर्भगवानृषिः । उवाच सहितान्देवानृषींश्चैव समागतान् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: Coming to the ocean, the exalted Rishi, the son of Varuna thus spoke to the assembled celestials and the Rishis, who had come with him.

data.v: एष लोकहितार्थं वै पिबामि वरुणालयम् । भवद्भिर्यदनुष्ठेयं तच्छीघ्रं संविधीयताम् ।।
data.md: "For the good of the world, I shall drink up this abode of Varuna (ocean). You should at once make the preparations which devolves upon you to make."

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं मैत्रावरुणिरच्युतः । समुद्रमपिबत्क्रुद्धः सर्वलोकस्य पश्यतः ।।
data.md: Having spoken these few words, the undeteriorating son of Mitra and Varuna began in wrath to drink up the ocean in the sight of all the world.

data.v: पीयमानं समुद्रं तु दृष्ट्वा देवाः सवासवाः । विस्मयं परमं जग्मुः स्तुतिभिश्चाप्यपूजयन् ।।
data.md: Seeing how the ocean was being drunk up, Indra and the other immortals were filled with great astonishment; and they began to adore him by reciting his praises.

data.v: त्वं नस्त्राता विधाता च लोकानां लोकभावनः । त्वत्प्रसादात्समुच्छेदं न गच्छेत्सामरं जगत् ।।
data.md: (They said) “O protector of the world you our Saviour and you are the creator of the world. Through your favour the universe with the immortals may be saved from extermination."

data.v: संपूज्यमानस्त्रिदशैर्महात्मा; गन्धर्वतूर्येषु नदत्सु सर्वशः । दिव्यैश्च पुष्पैरवकीर्यमाणो; महार्णवं निःसलिलं चकार ।।
data.md: Being thus worshipped by the celestials while the musical instruments of the Gandharvas played all around and celestials blossoms were showered on him, that highsouled (Rishi) made the great ocean waterless.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा कृतं निःसलिलं महार्णवं; सुराः समस्ताः परमप्रहृष्टाः । प्रगृह्य दिव्यानि वरायुधानि; तान्दानवाञ्जघ्नुरदीनसत्त्वाः ।।
data.md: Seeing the great ocean made waterless, all the celestials were filled with joy; and taking up various celestials weapons they began to kill the Danayas with courageous hearts.

data.v: ते वध्यमानास्त्रिदशैर्महात्मभि;र्महाबलैर्वेगिभिरुन्नदद्भिः । न सेहिरे वेगवतां महात्मनां; वेगं तदा धारयितुं दिवौकसाम् ।।
data.md: Being attacked by the high-souled and greatly powerful, swift-coursing and loudly roaring celestials, they (the Danavas) were unable to withstand the on set of those swift and courageous dwellers of heaven.

data.v: ते वध्यमानास्त्रिदशैर्दानवा भीमनिस्वनाः । चक्रुः सुतुमुलं युद्धं मुहूर्तमिव भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of the Bharata, those loudly roaring Danavas, being thus attacked by the celestials, fought a great battle for a moment.

data.v: ते पूर्वं तपसा दग्धा मुनिभिर्भावितात्मभिः । यतमानाः परं शक्त्या त्रिदशैर्विनिषूदिताः ।।
data.md: But they had been already burnt by the force of the penances of pure-souled Rishis (whom they had killed). Therefore though they tried their utmost, they were all killed by the celestials.

data.v: ते हेमनिष्काभरणाः कुण्डलाङ्गदधारिणः । निहत्य बह्वशोभन्त पुष्पिता इव किंशुकाः ।।

data.md: These are the beautiful and fragrant garlands entwined with silken threads. They belonged to him. Blazing in ascetic merits he scattered these garlands here and he then went back to his own hermitage.

data.v: गतेन तेनास्मि कृतो विचेता; गात्रं च मे संपरितप्यतीव । इच्छामि तस्यान्तिकमाशु गन्तुं; तं चेह नित्यं परिवर्तमानम् ।।
data.md: At his departure my heart has become sad and my body seems to be burning. I desire to go to him as soon as I can. I desire that he should always walk about here.

data.v: गच्छामि तस्यान्तिकमेव तात; का नाम सा व्रतचर्या च तस्य । इच्छाम्यहं चरितुं तेन सार्धं; यथा तपः स चरत्युग्रकर्मा ।।
data.md: O sire, I shall this very moment go to him. What is the name of the Brahmacharya that is practised by him? I desire to lead the same life with him, the same religious life led by that man of noble virtue.

data.v: रक्षांसि चैतानि चरन्ति पुत्र; रूपेण तेनाद्भुतदर्शनेन । अतुल्यरूपाण्यतिघोरवन्ति; विघ्नं सदा तपसश्चिन्तयन्ति ।।
data.md: Vibhandaka said: O son, they are Rakshashas. They walk about here in wonderfully beautiful forms. Their prowess is matchless and their beauty is extraordinary. They always think think upon obstructing asceticism.

data.v: सुरूपरूपाणि च तानि तात; प्रलोभयन्ते विविधैरुपायैः । सुखाच्च लोकाच्च निपातयन्ति; तान्युग्रकर्माणि मुनीन्वनेषु ।।
data.md: O child, assuming beautiful forms they allure (men) by various means. These fearful beings hurl the Rishis in the forest from the blissful regions.

data.v: न तानि सेवेत मुनिर्यतात्मा; सतां लोकान्प्रार्थयानः कथंचित् । कृत्वा विघ्नं तापसानां रमन्ते; पापाचारास्तपसस्तान्यपाप ।।
data.md: The self-controlled Rishis who desire to obtain the region of the righteous never serve them. Those sinful beings take pleasure in obstructing the practices of the ascetics and (therefore) the ascetics do not see them.

data.v: असज्जनेनाचरितानि पुत्र; पापान्यपेयानि मधूनि तानि । माल्यानि चैतानि न वै मुनीनां; स्मृतानि चित्रोज्ज्वलगन्धवन्ति ।।
data.md: O son, those are intoxicating liquors, they are drunk by unrighteous men and they are unworthy to be drunk (by good men). These fragrant, bright and many coloured garlands are not for the ascetics.

data.v: रक्षांसि तानीति निवार्य पुत्रं; विभाण्डकस्तां मृगयां बभूव । नासादयामास यदा त्र्यहेण; तदा स पर्याववृतेऽऽश्रमाय ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: Having forbidden his son by saying “They are Rakshashas," Vibhandaka went in search of her. When after three days' search he did not find her, he then returned to his hermitage.

data.v: यदा पुनः काश्यपो वै जगाम; फलान्याहर्तुं विधिना श्रामणेन । तदा पुनर्लोभयितुं जगाम; सा वेशयोषा मुनिमृश्यशृङ्गम् ।।
data.md: When again the son of Kashyapa went out to gather fruits, in the meanwhile, that courtesan again came to tempt the Rishi Rishyashringa.

data.v: दृष्ट्वैव तामृश्यशृङ्गः प्रहृष्टः; संभ्रान्तरूपोऽभ्यपतत्तदानीम् । प्रोवाच चैनां भवतोऽऽश्रमाय; गच्छाव यावन्न पिता ममैति ।।
data.md: As soon as Rishyashringa saw her, he became exceedingly glad and rushing towards her said “Let us go to your hermitage before my father returns.”

data.v: ततो राजन्काश्यपस्यैकपुत्रं; प्रवेश्य योगेन विमुच्य नावम् । प्रलोभयन्त्यो विविधैरुपायै;राजग्मुरङ्गाधिपतेः समीपम् ।।
data.md: O king, thereupon making the only son of Kashyapa enter the boat by clever means, she unmoored it. She delighted him by various means and brought him before the king of Anga.

data.v: संस्थाप्य तामाश्रमदर्शने तु; संतारितां नावमतीव शुभ्राम् । तीरादुपादाय तथैव चक्रे; राजाश्रमं नाम वनं विचित्रम् ।।
data.md: Taking the exceedingly white vessel from the water and placing it within the sight of the hermitage, she then made a beautiful forest, named “Floating Hermitage.”

data.v: अन्तःपुरे तं तु निवेश्य राजा; विभाण्डकस्यात्मजमेकपुत्रम् । ददर्श देवं सहसा प्रवृष्ट;मापूर्यमाणं च जगज्जलेन ।।
data.md: But the king kept the only son of Vibhandaka in the female apartments. Then he saw that rain was suddenly poured by heaven and the world was flooded with water.

data.v: स लोमपादः परिपूर्णकामः; सुतां ददावृश्यशृङ्गाय शान्ताम् । क्रोधप्रतीकारकरं च चक्रे; गोभिश्च मार्गेष्वभिकर्षणं च ।।
data.md: Having his desire fulfilled, Lomapada bestowed his daughter Santa on Rishvshrnga. And to appease the wrath of his father, caused kine to be placed on the roads and the fields to be tilled.

data.v: विभाण्डकस्याव्रजतः स राजा; पशून्प्रभूतान्पशुपांश्च वीरान् । समादिशत्पुत्रगृद्धी महर्षि;र्विभाण्डकः परिपृच्छेद्यदा वः ।।
स वक्तव्यः प्राञ्जलिभिर्भवद्भिः; पुत्रस्य ते पशवः कर्षणं च । किं ते प्रियं वै क्रियतां महर्षे; दासाः स्म सर्वे तव वाचि बद्धाः ।।
अथोपायात्स मुनिश्चण्डकोपः; स्वमाश्रमं मूलफलानि गृह्य । अन्वेषमाणश्च न तत्र पुत्रं; ददर्श चुक्रोध ततो भृशं सः ।।
data.md: In the meanwhile that greatly wrathful Rishi (Vibhandaka) returned to his hermitage after gathering fruits and roots. He did not find his son after a search and he became exceedingly angry.

data.v: ततः स कोपेन विदीर्यमाण; आशङ्कमानो नृपतेर्विधानम् । जगाम चम्पां प्रदिधक्षमाण;स्तमङ्गराजं विषयं च तस्य ।।
data.md: Thereupon he became inflamed with anger and thought it to be the doing of the king (of Anga). Having made up his mind to burn the king, his city and his whole country, he therefore went towards (the city of) Champa.

data.v: स वै श्रान्तः क्षुधितः काश्यपस्ता;न्घोषान्समासादितवान्समृद्धान् । गोपैश्च तैर्विधिवत्पूज्यमानो; राजेव तां रात्रिमुवास तत्र ।।
data.md: Fatigued and hungry the son of Kashyapa arrived at the settlements of cowherds, rich with cattle. He was greatly honoured and adored by the cow-herds and he passed the night there like a king.

data.v: संप्राप्य सत्कारमतीव तेभ्यः; प्रोवाच कस्य प्रथिताः स्थ सौम्याः । ऊचुस्ततस्तेऽभ्युपगम्य सर्वे; धनं तवेदं विहितं सुतस्य ।।
data.md: Having received very great hospitality from them, he asked them, “O cow-herds, to whom do you belong?” Thereupon they all came up to him and said, "All this wealth belongs to your son."

data.v: देशे तु देशे तु स पूज्यमान;स्तांश्चैव शृण्वन्मधुरान्प्रलापान् । प्रशान्तभूयिष्ठरजाः प्रहृष्टः; समाससादाङ्गपतिं पुरस्थम् ।।
data.md: He was thus honoured at different places and he heard similar pleasing words. Thus is anger was much appeased. He entered the city and came to the king of Anga.

data.v: संपूजितस्तेन नरर्षभेण; ददर्श पुत्रं दिवि देवं यथेन्द्रम् । शान्तां स्नुषां चैव ददर्श तत्र; सौदामिनीमुच्चरन्तीं यथैव ।।
data.md: Having been worshipped by that foremost of men (the king), he saw his son who looked like Indra in heaven. He saw there also his daughter-in-law Santa who looked like a flashing lightning

data.v: ग्रामांश्च घोषांश्च सुतं च दृष्ट्वा; शान्तां च शान्तोऽस्य परः स कोपः । चकार तस्मै परमं प्रसादं; विभाण्डको भूमिपतेर्नरेन्द्र ।।
data.md: Having seen the villages and the cow-pens belonging to his son and also having seen Santa, his great anger was appeased. O ruler of men, thereupon Vibhandaka expressed his great satisfaction with that ruler of earth.

data.v: स तत्र निक्षिप्य सुतं महर्षि;रुवाच सूर्याग्निसमप्रभावम् । जाते पुत्रे वनमेवाव्रजेथा; राज्ञः प्रियाण्यस्य सर्वाणि कृत्वा ।।
data.md: Keeping his son there, that great Rishi, as effulgent as the sun or the fire, said "Having done all that would please the king and having begotten a son, you must come to the forest."

data.v: स तद्वचः कृतवानृश्यशृङ्गो; ययौ च यत्रास्य पिता बभूव । शान्ता चैनं पर्यचरद्यथाव;त्खे रोहिणी सोममिवानुकूला ।।
data.md: Rishyashringa did what his father said and went back to the place where his father was. O ruler of men, Shanta obediently waited upon him as Rohini waits upon Soma.

data.v: अरुन्धती वा सुभगा वसिष्ठं; लोपामुद्रा वापि यथा ह्यगस्त्यम् । नलस्य वा दमयन्ती यथाभू;द्यथा शची वज्रधरस्य चैव ।।
data.md: O, king as the blessed Arundhati waits upon Vasishtha or as Lopamudra waited upon Agastya. She to Rishyashringa as Damayanti was to Nala or as Sachi was to the wielder of the Vajra (Indra).

data.v: नाडायनी चेन्द्रसेना यथैव; वश्या नित्यं मुद्गलस्याजमीढ । तथा शान्ता ऋश्यशृङ्गं वनस्थं; प्रीत्या युक्ता पर्यचरन्नरेन्द्र ।।
data.md: Or as Indrasena, the daughter of Narayana, was to Mudgala. O descendant of Ajamida, O ruler of men, thus did Shanta affectionately wait upon Rishyashringa in the forest.

data.v: तस्याश्रमः पुण्य एषो विभाति; महाह्रदं शोभयन्पुण्यकीर्तेः । अत्र स्नातः कृतकृत्यो विशुद्ध;स्तीर्थान्यन्यान्यनुसंयाहि राजन् ।।
data.md: This is the sacred hermitage that belonged to him. The great lake shows in beauty here, it has a holy fame. Bathing here get all your was desires fulfilled. O king, having purified yourself here, go to some other sacred Tirthas.

data.v: ततः प्रयातः कौशिक्याः पाण्डवो जनमेजय । आनुपूर्व्येण सर्वाणि जगामायतनान्युत ।।
स सागरं समासाद्य गङ्गायाः संगमे नृप । नदीशतानां पञ्चानां मध्ये चक्रे समाप्लवम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: O Janmejaya, thereupon the Pandavas started from the Kaushika and went, one after the other, to all the sacred shrines. O King, going to the sea where the Ganges mingles with it, he performed the sacred ceremony of a plunge in the centre of the five hundred rivers.

data.v: ततः समुद्रतीरेण जगाम वसुधाधिपः । भ्रातृभिः सहितो वीरः कलिङ्गान्प्रति भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, that ruler of earth, the hero, accompanied by his brothers then went along the shore of the ocean to the land of the Kalinga.

data.v: एते कलिङ्गाः कौन्तेय यत्र वैतरणी नदी । यत्रायजत धर्मोऽपि देवाञ्शरणमेत्य वै ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O son of Kunti, this is Kalinga where flows the river Vaitarani, where (on the banks of which) Dharma performed sacrifices under the protection of the celestials.

data.v: ऋषिभिः समुपायुक्तं यज्ञियं गिरिशोभितम् । उत्तरं तीरमेतद्धि सततं द्विजसेवितम् ।।
data.md: This is the Northern bank of the Vaitarani) always frequented by the Brahmanas, inhabited by the Rishis, suitable tur performning sacrifices and adorned with a hill.

data.v: समेन देवयानेन पथा स्वर्गमुपेयुषः । अत्र वै ऋषयोऽन्येऽपि पुरा क्रतुभिरीजिरे ।।
data.md: It rivals the path by which a virtuous man fit for going to heaven goes to the celestials region in the days of yore, the Rishis performed sacrifices at this spot.

data.v: अत्रैव रुद्रो राजेन्द्र पशुमादत्तवान्मखे । रुद्रः पशुं मानवेन्द्र भागोऽयमिति चाब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: O king of kings, here at this spot Rudra seized the sacrificial beast. O king of kings, he then exclaimed, “This is my share.

data.v: हृते पशौ तदा देवास्तमूचुर्भरतर्षभ । मा परस्वमभिद्रोग्धा मा धर्मान्सकलान्नशीः ।।
data.md: O best of the Bharata race, the (sacrificial) beasts being thus taken away, the celestials then thus spoke to him, “Do not cast covetous eyes on the property of others. Do not disregard all the righteous rules.”

data.v: ततः कल्याणरूपाभिर्वाग्भिस्ते रुद्रमस्तुवन् । इष्ट्या चैनं तर्पयित्वा मानयां चक्रिरे तदा ।।
data.md: They then addressed pleasing words of glorification to Rudra (Shiva). They gratified him with a sacrifice and they offered him suitable honours.

data.v: ततः स पशुमुत्सृज्य देवयानेन जग्मिवान् । अत्रानुवंशो रुद्रस्य तं निबोध युधिष्ठिर ।।
data.md: Thereupon giving up the beast, he went away by the path trodden by the celestials. O Yudhishthira, hear from me me what then happened to Rudra.

data.v: अयातयामं सर्वेभ्यो भागेभ्यो भागमुत्तमम् । देवाः संकल्पयामासुर्भयाद्रुद्रस्य शाश्वतम् ।।
data.md: The celestials from the fear of Rudra set apart for eternity the best portion of all shares (of a sacrifice) such as was fresh and not stale.

data.v: इमां गाथामत्र गायन्नपः स्पृशति यो नरः । देवयानस्तस्य पन्थाश्चक्षुश्चैव प्रकाशते ।।
data.md: The man, who bathes at this spot and recites this ancient story, sees with his human eyes the path that leads to the celestials region.

data.v: ततो वैतरणीं सर्वे पाण्डवा द्रौपदी तथा । अवतीर्य महाभागा तर्पयां चक्रिरे पितॄन् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Thereupon all the highly exalted Pandavas with Draupadi descended to the Vaitarani and offered oblations to the Pitris.

data.v: उपस्पृश्यैव भगवन्नस्यां नद्यां तपोधन । मानुषादस्मि विषयादपेतः पश्य लोमश ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : O Lomasha, behold, how great is the merit of a pious act! Having bathed in this spot with proper form, I seem no more to touch the world of men.

data.v: सर्वाँल्लोकान्प्रपश्यामि प्रसादात्तव सुव्रत । वैखानसानां जपतामेष शब्दो महात्मनाम् ।।
data.md: O vow-observing Rishi, through your grace I see all the regions. This is the sound of the recitations (of the Vedas) by the high-souled Rishis.

data.v: त्रिशतं वै सहस्राणि योजनानां युधिष्ठिर । यत्र ध्वनिं शृणोष्येनं तूष्णीमास्स्व विशां पते ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O Yudhishthira, O ruler of men, the place from which you hear this sound, is distant from here three hundred thousand yojanas. Keep quiet.

data.v: एतत्स्वयंभुवो राजन्वनं रम्यं प्रकाशते । यत्रायजत कौन्तेय विश्वकर्मा प्रतापवान् ।।
data.md: O king, this is the celestials forest of the self-create (Brahma) where, O king of kings, the powerful Vishvamitra-performed his sacrifices.

data.v: यस्मिन्यज्ञे हि भूर्दत्ता कश्यपाय महात्मने । सपर्वतवनोद्देशा दक्षिणा वै स्वयंभुवा ।।
data.md: In which sacrifices the self-create (Brahma) gave away to the illustrious Kashyapa, as Dakshina, this earth with all its mountains, rivers and countries.

data.v: अवासीदच्च कौन्तेय दत्तमात्रा मही तदा । उवाच चापि कुपिता लोकेश्वरमिदं प्रभुम् ।।
data.md: O son of Kunti, as soon as earth was given away, she became sad; and thus she spoke in anger to the exalted lord of the world, “O exalted one, you should not have given me away to any mortal. Your this giving me away would come to nothing, for I am going down to the nether world."

data.v: न मां मर्त्याय भगवन्कस्मैचिद्दातुमर्हसि । प्रदानं मोघमेतत्ते यास्याम्येषा रसातलम् ।।
data.md: O son of Kunti, as soon as earth was given away, she became sad; and thus she spoke in anger to the exalted lord of the world, “O exalted one, you should not have given me away to any mortal. Your this giving me away would come to nothing, for I am going down to the nether world."

data.v: विषीदन्तीं तु तां दृष्ट्वा कश्यपो भगवानृषिः । प्रसादयां बभूवाथ ततो भूमिं विशां पते ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth seeing the earth sad and despondent, the exalted Rishi, Kashyapa, gratified her by a propitiatory act.

data.v: ततः प्रसन्ना पृथिवी तपसा तस्य पाण्डव । पुनरुन्मज्ज्य सलिलाद्वेदीरूपा स्थिता बभौ ।।
data.md: O son of Pandu, thereupon the earth was gratified with his asceticism. She again rose from the water and remained as a sacrificial altar.

data.v: सैषा प्रकाशते राजन्वेदी संस्थानलक्षणा । आरुह्यात्र महाराज वीर्यवान्वै भविष्यसि ।।
data.md: O king, yonder before us is the spot with the distinct form of that sacred altar. O great king, ascending it, become great in prowess.

data.v: अहं च ते स्वस्त्ययनं प्रयोक्ष्ये; यथा त्वमेनामधिरोक्ष्यसेऽद्य । स्पृष्टा हि मर्त्येन ततः समुद्र;मेषा वेदी प्रविशत्याजमीढ ।।
data.md: When you will ascend it today, I shall perform the ceremony to avert all evils from you, for, O descendant of Ajainida, this altar here, as soon as it is touched by a mortal, goes down into the sea.

data.v: अग्निर्मित्रो योनिरापोऽथ देव्यो; विष्णो रेतस्त्वममृतस्य नाभिः । एवं ब्रुवन्पाण्डव सत्यवाक्यं; वेदीमिमां त्वं तरसाधिरोह ।।
data.md: "The fire, the sun, the organ of generation, water, the goddess, the seed of Vishnu, nectar and the navel of nectar. The god of fire is the organ that generated you (ocean). The earth is your body. Vishnu gave the seed that caused your being. You are the navel of nectar." O son of Pandu, you must recite the above words of truth and as you recite you must quickly ascend this altar. O Pandava, thus, these words of truth must be audibly recited; and while thus reciting them, one must plunge into this lord of rivers (ocean).

data.v: ततः कृतस्वस्त्ययनो महात्मा; युधिष्ठिरः सागरगामगच्छत् । कृत्वा च तच्छासनमस्य सर्वं; महेन्द्रमासाद्य निशामुवास ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Thereupon when the ceremony to avert evils had been completed, the high-souled Yudhishthira went into the sea. Having performed all that the Rishi (Lomasha) had ordered, he went to the Mahendra (mountain) and spent the night there.

data.v: स तत्र तामुषित्वैकां रजनीं पृथिवीपतिः । तापसानां परं चक्रे सत्कारं भ्रातृभिः सह ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : That lord of earth (Yudhishthira) lived there for one night. He with his brothers gave the highest honours to the ascetics.

data.v: लोमशश्चास्य तान्सर्वानाचख्यौ तत्र तापसान् । भृगूनङ्गिरसश्चैव वासिष्ठानथ काश्यपान् ।।
data.md: Lomasha told him there the names of all the ascetics, namely the Bhrigus, the Angiras, the Vasishthas and the Kashyapas.

data.v: तान्समेत्य स राजर्षिरभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिः । रामस्यानुचरं वीरमपृच्छदकृतव्रणम् ।।
data.md: The royal sage (Yudhishthira) paid a visit to them all and made obeisance to thein with joined hands. He then thus asked Akritavrana who was the follower of heroic (Parshu) Rama. "When will the illustrious (Parshu) Rama show himself to the ascetics here? I desire on that occasion to see that descendant of Bhrigu.

data.v: कदा नु रामो भगवांस्तापसान्दर्शयिष्यति । तेनैवाहं प्रसङ्गेन द्रष्टुमिच्छामि भार्गवम् ।।
data.md: The royal sage (Yudhishthira) paid a visit to them all and made obeisance to thein with joined hands. He then thus asked Akritavrana who was the follower of heroic (Parshu) Rama. "When will the illustrious (Parshu) Rama show himself to the ascetics here? I desire on that occasion to see that descendant of Bhrigu.

data.v: आयानेवासि विदितो रामस्य विदितात्मनः । प्रीतिस्त्वयि च रामस्य क्षिप्रं त्वां दर्शयिष्यति ।।
data.md: Akritavrana said : Your coming here is already known to Rama whose soul spontaneously knows everything. Rama is pleased with you. He will soon show himself to you.

data.v: चतुर्दशीमष्टमीं च रामं पश्यन्ति तापसाः । अस्यां रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां भवित्री च चतुर्दशी ।।
data.md: The ascetics see Rama on the fourteenth and eighth day of the lunar month. At the close of this night, the fourteenth day of the lunar course will set in.

data.v: भवाननुगतो वीरं जामदग्न्यं महाबलम् । प्रत्यक्षदर्शी सर्वस्य पूर्ववृत्तस्य कर्मणः ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: You are a follower of the mighty Rama, the son of Jamadagni; you must have personally scen all the (great) deeds performed by him in the days of yore.

data.v: स भवान्कथयत्वेतद्यथा रामेण निर्जिताः । आहवे क्षत्रियाः सर्वे कथं केन च हेतुना ।।
data.md: Therefore narrate to us today how the Kshatriyas were vanquished by him in battle and what was the cause of it.

data.v: कन्यकुब्जे महानासीत्पार्थिवः सुमहाबलः । गाधीति विश्रुतो लोके वनवासं जगाम सः ।।
वने तु तस्य वसतः कन्या जज्ञेऽप्सरःसमा । ऋचीको भार्गवस्तां च वरयामास भारत ।।
तमुवाच ततो राजा ब्राह्मणं संशितव्रतम् । उचितं नः कुले किंचित्पूर्वैर्यत्संप्रवर्तितम् ।।
एकतःश्यामकर्णानां पाण्डुराणां तरस्विनाम् । सहस्रं वाजिनां शुल्कमिति विद्धि द्विजोत्तम ।।
data.md: Thereupon Gadhi thus spoke to that Brahmana of rigid vows, "There is a custom in our family, established from the days of yore. O foremost of Brahmanas, know, the bridegroom must give a dowry of one thousand swift and brown coloured and black-eared horses.

data.v: न चापि भगवान्वाच्यो दीयतामिति भार्गव । देया मे दुहिता चेयं त्वद्विधाय महात्मने ।।
data.md: O son of Bhrigu, O exalted one, you cannot be asked to give (such a dowry). O exalted one, my daughter also cannot be refused (when asked by you). Do what is proper."

data.v: एकतःश्यामकर्णानां पाण्डुराणां तरस्विनाम् । दास्याम्यश्वसहस्रं ते मम भार्या सुतास्तु ते ।।
data.md: Richika said: I shall give you one thousand swift, browncoloured and black-eared horses. Let your daughter become my wife.

data.v: स तथेति प्रतिज्ञाय राजन्वरुणमब्रवीत् । एकतःश्यामकर्णानां पाण्डुराणां तरस्विनाम् । सहस्रं वाजिनामेकं शुल्कार्थं मे प्रदीयताम् ।।
data.md: Akritavrana said: O king, having thus promised, he (Rechika) thus spoke to Varuna, "Give me one thousand swift, brown-coloured and black-eared horses to be my dowry. Varuna immediately gave him one thousand (such) horses.

data.v: तस्मै प्रादात्सहस्रं वै वाजिनां वरुणस्तदा । तदश्वतीर्थं विख्यातमुत्थिता यत्र ते हयाः ।।
गङ्गायां कन्यकुब्जे वै ददौ सत्यवतीं तदा । ततो गाधिः सुतां तस्मै जन्याश्चासन्सुरास्तदा । लब्ध्वा हयसहस्रं तु तांश्च दृष्ट्वा दिवौकसः ।।
धर्मेण लब्ध्वा तां भार्यामृचीको द्विजसत्तमः । यथाकामं यथाजोषं तया रेमे सुमध्यया ।।
तं विवाहे कृते राजन्सभार्यमवलोककः । आजगाम भृगुश्रेष्ठः पुत्रं दृष्ट्वा ननन्द च ।।
data.md: O king, when the marriage ceremony was over, Bhrigu came to see his excellent son, who with his wife duly worshipped him; and seeing them he (Bhrigu) was greatly pleased.

data.v: भार्यापती तमासीनं गुरुं सुरगणार्चितम् । अर्चित्वा पर्युपासीनौ प्राञ्जली तस्थतुस्तदा ।।
data.md: When the preceptor (Bhrigu), the adored of all the celestials, was seated, the husband and wife after duly worshipping him with joined hands stood before him and waited for his command.

data.v: ततः स्नुषां स भगवान्प्रहृष्टो भृगुरब्रवीत् । वरं वृणीष्व सुभगे दाता ह्यस्मि तवेप्सितम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon the exalted Bhrigu with a delighted heart thus spoke to nis daughter-inlaw, “O blessed girl, ask for a boon. I ain ready to grant you what you desire."

data.v: सा वै प्रसादयामास तं गुरुं पुत्रकारणात् । आत्मनश्चैव मातुश्च प्रसादं च चकार सः ।।
data.md: She gratified the preceptor (Bhrigu) in order to obtain a son for herself and for her mother; and he too granted her desire.

data.v: ऋतौ त्वं चैव माता च स्नाते पुंसवनाय वै । आलिङ्गेतां पृथग्वृक्षौ साश्वत्थं त्वमुदुम्बरम् ।।
data.md: Bhrigu said : At the time of the season you and your mother after bathing at the proper time must einbrace two different trees, she as Ashvatha tree and you a fig tree.

data.v: आलिङ्गने तु ते राजंश्चक्रतुः स्म विपर्ययम् । कदाचिद्भृगुरागच्छत्तं च वेद विपर्ययम् ।।
अथोवाच महातेजा भृगुः सत्यवतीं स्नुषाम् । ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रवृत्तिर्वै तव पुत्रो भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Thereupon the greatly effulgent Bhrigu thus spoke to his daughter-in-law Satyavati, “O blessed girl, O maiden of lovely brow, you have taken the wrong Charu and embraced the wrong tree. It was your mother who have deceived you. Your son, though a Brahmana, will adopt the practices of the Kshatriyas.

data.v: क्षत्रियो ब्राह्मणाचारो मातुस्तव सुतो महान् । भविष्यति महावीर्यः साधूनां मार्गमास्थितः ।।
data.md: The mighty son of your mother, though a Kshatriya, will adopt the practices of a Brahmanas. His power will be great; he will tread the path of the righteous.

data.v: ततः प्रसादयामास श्वशुरं सा पुनः पुनः । न मे पुत्रो भवेदीदृक्कामं पौत्रो भवेदिति ।।
data.md: Thereupon she again and again adored her father-in-law, saying, "Let not my son be of this character; let my grandson be such."

data.v: एवमस्त्विति सा तेन पाण्डव प्रतिनन्दिता । जमदग्निं ततः पुत्रं सा जज्ञे काल आगते । तेजसा वर्चसा चैव युक्तं भार्गवनन्दनम् ।।
data.md: O son of Pandu, he replied, “Be it so;" and he was pleased to grant her prayer. When the proper time came, her son was born, named Jamadagani.

data.v: स वर्धमानस्तेजस्वी वेदस्याध्ययनेन वै । बहूनृषीन्महातेजाः पाण्डवेयात्यवर्तत ।।
data.md: This descendant of Bhrigu was endued with both splendour and grace. He grew in years as well as in strength; and he excelled all in the Vedas.

data.v: तं तु कृत्स्नो धनुर्वेदः प्रत्यभाद्भरतर्षभ । चतुर्विधानि चास्त्राणि भास्करोपमवर्चसम् ।।
data.md: O best of the Bharata race, the science of arms with four kinds of weapons rivalling the lustre of the sun spontaneously and without instruction came to him.

data.v: स वेदाध्ययने युक्तो जमदग्निर्महातपाः । तपस्तेपे ततो देवान्नियमाद्वशमानयत् ।।
data.md: Akritavrana said: The greatly ascetic Jamadagni devoted himself to the study of the Vedas. Thereupon he performed great austerities. Pursuing a methodical course of study, he got a mastery over the Vedas.

data.v: स प्रसेनजितं राजन्नधिगम्य नराधिपम् । रेणुकां वरयामास स च तस्मै ददौ नृपः ।।
data.md: O king, going to the ruler of men, Prasenjit, he asked Renuka in marriage; and the king bestowed her upon him.

data.v: रेणुकां त्वथ संप्राप्य भार्यां भार्गवनन्दनः । आश्रमस्थस्तया सार्धं तपस्तेपेऽनुकूलया ।।
data.md: Having got Renuka as his wife, that son of Bhrigu came with her to the hermitage; and assisted by her he began to practise asceticism.

data.v: तस्याः कुमाराश्चत्वारो जज्ञिरे रामपञ्चमाः । सर्वेषामजघन्यस्तु राम आसीज्जघन्यजः ।।
data.md: Four sons were born of her, Rama being the fifth. Though the youngest, Rama became superior to all in merit.

data.v: फलाहारेषु सर्वेषु गतेष्वथ सुतेषु वै । रेणुका स्नातुमगमत्कदाचिन्नियतव्रता ।।
data.md: Once upon a time when her sons had all gone away to gathering fruits, Renuka of rigid vows went to bathe. saw

data.v: सा तु चित्ररथं नाम मार्त्तिकावतकं नृपम् । ददर्श रेणुका राजन्नागच्छन्ती यदृच्छया ।।
data.md: O king, when, she was going at pleasure, Renuka Chitraratha, the king of Martikavata. Seeing the king adorned with garlands of lotus sporting in the water with his wives, Renuka was filled with desire.

data.v: क्रीडन्तं सलिले दृष्ट्वा सभार्यं पद्ममालिनम् । ऋद्धिमन्तं ततस्तस्य स्पृहयामास रेणुका ।।
data.md: O king, when, she was going at pleasure, Renuka Chitraratha, the king of Martikavata. Seeing the king adorned with garlands of lotus sporting in the water with his wives, Renuka was filled with desire.

data.v: व्यभिचारात्तु सा तस्मात्क्लिन्नाम्भसि विचेतना । प्रविवेशाश्रमं त्रस्ता तां वै भर्तान्वबुध्यत ।।
data.md: Being unable to control her this unlawful desire, she became polluted; she then returned to the hermitage much frightened at heart.

data.v: स तां दृष्ट्वा च्युतां धैर्याद्ब्राह्म्या लक्ष्म्या विवर्जिताम् । धिक्शब्देन महातेजा गर्हयामास वीर्यवान् ।।
data.md: Having seen her deprived of the lustre of chastity and full of giddiness, that greatly effulgent and mighty Rishi reproached her by crying “fie".

data.v: ततो ज्येष्ठो जामदग्न्यो रुमण्वान्नाम नामतः । आजगाम सुषेणश्च वसुर्विश्वावसुस्तथा ।।
data.md: There came then the eldest of Jamadagni's son, named Rumanvan and then Sushena, then Vasu and then Vishvavasu.

data.v: तानानुपूर्व्याद्भगवान्वधे मातुरचोदयत् । न च ते जातसंमोहाः किंचिदूचुर्विचेतसः ।।
data.md: The exalted Rishi one after the other asked them to kill their mother. But they were confounded and could not utter a word.

data.v: ततः शशाप तान्कोपात्ते शप्ताश्चेतनां जहुः । मृगपक्षिसधर्माणः क्षिप्रमासञ्जडोपमाः ।।
data.md: Then he cursed them in great anger; and having been thus cursed they lost their sense and became like inanimate objects. They became in conduct like beasts and birds.

data.v: ततो रामोऽभ्यगात्पश्चादाश्रमं परवीरहा । तमुवाच महामन्युर्जमदग्निर्महातपाः ।।
data.md: Then that slayer of hostile heroes, Rama, came to the hermitage last of all. To him said the greatly ascetic, the mighty armed Jamadagni,

data.v: जहीमां मातरं पापां मा च पुत्र व्यथां कृथाः । तत आदाय परशुं रामो मातुः शिरोऽहरत् ।।
data.md: “O son, kill your this sinful mother without the least compunction.” Thereupon Rama took up an axe and cut off his mother's head.

data.v: ततस्तस्य महाराज जमदग्नेर्महात्मनः । कोपो अगच्छत्सहसा प्रसन्नश्चाब्रवीदिदम् ।।
data.md: O great king, the anger of the illustrious Jamadagni was then suddenly appeased; and being much pleased he thus spoke,

data.v: ममेदं वचनात्तात कृतं ते कर्म दुष्करम् । वृणीष्व कामान्धर्मज्ञ यावतो वाञ्छसे हृदा ।।
स वव्रे मातुरुत्थानमस्मृतिं च वधस्य वै । पापेन तेन चास्पर्शं भ्रातॄणां प्रकृतिं तथा ।।
अप्रतिद्वन्द्वतां युद्धे दीर्घमायुश्च भारत । ददौ च सर्वान्कामांस्ताञ्जमदग्निर्महातपाः ।।
कदाचित्तु तथैवास्य विनिष्क्रान्ताः सुताः प्रभो । अथानूपपतिर्वीरः कार्तवीर्योऽभ्यवर्तत ।।
data.md: O lord, once at a time when his sons had again gone out (to gather fruits), the mighty son of Kirtavirya, the king of the country near the sea-shore, came to the hermitage.

data.v: तमाश्रमपदं प्राप्तमृषेर्भार्या समर्चयत् । स युद्धमदसंमत्तो नाभ्यनन्दत्तथार्चनम् ।।
data.md: When he came to the hermitage, he was hospitably received by the Rishi's wife. But proud of prowess, he was not pleased with the reception. By force and in defiance of all resistance, he seized and carried off from the hermitage the chief cow whose milk supplied the sacred Ghee, not at all heeding the loud lowing of her calf. And he wantongly pulled down the trees of the forest.

data.v: प्रमथ्य चाश्रमात्तस्माद्धोमधेन्वास्तदा बलात् । जहार वत्सं क्रोशन्त्या बभञ्ज च महाद्रुमान् ।।
data.md: When he came to the hermitage, he was hospitably received by the Rishi's wife. But proud of prowess, he was not pleased with the reception. By force and in defiance of all resistance, he seized and carried off from the hermitage the chief cow whose milk supplied the sacred Ghee, not at all heeding the loud lowing of her calf. And he wantongly pulled down the trees of the forest.

data.v: आगताय च रामाय तदाचष्ट पिता स्वयम् । गां च रोरूयतीं दृष्ट्वा कोपो रामं समाविशत् ।।
data.md: When Rama came home, his father told him all that had happened. And seeing the calf lowing piteously, Rama became exceedingly angry.

data.v: स मन्युवशमापन्नः कार्तवीर्यमुपाद्रवत् । तस्याथ युधि विक्रम्य भार्गवः परवीरहा ।।
data.md: He rushed towards the son of Kartavirya who was under the shadow of death. The slayer of the hostile heroes, the descendant of Bhrigu, displayed his prowess in battle. O king, with sharpened arrows which were shot from a beautiful bow, he cut down Arjuna's one thousand arms each of which was like a massive iron bolt (for barring the door).

data.v: चिच्छेद निशितैर्भल्लैर्बाहून्परिघसंनिभान् । सहस्रसंमितान्राजन्प्रगृह्य रुचिरं धनुः ।।
data.md: He rushed towards the son of Kartavirya who was under the shadow of death. The slayer of the hostile heroes, the descendant of Bhrigu, displayed his prowess in battle. O king, with sharpened arrows which were shot from a beautiful bow, he cut down Arjuna's one thousand arms each of which was like a massive iron bolt (for barring the door).

data.v: अर्जुनस्याथ दायादा रामेण कृतमन्यवः । आश्रमस्थं विना रामं जमदग्निमुपाद्रवन् ।।
ते तं जघ्नुर्महावीर्यमयुध्यन्तं तपस्विनम् । असकृद्राम रामेति विक्रोशन्तमनाथवत् ।।
कार्तवीर्यस्य पुत्रास्तु जमदग्निं युधिष्ठिर । घातयित्वा शरैर्जग्मुर्यथागतमरिंदमाः ।।
अपक्रान्तेषु चैतेषु जमदग्नौ तथागते । समित्पाणिरुपागच्छदाश्रमं भृगुनन्दनः ।।
स दृष्ट्वा पितरं वीरस्तथा मृत्युवशं गतम् । अनर्हन्तं तथाभूतं विललाप सुदुःखितः ।।
ममापराधात्तैः क्षुद्रैर्हतस्त्वं तात बालिशैः । कार्तवीर्यस्य दायादैर्वने मृग इवेषुभिः ।।
data.md: Rama said: O father, for my fault you have been killed like a deer in the forest with arrows by those mean and foolish wretches, the sons of Kirtavirya.

data.v: धर्मज्ञस्य कथं तात वर्तमानस्य सत्पथे । मृत्युरेवंविधो युक्तः सर्वभूतेष्वनागसः ।।
data.md: O father, virtuous and ever steady in the honest path as you were, how can fate permit that you should die in this way?

data.v: किं नु तैर्न कृतं पापं यैर्भवांस्तपसि स्थितः । अयुध्यमानो वृद्धः सन्हतः शरशतैः शितैः ।।
data.md: What an awful sin must have been committed by them who have with hundreds of arrows killed you who were ever engaged in asceticism, who were old and who were averse to fight with them.

data.v: किं नु ते तत्र वक्ष्यन्ति सचिवेषु सुहृत्सु च । अयुध्यमानं धर्मज्ञमेकं हत्वानपत्रपाः ।।
data.md: How can those shameless men speak of their (shameful) deed to their friends and relatives that they have killed virtuous man who was averse to fight.

data.v: विलप्यैवं स करुणं बहु नानाविधं नृप । प्रेतकार्याणि सर्वाणि पितुश्चक्रे महातपाः ।।
data.md: Avitavarna Said: O king, thus did he lamentin piteous manner; and then that great ascetic performed all the obsequies of his (deceased) father. That conqueror of hostile cities, Rama, then set fire (to the funeral pyre) of his, father, O descendant of Bharata and then took an oath to destroy all Kshatriyas.

data.v: ददाह पितरं चाग्नौ रामः परपुरंजयः । प्रतिजज्ञे वधं चापि सर्वक्षत्रस्य भारत ।।
data.md: Avitavarna Said: O king, thus did he lamentin piteous manner; and then that great ascetic performed all the obsequies of his (deceased) father. That conqueror of hostile cities, Rama, then set fire (to the funeral pyre) of his, father, O descendant of Bharata and then took an oath to destroy all Kshatriyas.

data.v: संक्रुद्धोऽतिबलः शूरः शस्त्रमादाय वीर्यवान् । जघ्निवान्कार्तवीर्यस्य सुतानेकोऽन्तकोपमः ।।
data.md: That mighty hero, greatly powerful in battle, equal to god of death himself, then took up weapons in anger; and alone he killed the sons of Kirtavirya.

data.v: तेषां चानुगता ये च क्षत्रियाः क्षत्रियर्षभ । तांश्च सर्वानवामृद्नाद्रामः प्रहरतां वरः ।।
data.md: O best of Kshatriyas, that foremost of all wielders of arms, Rama, destroyed all those Kshatriyas who were their followers.

data.v: त्रिःसप्तकृत्वः पृथिवीं कृत्वा निःक्षत्रियां प्रभुः । समन्तपञ्चके पञ्च चकार रुधिरह्रदान् ।।
data.md: Twenty-one times that lord made the earth Kshatriya-less. With their blood he made five lakes in Samantapanchaka.

data.v: स तेषु तर्पयामास पितॄन्भृगुकुलोद्वहः । साक्षाद्ददर्श चर्चीकं स च रामं न्यवारयत् ।।
data.md: That perpetuator of the Bhrigu race then offered there oblations to his ancestors. Then Rechika appeared to him in a visible form and stopped him.

data.v: ततो यज्ञेन महता जामदग्न्यः प्रतापवान् । तर्पयामास देवेन्द्रमृत्विग्भ्यश्च महीं ददौ ।।
data.md: Then the mighty son of Jamadagni offered libations to the lord of the celestials in a great sacrifice, in which he bestowed the earth of the Ritvijas.

data.v: वेदीं चाप्यददद्धैमीं कश्यपाय महात्मने । दशव्यामायतां कृत्वा नवोत्सेधां विशां पते ।।
data.md: O king, he built an altar made of gold which was ten vyamas (2O yards) in breadth and nine in height. He made a gift of it to the illustrious Kashyapa.

data.v: तां कश्यपस्यानुमते ब्राह्मणाः खण्डशस्तदा । व्यभजंस्तेन ते राजन्प्रख्याताः खाण्डवायनाः ।।
data.md: O king, then at the request of Kashyapa, the Brahmanas divided it into a number of shares and thus they came to be called the Khandavayanas (share-takers).

data.v: स प्रदाय महीं तस्मै कश्यपाय महात्मने । अस्मिन्महेन्द्रे शैलेन्द्रे वसत्यमितविक्रमः ।।
data.md: O king, having bestowed the earth on the illustrious Kashyapa, he engaged in severe austerities on the Mahendra, the foremost of mountains.

data.v: एवं वैरमभूत्तस्य क्षत्रियैर्लोकवासिभिः । पृथिवी चापि विजिता रामेणामिततेजसा ।।
data.md: Thus did hostility arise between him and the Kshatriyas that lived on the earth. The entire world was thus conquered by the imineasurably effulgent Rama.

data.v: ततश्चतुर्दशीं रामः समयेन महामनाः । दर्शयामास तान्विप्रान्धर्मराजं च सानुजम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Then on the fourteenth day of noon, the high-souled Rama at the proper hour appeared before the Brahinanas and Dharınaraja (Yudhishthira) with his younger brothers.

data.v: स तमानर्च राजेन्द्रो भ्रातृभिः सहितः प्रभुः । द्विजानां च परां पूजां चक्रे नृपतिसत्तमः ।।
data.md: O king of kings, that foremost of kings, that lord, then with his brothers offered highest worship to the Brahmanas; and they also worshipped him (Rama).

data.v: अर्चयित्वा जामदग्न्यं पूजितस्तेन चाभिभूः । महेन्द्र उष्य तां रात्रिं प्रययौ दक्षिणामुखः ।।
data.md: Having worshipped the son of Jamadagni and having received due respect from him, he (Yudhishthira) spent a night on the Mahendra (mountain) and he then started towards the south.

data.v: गच्छन्स तीर्थानि महानुभावः; पुण्यानि रम्याणि ददर्श राजा । सर्वाणि विप्रैरुपशोभितानि; क्वचित्क्वचिद्भारत सागरस्य ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : That magnanimous king then went to many sacred places and to various spots on the seashore, all adorned with the presence of Brahmanas. (He went to many) charming Tirthas and saw them.

data.v: स वृत्तवांस्तेषु कृताभिषेकः; सहानुजः पार्थिवपुत्रपौत्रः । समुद्रगां पुण्यतमां प्रशस्तां; जगाम पारिक्षित पाण्डुपुत्रः ।।
data.md: O son of Parikshit, bathing in them and distributing wealth, that son of Pandu with his younger brothers went to a greatly holy and broad river.

data.v: तत्रापि चाप्लुत्य महानुभावः; संतर्पयामास पितॄन्सुरांश्च । द्विजातिमुख्येषु धनं विसृज्य; गोदावरीं सागरगामगच्छत् ।।
data.md: That magnanimous king, bathing there, offered oblations to the Pitris and the celestials. Giving wealth to the foremost of Brahmanas, he then went to the ocean-going Godavari.

data.v: ततो विपाप्मा द्रविडेषु राज;न्समुद्रमासाद्य च लोकपुण्यम् । अगस्त्यतीर्थं च पवित्रपुण्यं; नारीतीर्थान्यथ वीरो ददर्श ।।
data.md: O king, then being cleansed. of his sins, he came to the sea in the Dravida. The hero then saw the greatly holy and sacred Agastya Tirtha and also the Nari Tirtha.

data.v: तत्रार्जुनस्याग्र्यधनुर्धरस्य; निशम्य तत्कर्म परैरसह्यम् । संपूज्यमानः परमर्षिसंघैः; परां मुदं पाण्डुसुतः स लेभे ।।
data.md: He heard here the story of the famous feat which was achieved by Arjuna, inat foremost of wielders of bow and which was beyond the power of man. Being praised by the great Rishis, the son of Pandu derived much pleasure.

data.v: स तेषु तीर्थेष्वभिषिक्तगात्रः; कृष्णासहायः सहितोऽनुजैश्च । संपूजयन्विक्रममर्जुनस्य; रेमे महीपालपतिः पृथिव्याम् ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, that lord of earth with Krishna (Draupadi) and his younger brothers, praising the prowess of Arjuna, then lived there in great happiness.

data.v: ततः सहस्राणि गवां प्रदाय; तीर्थेषु तेष्वम्बुधरोत्तमस्य । हृष्टः सह भ्रातृभिरर्जुनस्य; संकीर्तयामास गवां प्रदानम् ।।
data.md: He then gave away one thousand kine in those Tirthas situated on the shore of the excellent sea; and with his brothers he narrated with joy the account of Arjuna's bestowal of kine.

data.v: स तानि तीर्थानि च सागरस्य; पुण्यानि चान्यानि बहूनि राजन् । क्रमेण गच्छन्परिपूर्णकामः; शूर्पारकं पुण्यतमं ददर्श ।।
data.md: O king, he then went one after the other to all the Tirthas and also to other sacred places and thus his desires were fulfilled. He then saw the very sacred Shurparaka.

data.v: तत्रोदधेः कंचिदतीत्य देशं; ख्यातं पृथिव्यां वनमाससाद । तप्तं सुरैर्यत्र तपः पुरस्ता;दिष्टं तथा पुण्यतमैर्नरेन्द्रैः ।।
data.md: Then having crossed a certain tract on the sca coast, he came to a forest celebrated over the earth. In the days of yore the celestials performed asceticism there and the kings performed sacrifices.

data.v: स तत्र तामग्र्यधनुर्धरस्य; वेदीं ददर्शायतपीनबाहुः । ऋचीकपुत्रस्य तपस्विसंघैः; समावृतां पुण्यकृदर्चनीयाम् ।।
data.md: The long and lusty-armed hero saw the celebrated altar of Rechika's son, that foremost of all wielders of the bow. It was surrounded by many ascetics and was fit to be worshipped by the virtuous..

data.v: ततो वसूनां वसुधाधिपः स; मरुद्गणानां च तथाश्विनोश्च । वैवस्वतादित्यधनेश्वराणा;मिन्द्रस्य विष्णोः सवितुर्विभोश्च ।।
भगस्य चन्द्रस्य दिवाकरस्य; पतेरपां साध्यगणस्य चैव । धातुः पितॄणां च तथा महात्मा; रुद्रस्य राजन्सगणस्य चैव ।।
सरस्वत्याः सिद्धगणस्य चैव; पूष्णश्च ये चाप्यमरास्तथान्ये । पुण्यानि चाप्यायतनानि तेषां; ददर्श राजा सुमनोहराणि ।।
तेषूपवासान्विविधानुपोष्य; दत्त्वा च रत्नानि महाधनानि । तीर्थेषु सर्वेषु परिप्लुताङ्गः; पुनः स शूर्पारकमाजगाम ।।
data.md: The king observed many fasts in these Tirthas and gave away many costly gems. Having bathed his body in these holy places, he again came back to Shurparaka.

data.v: स तेन तीर्थेन तु सागरस्य; पुनः प्रयातः सह सोदरीयैः । द्विजैः पृथिव्यां प्रथितं महद्भि;स्तीर्थं प्रभासं समुपाजगाम ।।
data.md: He then with his brothers went along those Tirthas on the sea-coast; and he then came to Prabhasa, the fame of which had been spread by the Brahmanas all over the world.

data.v: तत्राभिषिक्तः पृथुलोहिताक्षः; सहानुजैर्देवगणान्पितॄंश्च । संतर्पयामास तथैव कृष्णा; ते चापि विप्राः सह लोमशेन ।।
data.md: The large and red-eyed hero, having bathed in it with his brothers, offered oblations to the celestials and the Pitris. So did Krishna (Draupadi) and all the Brahmanas with Lomasha.

data.v: स द्वादशाहं जलवायुभक्षः; कुर्वन्क्षपाहःसु तदाभिषेकम् । समन्ततोऽग्नीनुपदीपयित्वा; तेपे तपो धर्मभृतां वरिष्ठः ।।
data.md: For twelve days he lived on air and water. He performed ablutions for day and for night; he surrounded himself with fire kindled on all sides. Thus did that greatest of all virtuous men engaged himself in asceticism,

data.v: तमुग्रमास्थाय तपश्चरन्तं; शुश्राव रामश्च जनार्दनश्च । तौ सर्ववृष्णिप्रवरौ ससैन्यौ; युधिष्ठिरं जग्मतुराजमीढम् ।।
data.md: When he was thus practising the severe austerities, Rama and Janardana (Balarama and Krishna) heard of it. The two leaders of the Vrishnis accompanied with soldiers went to Yudhishthira, the descendant of Ajamidha.

data.v: ते वृष्णयः पाण्डुसुतान्समीक्ष्य; भूमौ शयानान्मलदिग्धगात्रान् । अनर्हतीं द्रौपदीं चापि दृष्ट्वा; सुदुःखिताश्चुक्रुशुरार्तनादम् ।।
data.md: The Vrishnis saw that the sons of Pandu lay down on the ground, their bodies being besmeared all over with dirt. Seeing Draupadi in a sad state, they were filled with grief and broke out into loud lamentations.

data.v: ततः स रामं च जनार्दनं च; कार्ष्णिं च साम्बं च शिनेश्च पौत्रम् । अन्यांश्च वृष्णीनुपगम्य पूजां; चक्रे यथाधर्ममदीनसत्त्वः ।।
data.md: The king, whom misfortune never could cast down, cordially met Rama and Krishna, Krishna's son Samba, the grandson of Shini and other Vrishni and paid to them all due honours.

data.v: ते चापि सर्वान्प्रतिपूज्य पार्थां;स्तैः सत्कृताः पाण्डुसुतैस्तथैव । युधिष्ठिरं संपरिवार्य राज;न्नुपाविशन्देवगणा यथेन्द्रम् ।।
data.md: They also paid due honours to the son of Pandu and were similarly honoured by him. () king, they sat round Yudhishthira as Indra is seated surrounded by the celestials.

data.v: तेषां स सर्वं चरितं परेषां; वने च वासं परमप्रतीतः । अस्त्रार्थमिन्द्रस्य गतं च पार्थं; कृष्णे शशंसामरराजपुत्रम् ।।
data.md: Being highly pleased, he narrated to them all the machinations of his enemies and how he lived in the forest and how Arjuna had gone to the abode of Indra; all this he narrated in great gladness of heart.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु ते तस्य वचः प्रतीता;स्तांश्चापि दृष्ट्वा सुकृशानतीव । नेत्रोद्भवं संमुमुचुर्दशार्हा; दुःखार्तिजं वारि महानुभावाः ।।
data.md: They were glad to learn all this from him. When they saw the Pandavas lean, the magnanimous and the majestic Vrishnis began to shed tears, which came out spontaneously from their eyes.

data.v: प्रभासतीर्थं संप्राप्य वृष्णयः पाण्डवास्तथा । किमकुर्वन्कथाश्चैषां कास्तत्रासंस्तपोधन ।।
