data.v: असंशयं माधव सत्यमेत;द्गृह्णीम ते वाक्यमदीनसत्त्व । स्वाभ्यां भुजाभ्यामजितां तु भूमिं; नेच्छेत्कुरूणामृषभः कथंचित् ।।
data.md: Krishna said: O descendant of Madhu, there is no doubt what you say is true. O greatly courageous hero, we accept your words. This foremost of Kurus, (Yudhishthira) does not desire to possess the land that is not won by his won prowess of arms.

data.v: न ह्येष कामान्न भयान्न लोभा;द्युधिष्ठिरो जातु जह्यात्स्वधर्मम् । भीमार्जुनौ चातिरथौ यमौ वा; तथैव कृष्णा द्रुपदात्मजेयम् ।।
data.md: Neither for the sake of pleasure, nor from fear, nor from covetousness would Yudhishthira ever abandon the rules of his (Kshatriya) order, nor would the two great carwarriors, Bhima and Arjuna, nor the twins (Nakula and Sahadeva), nor Krishna, the daughter of Drupada.

data.v: उभौ हि युद्धेऽप्रतिमौ पृथिव्यां; वृकोदरश्चैव धनंजयश्च । कस्मान्न कृत्स्नां पृथिवीं प्रशासे;न्माद्रीसुताभ्यां च पुरस्कृतोऽयम् ।।
data.md: Vrikodara (Bhima) and Dhananjaya (Arjuna) are both unrivalled in fight on earth. Why should he not rule over the earth when the two sons of Madri are there to espouse his cause?

data.v: यदा तु पाञ्चालपतिर्महात्मा; सकेकयश्चेदिपतिर्वयं च । योत्स्याम विक्रम्य परांस्तदा वै; सुयोधनस्त्यक्ष्यति जीवलोकम् ।।
data.md: When the illustrious king of Panchala together with the king of Kekaya and we also, would put forth our united strength, then the enemies of Yudhishthira would surely be annihilated.

data.v: नैतच्चित्रं माधव यद्ब्रवीषि; सत्यं तु मे रक्ष्यतमं न राज्यम् । कृष्णस्तु मां वेद यथावदेकः; कृष्णं च वेदाहमथो यथावत् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: O descendant of Madhu, there is nothing to be surprised that you should speak thus. To me truth is over my sovereignty. It is Krishna alone who knows what I am and it is I alone who know what Krishna is.

data.v: यदैव कालं पुरुषप्रवीरो; वेत्स्यत्ययं माधव विक्रमस्य । तदा रणे त्वं च शिनिप्रवीर; सुयोधनं जेष्यसि केशवश्च ।।
data.md: O descendant of Madhu, O foremost of the Sinis, when this best of men (Krishna) will perceive that the proper time is come for displaying courage, you and he will then defeat Suyodhana (Duryodhana).

data.v: प्रतिप्रयान्त्वद्य दशार्हवीरा; दृढोऽस्मि नाथैर्नरलोकनाथैः । धर्मेऽप्रमादं कुरुताप्रमेया; द्रष्टास्मि भूयः सुखिनः समेतान् ।।
data.md: Let the heroes of the Dasharaha race go back today. They are my patrons, these best of men have come here to visit me. O immeasurably powerful heroes, never fall off from the path of virtue. I shall see you again when you will be happily assembled together.

data.v: तेऽन्योन्यमामन्त्र्य तथाभिवाद्य; वृद्धान्परिष्वज्य शिशूंश्च सर्वान् । यदुप्रवीराः स्वगृहाणि जग्मू; राजापि तीर्थान्यनुसंचचार ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: Then after mutual greeting and obeisance to the seniors and embracing the youthful, those foremost of the Yadus and the sons of Pandu separated. The Yadus went home and they (the Pandavas, continued their journey to the Tirthas.

data.v: विसृज्य कृष्णं त्वथ धर्मराजो; विदर्भराजोपचितां सुतीर्थाम् । सुतेन सोमेन विमिश्रितोदां; ततः पयोष्णीं प्रति स ह्युवास ।।
data.md: Having parted with Krishna, Dharmaraja with his younger brothers and with Lomasha and with servants went to the sacred river Payoshini the landing place of which was constructed by the king of Vidharbha.

data.v: नृगेण यजमानेन सोमेनेह पुरंदरः । तर्पितः श्रूयते राजन्स तृप्तो मदमभ्यगात् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O King, when Nriga performed sacrifices and gratified Purandara (Indra) with the offer of Soma juice, he became very much gratified and was much pleased.

data.v: इह देवैः सहेन्द्रैर्हि प्रजापतिभिरेव च । इष्टं बहुविधैर्यज्ञैर्महद्भिर्भूरिदक्षिणैः ।।
data.md: Here did the celestials with Indra and Prajapati (Brahma) perform many sacrifices on a large scale and paid large Dakshinas to the ministering priests.

data.v: आमूर्तरयसश्चेह राजा वज्रधरं प्रभुम् । तर्पयामास सोमेन हयमेधेषु सप्तसु ।।
data.md: Here king Amurtarasya offered oblations of Soma to the wielder of Vajra (Indra) in seven great horse-sacrifices.

data.v: तस्य सप्तसु यज्ञेषु सर्वमासीद्धिरण्मयम् । वानस्पत्यं च भौमं च यद्द्रव्यं नियतं मखे ।।
data.md: The articles which in other sacrificial rites are uniformly made of timber, wood and of earth were all made of gold in these seven sacrifices.

data.v: तेष्वेव चास्य यज्ञेषु प्रयोगाः सप्त विश्रुताः । सप्तैकैकस्य यूपस्य चषालाश्चोपरि स्थिताः ।।
तस्य स्म यूपान्यज्ञेषु भ्राजमानान्हिरण्मयान् । स्वयमुत्थापयामासुर्देवाः सेन्द्रा युधिष्ठिर ।।
तेषु तस्य मखाग्र्येषु गयस्य पृथिवीपतेः । अमाद्यदिन्द्रः सोमेन दक्षिणाभिर्द्विजातयः ।।
सिकता वा यथा लोके यथा वा दिवि तारकाः । यथा वा वर्षतो धारा असंख्येयाश्च केनचित् ।।
data.md: As the sand-grains on earth, as stars in the firmament, as the rain drops when it rains cannot be counted. So the wealth that Gaya gave away could not be counted.

data.v: तथैव तदसंख्येयं धनं यत्प्रददौ गयः । सदस्येभ्यो महाराज तेषु यज्ञेषु सप्तसु ।।
data.md: As the sand-grains on earth, as stars in the firmament, as the rain drops when it rains cannot be counted. So the wealth that Gaya gave away could not be counted.

data.v: भवेत्संख्येयमेतद्वै यदेतत्परिकीर्तितम् । न सा शक्या तु संख्यातुं दक्षिणा दक्षिणावतः ।।
data.md: O great king, even the above mentioned objects might be counted, but the Dakshinas bestowed on the priests in those seven sacrifices could not be counted. Its largeness exceeded all that was known before.

data.v: हिरण्मयीभिर्गोभिश्च कृताभिर्विश्वकर्मणा । ब्राह्मणांस्तर्पयामास नानादिग्भ्यः समागतान् ।।
data.md: The images of the goddess of speech were made of gold by Vishvakarma himself. The king gratified the Brahmanas by presenting them to those priests who came there from all directions. O king, when Gaya performed his sacrifices, he erected sacrificial stakes at so many places that little space was left (uncovered) on earth.

data.v: अल्पावशेषा पृथिवी चैत्यैरासीन्महात्मनः । गयस्य यजमानस्य तत्र तत्र विशां पते ।।
स लोकान्प्राप्तवानैन्द्रान्कर्मणा तेन भारत । सलोकतां तस्य गच्छेत्पयोष्ण्यां य उपस्पृशेत् ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, he obtained the region of Indra by his that act. He who bathes in the Payoshini goes to the region obtained by him.

data.v: तस्मात्त्वमत्र राजेन्द्र भ्रातृभिः सहितोऽनघ । उपस्पृश्य महीपाल धूतपाप्मा भविष्यसि ।।
data.md: Therefore, O king of kings, O undeteriorating one, O protector of earth, you and your brothers should bathe in this river; and then you will be freed from all sins.

data.v: स पयोष्ण्यां नरश्रेष्ठः स्नात्वा वै भ्रातृभिः सह । वैडूर्यपर्वतं चैव नर्मदां च महानदीम् । समाजगाम तेजस्वी भ्रातृभिः सहितोऽनघः ।।
ततोऽस्य सर्वाण्याचख्यौ लोमशो भगवानृषिः । तीर्थानि रमणीयानि तत्र तत्र विशां पते ।।
यथायोगं यथाप्रीति प्रययौ भ्रातृभिः सह । ददमानोऽसकृद्वित्तं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः सहस्रशः ।।
देवानामेति कौन्तेय तथा राज्ञां सलोकताम् । वैडूर्यपर्वतं दृष्ट्वा नर्मदामवतीर्य च ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O son of Kunti, seeing the Vaidurya mountain and bathing in the Narmada, one obtains the region of the celestials and the kings.

data.v: संधिरेष नरश्रेष्ठ त्रेताया द्वापरस्य च । एतमासाद्य कौन्तेय सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, O son of Kunti, this is the junction of Treta and Kali (ages); this is the time when a person is cleansed of all his sins.

data.v: एष शर्यातियज्ञस्य देशस्तात प्रकाशते । साक्षाद्यत्रापिबत्सोममश्विभ्यां सह कौशिकः ।।
data.md: O child, this is the place where Sharyati performed his sacrifice. Kaushika (Indra) with Ashvins appeared here in their visible forms and drank the Soma (juice).

data.v: चुकोप भार्गवश्चापि महेन्द्रस्य महातपाः । संस्तम्भयामास च तं वासवं च्यवनः प्रभुः । सुकन्यां चापि भार्यां स राजपुत्रीमिवाप्तवान् ।।
data.md: The greatly ascetic, the descendant of Bhrigu, was filled with anger against Indra. The lord Chyavana paralyzed Indra and obtained the princess Sukanya as his wife.

data.v: कथं विष्टम्भितस्तेन भगवान्पाकशासनः । किमर्थं भार्गवश्चापि कोपं चक्रे महातपाः ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: Why the exalted chastiser of Paka, Indra, was paralyzed and the great ascetic, the descendant of Bhrigu got angry against him?

data.v: नासत्यौ च कथं ब्रह्मन्कृतवान्सोमपीथिनौ । एतत्सर्वं यथावृत्तमाख्यातु भगवान्मम ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, why he made the Ashvins, the drinkers of Soma? O exalted one, narrate all this to me in detail.

data.v: भृगोर्महर्षेः पुत्रोऽभूच्च्यवनो नाम भार्गवः । समीपे सरसः सोऽस्य तपस्तेपे महाद्युतिः ।।
स्थाणुभूतो महातेजा वीरस्थानेन पाण्डव । अतिष्ठत्सुबहून्कालानेकदेशे विशां पते ।।
स वल्मीकोऽभवदृषिर्लताभिरभिसंवृतः । कालेन महता राजन्समाकीर्णः पिपीलिकैः ।।
data.md: O king, after the lapse of a long time he was covered with an ant-hill which was in its turn covered with creepers. Crowds of ants enveloped him.

data.v: तथा स संवृतो धीमान्मृत्पिण्ड इव सर्वशः । तप्यति स्म तपो राजन्वल्मीकेन समावृतः ।।
data.md: Covered all over with ants and looking like a heap of earth, that greatly intelligent one performed severe austerities.

data.v: अथ दीर्घस्य कालस्य शर्यातिर्नाम पार्थिवः । आजगाम सरो रम्यं विहर्तुमिदमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Then after the lapse of a long time the king named Sharyati came to sport in this charming and excellent lake.

data.v: तस्य स्त्रीणां सहस्राणि चत्वार्यासन्परिग्रहः । एकैव च सुता शुभ्रा सुकन्या नाम भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, with him were four thousand women, all wedded to him. There was also with him his daughter of beautiful brows, named Sukanya.

data.v: सा सखीभिः परिवृता सर्वाभरणभूषिता । चङ्क्रम्यमाणा वल्मीकं भार्गवस्य समासदत् ।।
data.md: Surrounded by her companions and adorned with beautiful ornaments, she came to the anthill within which Bhrigu's son was seated.

data.v: सा चैव सुदती तत्र पश्यमाना मनोरमान् । वनस्पतीन्विचिन्वन्ती विजहार सखीवृता ।।
data.md: Accompanied by her maids, she began to sport there, seeing the beautiful scenery and looking at the large trees that stood in the forest.

data.v: रूपेण वयसा चैव मदनेन मदेन च । बभञ्ज वनवृक्षाणां शाखाः परमपुष्पिताः ।।
data.md: She was handsome, she was young, she was amorous and she was frolic-some. She began to break the trees that were full of blossoms, The intelligent son of Bhrigu saw her alone without her maids. Adorned with ornaments and clad in one cloth she was wandering about in the forest) like a flash of lightning.

data.v: तां सखीरहितामेकामेकवस्त्रामलंकृताम् । ददर्श भार्गवो धीमांश्चरन्तीमिव विद्युतम् ।।
data.md: She was handsome, she was young, she was amorous and she was frolic-some. She began to break the trees that were full of blossoms, The intelligent son of Bhrigu saw her alone without her maids. Adorned with ornaments and clad in one cloth she was wandering about in the forest) like a flash of lightning.

data.v: तां पश्यमानो विजने स रेमे परमद्युतिः । क्षामकण्ठश्च ब्रह्मर्षिस्तपोबलसमन्वितः । तामाबभाषे कल्याणीं सा चास्य न शृणोति वै ।।
data.md: Seeing her sporting in the lonely forest, the greatly effulgent Brahmana Rishi, endued with the ascetic prowess, was filled with desire,

data.v: ततः सुकन्या वल्मीके दृष्ट्वा भार्गवचक्षुषी । कौतूहलात्कण्टकेन बुद्धिमोहबलात्कृता ।।
किं नु खल्विदमित्युक्त्वा निर्बिभेदास्य लोचने । अक्रुध्यत्स तया विद्धे नेत्रे परममन्युमान् । ततः शर्यातिसैन्यस्य शकृन्मूत्रं समावृणोत् ।।
data.md: His eyes being thus pierced, he felt great pain and became very angry. He then stopped the calls of nature of the troops of Sharyati.

data.v: ततो रुद्धे शकृन्मूत्रे सैन्यमानाहदुःखितम् । तथागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य पर्यपृच्छत्स पार्थिवः ।।
data.md: Their state thus becoming deplorable, they were greatly afflicted. Seeing this the king asked, "Who has done injury to the illustrious son of Bhrigu, who is old, who is ever engaged in asceticism and who is of wrathful temper?

data.v: तपोनित्यस्य वृद्धस्य रोषणस्य विशेषतः । केनापकृतमद्येह भार्गवस्य महात्मनः । ज्ञातं वा यदि वाज्ञातं तदृतं ब्रूत माचिरम् ।।
तमूचुः सैनिकाः सर्वे न विद्मोऽपकृतं वयम् । सर्वोपायैर्यथाकामं भवांस्तदधिगच्छतु ।।
ततः स पृथिवीपालः साम्ना चोग्रेण च स्वयम् । पर्यपृच्छत्सुहृद्वर्गं प्रत्यजानन्न चैव ते ।।
आनाहार्तं ततो दृष्ट्वा तत्सैन्यमसुखार्दितम् । पितरं दुःखितं चापि सुकन्येदमथाब्रवीत् ।।
मयाटन्त्येह वल्मीके दृष्टं सत्त्वमभिज्वलत् । खद्योतवदभिज्ञातं तन्मया विद्धमन्तिकात् ।।
एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु शर्यातिर्वल्मीकं तूर्णमाद्रवत् । तत्रापश्यत्तपोवृद्धं वयोवृद्धं च भार्गवम् ।।
अयाचदथ सैन्यार्थं प्राञ्जलिः पृथिवीपतिः । अज्ञानाद्बालया यत्ते कृतं तत्क्षन्तुमर्हसि ।।
ततोऽब्रवीन्महीपालं च्यवनो भार्गवस्तदा । रूपौदार्यसमायुक्तां लोभमोहबलात्कृताम् ।।
तामेव प्रतिगृह्याहं राजन्दुहितरं तव । क्षमिष्यामि महीपाल सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ।।
ऋषेर्वचनमाज्ञाय शर्यातिरविचारयन् । ददौ दुहितरं तस्मै च्यवनाय महात्मने ।।
data.md: Having heard the words of the Rishi, Sharyati without pausing for consideration at once bestowed his daughter on the high-souled Chyavana.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तां कन्यां च्यवनः प्रससाद ह । प्राप्तप्रसादो राजा स ससैन्यः पुनराव्रजत् ।।
data.md: Having received that maiden, the exalted one was pleased (with the king). Having obtained the Rishi's grace, the king with his soldiers then went to his own city.

data.v: सुकन्यापि पतिं लब्ध्वा तपस्विनमनिन्दिता । नित्यं पर्यचरत्प्रीत्या तपसा नियमेन च ।।
data.md: The faultless Sukanya also, having obtained that ascetic for her husband, began to wait upon him by practising asceticism and observing the ordinances,

data.v: अग्नीनामतिथीनां च शुश्रूषुरनसूयिका । समाराधयत क्षिप्रं च्यवनं सा शुभानना ।।
data.md: The beautiful-featured one, that guileless lady, worshipped Chyavana and waited upon his guests and ministers to the sacred fire.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य सुराणामश्विनौ नृप । कृताभिषेकां विवृतां सुकन्यां तामपश्यताम् ।।
तां दृष्ट्वा दर्शनीयाङ्गीं देवराजसुतामिव । ऊचतुः समभिद्रुत्य नासत्यावश्विनाविदम् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : O king, once on a time, the (two) celestials the Ashvins saw Sukanya, when she had bathed and when she had no clothes on her person. Having seen that charming damsel who resembled a daughter of the celestials king, the horse-born Ashvins came to her and thus spoke to her.

data.v: कस्य त्वमसि वामोरु किं वने वै करोषि च । इच्छाव भद्रे ज्ञातुं त्वां तत्त्वमाख्याहि शोभने ।।
data.md: "O lady of tapering thighs, whose daughter are you? What are you doing in this forest? O blessed one, O beautiful damsel, we desire to know this. Therefore tell us."

data.v: ततः सुकन्या संवीता तावुवाच सुरोत्तमौ । शर्यातितनयां वित्तं भार्यां च च्यवनस्य माम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon Sukanya filled with bashfulness thus spoke to those foremost of celestials," "I am the daughter of Sharyati and I am the wife of Chyavana."

data.v: अथाश्विनौ प्रहस्यैतामब्रूतां पुनरेव तु । कथं त्वमसि कल्याणि पित्रा दत्ता गताध्वने ।।
data.md: Ashvins then again spoke to her with smiles, “O auspicious one, why has your gather bestowed you on a man who is verging on death? O timid one, you shine in this forest like the flashing lightning. O beautiful lady, we have never seen any one like you even in the celestials region.

data.v: भ्राजसे वनमध्ये त्वं विद्युत्सौदामिनी यथा । न देवेष्वपि तुल्यां हि त्वया पश्याव भामिनि ।।
सर्वाभरणसंपन्ना परमाम्बरधारिणी । शोभेथास्त्वनवद्याङ्गि न त्वेवं मलपङ्किनी ।।
data.md: O lady of faultless limbs, you cannot (however) look so beautiful besmeared as you are with mud and dirt as you would if adorned with ornaments and clad in gorgeous costume.

data.v: कस्मादेवंविधा भूत्वा जराजर्जरितं पतिम् । त्वमुपास्से ह कल्याणि कामभोगबहिष्कृतम् ।।
data.md: O auspicious one, becoming such why do you serve a decrepit old husband, one that has become incapable of realising pleasure,

data.v: असमर्थं परित्राणे पोषणे च शुचिस्मिते । साधु च्यवनमुत्सृज्य वरयस्वैकमावयोः । पत्यर्थं देवगर्भाभे मा वृथा यौवनं कृथाः ।।
data.md: O lady of sweet smiles, one who is in incapable of protecting and supporting u? Therefore abandoning Chyavana, accept one of us as your husband.

data.v: एवमुक्ता सुकन्या तु सुरौ ताविदमब्रवीत् । रताहं च्यवने पत्यौ मैवं मा पर्यशङ्किथाः ।।
तावब्रूतां पुनस्त्वेनामावां देवभिषग्वरौ । युवानं रूपसंपन्नं करिष्यावः पतिं तव ।।
ततस्तस्यावयोश्चैव पतिमेकतमं वृणु । एतेन समयेनैनमामन्त्रय वरानने ।।
सा तयोर्वचनाद्राजन्नुपसंगम्य भार्गवम् । उवाच वाक्यं यत्ताभ्यामुक्तं भृगुसुतं प्रति ।।
data.md: O king, she went at their word to Bhrigu's son and told the son of Bhrigu what the two celestials had said. Having heard this, Chyavana said, "Do it."

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा च्यवनो भार्यामुवाच क्रियतामिति । भर्त्रा सा समनुज्ञाता क्रियतामित्यथाब्रवीत् ।।
श्रुत्वा तदश्विनौ वाक्यं तत्तस्याः क्रियतामिति । ऊचतू राजपुत्रीं तां पतिस्तव विशत्वपः ।।
ततोऽम्भश्च्यवनः शीघ्रं रूपार्थी प्रविवेश ह । अश्विनावपि तद्राजन्सरः प्रविशतां प्रभो ।।
ततो मुहूर्तादुत्तीर्णाः सर्वे ते सरसस्ततः । दिव्यरूपधराः सर्वे युवानो मृष्टकुण्डलाः । तुल्यरूपधराश्चैव मनसः प्रीतिवर्धनाः ।।
data.md: O king, the two Ashvins also entered into the lake. A few minutes after they all came out from the lake, becoming exceedingly beautiful, young and wearing brilliant car-rings, all assuming the same appearance delightful to the heart.

data.v: तेऽब्रुवन्सहिताः सर्वे वृणीष्वान्यतमं शुभे । अस्माकमीप्सितं भद्रे पतित्वे वरवर्णिनि । यत्र वाप्यभिकामासि तं वृणीष्व सुशोभने ।।
data.md: They then all said to her “O blessed lady, O fortunate one, O beautiful damsel, chose one of us as your husband.

data.v: सा समीक्ष्य तु तान्सर्वांस्तुल्यरूपधरान्स्थितान् । निश्चित्य मनसा बुद्ध्या देवी वव्रे स्वकं पतिम् ।।
लब्ध्वा तु च्यवनो भार्यां वयोरूपं च वाञ्छितम् । हृष्टोऽब्रवीन्महातेजास्तौ नासत्याविदं वचः ।।
यथाहं रूपसंपन्नो वयसा च समन्वितः । कृतो भवद्भ्यां वृद्धः सन्भार्यां च प्राप्तवानिमाम् ।।
तस्माद्युवां करिष्यामि प्रीत्याहं सोमपीथिनौ । मिषतो देवराजस्य सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि वाम् ।।
तच्छ्रुत्वा हृष्टमनसौ दिवं तौ प्रतिजग्मतुः । च्यवनोऽपि सुकन्या च सुराविव विजह्रतुः ।।
data.md: Having heard this, the two (Ashvins) cheerfully went to heaven. Chyavana and Sukanya also passed happily their days like (two) celestials.

data.v: ततः श्रुत्वा तु शर्यातिर्वयःस्थं च्यवनं कृतम् । संहृष्टः सेनया सार्धमुपायाद्भार्गवाश्रमम् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: Thereupon hearing that Chyavana had been turned into a youth, Sharyati, becoming very much pleased, came with his troops to the hermitage of the son of Bhrigu.

data.v: च्यवनं च सुकन्यां च दृष्ट्वा देवसुताविव । रेमे महीपः शर्यातिः कृत्स्नां प्राप्य महीमिव ।।
data.md: He saw Chyavana and Sukanya like two celestials children. Sharyati with his wife was as pleased as he would have been, if he had acquired the whole earth. The ruler of earth together with his wife was received honourable by those saints. The king seated himself near the ascetic and entered into a delightful conversation of an auspicious kind.

data.v: ऋषिणा सत्कृतस्तेन सभार्यः पृथिवीपतिः । उपोपविष्टः कल्याणीः कथाश्चक्रे महामनाः ।।
अथैनं भार्गवो राजन्नुवाच परिसान्त्वयन् । याजयिष्यामि राजंस्त्वां संभारानुपकल्पय ।।
data.md: O king, the son of Bhrigu thus spoke to that ruler of worlds these words of a soothing nature, “O king, I shall perform your sacrifice. Let the necessary articles be procured."

data.v: ततः परमसंहृष्टः शर्यातिः पृथिवीपतिः । च्यवनस्य महाराज तद्वाक्यं प्रत्यपूजयत् ।।
data.md: Thereupon that ruler of earth, Sharyati was exceedingly delighted. O great king, he expressed his approbation of the proposal made by Chyavana.

data.v: प्रशस्तेऽहनि यज्ञीये सर्वकामसमृद्धिमत् । कारयामास शर्यातिर्यज्ञायतनमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: On an auspicious day, suitable for the commencement of a sacrificial ceremony, Sharyati ordered the erection of an excellent sacrificial shrine. He then splendidly furnished it with all desirable things.

data.v: तत्रैनं च्यवनो राजन्याजयामास भार्गवः । अद्भुतानि च तत्रासन्यानि तानि निबोध मे ।।
data.md: O king, Chyavana, the son of Bhrigu performed his sacrifice. Hear the wonderful events which happened at that spot.

data.v: अगृह्णाच्च्यवनः सोममश्विनोर्देवयोस्तदा । तमिन्द्रो वारयामास गृह्यमाणं तयोर्ग्रहम् ।।
data.md: Chyavana took up some Soma juice, so that he might offer it to the Ashvins who are the physician to the celestials. When he was going to offer it, Indra prevented him.

data.v: उभावेतौ न सोमार्हौ नासत्याविति मे मतिः । भिषजौ देवपुत्राणां कर्मणा नैवमर्हतः ।।
data.md: Indra said: These two (Ashvins) in my opinion have no right to receive an offering of the Soma juice; they are the physicians to the celestials. As such, they are prevented (from receiving it).

data.v: मावमंस्था महात्मानौ रूपद्रविणवत्तरौ । यौ चक्रतुर्मां मघवन्वृन्दारकमिवाजरम् ।।
ऋते त्वां विबुधांश्चान्यान्कथं वै नार्हतः सवम् । अश्विनावपि देवेन्द्र देवौ विद्धि पुरंदर ।।
data.md: Chyavana said: O Indra, these two are of great energy, they are high-souled, beautiful and handsome, they have made me eternally young like a celestials. Why should you and the other celestials have a right to the Soma juice and not they? O lord of the celestials, O Purandara, know that the Ashvins are also celestials.

data.v: चिकित्सकौ कर्मकरौ कामरूपसमन्वितौ । लोके चरन्तौ मर्त्यानां कथं सोममिहार्हतः ।।
data.md: Indra said: These two are physicians and as such they are but servants. Assuming various forms at pleasure, they roam about the world of the mortals. How can they claim the Soma juice?

data.v: एतदेव यदा वाक्यमाम्रेडयति वासवः । अनादृत्य ततः शक्रं ग्रहं जग्राह भार्गवः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : When these words were said by the king of the celestials, the son of Bhrigu (Chyavana) did not heed them; and he took up the offering of (the soma).

data.v: ग्रहीष्यन्तं तु तं सोममश्विनोरुत्तमं तदा । समीक्ष्य बलभिद्देव इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Having seen that he was about to take up an excellent portion of Soma to offer it to the Ashvins, the destroyer of Bala Indra thus spoke to hiin,

data.v: आभ्यामर्थाय सोमं त्वं ग्रहीष्यसि यदि स्वयम् । वज्रं ते प्रहरिष्यामि घोररूपमनुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: "If you take up the Soma to offer it to those two celestials, I shall hurl at you my fearful thunder which is superior to all existing weapons."

data.v: एवमुक्तः स्मयन्निन्द्रमभिवीक्ष्य स भार्गवः । जग्राह विधिवत्सोममश्विभ्यामुत्तमं ग्रहम् ।।
data.md: Having been thus addressed, the son of Bhrigu smilingly looked at Indra and he then took up in due form some excellent Soma juice to offer it to the Ashvins.

data.v: ततोऽस्मै प्राहरद्वज्रं घोररूपं शचीपतिः । तस्य प्रहरतो बाहुं स्तम्भयामास भार्गवः ।।
data.md: The husband of Sachi (Indra), then hurled at him the fearful thunder. When he was about to hurl it, the son of Bhrigu paralyzed it.

data.v: संस्तम्भयित्वा च्यवनो जुहुवे मन्त्रतोऽनलम् । कृत्यार्थी सुमहातेजा देवं हिंसितुमुद्यतः ।।
data.md: Having paralyzed his arms, Chyavana recited sacred hymns and made offerings to the fire. That greatly effulgent one, having gained his object tried to kill the celestials (Indra).

data.v: ततः कृत्या समभवदृषेस्तस्य तपोबलात् । मदो नाम महावीर्यो बृहत्कायो महासुरः । शरीरं यस्य निर्देष्टुमशक्यं तु सुरासुरैः ।।
data.md: Thereupon the Rishi created, by his ascetic power, a great Asura of huge body and exceeding prowess, named Mada.

data.v: तस्यास्यमभवद्घोरं तीक्ष्णाग्रदशनं महत् । हनुरेका स्थिता तस्य भूमावेका दिवं गता ।।
चतस्र आयता दंष्ट्रा योजनानां शतं शतम् । इतरे त्वस्य दशना बभूवुर्दशयोजनाः । प्राकारसदृशाकाराः शूलाग्रसमदर्शनाः ।।
data.md: His other fangs extended as far as one hundred yojanas. They looked like the towers on a palace. They might be likened to the ends of spears.

data.v: बाहू पर्वतसंकाशावायतावयुतं समौ । नेत्रे रविशशिप्रख्ये वक्त्रमन्तकसंनिभम् ।।
data.md: His two arms were like two hills. They were of equal bulk and extended ten thousand yojanas. His two eyes resembled the sun and the moon and his countenance looked like the great fire at the universal dissolution.

data.v: लेलिहञ्जिह्वया वक्त्रं विद्युच्चपललोलया । व्यात्ताननो घोरदृष्टिर्ग्रसन्निव जगद्बलात् ।।
data.md: He was licking his mouth with his tongue, which like lightning knew no rest. His mouth was open and his glance was fearful. It appeared as if he would forcibly swallow up the world.

data.v: स भक्षयिष्यन्संक्रुद्धः शतक्रतुमुपाद्रवत् । महता घोररूपेण लोकाञ्शब्देन नादयन् ।।
data.md: He rushed upon Shatakratu (Indra) with the intention of devouring that deity. The worlds resounded with the loud and fearful roaring of that Asura.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा घोरवदनं मदं देवः शतक्रतुः । आयान्तं भक्षयिष्यन्तं व्यात्ताननमिवान्तकम् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: Having seen the fearful-faced Mada, coming with open mouth like death himself with the intention of devouring him, the deity Shatakratu (Indra).

data.v: भयात्संस्तम्भितभुजः सृक्किणी लेलिहन्मुहुः । ततोऽब्रवीद्देवराजश्च्यवनं भयपीडितः ।।
data.md: Licked the corner of his mouth when his arms were paralyzed. Being afflicted with fear, the celestials king thus spoke, O son of Bhrigu, O Brahmanas, I truly tell you that from this day the two Ashvins will be entitled to receive the Soma juice. Therefore be merciful to me.

data.v: सोमार्हावश्विनावेतावद्य प्रभृति भार्गव । भविष्यतः सत्यमेतद्वचो ब्रह्मन्ब्रवीमि ते ।।
न ते मिथ्या समारम्भो भवत्वेष परो विधिः । जानामि चाहं विप्रर्षे न मिथ्या त्वं करिष्यसि ।।
data.md: O Brahmana Rishi, your attempts can never be futile. Let this be the rule. I know your act can never be in vain.

data.v: सोमार्हावश्विनावेतौ यथैवाद्य कृतौ त्वया । भूय एव तु ते वीर्यं प्रकाशेदिति भार्गव ।।
data.md: O son of Bhrigu, these two Ashvins are now entitled to drink the Soma juice as you have made them today. O son of Bhrigu, I have done it to spread the fame of your powers.

data.v: सुकन्यायाः पितुश्चास्य लोके कीर्तिः प्रथेदिति । अतो मयैतद्विहितं तव वीर्यप्रकाशनम् । तस्मात्प्रसादं कुरु मे भवत्वेतद्यथेच्छसि ।।
data.md: My object was to spread the fame of the father of Sukanya all over the world. It has been done by me, so that your fame may spread.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्य शक्रेण च्यवनस्य महात्मनः । स मन्युर्व्यगमच्छीघ्रं मुमोच च पुरंदरम् ।।
मदं च व्यभजद्राजन्पाने स्त्रीषु च वीर्यवान् । अक्षेषु मृगयायां च पूर्वसृष्टं पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: Was soon appeased; and he set free Purandara (Indra). O king, that mighty Rishi distributed Mada and put it piece-meal in drinks, in women, in gambling and in the field of sports. This Mada was formerly created again and again. Having thus thrown away Mada, he adored Indra with Soma.

data.v: तथा मदं विनिक्षिप्य शक्रं संतर्प्य चेन्दुना । अश्विभ्यां सहितान्देवान्याजयित्वा च तं नृपम् ।।

data.md: Yudhishthira said : O foremost of speakers, what was the prowess of the king, Somaka. I desire to hear an exact account of his achievements and prowess.
