data.md: Lomasha said: O king, O Yudhishthira, there was a virtuous king, named Somaka. He had one hundred wives, all suitably matched to him.

data.v: स वै यत्नेन महता तासु पुत्रं महीपतिः । कंचिन्नासादयामास कालेन महता अपि ।।
data.md: Though a long period of time passed away and though he took great care, yet he could not succeed in getting a son.

data.v: कदाचित्तस्य वृद्धस्य यतमानस्य यत्नतः । जन्तुर्नाम सुतस्तस्मिन्स्त्रीशते समजायत ।।
data.md: One day when he had (already) grown old, he tried every means to have a son and (at last) a son was born to him by once of that one hundred wives. He was named Jantu.

data.v: तं जातं मातरः सर्वाः परिवार्य समासते । सततं पृष्ठतः कृत्वा कामभोगान्विशां पते ।।
data.md: O king, all those mothers sat round their son; and every one of them gave him such objects as might give him enjoyments and pleasure.

data.v: ततः पिपीलिका जन्तुं कदाचिददशत्स्फिजि । स दष्टो व्यनदद्राजंस्तेन दुःखेन बालकः ।।
data.md: One day an ant stung the boy at his hip and the boy screamed out on account of the pain caused by the sting.

data.v: ततस्ता मातरः सर्वाः प्राक्रोशन्भृशदुःखिताः । परिवार्य जन्तुं सहिताः स शब्दस्तुमुलोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: The mothers were greatly distressed to find the child stung by the ant; and they stood round him and began to cry as loudly as the boy.

data.v: तमार्तनादं सहसा शुश्राव स महीपतिः । अमात्यपरिषन्मध्ये उपविष्टः सहर्त्विजैः ।।
data.md: When he was seated with his ministers and his family priest that ruler of earth suddenly heard that great screaming (of the women).

data.v: ततः प्रस्थापयामास किमेतदिति पार्थिवः । तस्मै क्षत्ता यथावृत्तमाचचक्षे सुतं प्रति ।।
data.md: The king sent for information as to what it was about. And the royal usher then explained to him what had happened to his son.

data.v: त्वरमाणः स चोत्थाय सोमकः सह मन्त्रिभिः । प्रविश्यान्तःपुरं पुत्रमाश्वासयदरिंदमः ।।
data.md: Somaka rose with his ministers and hastened towards the female apartments. O chastiser of foes, on going there, he consoled his son.

data.v: सान्त्वयित्वा तु तं पुत्रं निष्क्रम्यान्तःपुरान्नृपः । ऋत्विजैः सहितो राजन्सहामात्य उपाविशत् ।।
data.md: Having comforted his son and come out from the female apartments, the king sat down with his family priest and ministers.

data.v: धिगस्त्विहैकपुत्रत्वमपुत्रत्वं वरं भवेत् । नित्यातुरत्वाद्भूतानां शोक एवैकपुत्रता ।।
data.md: Somaka said: Fie on having one son! I would rather be a sonless man. To all beings, liable as they are to diseases, it is but a trouble to have only one son.

data.v: इदं भार्याशतं ब्रह्मन्परीक्ष्योपचितं प्रभो । पुत्रार्थिना मया वोढं न चासां विद्यते प्रजा ।।
data.md: O Brahmanas, O lord, with the intention of getting sons, I married all these one hundred wives after carefully examining them whether they were suitable to me. But they have none.

data.v: एकः कथंचिदुत्पन्नः पुत्रो जन्तुरयं मम । यतमानस्य सर्वासु किं नु दुःखमतः परम् ।।
data.md: Having tried every means and put forth great efforts they have (at last) given birth to this one single son, Jantu. What greater grief can there be than this!

data.v: वयश्च समतीतं मे सभार्यस्य द्विजोत्तम । आसां प्राणाः समायत्ता मम चात्रैकपुत्रके ।।
data.md: O excellent Brahmana, I am grown old in years and so are my wives. This only one son is like the breadth of their nostrils; so is he to me.

data.v: स्यान्नु कर्म तथा युक्तं येन पुत्रशतं भवेत् । महता लघुना वापि कर्मणा दुष्करेण वा ।।
data.md: Is there any such (religious) ceremony by celebrating which one may get one hundred sons? Tell me whether it is great or it is small, whether it is easy or it is difficult to perform.

data.v: अस्ति वै तादृशं कर्म येन पुत्रशतं भवेत् । यदि शक्नोषि तत्कर्तुमथ वक्ष्यामि सोमक ।।
data.md: Ritvija said : There is a ceremony by which a man may get one hundred sons. O Somaka, if you are able to perform it, (then tell me); I shall explain it to you?

data.v: कार्यं वा यदि वाकार्यं येन पुत्रशतं भवेत् । कृतमेव हि तद्विद्धि भगवान्प्रब्रवीतु मे ।।
data.md: Somaka said: Whether it is a good or an evil deed, you may consider that the ceremony by which one hundred sons may be born as already performed, O exalted one explain it to me.

data.v: यजस्व जन्तुना राजंस्त्वं मया वितते क्रतौ । ततः पुत्रशतं श्रीमद्भविष्यत्यचिरेण ते ।।
data.md: Ritvija said : O king, I shall perform this sacrifice, but you must sacrifice in it your son Jantu. Then one hundred handsome sons will be born to you.

data.v: वपायां हूयमानायां धूममाघ्राय मातरः । ततस्ताः सुमहावीर्याञ्जनयिष्यन्ति ते सुतान् ।।
data.md: When Jantu's fat will be put into the fire as an offering to the celestials, the mothers your wives will have to take a smell of that smoke. ! And thus they would give birth to a number of courageous and strong sons. Jantu also will again be born in the womb of his (former) mother. On this back there will appear a mark of gold.

data.v: तस्यामेव तु ते जन्तुर्भविता पुनरात्मजः । उत्तरे चास्य सौवर्णं लक्ष्म पार्श्वे भविष्यति ।।
data.md: When Jantu's fat will be put into the fire as an offering to the celestials, the mothers your wives will have to take a smell of that smoke. ! And thus they would give birth to a number of courageous and strong sons. Jantu also will again be born in the womb of his (former) mother. On this back there will appear a mark of gold.

data.v: ब्रह्मन्यद्यद्यथा कार्यं तत्तत्कुरु तथा तथा । पुत्रकामतया सर्वं करिष्यामि वचस्तव ।।
data.md: Somaka said: O Brahmana, whatever is to be performed, do exactly as it is necessary, I desire to get a number of sons; I shall do all as asked by you.

data.v: ततः स याजयामास सोमकं तेन जन्तुना । मातरस्तु बलात्पुत्रमपाकर्षुः कृपान्विताः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: Thereupon he performed that sacrifice in which Jantu was offered as a victim. But the mothers out of affection forcibly dragged the son.

data.v: हा हताः स्मेति वाशन्त्यस्तीव्रशोकसमन्विताः । तं मातरः प्रत्यकर्षन्गृहीत्वा दक्षिणे करे । सव्ये पाणौ गृहीत्वा तु याजकोऽपि स्म कर्षति ।।
कुररीणामिवार्तानामपाकृष्य तु तं सुतम् । विशस्य चैनं विधिना वपामस्य जुहाव सः ।।
वपायां हूयमानायां गन्धमाघ्राय मातरः । आर्ता निपेतुः सहसा पृथिव्यां कुरुनन्दन । सर्वाश्च गर्भानलभंस्ततस्ताः पार्थिवाङ्गनाः ।।
ततो दशसु मासेषु सोमकस्य विशां पते । जज्ञे पुत्रशतं पूर्णं तासु सर्वासु भारत ।।
data.md: O king, O descendant of Bharata, at the end of the tenth month, full one hundred sons were born to Somaka.

data.v: जन्तुर्ज्येष्ठः समभवज्जनित्र्यामेव भारत । स तासामिष्ट एवासीन्न तथान्ये निजाः सुताः ।।
data.md: O king, Jantu became the eldest son and he was born to his former mother. He became the most beloved of all those women but not so were their own sons.

data.v: तच्च लक्षणमस्यासीत्सौवर्णं पार्श्व उत्तरे । तस्मिन्पुत्रशते चाग्र्यः स बभूव गुणैर्युतः ।।
data.md: He had that golden mark on his back; and among all those one hundred sons, he was superior to all in everything.

data.v: ततः स लोकमगमत्सोमकस्य गुरुः परम् । अथ काले व्यतीते तु सोमकोऽप्यगमत्परम् ।।
data.md: Then that great preceptor of Somaka died, so did Somaka also after sometime. He saw his priest being grilled in a terrible hell. He then asked him, “O Brahmana, why are you being grilled in this hell!

data.v: अथ तं नरके घोरे पच्यमानं ददर्श सः । तमपृच्छत्किमर्थं त्वं नरके पच्यसे द्विज ।।
data.md: Then that great preceptor of Somaka died, so did Somaka also after sometime. He saw his priest being grilled in a terrible hell. He then asked him, “O Brahmana, why are you being grilled in this hell!

data.v: तमब्रवीद्गुरुः सोऽथ पच्यमानोऽग्निना भृशम् । त्वं मया याजितो राजंस्तस्येदं कर्मणः फलम् ।।
एतच्छ्रुत्वा स राजर्षिर्धर्मराजानमब्रवीत् । अहमत्र प्रवेक्ष्यामि मुच्यतां मम याजकः । मत्कृते हि महाभागः पच्यते नरकाग्निना ।।
data.md: Thereupon the preceptor, greatly being grilled in the (hell fire) thus spoke to him, “O king, it is the result of my performing your sacrifice.” Having heard this, that royal sage thus spoke to the god of justice? “I shall enter (this fire). Set free my priest. This greatly exalted man is grilled in the hell fire on my account.

data.v: नान्यः कर्तुः फलं राजन्नुपभुङ्क्ते कदाचन । इमानि तव दृश्यन्ते फलानि ददतां वर ।।
data.md: Dharmaraja said : O king, O foremost of speakers, one cannot suffer or enjoy for another person's acts. These are the fruits of your acts. See them here.

data.v: पुण्यान्न कामये लोकानृतेऽहं ब्रह्मवादिनम् । इच्छाम्यहमनेनैव सह वस्तुं सुरालये ।।
data.md: Somaka said: I do not desire to go to the region of bliss without this Brahmana here. O Dharmaraja, I desire to live with him. O god, my act is identical with that done by him and therefore the fruits of our acts must be the same.

data.v: नरके वा धर्मराज कर्मणास्य समो ह्यहम् । पुण्यापुण्यफलं देव सममस्त्वावयोरिदम् ।।
data.md: Somaka said: I do not desire to go to the region of bliss without this Brahmana here. O Dharmaraja, I desire to live with him. O god, my act is identical with that done by him and therefore the fruits of our acts must be the same.

data.v: यद्येवमीप्सितं राजन्भुङ्क्ष्वास्य सहितः फलम् । तुल्यकालं सहानेन पश्चात्प्राप्स्यसि सद्गतिम् ।।
data.md: Dharmaraja said : O king, if this be your wish, then taste with him the fruits of that act, as long as he is to do. After that you will obtain the blessed state.

data.v: स चकार तथा सर्वं राजा राजीवलोचनः । पुनश्च लेभे लोकान्स्वान्कर्मणा निर्जिताञ्शुभान् । सह तेनैव विप्रेण गुरुणा स गुरुप्रियः ।।
data.md: O king, that lover of his preceptor secured for his preceptor by his meritorious acts all those blessings of which he was entitled.

data.v: एष तस्याश्रमः पुण्यो य एषोऽग्रे विराजते । क्षान्त उष्यात्र षड्रात्रं प्राप्नोति सुगतिं नरः ।।
data.md: This is his sacred hermitage, situated before us. The man who passes six nights here with controlled passions obtains the blessed state.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नपि राजेन्द्र वत्स्यामो विगतज्वराः । षड्रात्रं नियतात्मानः सज्जीभव कुरूद्वह ।।
data.md: O king of kings, O perpetuator of the Kuru race, being free from excitement and controlling our passions, we must spend six nights here. Therefore be ready.

data.v: अस्मिन्किल स्वयं राजन्निष्टवान्वै प्रजापतिः । सत्रमिष्टीकृतं नाम पुरा वर्षसहस्रिकम् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O king, here did Prajapati himself perform a sacrifice in the days of yore. It was called Ishtikrita which occupied one thousands years.

data.v: अम्बरीषश्च नाभाग इष्टवान्यमुनामनु । यज्ञैश्च तपसा चैव परां सिद्धिमवाप सः ।।
देशो नाहुषयज्ञानामयं पुण्यतमो नृप । यत्रेष्ट्वा दश पद्मानि सदस्येभ्यो निसृष्टवान् ।।
data.md: The son of Nabhaga, Ambrisha, performed a sacrifice near the Yumuna in which he gave away ten padmas (of gold coins) to the Sadasyas.

data.v: सार्वभौमस्य कौन्तेय ययातेरमितौजसः । स्पर्धमानस्य शक्रेण पश्येदं यज्ञवास्त्विह ।।
data.md: O son of Kunti, he obtained the greatest success by his sacrifices and asceticism; this is the place where the king of all kings, the immeasurably powerful Yayati, the son of Nahusha, performed his sacrifices. He competed with Indra and he performed his sacrifices here.

data.v: पश्य नानाविधाकारैरग्निभिर्निचितां महीम् । मज्जन्तीमिव चाक्रान्तां ययातेर्यज्ञकर्मभिः ।।
data.md: Behold how the ground is studded with places for sacrificial altars of all sorts. (Behold), the earth appears as if she is sinking under the preasure of Yayati's good works.

data.v: एषा शम्येकपत्रा सा शरकं चैतदुत्तमम् । पश्य रामह्रदानेतान्पश्य नारायणाश्रमम् ।।
data.md: Here is the Shami tree which has but one; single leaf; this is an excellent work. Behold the lake of Rama and the hermitage of Narayana.

data.v: एतदार्चीकपुत्रस्य योगैर्विचरतो महीम् । अपसर्पणं महीपाल रौप्यायाममितौजसः ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, this is the path which was followed by immeasurably effulgent son of Richika who roamed over the earth practising Yoga on the banks of the Raupya.

data.v: अत्रानुवंशं पठतः शृणु मे कुरुनन्दन । उलूखलैराभरणैः पिशाची यदभाषत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Kuru, hear what a Pishacha woman, adorned with pestles as her ornaments, said as I was reciting the table of genealogy.

data.v: युगंधरे दधि प्राश्य उषित्वा चाच्युतस्थले । तद्वद्भूतिलये स्नात्वा सपुत्रा वस्तुमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: (She said), "Having eaten curd Yugandhara and lived in Achyutasthala and at also bathed in Bhutalya you should live with your sons.

data.v: एकरात्रमुषित्वेह द्वितीयं यदि वत्स्यसि । एतद्वै ते दिवा वृत्तं रात्रौ वृत्तमतोऽन्यथा ।।
data.md: Having spent here the first night, if you pass the second night here, the events of the nighttime will then be different from the day-time.

data.v: अत्राद्याहो निवत्स्यामः क्षपां भरतसत्तम । द्वारमेतद्धि कौन्तेय कुरुक्षेत्रस्य भारत ।।
data.md: O foremost of the Bharata race, O descendant of Bharata, O son of Kunti, we shall today live here. This is the gate of Kurukshetra.

data.v: अत्रैव नाहुषो राजा राजन्क्रतुभिरिष्टवान् । ययातिर्बहुरत्नाढ्यैर्यत्रेन्द्रो मुदमभ्यगात् ।।
data.md: O king, here did king Yayati, the son of Nahusha, perform sacrifices in which gifts of gems were in great abundance and by which Indra was much gratified.

data.v: एतत्प्लक्षावतरणं यमुनातीर्थमुच्यते । एतद्वै नाकपृष्ठस्य द्वारमाहुर्मनीषिणः ।।
data.md: This is Plakshavatarana, an excellent tirtha in the Yamuna. The learned men call it the gate of heaven.

data.v: अत्र सारस्वतैर्यज्ञैरीजानाः परमर्षयः । यूपोलूखलिनस्तात गच्छन्त्यवभृथाप्लवम् ।।
data.md: O child, after performing the Sarasvata sacrifice and using the sacrificial stakes as their pestles, the great Rishis perform here these ablutions prescribed at the end of a sacrifice.

data.v: अत्रैव भरतो राजा मेध्यमश्वमवासृजत् । असकृत्कृष्णसारङ्गं धर्मेणावाप्य मेदिनीम् ।।
अत्रैव पुरुषव्याघ्र मरुत्तः सत्रमुत्तमम् । आस्ते देवर्षिमुख्येन संवर्तेनाभिपालितः ।।
अत्रोपस्पृश्य राजेन्द्र सर्वाँल्लोकान्प्रपश्यति । पूयते दुष्कृताच्चैव समुपस्पृश्य भारत ।।
तत्र सभ्रातृकः स्नात्वा स्तूयमानो महर्षिभिः । लोमशं पाण्डवश्रेष्ठ इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: Being praised by the great Rishis he (Yudhishthira) bathed there with his brothers. Then that foremost of the Pandavas thus spoke to Lomasha.

data.v: सर्वाँल्लोकान्प्रपश्यामि तपसा सत्यविक्रम । इहस्थः पाण्डवश्रेष्ठं पश्यामि श्वेतवाहनम् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: O greatly powerful Rishis, I see all the worlds by virtue of asceticism. I also see that foremost of the Pandavas Svetavahana (Arjuna).

data.v: एवमेतन्महाबाहो पश्यन्ति परमर्षयः । सरस्वतीमिमां पुण्यां पश्यैकशरणावृताम् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O mighty-armed hero, it is as you say. Thus do great Rishis see (all the worlds). Yonder is the sacred Sarasvati, thronged by persons who consider her to be their sole refuge.

data.v: यत्र स्नात्वा नरश्रेष्ठ धूतपाप्मा भविष्यति । इह सारस्वतैर्यज्ञैरिष्टवन्तः सुरर्षयः । ऋषयश्चैव कौन्तेय तथा राजर्षयोऽपि च ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, bathing in it, you will be freed from all your sins. O son of Kunti, the celestials Rishis performed here the Sarasvata sacrifice; so did the Rishis and the royal sages.

data.v: वेदी प्रजापतेरेषा समन्तात्पञ्चयोजना । कुरोर्वै यज्ञशीलस्य क्षेत्रमेतन्महात्मनः ।।
data.md: This is the altar of the Prajapati; it is five yojanas in extent on all sides round. This is the field of the high-souled Kurus who always performed sacrifices.

data.v: इह मर्त्यास्तपस्तप्त्वा स्वर्गं गच्छन्ति भारत । मर्तुकामा नरा राजन्निहायान्ति सहस्रशः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O descendant of Bharata, if men give up their bodies here, they go to heaven. O king, thousands of men come here with the desire to die.

data.v: एवमाशीः प्रयुक्ता हि दक्षेण यजता पुरा । इह ये वै मरिष्यन्ति ते वै स्वर्गजितो नराः ।।
data.md: A blessing was pronounced here by Daksha when in the days of yore he was performing sacrifice at this spot. (It was as follows), “The men that will die here will go to heaven.”

data.v: एषा सरस्वती पुण्या दिव्या चोघवती नदी । एतद्विनशनं नाम सरस्वत्या विशां पते ।।
data.md: O king, here is the charming celestials river full of water, named Sarasvati. It is here Vinasana of the Sarasvati (where she disappeared).

data.v: द्वारं निषादराष्ट्रस्य येषां द्वेषात्सरस्वती । प्रविष्टा पृथिवीं वीर मा निषादा हि मां विदुः ।।
data.md: O hero, here is the gate of the kingdom of the Nishadas; it is from the hatred of the Nishadhas that the Sarasvati entered the earth so that she might not be seen by the Nishadas.

data.v: एष वै चमसोद्भेदो यत्र दृश्या सरस्वती । यत्रैनामभ्यवर्तन्त दिव्याः पुण्याः समुद्रगाः ।।
data.md: Here is also Chamashodbheda where the Sarasvati again reappeared. Here she was joined by all the other sacred ocean-going currents.

data.v: एतत्सिन्धोर्महत्तीर्थं यत्रागस्त्यमरिंदम । लोपामुद्रा समागम्य भर्तारमवृणीत वै ।।
data.md: O chastiser of foes, here is the greatly sacred place called Sindhu, where Lopamudra accepted the great Rishi Agastya as her husband.

data.v: एतत्प्रभासते तीर्थं प्रभासं भास्करद्युते । इन्द्रस्य दयितं पुण्यं पवित्रं पापनाशनम् ।।
data.md: O sun-like effulgent hero, here is the sacred Tirtha called Pravasha which is truly sacred, sin-destroying and a favourite place of Indra.

data.v: एतद्विष्णुपदं नाम दृश्यते तीर्थमुत्तमम् । एषा रम्या विपाशा च नदी परमपावनी ।।
data.md: Yonder appears the excellent Tirtha called Vishnupada. Here also is the charming river and greatly purifying Vipasa.

data.v: अत्रैव पुत्रशोकेन वसिष्ठो भगवानृषिः । बद्ध्वात्मानं निपतितो विपाशः पुनरुत्थितः ।।
data.md: Here from the grief at his son's death, the great Rishi Vasishtha threw himself into the Vipasa after first binding himself, but he rose again.

data.v: काश्मीरमण्डलं चैतत्सर्वपुण्यमरिंदम । महर्षिभिश्चाध्युषितं पश्येदं भ्रातृभिः सह ।।
data.md: O chastiser of foes, behold with your brothers the sacred region of Kashmira, ever frequented by the holy Rishis.

data.v: अत्रोत्तराणां सर्वेषामृषीणां नाहुषस्य च । अग्नेश्चात्रैव संवादः काश्यपस्य च भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, here a conference took place between Agni and the Rishi Kashyapa and between the son of Nahusha (Yayati) and the Rishis of the north.

data.v: एतद्द्वारं महाराज मानसस्य प्रकाशते । वर्षमस्य गिरेर्मध्ये रामेण श्रीमता कृतम् ।।
data.md: O great king, yonder appears the gate of Manaka. A gap was opened by Rama in the midst of this mountain.

data.v: एष वातिकषण्डो वै प्रख्यातः सत्यविक्रमः । नाभ्यवर्तत यद्द्वारं विदेहानुत्तरं च यः ।।
data.md: O greatly powerful hero, here is the celebrated Vatikakhanda, which although near the gate of Vedika, lies on the north of it.

data.v: एष उज्जानको नाम यवक्रीर्यत्र शान्तवान् । अरुन्धतीसहायश्च वसिष्ठो भगवानृषिः ।।
ह्रदश्च कुशवानेष यत्र पद्मं कुशेशयम् । आश्रमश्चैव रुक्मिण्या यत्राशाम्यदकोपना ।।
data.md: Yonder is the lake called Kushavanisha in which grow the lotuses called Kushashaya. Here also is the hermitage of Rukmini where she attained peace by conquering her anger. O son of Pandu, O great king, you must have heard of the great hill Bhrigutunga. Behold it (now).

data.v: समाधीनां समासस्तु पाण्डवेय श्रुतस्त्वया । तं द्रक्ष्यसि महाराज भृगुतुङ्गं महागिरिम् ।।
data.md: Yonder is the lake called Kushavanisha in which grow the lotuses called Kushashaya. Here also is the hermitage of Rukmini where she attained peace by conquering her anger. O son of Pandu, O great king, you must have heard of the great hill Bhrigutunga. Behold it (now).

data.v: जलां चोपजलां चैव यमुनामभितो नदीम् । उशीनरो वै यत्रेष्ट्वा वासवादत्यरिच्यत ।।
data.md: (Behold) Jala and Upjala the rivers on both the sides of the Yamuna. Ushinara surpassed Vasava (Indra in greatness) by performing a sacrifice here.

data.v: तां देवसमितिं तस्य वासवश्च विशां पते । अभ्यगच्छत राजानं ज्ञातुमग्निश्च भारत ।।
data.md: O king, O descendant of Bharata, being desirous of testing the merit of that great king, Vasava (Indra) and Agni came to his celestialslike Sava.

data.v: जिज्ञासमानौ वरदौ महात्मानमुशीनरम् । इन्द्रः श्येनः कपोतोऽग्निर्भूत्वा यज्ञेऽभिजग्मतुः ।।
data.md: Being inquisitive to know Ushinara and being willing to bestow boons on him, those two celestials Indra and Agni, came to his sacrificial ground, Indra becoming a hawk and Agni a pigeon.

data.v: ऊरुं राज्ञः समासाद्य कपोतः श्येनजाद्भयात् । शरणार्थी तदा राजन्निलिल्ये भयपीडितः ।।
data.md: O king, the pigeon from the fear of the hawk fell upon the king's thighs for protection; and it became almost dead from the great fear.

data.v: धर्मात्मानं त्वाहुरेकं सर्वे राजन्महीक्षितः । स वै धर्मविरुद्धं त्वं कस्मात्कर्म चिकीर्षसि ।।
data.md: The Hawk said: All the kings of earth call you virtuous. Therefore why do you perform an act which is not in accordance with Dharma?

data.v: विहितं भक्षणं राजन्पीड्यमानस्य मे क्षुधा । मा भाङ्क्षीर्धर्मलोभेन धर्ममुत्सृष्टवानसि ।।
data.md: O king, I am oppressed by hunger; do not withhold from me my ordained food on the belief that you are thus gaining virtue, whereas you are not.

data.v: संत्रस्तरूपस्त्राणार्थी त्वत्तो भीतो महाद्विज । मत्सकाशमनुप्राप्तः प्राणगृध्नुरयं द्विजः ।।
data.md: The King said: O great bird, this one is afflicted with the fear of you; and desirous of escaping from you it has come in a fury to me for protection.

data.v: एवमभ्यागतस्येह कपोतस्याभयार्थिनः । अप्रदाने परोऽधर्मः किं त्वं श्येन प्रपश्यसि ।।
data.md: O hawk, why do you not see that it is a great virtue for me not to give up this pigeon which has thus come to me?

data.v: प्रस्पन्दमानः संभ्रान्तः कपोतः श्येन लक्ष्यते । मत्सकाशं जीवितार्थी तस्य त्यागो विगर्हितः ।।
data.md: O hawk, this pigeon is seen to tremble with fear; it is agitated, it has come to me for protection of its life. It is not proper for me to forsake it.

data.v: आहारात्सर्वभूतानि संभवन्ति महीपते । आहारेण विवर्धन्ते तेन जीवन्ति जन्तवः ।।
data.md: The Hawk said : O ruler of earth, all creatures exist on food. The animals are nourished and sustained by food.

data.v: शक्यते दुस्त्यजेऽप्यर्थे चिररात्राय जीवितुम् । न तु भोजनमुत्सृज्य शक्यं वर्तयितुं चिरम् ।।
data.md: A man can live many days even after forsaking his dear ones, but be cannot live long after abstaining from food.

data.v: भक्ष्याद्विलोपितस्याद्य मम प्राणा विशां पते । विसृज्य कायमेष्यन्ति पन्थानमपुनर्भवम् ।।
data.md: O king, my life will depart today if deprived of food. Leaving my body it would fearlessly go away to other ways.

data.v: प्रमृते मयि धर्मात्मन्पुत्रदारं नशिष्यति । रक्षमाणः कपोतं त्वं बहून्प्राणान्नशिष्यसि ।।
data.md: O virtuous-minded one, at my death my wife and children will perish. By protecting the pigeon you do not (at all) protect many lives.

data.v: धर्मं यो बाधते धर्मो न स धर्मः कुधर्म तत् । अविरोधी तु यो धर्मः स धर्मः सत्यविक्रम ।।
data.md: The virtue, that stands in the way of another virtue, is (really) unrighteousness. O truthful king, that virtue true virtue which is not conflicting.

data.v: विरोधिषु महीपाल निश्चित्य गुरुलाघवम् । न बाधा विद्यते यत्र तं धर्मं समुदाचरेत् ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, after comparing the opposing virtues and weighing their comparative merits, one ought to espouse that which is not opposing. Where there is no confliction, one should adopt that virtue which preponderates.

data.v: गुरुलाघवमाज्ञाय धर्माधर्मविनिश्चये । यतो भूयांस्ततो राजन्कुरु धर्मविनिश्चयम् ।।
बहुकल्याणसंयुक्तं भाषसे विहगोत्तम । सुपर्णः पक्षिराट्किं त्वं धर्मज्ञश्चास्यसंशयम् । तथा हि धर्मसंयुक्तं बहु चित्रं प्रभाषसे ।।
data.md: The King said : O excellent bird, as you speak words fraught with good, (may I ask) are you the king of birds, Suparna (Garuda)? I have not the least doubt that you are learned in all the precepts of virtue.

data.v: न तेऽस्त्यविदितं किंचिदिति त्वा लक्षयाम्यहम् । शरणैषिणः परित्यागं कथं साध्विति मन्यसे ।।
आहारार्थं समारम्भस्तव चायं विहंगम । शक्यश्चाप्यन्यथा कर्तुमाहारोऽप्यधिकस्त्वया ।।
गोवृषो वा वराहो वा मृगो वा महिषोऽपि वा । त्वदर्थमद्य क्रियतां यद्वान्यदभिकाङ्क्षसे ।।
data.md: You can appease you hunger with some other food which would be more plentiful. I am perfectly willing to procure for you any sort of food that would be palatable to you, whether it be an ox or a boar or a deer or a buffalo.

data.v: न वराहं न चोक्षाणं न मृगान्विविधांस्तथा । भक्षयामि महाराज किमन्नाद्येन तेन मे ।।
data.md: The Hawk said: O great king, I am not desirous of eating a boar or an ox or any other kind of beasts. What have I to do with any other food?

data.v: यस्तु मे दैवविहितो भक्षः क्षत्रियपुंगव । तमुत्सृज महीपाल कपोतमिममेव मे ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, O best of Kshatriyas, give me therefore this pigeon which is the food ordained to me by the celestials.

data.v: श्येनाः कपोतान्खादन्ति स्थितिरेषा सनातनी । मा राजन्मार्गमाज्ञाय कदलीस्कन्धमारुह ।।
data.md: O king, that the hawks eat the pigeons, is an eternal law. Do not get on a plantain tree not knowing its want of strength (to support you).

data.v: राज्यं शिबीनामृद्धं वै शाधि पक्षिगणार्चित । यद्वा कामयसे किंचिच्छ्येन सर्वं ददानि ते । विनेमं पक्षिणं श्येन शरणार्थिनमागतम् ।।
येनेमं वर्जयेथास्त्वं कर्मणा पक्षिसत्तम । तदाचक्ष्व करिष्यामि न हि दास्ये कपोतकम् ।।
data.md: O hawk, O excellent bird, with the exception of giving up this pigeon which has come to me for protection. Tell me what I shall have to do for the deliverance of this bird, I shall not give you this pigeon.

data.v: उशीनर कपोते ते यदि स्नेहो नराधिप । आत्मनो मांसमुत्कृत्य कपोततुलया धृतम् ।।
data.md: The Hawk said : O Ushinara, O ruler of men, if you have so much affection for the pigeon, then cut a portion of your flesh and weigh it against this pigeon.

data.v: यदा समं कपोतेन तव मांसं भवेन्नृप । तदा प्रदेयं तन्मह्यं सा मे तुष्टिर्भविष्यति ।।
data.md: O excellent king, when you flesh would be equal in weight with this pigeon, give it then to me and I shall be then satisfied.

data.v: अनुग्रहमिमं मन्ये श्येन यन्माभियाचसे । तस्मात्तेऽद्य प्रदास्यामि स्वमांसं तुलया धृतम् ।।
data.md: The King said : O hawk, I consider your this request as a favour. I shall give you my own flesh weighing it against the pigeon.

data.v: अथोत्कृत्य स्वमांसं तु राजा परमधर्मवित् । तुलयामास कौन्तेय कपोतेन सहाभिभो ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O son of Kunti, O lord, cutting off his own flesh, that virtuous king weighed it against the pigeon.

data.v: ध्रियमाणस्तु तुलया कपोतो व्यतिरिच्यते । पुनश्चोत्कृत्य मांसानि राजा प्रादादुशीनरः ।।
data.md: But when he found that the pigeon was more heavy than this flesh (thus cut and placed in the scale), the king Ushinara again cut (some more) flesh (from his body) and placed it (in the scale).

data.v: न विद्यते यदा मांसं कपोतेन समं धृतम् । तत उत्कृत्तमांसोऽसावारुरोह स्वयं तुलाम् ।।
data.md: When portion after portion of his flesh had been added to weigh against the pigeon and no more flesh was left on his body, he then himself mounted on the scale.

data.v: इन्द्रोऽहमस्मि धर्मज्ञ कपोतो हव्यवाडयम् । जिज्ञासमानौ धर्मे त्वां यज्ञवाटमुपागतौ ।।
data.md: The Hawk said : O virtuous king, I am Indra. The pigeon is the carrier of the sacrificial Ghee (Agni). In order to test your virtuous merit, we came to your sacrificial grounds,

data.v: यत्ते मांसानि गात्रेभ्य उत्कृत्तानि विशां पते । एषा ते भास्वरी कीर्तिर्लोकानभिभविष्यति ।।
data.md: O king, as you have cut off your flesh from your body, your glory will be resplendent.

data.v: यावल्लोके मनुष्यास्त्वां कथयिष्यन्ति पार्थिव । तावत्कीर्तिश्च लोकाश्च स्थास्यन्ति तव शाश्वताः ।।
data.md: O king, as long as men will speak of you on earth, so long will your glory endure and eternal region would be reserved for you.

data.v: तत्पाण्डवेय सदनं राज्ञस्तस्य महात्मनः । पश्यस्वैतन्मया सार्धं पुण्यं पापप्रमोचनम् ।।
अत्र वै सततं देवा मुनयश्च सनातनाः । दृश्यन्ते ब्राह्मणै राजन्पुण्यवद्भिर्महात्मभिः ।।
data.md: Behold it which is holy and capable of cleansing sins. O king, here are always seen the celestials and eternal Rishis and also virtuous and high-souled Brahmanas.

data.v: यः कथ्यते मन्त्रविदग्र्यबुद्धि;रौद्दालकिः श्वेतकेतुः पृथिव्याम् । तस्याश्रमं पश्य नरेन्द्र पुण्यं; सदाफलैरुपपन्नं महीजैः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O ruler of men, behold the sacred hermitage of Shvatakatu, the son of Uddalka, whose fame as an expert in Mantras is so widely spread all over the world. It always abounds in fruit trees.

data.v: साक्षादत्र श्वेतकेतुर्ददर्श; सरस्वतीं मानुषदेहरूपाम् । वेत्स्यामि वाणीमिति संप्रवृत्तां; सरस्वतीं श्वेतकेतुर्बभाषे ।।
data.md: Here did Shvatakatu see Sarasvati herself in her heavenly form. Shvatakatu said to Sarasvati when she appeared, “Make me endued with the gift of speech.”

data.v: तस्मिन्काले ब्रह्मविदां वरिष्ठा;वास्तां तदा मातुलभागिनेयौ । अष्टावक्रश्चैव कहोडसूनु;रौद्दालकिः श्वेतकेतुश्च राजन् ।।
विदेहराजस्य महीपतेस्तौ; विप्रावुभौ मातुलभागिनेयौ । प्रविश्य यज्ञायतनं विवादे; बन्दिं निजग्राहतुरप्रमेयम् ।।
data.md: These two Brahmanas of matchless energy went to the sacrificial ground of the king of Videha and defeated Bandi (in a controversy).

data.v: कथंप्रभावः स बभूव विप्र;स्तथायुक्तं यो निजग्राह बन्दिम् । अष्टावक्रः केन चासौ बभूव; तत्सर्वं मे लोमश शंस तत्त्वम् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : O Lomasha, tell me all about the power of this Brahmana who had thus defeated Bandi. Why was he born as Ashtavakra (crooked in cight parts of his body)?

data.v: उद्दालकस्य नियतः शिष्य एको; नाम्ना कहोडेति बभूव राजन् । शुश्रूषुराचार्यवशानुवर्ती; दीर्घं कालं सोऽध्ययनं चकार ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : Udhalaka had a self-controlled disciple who was known by the name of Kohada. He was entirely devoted to the service of his preceptor and he continued his studies for a long time.

data.v: तं वै विप्राः पर्यभवंश्च शिष्या;स्तं च ज्ञात्वा विप्रकारं गुरुः सः । तस्मै प्रादात्सद्य एव श्रुतं च; भार्यां च वै दुहितरं स्वां सुजाताम् ।।
data.md: That Brahmana served his preceptor for a long time. Recognising it his preceptor gave him a mastery over the Shastras and also bestowed upon him his own daughter Sujata.

data.v: तस्या गर्भः समभवदग्निकल्पः; सोऽधीयानं पितरमथाभ्युवाच । सर्वां रात्रिमध्ययनं करोषि; नेदं पितः सम्यगिवोपवर्तते ।।
data.md: She became with child as cffulgent as fire and the child while engaged in study spoke thus to his father, “O father, you have been reading for the whole night, but your reading does not seem to me correct.

data.v: उपालब्धः शिष्यमध्ये महर्षिः; स तं कोपादुदरस्थं शशाप । यस्मात्कुक्षौ वर्तमानो ब्रवीषि; तस्माद्वक्रो भवितास्यष्टकृत्वः ।।
data.md: Through your grace I have become even in my this fatal state learned in all the Shastras and in the Vedas and in the Vedangas. But O father, I tell you what proceeds from your lips is not correct."

data.v: स वै तथा वक्र एवाभ्यजाय;दष्टावक्रः प्रथितो वै महर्षिः । तस्यासीद्वै मातुलः श्वेतकेतुः; स तेन तुल्यो वयसा बभूव ।।
data.md: Having been thus insulted before his disciples, the great Rishi cursed in anger the child in the womb. “As you speak from the womb, so will you be crooked in eight parts of your body." Thus the child was born crooked and the great Rishi was ever afterwards known by the name of Ashtavakra. He had an uncle, named Shvatakatu who was of the same age as himself.

data.v: संपीड्यमाना तु तदा सुजाता; विवर्धमानेन सुतेन कुक्षौ । उवाच भर्तारमिदं रहोगता; प्रसाद्य हीनं वसुना धनार्थिनी ।।
data.md: Having been much oppressed for the growth of the child in the womb, Sujata, who was desirous of obtaining wealth, conciliating her husband who had no wealth, spoke to him thus in private.

data.v: कथं करिष्याम्यधना महर्षे; मासश्चायं दशमो वर्तते मे । न चास्ति ते वसु किंचित्प्रजाता; येनाहमेतामापदं निस्तरेयम् ।।
data.md: "O great king, what shall I do now, as the tenth month of my pregnancy has come! Neither you nor I possess any wealth with which we can be delivered from this distress."

data.v: उक्तस्त्वेवं भार्यया वै कहोडो; वित्तस्यार्थे जनकमथाभ्यगच्छत् । स वै तदा वादविदा निगृह्य; निमज्जितो बन्दिनेहाप्सु विप्रः ।।
data.md: Having been thus addressed by his wife, Kohada went to Janaka for wealth. That Brahmana was defeated (in a controversy) by Bandi who was learned in the science of arguments. The result was that he was drowned.

data.v: उद्दालकस्तं तु तदा निशम्य; सूतेन वादेऽप्सु तथा निमज्जितम् । उवाच तां तत्र ततः सुजाता;मष्टावक्रे गूहितव्योऽयमर्थः ।।
data.md: Having heard that his sin-in-law had been defeated by Bandi and that he had been drowned, Udhalaka thus spoke to Sujata, “You must keep it a secret from Ashtavakra.”

data.v: ररक्ष सा चाप्यति तं सुमन्त्रं; जातोऽप्येवं न स शुश्राव विप्रः । उद्दालकं पितृवच्चापि मेने; अष्टावक्रो भ्रातृवच्छ्वेतकेतुम् ।।
data.md: She (accordingly) kept it a secret (from Ashtavakra). Thus that Brahmana heard nothing of it when he was born. He regarded Udhalaka as his father and Shvataketu as his brother.

data.v: ततो वर्षे द्वादशे श्वेतकेतु;रष्टावक्रं पितुरङ्के निषण्णम् । अपाकर्षद्गृह्य पाणौ रुदन्तं; नायं तवाङ्कः पितुरित्युक्तवांश्च ।।
data.md: When Ashtavakra was in his twelfth year, Shvataketu one day saw him on his father's lap. He dragged Ashtavakra by catching hold of his hand and when he (Ashtavakra) began to cry, he said, “This is not your father's lap.”

data.v: यत्तेनोक्तं दुरुक्तं तत्तदानीं; हृदि स्थितं तस्य सुदुःखमासीत् । गृहं गत्वा मातरं रोदमानः; पप्रच्छेदं क्व नु तातो ममेति ।।
data.md: These cruel word went to his heart and he became greatly aggrieved. Going home and coming to his mother, he asked “Where is my father?"

data.v: ततः सुजाता परमार्तरूपा; शापाद्भीता सर्वमेवाचचक्षे । तद्वै तत्त्वं सर्वमाज्ञाय मातु;रित्यब्रवीच्छ्वेतकेतुं स विप्रः ।।
data.md: Thereupon Sujata greatly afflicted and afraid of his curse told him all that had happened. Having heard all, that Brahmana (Ashtavakra) spoke in the night thus to Shvataketu.

data.v: गच्छाव यज्ञं जनकस्य राज्ञो; बह्वाश्चर्यः श्रूयते तस्य यज्ञः । श्रोष्यावोऽत्र ब्राह्मणानां विवाद;मन्नं चाग्र्यं तत्र भोक्ष्यावहे च । विचक्षणत्वं च भविष्यते नौ; शिवश्च सौम्यश्च हि ब्रह्मघोषः ।।
तौ जग्मतुर्मातुलभागिनेयौ; यज्ञं समृद्धं जनकस्य राज्ञः । अष्टावक्रः पथि राज्ञा समेत्य; उत्सार्यमाणो वाक्यमिदं जगाद ।।
data.md: Thereupon the uncle and the nephew went to the splendid sacrifice of the king Janaka. Having been driven away from the path, Ashtavakra on meeting the king thus spoke to him.

data.v: अन्धस्य पन्था बधिरस्य पन्थाः; स्त्रियः पन्था वैवधिकस्य पन्थाः । राज्ञः पन्था ब्राह्मणेनासमेत्य; समेत्य तु ब्राह्मणस्यैव पन्थाः ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: When no Brahmana passes along a path, it then belongs first to the blind, then to the deaf, then to women, then to the carriers of burden and then (last of all) to the king But when a Brahmana is met on the way, it solely belongs to him.

data.v: पन्था अयं तेऽद्य मया निसृष्टो; येनेच्छसे तेन कामं व्रजस्व । न पावको विद्यते वै लघीया;निन्द्रोऽपि नित्यं नमते ब्राह्मणानाम् ।।
data.md: The king said : I leave the path, go in whatever way you like. Even the smallest fire is not to be slighted. Indra himself always bows down to a Brahmana.

data.v: यज्ञं द्रष्टुं प्राप्तवन्तौ स्व तात; कौतूहलं नौ बलवद्वै विवृद्धम् । आवां प्राप्तावतिथी संप्रवेशं; काङ्क्षावहे द्वारपते तवाज्ञाम् ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said : O king, O ruler of men, we have come to see the sacrifice, our curiosity was very great. We have come as Athithis (guests). We ask your order on the gate-keeper.

data.v: ऐन्द्रद्युम्नेर्यज्ञदृशाविहावां; विवक्षू वै जनकेन्द्रं दिदृक्षू । न वै क्रोधाद्व्याधिनैवोत्तमेन; संयोजय द्वारपाल क्षणेन ।।
data.md: O son of Indradumnya, we have come here with the desire of seeing the sacrifice and to see and to speak with king Janaka. We are burning with anger, for the gate-keeper stops us.

data.v: बन्देः समादेशकरा वयं स्म; निबोध वाक्यं च मयेर्यमाणम् । न वै बालाः प्रविशन्त्यत्र विप्रा; वृद्धा विद्वांसः प्रविशन्ति द्विजाग्र्याः ।।
data.md: The gate-keeper said : We carry out the word of Bandi. Hear what I say. The boy are not permitted to enter here; only old and learned Brahmanas are allowed to enter.

data.v: यद्यत्र वृद्धेषु कृतः प्रवेशो; युक्तं मम द्वारपाल प्रवेष्टुम् । वयं हि वृद्धाश्चरितव्रताश्च; वेदप्रभावेन प्रवेशनार्हाः ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: O gate-keeper, if this be the order that only old men can enter here, then we can enter. We also are old and we have observed severe vows. We are endued with the effulgence of the Vedas,

data.v: शुश्रूषवश्चापि जितेन्द्रियाश्च; ज्ञानागमे चापि गताः स्म निष्ठाम् । न बाल इत्यवमन्तव्यमाहु;र्बालोऽप्यग्निर्दहति स्पृश्यमानः ।।
data.md: We have served our preceptor and we have subdued our passions and we have also obtained proficiency in knowledge. It is said that even boys must not be slighted; for the smallest fire if touched burns.

data.v: सरस्वतीमीरय वेदजुष्टा;मेकाक्षरां बहुरूपां विराजम् । अङ्गात्मानं समवेक्षस्व बालं; किं श्लाघसे दुर्लभा वादसिद्धिः ।।
data.md: The gate-keeper said: O boy, if you know, recite the verse demonstrating the existence of the Supreme Being, adored by the celestials sages and composed of one letter though multifarious. Do not indulge in vain boasting. Learned men are very rare.

data.v: न ज्ञायते कायवृद्ध्या विवृद्धि;र्यथाष्ठीला शाल्मलेः संप्रवृद्धा । ह्रस्वोऽल्पकायः फलितो विवृद्धो; यश्चाफलस्तस्य न वृद्धभावः ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: True growth can not be inferred from the mere growth of the body, as the growth of the knots of Salmali tree cannot tell its age. That tree is called full grown, which, though slender and short, bears fruits.

data.v: वृद्धेभ्य एवेह मतिं स्म बाला; गृह्णन्ति कालेन भवन्ति वृद्धाः । न हि ज्ञानमल्पकालेन शक्यं; कस्माद्बालो वृद्ध इवावभाषसे ।।
data.md: The gate-keeper said : Boys receive instruction from the old and they thus in due time grow old. Knowledge cannot be obtained in a short time. Therefore why being but a child do you talk like an old man?

data.v: न तेन स्थविरो भवति येनास्य पलितं शिरः । बालोऽपि यः प्रजानाति तं देवाः स्थविरं विदुः ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said : One is not old, because his hair has turned white. Even boys who possess knowledge are considered to be old by the celestials.

data.v: न हायनैर्न पलितैर्न वित्तेन न बन्धुभिः । ऋषयश्चक्रिरे धर्मं योऽनूचानः स नो महान् ।।
data.md: The Rishis have not ordained that a man's merit depends on years or on gray hair or wealth or friend. To us one who is versed in the Vedas is great.

data.v: दिदृक्षुरस्मि संप्राप्तो बन्दिनं राजसंसदि । निवेदयस्व मां द्वाःस्थ राज्ञे पुष्करमालिने ।।
data.md: O gate-keeper, I have come with the desire of secing Bandi. Go, inform the king (Janaka) adorned with the garlands of lotuses.

data.v: द्रष्टास्यद्य वदतो द्वारपाल; मनीषिभिः सह वादे विवृद्धे । उताहो वाप्युच्चतां नीचतां वा; तूष्णीं भूतेष्वथ सर्वेषु चाद्य ।।
कथं यज्ञं दशवर्षो विशेस्त्वं; विनीतानां विदुषां संप्रवेश्यम् । उपायतः प्रयतिष्ये तवाहं; प्रवेशने कुरु यत्नं यथावत् ।।
data.md: The gate-keeper said : How can you, who are but in your tenth year, hope to enter into the grounds of this sacrifice into which only learned and educated men are admitted? I shall however try some means to admit you. You too make an attempt.

data.v: भो भो राजञ्जनकानां वरिष्ठ; सभाज्यस्त्वं त्वयि सर्वं समृद्धम् । त्वं वा कर्ता कर्मणां यज्ञियानां; ययातिरेको नृपतिर्वा पुरस्तात् ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: O king, O best of Janaka's race, you are an emperor and all wealth rest in you. In the days of yore, Yayati was the (great) performer of sacrifices and in the modern age you are the great performer of sacrifices.

data.v: विद्वान्बन्दी वेदविदो निगृह्य; वादे भग्नानप्रतिशङ्कमानः । त्वया निसृष्टैः पुरुषैराप्तकृद्भि;र्जले सर्वान्मज्जयतीति नः श्रुतम् ।।
data.md: We have heard that the learned Bandi, after defeating (in controversy), men who are experts in discussion, causes them to be drowned by faithful servants employed by you.

data.v: स तच्छ्रुत्वा ब्राह्मणानां सकाशा;द्ब्रह्मोद्यं वै कथयितुमागतोऽस्मि । क्वासौ बन्दी यावदेनं समेत्य; नक्षत्राणीव सविता नाशयामि ।।
data.md: Having heard this from the Brahmanas, I have come to expound the doctrine of the Supreme Being. Where is that Bandi? Tell me, so that I may destroy him, as the sun destroys the stars.

data.v: आशंससे बन्दिनं त्वं विजेतु;मविज्ञात्वा वाक्यबलं परस्य । विज्ञातवीर्यैः शक्यमेवं प्रवक्तुं; दृष्टश्चासौ ब्राह्मणैर्वादशीलैः ।।
data.md: The King said: You hope to defeat Bandi, because you do not know his power. Can they, who know him, speak as you do? He had been tested by the Brahmanas who were experts in discussion.

data.v: विवादितोऽसौ न हि मादृशैर्हि; सिंहीकृतस्तेन वदत्यभीतः । समेत्य मां निहतः शेष्यतेऽद्य; मार्गे भग्नं शकटमिवाबलाक्षम् ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said : Bandi has never had an occasion to hold a discussion with a man like me. It is only for this reasor, that he considers himself as a lion and goes about roaring like one. But when he will meet me today, he will lie down (dead) as a cart breaks down on the road when its wheels have been deranged.

data.v: षण्णाभेर्द्वादशाक्षस्य चतुर्विंशतिपर्वणः । यस्त्रिषष्टिशतारस्य वेदार्थं स परः कविः ।।
data.md: The King said : He alone is a really learned man who understands the thing that has thirty divisions, twelve parts, twenty-four joints and three hundred and sixty spokes.

data.v: चतुर्विंशतिपर्व त्वां षण्णाभि द्वादशप्रधि । तत्त्रिषष्टिशतारं वै चक्रं पातु सदागति ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: May that ever-revolving wheel (Time) that has twenty-four joints, six naves twelve peripheries and sixty spokes protect you.

data.v: वडवे इव संयुक्ते श्येनपाते दिवौकसाम् । कस्तयोर्गर्भमाधत्ते गर्भं सुषुवतुश्च कम् ।।
data.md: The King said : Who among the celestials gives birth to those who which go together like two yoked mares and swoop down like hawks; and to what also do they give birth?

data.v: मा स्म ते ते गृहे राजञ्शात्रवाणामपि ध्रुवम् । वातसारथिराधत्ते गर्भं सुषुवतुश्च तम् ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said : O king, may God keep away from your house those two (thunder and lightning), nay cven from the house of your enemies. He who appears with the wind as his charioteer (cloud or mind) gives, birth to them and they also produce him.

data.v: किं स्वित्सुप्तं न निमिषति किं स्विज्जातं न चोपति । कस्य स्विद्धृदयं नास्ति किं स्विद्वेगेन वर्धते ।।
data.md: The King said: What is it that does not close its eyes even when it is asleep? What is it that does not move when born? What is it that has no heart and what is it that increases in its speed?

data.v: मत्स्यः सुप्तो न निमिषत्यण्डं जातं न चोपति । अश्मनो हृदयं नास्ति नदी वेगेन वर्धते ।।
data.md: The King said: What is it that does not close its eyes even when it is asleep? What is it that does not move when born? What is it that has no heart and what is it that increases in its speed?

data.v: न त्वा मन्ये मानुषं देवसत्त्वं; न त्वं बालः स्थविरस्त्वं मतो मे । न ते तुल्यो विद्यते वाक्प्रलापे; तस्माद्द्वारं वितराम्येष बन्दी ।।
data.md: The King said : Opossessor of divine energy, it appears that you are not a human being. I do not consider that you are a boy. I consider you to be a grown up man. There is none who can be compared with you in learning. Therefore I give you admittance. Yonder is Bandi.

data.v: अत्रोग्रसेनसमितेषु राज;न्समागतेष्वप्रतिमेषु राजसु । न वै विवित्सान्तरमस्ति वादिनां; महाजले हंसनिनादिनामिव ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said : O king, O commander of large army, cannot find Bandi, this chief of controversialists in that assembly of these kings of matchless power who have met together. I search for him as one searches for a swan on a vast expanse of water.

data.v: न मेऽद्य वक्ष्यस्यतिवादिमानि;न्ग्लहं प्रपन्नः सरितामिवागमः । हुताशनस्येव समिद्धतेजसः; स्थिरो भवस्वेह ममाद्य बन्दिन् ।।
data.md: O Bandi, you consider that you are the foremost of all controversialists. When you will engage with me to argue, you will then not be able to flow like the current of a river. I am like a flaming fire. Be silent before me.

data.v: व्याघ्रं शयानं प्रति मा प्रबोधय; आशीविषं सृक्किणी लेलिहानम् । पदाहतस्येव शिरोऽभिहत्य; नादष्टो वै मोक्ष्यसे तन्निबोध ।।
data.md: Do not awaken a sleeping tiger. Know that you will not escape biting when you will trample on the head of a poisonous snake, which is licking the corner of its mouth with its tongue and which has been hurt by your foot.

data.v: यो वै दर्पात्संहननोपपन्नः; सुदुर्बलः पर्वतमाविहन्ति । तस्यैव पाणिः सनखो विशीर्यते; न चैव शैलस्य हि दृश्यते व्रणः ।।
data.md: That weak man, who in the pride of his strength strikes a blow at a mountain, only hurts his hands and nails. He can not wound the mountains.

data.v: सर्वे राज्ञो मैथिलस्य मैनाकस्येव पर्वताः । निकृष्टभूता राजानो वत्सा अनदुहो यथा ।।
data.md: As all other mountains are inferior to the Mainakas, as calves are inferior to the ox, so are all the others kings of the earth inferior to the king of Mithila.

data.v: अष्टावक्रः समितौ गर्जमानो; जातक्रोधो बन्दिनमाह राजन् । उक्ते वाक्ये चोत्तरं मे ब्रवीहि; वाक्यस्य चाप्युत्तरं ते ब्रवीमि ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O king, having said this and becoming greatly angry with Bandi, Ashtavakra began to roar in the assembly. He said, “Answer my questions, I shall answer yours.”

data.v: एक एवाग्निर्बहुधा समिध्यते; एकः सूर्यः सर्वमिदं प्रभासते । एको वीरो देवराजो निहन्ता; यमः पितॄणामीश्वरश्चैक एव ।।
data.md: Bandi said: Fire is only one which blazes in various forms, One is the sun that illuminates the universe, One is the hero, Indra, the lord of the celestials who destroys all enemies, One is Yama, the sole lord of the Pitris.

data.v: द्वाविन्द्राग्नी चरतो वै सखायौ; द्वौ देवर्षी नारदः पर्वतश्च । द्वावश्विनौ द्वे च रथस्य चक्रे; भार्यापती द्वौ विहितौ विधात्रा ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said : The two friends, Agni and Indra, move together; the celestials sages are Two Narada and Parvata, the Ashvins are Two, the wheels of a car are two. It is Two, husband and wife, that live together as ordained by the deity.

data.v: त्रिः सूयते कर्मणा वै प्रजेयं; त्रयो युक्ता वाजपेयं वहन्ति । अध्वर्यवस्त्रिषवणानि तन्वते; त्रयो लोकास्त्रीणि ज्योतींषि चाहुः ।।
data.md: Bandi said: Three kinds of being are born as the results of their acts, Three are the Vedas that perform the Vajapeya sacrifice; at three different times the Adhvaryus commence sacrifice, three also are the divine lights.

data.v: चतुष्टयं ब्राह्मणानां निकेतं; चत्वारो युक्ता यज्ञमिमं वहन्ति । दिशश्चतस्रश्चतुरश्च वर्णा;श्चतुष्पदा गौरपि शश्वदुक्ता ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: Four are the Ashrams of the Brahmanas; four orders perform sacrifices; four are the cardinal points; four is the number of letters and four also are the legs of a cow.

data.v: पञ्चाग्नयः पञ्चपदा च पङ्क्ति;र्यज्ञाः पञ्चैवाप्यथ पञ्चेन्द्रियाणि । दृष्टा वेदे पञ्चचूडाश्च पञ्च; लोके ख्यातं पञ्चनदं च पुण्यम् ।।
data.md: Bandi said: Five is the number of fires; five are the feet of Punkti (a meter); five are the sacrifices; it is said in the Vedas that five locks are on the heads of the Apsaras and five are the sacred rivers in the world.

data.v: षडाधाने दक्षिणामाहुरेके; षडेवेमे ऋतवः कालचक्रम् । षडिन्द्रियाण्युत षट्कृत्तिकाश्च; षट्साद्यस्काः सर्ववेदेषु दृष्टाः ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: Six cows are paid as Dakshina on establishing the sacred fire; six are the seasons belonging to the wheel of time, six stars constitute the constellation Kirtika and the Vedas say six the number of Sadyaska sacrifice.

data.v: सप्त ग्राम्याः पशवः सप्त वन्याः; सप्त छन्दांसि क्रतुमेकं वहन्ति । सप्तर्षयः सप्त चाप्यर्हणानि; सप्ततन्त्री प्रथिता चैव वीणा ।।
data.md: Bandi said : Seven is the number of domestic animals, seven also is the number of wild animals; seven meters are used in completing a sacrifice; seven are the Rishis, seven are the forms of paying homage and seven, are the strings of the Binda.

data.v: अष्टौ शाणाः शतमानं वहन्ति; तथाष्टपादः शरभः सिंहघाती । अष्टौ वसूञ्शुश्रुम देवतासु; यूपश्चाष्टास्रिर्विहितः सर्वयज्ञः ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: Eight are the bags that hold hundred-fold, eight is the number of the Sarava, which preys upon lions, eight are the Vasus among the celestials and eight are the angles of a Yupa (stake) in a sacrifice.

data.v: नवैवोक्ताः सामिधेन्यः पितॄणां; तथा प्राहुर्नवयोगं विसर्गम् । नवाक्षरा बृहती संप्रदिष्टा; नवयोगो गणनामेति शश्वत् ।।
data.md: Bandi said: Nine is the number of the Mantras used in kindling the fire in a sacrifice to the Pitris: nine are the fixed functions in the progresses of creation, nine letters compose the foot of Vrihati (a meter) and nine also are numbers (in calculation).

data.v: दशा दशोक्ताः पुरुषस्य लोके; सहस्रमाहुर्दश पूर्णं शतानि । दशैव मासान्बिभ्रति गर्भवत्यो; दशेरका दश दाशा दशार्णाः ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said : Ten is the number of the cardinal points; ten times hundred make a thousand; ten is the number of months of a woman's conception, ten are the teachers of true knowledge and ten are the haters of knowledge and ten again who are capable of obtaining it.

data.v: एकादशैकादशिनः पशूना;मेकादशैवात्र भवन्ति यूपाः । एकादश प्राणभृतां विकारा; एकादशोक्ता दिवि देवेषु रुद्राः ।।
data.md: Eleven are the enjoyable objects, eleven is the number of Yupas (sacrificial stake), eleven are the natural states of all living creatures, eleven are the Rudras among the celestials in heaven.

data.v: संवत्सरं द्वादश मासमाहु;र्जगत्याः पादो द्वादशैवाक्षराणि । द्वादशाहः प्राकृतो यज्ञ उक्तो; द्वादशादित्यान्कथयन्तीह विप्राः ।।
data.md: Twelve are the months in a year; twelve letters compose a foot of Yayati (a meter) twelve are the sacrifices and the learned say twelve is the number of the Adityas.

data.v: त्रयोदशी तिथिरुक्ता महोग्रा; त्रयोदशद्वीपवती मही च ।।
data.md: Bandi said : Thirteen lunar days are most auspicious and thirteen islands exist on earth.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा विरराम बन्दी; श्लोकस्यार्धं व्याजहाराष्टवक्रः । त्रयोदशाहानि ससार केशी; त्रयोदशादीन्यतिच्छन्दांसि चाहुः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : Having said this Bandi stopped. Thereupon Ashtavakra supplied the other half of the Sloka.

data.v: ततो महानुदतिष्ठन्निनाद;स्तूष्णींभूतं सूतपुत्रं निशम्य । अधोमुखं ध्यानपरं तदानी;मष्टावक्रं चाप्युदीर्यन्तमेव ।।
तस्मिंस्तथा संकुले वर्तमाने; स्फीते यज्ञे जनकस्याथ राज्ञः । अष्टावक्रं पूजयन्तोऽभ्युपेयु;र्विप्राः सर्वे प्राञ्जलयः प्रतीताः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: Having seen Ashtavakra speaking and Suta's son sitting silent and pensive and with head down-cast, all men raised up great uproar in the assembly. When the tumult thus rose in the king Janaka's great sacrifice, the Brahmanas i became very much pleased and with joined hands they came to Ashtavakra and paid him homage.

data.v: अनेन वै ब्राह्मणाः शुश्रुवांसो; वादे जित्वा सलिले मज्जिताः किल । तानेव धर्मानयमद्य बन्दी; प्राप्नोतु गृह्याप्सु निमज्जयैनम् ।।
data.md: Defeating the Brahmanas in controversy Bandi threw them into the waters. Let Bandi meet with the same fate to day. Seize him and drown him in the water.

data.v: अहं पुत्रो वरुणस्योत राज्ञ;स्तत्रास सत्रं द्वादशवार्षिकं वै । सत्रेण ते जनक तुल्यकालं; तदर्थं ते प्रहिता मे द्विजाग्र्याः ।।
data.md: O Janaka, I am the son of king Varuna. Simultaneously with your sacrifice, there (underneath the sea) has been commenced (by Varuna) a sacrifice extending over twelve years. Therefore I have sent there those chief Brahmanas.

data.v: एते सर्वे वरुणस्योत यज्ञं; द्रष्टुं गता इह आयान्ति भूयः । अष्टावक्रं पूजये पूजनीयं; यस्य हेतोर्जनितारं समेष्ये ।।
data.md: They had all gone to see Varuna's sacrifice. Behold they are (all) coming. I pay homage to the revered Ashtavakra by whose favour I shall today join him who has begotten me.

data.v: विप्राः समुद्राम्भसि मज्जितास्ते; वाचा जिता मेधया आविदानाः । तां मेधया वाचमथोज्जहार; यथा वाचमवचिन्वन्ति सन्तः ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said: Defeating the Brahmanas either by words or subtlety, he has thrown them into the waters of the sea. By dint of my intellect I have to day have rescued them.

data.v: अग्निर्दहञ्जातवेदाः सतां गृहा;न्विसर्जयंस्तेजसा न स्म धाक्षीत् । बालेषु पुत्रेषु कृपणं वदत्सु; तथा वाचमवचिन्वन्ति सन्तः ।।
data.md: As Agni (fire) who knows the character of both the good and the bad, leaves unscorched those that are honest, so do good men judge the assertions of even boys, though they lack in the power of speech.

data.v: श्लेष्मातकी क्षीणवर्चाः शृणोषि; उताहो त्वां स्तुतयो मादयन्ति । हस्तीव त्वं जनक वितुद्यमानो; न मामिकां वाचमिमां शृणोषि ।।
data.md: O Janaka, you are hearing my words as if you have been stupified by eating the fruit of Sleshmataki tree. You have been robbed of your sense by flattery. Therefore though you are pierced by my words as an elephant by the goad, you do not heed them.

data.v: शृणोमि वाचं तव दिव्यरूपा;ममानुषीं दिव्यरूपोऽसि साक्षात् । अजैषीर्यद्बन्दिनं त्वं विवादे; निसृष्ट एष तव कामोऽद्य बन्दी ।।
data.md: Janaka said: I listen to your words which are excellent and superhuman. Your appearance also appears to me as superhuman. As you "have to day defeated Bandi, I place even him at your disposal.

data.v: नानेन जीवता कश्चिदर्थो मे बन्दिना नृप । पिता यद्यस्य वरुणो मज्जयैनं जलाशये ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra said : O king, if Bandi remains alive, he would come to no use of mine. If his father is really Varuna, let him be drowned in the sea.

data.v: अहं पुत्रो वरुणस्योत राज्ञो; न मे भयं सलिले मज्जितस्य । इमं मुहूर्तं पितरं द्रक्ष्यतेऽय;मष्टावक्रश्चिरनष्टं कहोडम् ।।
data.md: Bandi said: I am the son of the king Varuna. I have therefore no fear to be drowned. Even at this very moment Ashtavakra would see his longlost father Kahoda.

data.v: ततस्ते पूजिता विप्रा वरुणेन महात्मना । उदतिष्ठन्त ते सर्वे जनकस्य समीपतः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : Then rose before Janaka all the Brahmanas, after they been duly worshipped by the illustrious Varuna.

data.v: इत्यर्थमिच्छन्ति सुताञ्जना जनक कर्मणा । यदहं नाशकं कर्तुं तत्पुत्रः कृतवान्मम ।।
data.md: Kahoda said: O Janaka, it is for this reason men desire for sons by performing virtuous acts. That in which I failed has been done by my son.

data.v: उताबलस्य बलवानुत बालस्य पण्डितः । उत वाविदुषो विद्वान्पुत्रो जनक जायते ।।
data.md: O Janaka, weak men may have strong sons, fools may have intelligent sons and the illiterate may have learned sons.

data.v: शितेन ते परशुना स्वयमेवान्तको नृप । शिरांस्यपाहरत्वाजौ रिपूणां भद्रमस्तु ते ।।
data.md: Bandi said: O king, it is with your sharp axe that Yama severs the heads of his enemies. May prosperity attend you.

data.v: महदुक्थ्यं गीयते साम चाग्र्यं; सम्यक्सोमः पीयते चात्र सत्रे । शुचीन्भागान्प्रतिजगृहुश्च हृष्टाः; साक्षाद्देवा जनकस्येह यज्ञे ।।
data.md: In this sacrifice of king Janaka, the chief hymns relating to the Uktha rites are sung and the Soma juice is properly drunk. The celestials themselves with cheerful hearts accept their sacred portions.

data.v: समुत्थितेष्वथ सर्वेषु राज;न्विप्रेषु तेष्वधिकं सुप्रभेषु । अनुज्ञातो जनकेनाथ राज्ञा; विवेश तोयं सागरस्योत बन्दी ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O king, when all the Brahmanas rose (from the waters), their splendour was much enhanced; Bandi with the permission of king Janaka then entered the ocean.

data.v: अष्टावक्रः पितरं पूजयित्वा; संपूजितो ब्राह्मणैस्तैर्यथावत् । प्रत्याजगामाश्रममेव चाग्र्यं; जित्वा बन्दिं सहितो मातुलेन ।।
data.md: Ashtavakra then worshipped his father and he himself was (also) worshipped by the Brahmanas. Having thus defeated Suta's son, he returned with his uncle to his excellent hermitage.

data.v: अत्र कौन्तेय सहितो भ्रातृभिस्त्वं; सुखोषितः सह विप्रैः प्रतीतः । पुण्यान्यन्यानि शुचिकर्मैकभक्ति;र्मया सार्धं चरितास्याजमीढ ।।
data.md: O son of Kunti, O descendant of Ajamira, being intent on good deeds, you will perform many other virtuous acts by living happily here with your brothers and the Brahmanas.

data.v: एषा मधुविला राजन्समङ्गा संप्रकाशते । एतत्कर्दमिलं नाम भरतस्याभिषेचनम् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: O king, here is visible the river Samanga which is also called Madhubela. Yonder is Kardamela, the bathing place of Bharata.

data.v: अलक्ष्म्या किल संयुक्तो वृत्रं हत्वा शचीपतिः । आप्लुतः सर्वपापेभ्यः समङ्गायां व्यमुच्यत ।।
data.md: When the lord of Sachi, (Indra) became devoid of his prosperity in consequence of killing Vritra, he was cleansed of his sins by bathing in the Samanga.

data.v: एतद्विनशनं कुक्षौ मैनाकस्य नरर्षभ । अदितिर्यत्र पुत्रार्थं तदन्नमपचत्पुरा ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, here is the spot where the Mainaka has sunk into the interior of the earth. It is therefore called Vinasana. In order to obtain sons Aditi in the days of yore cooked his famous food.

data.v: एनं पर्वतराजानमारुह्य पुरुषर्षभ । अयशस्यामसंशब्द्यामलक्ष्मीं व्यपनोत्स्यथ ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, ascend this lofty mountain and put an end to your inglorious misery which is not worthy of uttering.

data.v: एते कनखला राजनृषीणां दयिता नगाः । एषा प्रकाशते गङ्गा युधिष्ठिर महानदी ।।
data.md: O king, yonder is the Kanakhala mountain, the favourite resort of the Rishis, O Yudhishthira, yonder is the great river Ganga.

data.v: सनत्कुमारो भगवानत्र सिद्धिमगात्पराम् । आजमीढावगाह्यैनां सर्वपापैः प्रमोक्ष्यसे ।।
data.md: Here in the days of yore the holy sage Sanatkumara attained ascetic auccess. O descendant of Ajmira, if you bathe in it, you will be cleansed of all your sins.

data.v: अपां ह्रदं च पुण्याख्यं भृगुतुङ्गं च पर्वतम् । तूष्णीं गङ्गां च कौन्तेय सामात्यः समुपस्पृश ।।
data.md: O son of Kunti, touch with your ministers this lake, called Punya and this Bhrigutunga (mountain) and also these two rivers called Tashniganga.

data.v: आश्रमः स्थूलशिरसो रमणीयः प्रकाशते । अत्र मानं च कौन्तेय क्रोधं चैव विवर्जय ।।
data.md: O son of Kunti, yonder is the charming hermitage of Sulasherasha. Abandon your anger and sense of self-importance.

data.v: एष रैभ्याश्रमः श्रीमान्पाण्डवेय प्रकाशते । भारद्वाजो यत्र कविर्यवक्रीतो व्यनश्यत ।।
data.md: O son of Pandu, yonder is the beautiful hermitage of Raivya where died the son of Bharadvaja, Yavakrit, learned in the Vedas.

data.v: कथंयुक्तोऽभवदृषिर्भरद्वाजः प्रतापवान् । किमर्थं च यवक्रीत ऋषिपुत्रो व्यनश्यत ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: How did the mighty sage Yavakrit, the son of the ascetic Bharadvaja, acquire profound knowledge in the Vedas. How also did he die?

data.v: एतत्सर्वं यथावृत्तं श्रोतुमिच्छामि लोमश । कर्मभिर्देवकल्पानां कीर्त्यमानैर्भृशं रमे ।।
data.md: I desire to learn all this as they happened. I take delight in hearing the accounts of the celestials-like men.

data.v: भरद्वाजश्च रैभ्यश्च सखायौ संबभूवतुः । तावूषतुरिहात्यन्तं प्रीयमाणौ वनान्तरे ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : Bharadvaja and Raivya were two friends. They both lived here always taking the greatest pleasure in each other's company.

data.v: रैभ्यस्य तु सुतावास्तामर्वावसुपरावसू । आसीद्यवक्रीः पुत्रस्तु भरद्वाजस्य भारत ।।
data.md: Raivya had two sons, named Arvavasu and Pravashu. O descendant of Bharata, Bharadvaja had only one son named Yavakrit.

data.v: रैभ्यो विद्वान्सहापत्यस्तपस्वी चेतरोऽभवत् । तयोश्चाप्यतुला प्रीतिर्बाल्यात्प्रभृति भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, Raivya and his sons became learned and the other (Bharadvaja) became an ascetic. From their childhood their friendship was matchless.

data.v: यवक्रीः पितरं दृष्ट्वा तपस्विनमसत्कृतम् । दृष्ट्वा च सत्कृतं विप्रै रैभ्यं पुत्रैः सहानघ ।।
data.md: O sinless one, seeing that his father who practised asceticism was slighted by the Brahmanas, while Raivya with his sons was greatly respected by them, the high-spirited Yavakrit was overwhelmed with sorrow and became pale. O son of Pandu, he underwent severe austerities in order to get the knowledge of the Vedas.

data.v: पर्यतप्यत तेजस्वी मन्युनाभिपरिप्लुतः । तपस्तेपे ततो घोरं वेदज्ञानाय पाण्डव ।।
data.md: O sinless one, seeing that his father who practised asceticism was slighted by the Brahmanas, while Raivya with his sons was greatly respected by them, the high-spirited Yavakrit was overwhelmed with sorrow and became pale. O son of Pandu, he underwent severe austerities in order to get the knowledge of the Vedas.

data.v: सुसमिद्धे महत्यग्नौ शरीरमुपतापयन् । जनयामास संतापमिन्द्रस्य सुमहातपाः ।।
data.md: He exposed his body to a flaming fire. By thus practising great asceticism he filled Indra with great anxiety.

data.v: तत इन्द्रो यवक्रीतमुपगम्य युधिष्ठिर । अब्रवीत्कस्य हेतोस्त्वमास्थितस्तप उत्तमम् ।।
data.md: O Yudhishthira, thereupon Indra went to him and thus spoke to him, 'Why have you been engaged in the severe austerities?

data.v: द्विजानामनधीता वै वेदाः सुरगणार्चित । प्रतिभान्त्विति तप्येऽहमिदं परमकं तपः ।।
data.md: Yavakrit said : O worshipped of the celestials, I am engaged in the severe asceticism, because I desire to possess such knowledge of the Vedas as has never been acquired by any Brahmana.

data.v: स्वाध्यायार्थे समारम्भो ममायं पाकशासन । तपसा ज्ञातुमिच्छामि सर्वज्ञानानि कौशिक ।।
data.md: O chastiser of Paka, O Kaushika, my this attempt is for obtaining the knowledge of the Vedas. By the force of my asceticism, I desire to acquire all sorts of knowledge.

data.v: कालेन महता वेदाः शक्या गुरुमुखाद्विभो । प्राप्तुं तस्मादयं यत्नः परमो मे समास्थितः ।।
data.md: O lord, the knowledge of the Vedas that are to be learnt from teachers, requires long time to acquire. Therefore I am engaged in this great attempt.

data.v: अमार्ग एष विप्रर्षे येन त्वं यातुमिच्छसि । किं विघातेन ते विप्र गच्छाधीहि गुरोर्मुखात् ।।
data.md: Indra said: O Brahmana Rishi, the way you have adopted is not the proper way. O Brahmana, why will you destroy yourself? Go and learn (the Vedas) from a preceptor.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा गतः शक्रो यवक्रीरपि भारत । भूय एवाकरोद्यत्नं तपस्यमितविक्रम ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, having said this, Sakra (Indra) departed and Yavakrit of immeasurable prowess again engaged himself in asceticism.

data.v: घोरेण तपसा राजंस्तप्यमानो महातपाः । संतापयामास भृशं देवेन्द्रमिति नः श्रुतम् ।।
data.md: O king we have heard that by thus undergoing severe asceticism, he again greatly agitated the lord of the celestials.

data.v: तं तथा तप्यमानं तु तपस्तीव्रं महामुनिम् । उपेत्य बलभिद्देवो वारयामास वै पुनः ।।
data.md: The slayer of Bala, the deity (Indra) again came to that great Rishi who was engaged in that great austerity and forbade him to do it.

data.v: अशक्योऽर्थः समारब्धो नैतद्बुद्धिकृतं तव । प्रतिभास्यन्ति वै वेदास्तव चैव पितुश्च ते ।।
data.md: Indra said: You are doing all this with the intention that the knowledge of the Vedas might be manifest in you and in your father, but your attempt can never be successful. Your this act is not welladvised.

data.v: न चैतदेवं क्रियते देवराज ममेप्सितम् । महता नियमेनाहं तप्स्ये घोरतरं तपः ।।
data.md: Yavakrit said : O king of the celestials, if you will not do what I desire, I shall, then, by observing stricter vows, practise still more severe austerities.

data.v: समिद्धेऽग्नावुपकृत्याङ्गमङ्गं; होष्यामि वा मघवंस्तन्निबोध । यद्येतदेवं न करोषि कामं; ममेप्सितं देवराजेह सर्वम् ।।
data.md: O king of the celestials, know that if you do not fulfill all my desires, I shall then cut off my limbs and offer them as a sacrifice to a blazing fire.

data.v: निश्चयं तमभिज्ञाय मुनेस्तस्य महात्मनः । प्रतिवारणहेत्वर्थं बुद्ध्या संचिन्त्य बुद्धिमान् ।।
data.md: Lomasha said: Having known the firın resolution of that high-souled Rishi, that intelligent deity (Indra) reflected (for a moment) and hit upon a means by which to dissuade him.

data.v: तत इन्द्रोऽकरोद्रूपं ब्राह्मणस्य तपस्विनः । अनेकशतवर्षस्य दुर्बलस्य सयक्ष्मणः ।।
data.md: Thereupon Indra assumed the garb of an ascetic Brahmana, who was many hundred years of age and who was weak and consumptive.

data.v: यवक्रीतस्य यत्तीर्थमुचितं शौचकर्मणि । भागीरथ्यां तत्र सेतुं वालुकाभिश्चकार सः ।।
data.md: He began to construct a dam of sands at thai spot of the Bhagirathi where Yavakrit used to go to perform his ablutions.

data.v: यदास्य वदतो वाक्यं न स चक्रे द्विजोत्तमः । वालुकाभिस्ततः शक्रो गङ्गां समभिपूरयन् ।।
data.md: As that foremost of Brahmanas paid no heed to the words of Sakra (Indra), he therefore began to fill Ganga with sands.

data.v: वालुकामुष्टिमनिशं भागीरथ्यां व्यसर्जयत् । सेतुमभ्यारभच्छक्रो यवक्रीतं निदर्शयन् ।।
data.md: Without stopping for a moment, he threw handfuls of sands into the Bhagirathi and to construct the dam thus attracting the notice of the Rishi.

data.v: तं ददर्श यवक्रीस्तु यत्नवन्तं निबन्धने । प्रहसंश्चाब्रवीद्वाक्यमिदं स मुनिपुंगवः ।।
data.md: When that foremost of Rishis, Yavakrit, saw him thus earnestly engaged in bridging (the Ganges), he broke out into a loud laughter and thus spoke.

data.v: किमिदं वर्तते ब्रह्मन्किं च ते ह चिकीर्षितम् । अतीव हि महान्यत्नः क्रियतेऽयं निरर्थकः ।।
data.md: Yavakrit said: O Brahmana, what are you doing? What is your intention? Why are you in vain making this great attempt?

data.v: बन्धिष्ये सेतुना गङ्गां सुखः पन्था भविष्यति । क्लिश्यते हि जनस्तात तरमाणः पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: Indra said: O sire, I am trying to bridge the Ganga, so that a comfortable way may be made across it. People meet with great inconvenience in again and again crossing and recrossing it.

data.v: नायं शक्यस्त्वया बद्धुं महानोघः कथंचन । अशक्याद्विनिवर्तस्व शक्यमर्थं समारभ ।।
data.md: Yavakrit said : O ascetic, you cannot bridge this mighty river. O Brahmana, desist from what is impracticable; attempt some thing practicable.

data.v: यथैव भवता चेदं तपो वेदार्थमुद्यतम् । अशक्यं तद्वदस्माभिरयं भारः समुद्यतः ।।
data.md: Indra said: I have undertaken this heavy task, as you have engaged yourself in these great austerities to obtain the knowledge of the Vedas, an attempt which can never be successful.

data.v: यथा तव निरर्थोऽयमारम्भस्त्रिदशेश्वर । तथा यदि ममापीदं मन्यसे पाकशासन ।।
data.md: Yavakrit said : O lord of the celestials, O chastiser of Paka, if you consider these my attempts as fruitless, as yours are,

data.v: क्रियतां यद्भवेच्छक्यं मया सुरगणेश्वर । वरांश्च मे प्रयच्छान्यान्यैरन्यान्भवितास्म्यति ।।
data.md: O lord of the celestials, be pleased to do for me what is practicable. Favour me with boons by which I may excel all other men.

data.v: तस्मै प्रादाद्वरानिन्द्र उक्तवान्यान्महातपाः । प्रतिभास्यन्ति ते वेदाः पित्रा सह यथेप्सिताः ।।
data.md: Lomasha said : Indra granted him boons as was asked by the great ascetic. He said, "as you desire it, the Vedas will be manifest in you as well as in your father.

data.v: यच्चान्यत्काङ्क्षसे कामं यवक्रीर्गम्यतामिति । स लब्धकामः पितरमुपेत्याथ ततोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Your all other desires also will be fulfilled." Having thus obtained all that he desired, he came to his father and said,

data.v: प्रतिभास्यन्ति वै वेदा मम तातस्य चोभयोः । अति चान्यान्भविष्यावो वरा लब्धास्तथा मया ।।
data.md: O father, the Vedas will be manifest in you as well as in me. In have obtained boons by which we shall excel all other men.

data.v: दर्पस्ते भविता तात वराँल्लब्ध्वा यथेप्सितान् । स दर्पपूर्णः कृपणः क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यसि ।।
data.md: Bharadvaja said : O son, as you have obtained all that you desired, you (as a matter of course) will (now) be proud. And when you will be filled with pride, destruction will soon overtake you.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीमा गाथा देवैरुदाहृताः । ऋषिरासीत्पुरा पुत्र बालधिर्नाम वीर्यवान् ।।
data.md: O son, there is a story told by the celestials as an instance (of this). In the days of yore there was a greatly powerful Rishi, named Valadhi.

data.v: स पुत्रशोकादुद्विग्नस्तपस्तेपे सुदुश्चरम् । भवेन्मम सुतोऽमर्त्य इति तं लब्धवांश्च सः ।।
data.md: Being afflicted with grief for the death of his son, he performed great asceticism, to get a child who would be immortal. He obtained such a son.

data.v: तस्य प्रसादो देवैश्च कृतो न त्वमरैः समः । नामर्त्यो विद्यते मर्त्यो निमित्तायुर्भविष्यति ।।
data.md: But the celestials, though very much favourably disposed towards him, did not still make his son immortal like the celestials. They said that on no condition a mortal can be made immortal.

data.v: यथेमे पर्वताः शश्वत्तिष्ठन्ति सुरसत्तमाः । अक्षयास्तन्निमित्तं मे सुतस्यायुर्भवेदिति ।।
data.md: Valadhi said: O foremost of the celestials, these mountains are existing for an ever-lasting time; indestructible as they are, they will be the instrumental of my son's immortality.

data.v: तस्य पुत्रस्तदा जज्ञे मेधावी क्रोधनः सदा । स तच्छ्रुत्वाकरोद्दर्पमृषींश्चैवावमन्यत ।।
data.md: Bharadvaja said : Afterwards a son was born to that Rishi, named Medhavi, who was of very wrathful temper. Having heard all about his birth he grew haughty and began to insult the Rishis.

data.v: विकुर्वाणो मुनीनां तु चरमाणो महीमिमाम् । आससाद महावीर्यं धनुषाक्षं मनीषिणम् ।।
data.md: He roamed over the earth committing various mischiefs to the Rishis. He one day met with the intelligent and greatly powerful (Rishi) Dhanushakha.

data.v: तस्यापचक्रे मेधावी तं शशाप स वीर्यवान् । भव भस्मेति चोक्तः स न भस्म समपद्यत ।।
data.md: Medhavi maltreated him; therefore that greatly powerful Rishi cursed him saying, "Be reduced to ashes.” But he was not reduced to ashes.

data.v: धनुषाक्षस्तु तं दृष्ट्वा मेधाविनमनामयम् । निमित्तमस्य महिषैर्भेदयामास वीर्यवान् ।।
data.md: Thereupon having seen this, Dhanushakha caused the mountain which was the instrumental cause of his life to be shattered by buffaloes.

data.v: स निमित्ते विनष्टे तु ममार सहसा शिशुः । तं मृतं पुत्रमादाय विललाप ततः पिता ।।
data.md: When the instrumental cause of his life was destroyed, the child (Medhavi) suddenly died. Thereupon taking up his dead son the father began to lament.

data.v: लालप्यमानं तं दृष्ट्वा मुनयः पुनरार्तवत् । ऊचुर्वेदोक्तया पूर्वं गाथया तन्निबोध मे ।।
data.md: Now hear from me the verse that was recited by the Rishis learned in the Vedas when they saw the Rishi thus mourning.

data.v: न दिष्टमर्थमत्येतुमीशो मर्त्यः कथंचन । महिषैर्भेदयामास धनुषाक्षो महीधरान् ।।
data.md: "On no condition can a mortal overcome what has been ordained by Fate. Dhanushakha shattered even mountain by buffaloes.”

data.v: एवं लब्ध्वा वरान्बाला दर्पपूर्णास्तरस्विनः । क्षिप्रमेव विनश्यन्ति यथा न स्यात्तथा भवान् ।।
data.md: Thus having obtained boons, young ascetics are (generally) filled with pride and perish in no time. Do not become one of them.

data.v: एष रैभ्यो महावीर्यः पुत्रौ चास्य तथाविधौ । तं यथा पुत्र नाभ्येषि तथा कुर्यास्त्वतन्द्रितः ।।
data.md: O son, this Raibhya is greatly powerful, so are his two sons. Therefore, be careful never to approach him.

data.v: स हि क्रुद्धः समर्थस्त्वां पुत्र पीडयितुं रुषा । वैद्यश्चापि तपस्वी च कोपनश्च महानृषिः ।।
data.md: O son, this Raibhya is a great Rishi and an ascetic of wrathful temper. If wrathful he can do you harm in anger.

data.v: एवं करिष्ये मा तापं तात कार्षीः कथंचन । यथा हि मे भवान्मान्यस्तथा रैभ्यः पिता मम ।।
data.md: Yavakrit said : O father, I shall do as you command me. Never be in anxiety for it. As you, my father, deserve to be respected by me, so is Raibhya.
