अथोपसृत्य तरसा भीमो भीमपराक्रमः । सिंहनादं समकरोद्बोधयिष्यन्कपिं तदा ।।
तेन शब्देन भीमस्य वित्रेसुर्मृगपक्षिणः । हनूमांश्च महासत्त्व ईषदुन्मील्य लोचने । अवैक्षदथ सावज्ञं लोचनैर्मधुपिङ्गलैः ।।
स्मितेनाभाष्य कौन्तेयं वानरो नरमब्रवीत् । किमर्थं सरुजस्तेऽहं सुखसुप्तः प्रबोधितः ।।
ननु नाम त्वया कार्या दया भूतेषु जानता । वयं धर्मं न जानीमस्तिर्यग्योनिं समाश्रिताः ।।
मनुष्या बुद्धिसंपन्ना दयां कुर्वन्ति जन्तुषु । क्रूरेषु कर्मसु कथं देहवाक्चित्तदूषिषु । धर्मघातिषु सज्जन्ते बुद्धिमन्तो भवद्विधाः ।।
data.md: Why do then men like your august self commit acts that are harmful alike to body, speech and heart and which are also destructive of virtue.

data.v: न त्वं धर्मं विजानासि वृद्धा नोपासितास्त्वया । अल्पबुद्धितया वन्यानुत्सादयसि यन्मृगान् ।।
data.md: You know not what virtue is. You have not taken advice from the wise men. You have but little sense and therefore from childishness you destroy lower animals.

data.v: ब्रूहि कस्त्वं किमर्थं वा वनं त्वमिदमागतः । वर्जितं मानुषैर्भावैस्तथैव पुरुषैरपि ।।
data.md: Tell me who you are. Why have you come to the forest devoid of humanity and human beings?

data.v: अतः परमगम्योऽयं पर्वतः सुदुरारुहः । विना सिद्धगतिं वीर गतिरत्र न विद्यते ।।
कारुण्यात्सौहृदाच्चैव वारये त्वां महाबल । नातः परं त्वया शक्यं गन्तुमाश्वसिहि प्रभो ।।
data.md: O hero, O lord, out of kindness I ask you, to desist. Listen to my words. Further up from this place you are not able to go. Therefore desist.

data.v: इमान्यमृतकल्पानि मूलानि च फलानि च । भक्षयित्वा निवर्तस्व ग्राह्यं यदि वचो मम ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, you are welcome here to day in every way. If you at all accept my words, then rest here partaking of fruits and roots as sweet as ambrosia. Do not for nothing be killed.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य वानरेन्द्रस्य धीमतः । भीमसेनस्तदा वीरः प्रोवाचामित्रकर्शनः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O chastiser foes, having heard these words of the intelligent monkey chief, the heroic Bhima thus spoke to him.

data.v: को भवान्किंनिमित्तं वा वानरं वपुराश्रितः । ब्राह्मणानन्तरो वर्णः क्षत्रियस्त्वानुपृच्छति ।।
data.md: Bhima said: Who are your august self? For what reason you are in the shape of a monkey? It is a Kshatriya, an order next to the Brahmanas who asks you.

data.v: कौरवः सोमवंशीयः कुन्त्या गर्भेण धारितः । पाण्डवो वायुतनयो भीमसेन इति श्रुतः ।।
data.md: I am a descendant of Kuru, born in the Lunar dynasty, born by Kunti in her womb, a son of Pandu, begotten by Vayu, known by the name of Bhimasena.

data.v: स वाक्यं भीमसेनस्य स्मितेन प्रतिगृह्य तत् । हनूमान्वायुतनयो वायुपुत्रमभाषत ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Hearing the words of that Kuru hero, Hanuman smiled and that son of Vayu thus spoke to the son of Vayu (Bhima).

data.v: वानरोऽहं न ते मार्गं प्रदास्यामि यथेप्सितम् । साधु गच्छ निवर्तस्व मा त्वं प्राप्स्यसि वैशसम् ।।
data.md: Hanuman said : I am a monkey; I shall not grant you the passage you desire. Desist like an honest man and go back. Do not meet with destruction.

data.v: वैशसं वास्तु यद्वान्यन्न त्वा पृच्छामि वानर । प्रयच्छोत्तिष्ठ मार्गं मे मा त्वं प्राप्स्यसि वैशसम् ।।
data.md: Bhima said: O monkey, I do not ask you about destruction or anything else. Give me way. Arise, do not meet with grief at my hand.

data.v: नास्ति शक्तिर्ममोत्थातुं व्याधिना क्लेशितो ह्यहम् । यद्यवश्यं प्रयातव्यं लङ्घयित्वा प्रयाहि माम् ।।
data.md: Hanuman said : I am suffering from illness, therefore I have no strength to rise. If you are resolved to go, then go overleaping me.

data.v: निर्गुणः परमात्मेति देहं ते व्याप्य तिष्ठति । तमहं ज्ञानविज्ञेयं नावमन्ये न लङ्घये ।।
data.md: Bhima said: The attributes Supreme Soul pervades all bodies. I cannot disregard him who is knowable by only knowledge. Therefore I cannot overleap you.

data.v: यद्यागमैर्न विन्देयं तमहं भूतभावनम् । क्रमेयं त्वां गिरिं चेमं हनूमानिव सागरम् ।।
data.md: Had I not known him from whom all creatures have become manifest, I would have overleaped you, also this mountain, even as Hanuman did the ocean.

data.v: क एष हनुमान्नाम सागरो येन लङ्घितः । पृच्छामि त्वा कुरुश्रेष्ठ कथ्यतां यदि शक्यते ।।
data.md: Hanuman said: Who is he of the name of Hanuman who leaped over the ocean. O foremost of men I ask you, relate it if you can.

data.v: भ्राता मम गुणश्लाघ्यो बुद्धिसत्त्वबलान्वितः । रामायणेऽतिविख्यातः शूरो वानरपुंगवः ।।
data.md: Bhima said: He was my brother, excellent in all accomplishments and endued with with both intelligence and strength. That handsome and foremost of monkeys is celebrated in the Ramayana.

data.v: रामपत्नीकृते येन शतयोजनमायतः । सागरः प्लवगेन्द्रेण क्रमेणैकेन लङ्घितः ।।
data.md: The ocean extending over one hundred yojanas was leaped over by that monkey for Rama's wife.

data.v: स मे भ्राता महावीर्यस्तुल्योऽहं तस्य तेजसा । बले पराक्रमे युद्धे शक्तोऽहं तव निग्रहे ।।
data.md: That greatly powerful hero was my brother; I am equal to him in might, strength and prowess. I am able also to chastise you.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ देहि मे मार्गं पश्य वा मेऽद्य पौरुषम् । मच्छासनमकुर्वाणं मा त्वा नेष्ये यमक्षयम् ।।
data.md: Arise therefore, give me way or witness my prowess today. If you fail to do what I say, I send you to the abode of Yama.

data.v: विज्ञाय तं बलोन्मत्तं बाहुवीर्येण गर्वितम् । हृदयेनावहस्यैनं हनूमान्वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: Knowing him to be intoxicated and proud of his strength of arms. Hanuman slighted him (very much) in his mind and he thus spoke to him.

data.v: प्रसीद नास्ति मे शक्तिरुत्थातुं जरयानघ । ममानुकम्पया त्वेतत्पुच्छमुत्सार्य गम्यताम् ।।
data.md: Hanuman said: O sinless one, be kind towards me. I have no strength to rise in consequence of old age. From pity for me go by moving aside my tail.

data.v: सावज्ञमथ वामेन स्मयञ्जग्राह पाणिना । न चाशकच्चालयितुं भीमः पुच्छं महाकपेः ।।
data.md: Therefore with a smile, Bhima carelessly took hold of the tail with his left hand, but he could not move that tail of the mighty monkey.

data.v: उच्चिक्षेप पुनर्दोर्भ्यामिन्द्रायुधमिवोच्छ्रितम् । नोद्धर्तुमशकद्भीमो दोर्भ्यामपि महाबलः ।।
data.md: Then with both arms he pulled the tail resembling the sacrificial) pole raised up in honour of Indra. But the mighty Bhima failed to raise the tail with both his arms.

data.v: उत्क्षिप्तभ्रूर्विवृत्ताक्षः संहतभ्रुकुटीमुखः । स्विन्नगात्रोऽभवद्भीमो न चोद्धर्तुं शशाक ह ।।
data.md: His eyes were contracted up and his eye falls rolled, his face was contracted into wrinkles and his body was covered with sweat but still he failed to raise it.

data.v: यत्नवानपि तु श्रीमाँल्लाङ्गूलोद्धरणोद्धुतः । कपेः पार्श्वगतो भीमस्तस्थौ व्रीडादधोमुखः ।।
data.md: When he failed to raise it after many attempts, the illustrious Bhima came to the side of the monkey and stood before him in great shame.

data.v: प्रणिपत्य च कौन्तेयः प्राञ्जलिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत् । प्रसीद कपिशार्दूल दुरुक्तं क्षम्यतां मम ।।
data.md: That son of Kunti bowing down his head and joining his two hands, thus spoke to him, "O foremost of monkeys, be kind towards me. Forgive my harsh words.

data.v: सिद्धो वा यदि वा देवो गन्धर्वो वाथ गुह्यकः । पृष्टः सन्कामया ब्रूहि कस्त्वं वानररूपधृक् ।।
data.md: Are you a Siddha, a celestials, a Gandharva or a Guhaka, I ask you in curiosity. Who are you in the shape of a monkey?

data.v: यत्ते मम परिज्ञाने कौतूहलमरिंदम । तत्सर्वमखिलेन त्वं शृणु पाण्डवनन्दन ।।
data.md: Hanuman said: O chastiser of foes, as you are curious to know all about me, I shall narrate to you all. O son of Pandu, listen to it.

data.v: अहं केसरिणः क्षेत्रे वायुना जगदायुषा । जातः कमलपत्राक्ष हनूमान्नाम वानरः ।।
data.md: O lotus eyed hero, I am born in the womb of Kesari, begotten by Vayu who is the life of the universe. I am the monkey, named Hanuman.

data.v: सूर्यपुत्रं च सुग्रीवं शक्रपुत्रं च वालिनम् । सर्ववानरराजानौ सर्ववानरयूथपाः ।।
data.md: O chastiser of foes, all the mighty monkey chiefs waited upon that son of the sun, Sugriva and that son of Indra, Bali, Friendship between Sugriva and myself was like that between the wind and the fire.

data.v: उपतस्थुर्महावीर्या मम चामित्रकर्शन । सुग्रीवेणाभवत्प्रीतिरनिलस्याग्निना यथा ।।
data.md: O chastiser of foes, all the mighty monkey chiefs waited upon that son of the sun, Sugriva and that son of Indra, Bali, Friendship between Sugriva and myself was like that between the wind and the fire.

data.v: निकृतः स ततो भ्रात्रा कस्मिंश्चित्कारणान्तरे । ऋश्यमूके मया सार्धं सुग्रीवो न्यवसच्चिरम् ।।
data.md: For some cause Sugriva was driven out by his brother and lived for a long time with me at the Hrishvamukha.

data.v: अथ दाशरथिर्वीरो रामो नाम महाबलः । विष्णुर्मानुषरूपेण चचार वसुधामिमाम् ।।
data.md: Once upon a time, the greatly powerful son of Dasharatha by name Rama who was Vishnu in human form wandered over the earth.

data.v: स पितुः प्रियमन्विच्छन्सहभार्यः सहानुजः । सधनुर्धन्विनां श्रेष्ठो दण्डकारण्यमाश्रितः ।।
data.md: In order to please his father, he with his wife and brother, armed with the best of bows, resided in the Dandaka forest.

data.v: तस्य भार्या जनस्थानाद्रावणेन हृता बलात् । वञ्चयित्वा महाबुद्धिं मृगरूपेण राघवम् ।।
हृतदारः सह भ्रात्रा पत्नीं मार्गन्स राघवः । दृष्टवाञ्शैलशिखरे सुग्रीवं वानरर्षभम् ।।
data.md: Hanuman said: Having thus lost his wife while that descendant of Raghu was searching his wife with his brother, he met with the monkey chief Sugriva on the summit of the mountain.

data.v: तेन तस्याभवत्सख्यं राघवस्य महात्मनः । स हत्वा वालिनं राज्ये सुग्रीवं प्रत्यपादयत् । स हरीन्प्रेषयामास सीतायाः परिमार्गणे ।।
data.md: Then a friendship was contracted between that high-souled descendant of Raghu and Sugriva. Killing Bali, he gave him (Sugriva) the kingdom.

data.v: ततो वानरकोटीभिर्यां वयं प्रस्थिता दिशम् । तत्र प्रवृत्तिः सीताया गृध्रेण प्रतिपादिता ।।
ततोऽहं कार्यसिद्ध्यर्थं रामस्याक्लिष्टकर्मणः । शतयोजनविस्तीर्णमर्णवं सहसाप्लुतः ।।
data.md: Thereupon to accomplish the work of Rama of stainless deeds, I suddenly leaped over the ocean extending one hundred yojanas.

data.v: दृष्टा सा च मया देवी रावणस्य निवेशने । प्रत्यागतश्चापि पुनर्नाम तत्र प्रकाश्य वै ।।
ततो रामेण वीरेण हत्वा तान्सर्वराक्षसान् । पुनः प्रत्याहृता भार्या नष्टा वेदश्रुतिर्यथा ।।
ततः प्रतिष्ठिते रामे वीरोऽयं याचितो मया । यावद्रामकथा वीर भवेल्लोकेषु शत्रुहन् । तावज्जीवेयमित्येवं तथास्त्विति च सोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: I said, "O chastiser of foes, O Rama, let me live as long as the history of your deeds remains extant on earth. Thereupon he said, “So be it."

data.v: दश वर्षसहस्राणि दश वर्षशतानि च । राज्यं कारितवान्रामस्ततस्तु त्रिदिवं गतः ।।
data.md: Rama reigned ten thousand ten hundred years. Then he ascended his own abode.

data.v: तदिहाप्सरसस्तात गन्धर्वाश्च सदानघ । तस्य वीरस्य चरितं गायन्त्यो रमयन्ति माम् ।।
data.md: O child, O sinless one, since then Apsaras and the Gandharvas delight me by singing the great deeds of that great hero,

data.v: अयं च मार्गो मर्त्यानामगम्यः कुरुनन्दन । ततोऽहं रुद्धवान्मार्गं तवेमं देवसेवितम् । धर्षयेद्वा शपेद्वापि मा कश्चिदिति भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Kuru, this passage is impassable to mortals; for this reason and as also with the view that none may defeat or curse you, I have obstructed your passage trodden by the celestials. This is one of the paths to heaven. Mortals cannot pass this way. But the lake in search of which you have come lies in that direction.

data.v: दिव्यो देवपथो ह्येष नात्र गच्छन्ति मानुषाः । यदर्थमागतश्चासि तत्सरोऽभ्यर्ण एव हि ।।
एवमुक्तो महाबाहुर्भीमसेनः प्रतापवान् । प्रणिपत्य ततः प्रीत्या भ्रातरं हृष्टमानसः । उवाच श्लक्ष्णया वाचा हनूमन्तं कपीश्वरम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having been thus addressed, the mighty armed and greatly powerful Bhimasena cheerfully bowed down his head to his brother Hanuman.

data.v: मया धन्यतरो नास्ति यदार्यं दृष्टवानहम् । अनुग्रहो मे सुमहांस्तृप्तिश्च तव दर्शनात् ।।
एवं तु कृतमिच्छामि त्वयार्याद्य प्रियं मम । यत्ते तदासीत्प्लवतः सागरं मकरालयम् । रूपमप्रतिमं वीर तदिच्छामि निरीक्षितुम् ।।
data.md: O hero, I desire to see your that matchless form which you had at the time when you jumped across the ocean, that abode of crocodiles and sharks.

data.v: एवं तुष्टो भविष्यामि श्रद्धास्यामि च ते वचः । एवमुक्तः स तेजस्वी प्रहस्य हरिरब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: I shall be then satisfied and I shall have faith in your words.” Having been thus addressed, that greatly powerful one smilingly thus replied,

data.v: न तच्छक्यं त्वया द्रष्टुं रूपं नान्येन केनचित् । कालावस्था तदा ह्यन्या वर्तते सा न सांप्रतम् ।।
data.md: "My that form neither you nor any one else can see. The state of things was different at that age. It does not exist now.

data.v: अन्यः कृतयुगे कालस्त्रेतायां द्वापरेऽपरः । अयं प्रध्वंसनः कालो नाद्य तद्रूपमस्ति मे ।।
data.md: In the Krita Yuga, the state of things was one, in the Treta another and in the Dvapara another. Diminution (of everything) is taking place in this age. I have (therefore) not that form today.

data.v: भूमिर्नद्यो नगाः शैलाः सिद्धा देवा महर्षयः । कालं समनुवर्तन्ते यथा भावा युगे युगे । बलवर्ष्मप्रभावा हि प्रहीयन्त्युद्भवन्ति च ।।
data.md: The ground, the rivers, the plants, the rocks, the Siddhas, the celestials, the great Rishis, all conform to Time, as it comes to be in the different Yugas.

data.v: तदलं तव तद्रूपं द्रष्टुं कुरुकुलोद्वह । युगं समनुवर्तामि कालो हि दुरतिक्रमः ।।
data.md: O perpetuator of the Kuru race, therefore do not desire to see my former form. I am following the tendency of this (present) age. Time is irresistible.

data.v: युगसंख्यां समाचक्ष्व आचारं च युगे युगे । धर्मकामार्थभावांश्च वर्ष्म वीर्यं भवाभवौ ।।
data.md: Tell me what is the duration of different Yugas and what are the different manners and customs, virtue, pleasure and profit, acts, prowess, life and death in those different ages.

data.v: कृतं नाम युगं तात यत्र धर्मः सनातनः । कृतमेव न कर्तव्यं तस्मिन्काले युगोत्तमे ।।
data.md: O child, that Yuga was called Krita when only one true eternal religion was extant. In that best of Yugas everyone had religious perfection. There was no need for performing (any) religious act.

data.v: न तत्र धर्माः सीदन्ति न क्षीयन्ते च वै प्रजाः । ततः कृतयुगं नाम कालेन गुणतां गतम् ।।
data.md: Virtue then knew no decrease. It was for this reason that Yuga was called Krita (perfect). In course of time it lost all its attributes.

data.v: देवदानवगन्धर्वयक्षराक्षसपन्नगाः । नासन्कृतयुगे तात तदा न क्रयविक्रयाः ।।
data.md: O child, in the Krita Yuga there were no celestials, no Danavas, no Gandharvas, no Yakshas, no Rakshasas and no Nagas. There was neither buying nor selling.

data.v: न सामयजुऋग्वर्णाः क्रिया नासीच्च मानवी । अभिध्याय फलं तत्र धर्मः संन्यास एव च ।।
data.md: The Sama, the Rick, the Vayu (Vedas) did not exist. There was no manual labour. The necessaries of life were procured only by thinking for them. The only Dharma was then renunciation.

data.v: न तस्मिन्युगसंसर्गे व्याधयो नेन्द्रियक्षयः । नासूया नापि रुदितं न दर्पो नापि पैशुनम् ।।
data.md: In that Yuga there was neither disease nor the decay of the senses. There was neither Imalice, nor pride, nor hypocrisy nor discord, nor ill-will nor cunningness, nor fear, nor misery, nor envy, nor covetousness.

data.v: न विग्रहः कुतस्तन्द्री न द्वेषो नापि वैकृतम् । न भयं न च संतापो न चेर्ष्या न च मत्सरः ।।
ततः परमकं ब्रह्म या गतिर्योगिनां परा । आत्मा च सर्वभूतानां शुक्लो नारायणस्तदा ।।
data.md: For this reason, even that chief refuge of all Yugas, the Supreme Brahma was attainable to all. The white cloth-wearing Narayana (also was the soul of all creatures,

data.v: ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रिया वैश्याः शूद्राश्च कृतलक्षणाः । कृते युगे समभवन्स्वकर्मनिरताः प्रजाः ।।
data.md: In the Krita Yuga, the distinctive characteristics of the Brahmanas, the Kshatriyas, the Vaishyas and the Sudras were the same and all men were engaged in their own respective duties.

data.v: समाश्रमं समाचारं समज्ञानमतीबलम् । तदा हि समकर्माणो वर्णा धर्मानवाप्नुवन् ।।
data.md: Brahma was then the sole refuge (of all men), there manners and customs were adopted to the attainments of Brahma, the object of their knowledge was Brahina; all their acts also had reference to Brahma. Thus men of all orders obtained equal merit.

data.v: एकवेदसमायुक्ता एकमन्त्रविधिक्रियाः । पृथग्धर्मास्त्वेकवेदा धर्ममेकमनुव्रताः ।।
data.md: One uniform Soul was the object of their meditation, there was but one religion and one ordinance. Though Though they had different characteristics, they followed one Veda and they had one religion.

data.v: चातुराश्रम्ययुक्तेन कर्मणा कालयोगिना । अकामफलसंयोगात्प्राप्नुवन्ति परां गतिम् ।।
data.md: According to the divisions of time, they led the four modes of life without aiming at any object. Thus they obtained (final) emancipation.

data.v: आत्मयोगसमायुक्तो धर्मोऽयं कृतलक्षणः । कृते युगे चतुष्पादश्चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य शाश्वतः ।।
data.md: The sign of Krita Yuga was that the religion thian consisted of the identification of self with Brahma. In the Krita age the four orders had eternal fourfold measure.

data.v: एतत्कृतयुगं नाम त्रैगुण्यपरिवर्जितम् । त्रेतामपि निबोध त्वं यस्मिन्सत्रं प्रवर्तते ।।
data.md: Such was Krita Yuga devoid of the these qualities. Now hear from me all about the Treta Yuga in which sacrifices were introduced (in the word).

data.v: पादेन ह्रसते धर्मो रक्ततां याति चाच्युतः । सत्यप्रवृत्ताश्च नराः क्रियाधर्मपरायणाः ।।
data.md: (In this age) virtue decreased by a quarter and Narayana assumed a red colour. Men practised truth and devoted themselves to religion and religious rites.

data.v: ततो यज्ञाः प्रवर्तन्ते धर्माश्च विविधाः क्रियाः । त्रेतायां भावसंकल्पाः क्रियादानफलोदयाः ।।
data.md: Thus sacrifices were introduced and many religious rites came to be performed. In the Treta Yuga men began to devise to attain an object and they attained to it by performing (religious) acts and (giving away) gifts.

data.v: प्रचलन्ति न वै धर्मात्तपोदानपरायणाः । स्वधर्मस्थाः क्रियावन्तो जनास्त्रेतायुगेऽभवन् ।।
data.md: Men never deviated from virtue and they were always engaged in asceticism and the bestowal of gifts. The four orders were devoted to their respective duties and they performed (religious) rites. Such were the men in the Treta Yuga.

data.v: द्वापरेऽपि युगे धर्मो द्विभागोनः प्रवर्तते । विष्णुर्वै पीततां याति चतुर्धा वेद एव च ।।
data.md: In the Dvapara Yuga virtue decreased by half; Vishnu assumed a yellow colour; and the Vedas became divided into four parts.

data.v: ततोऽन्ये च चतुर्वेदास्त्रिवेदाश्च तथापरे । द्विवेदाश्चैकवेदाश्चाप्यनृचश्च तथापरे ।।
data.md: Then some learnt all the four Vedas; some again only three, some two and some did not know even the Rich.

data.v: एवं शास्त्रेषु भिन्नेषु बहुधा नीयते क्रिया । तपोदानप्रवृत्ता च राजसी भवति प्रजा ।।
data.md: The Shastras having been thus divided, (religious) acts also (naturally) multiplied. Mostly influenced by passion, men engaged in asceticism and gifts.

data.v: एकवेदस्य चाज्ञानाद्वेदास्ते बहवः कृताः । सत्यस्य चेह विभ्रंशात्सत्ये कश्चिदवस्थितः ।।
data.md: As men had no capacity to study the entire Veda, it came to be divided into several parts. And as the intellect (of men) deteriorated, few were devoted to truth.

data.v: सत्यात्प्रच्यवमानानां व्याधयो बहवोऽभवन् । कामाश्चोपद्रवाश्चैव तदा दैवतकारिताः ।।
data.md: When men fall off from truth, they become subject to various diseases, lust overtakes men and natural calamities fall on them.

data.v: यैरर्द्यमानाः सुभृशं तपस्तप्यन्ति मानवाः । कामकामाः स्वर्गकामा यज्ञांस्तन्वन्ति चापरे ।।
data.md: Being affected by these, some then betake to asceticism. Others perform sacrifices with the desire of enjoying worldly luxuries or of obtaining heaven (and its pleasures).

data.v: एवं द्वापरमासाद्य प्रजाः क्षीयन्त्यधर्मतः । पादेनैकेन कौन्तेय धर्मः कलियुगे स्थितः ।।
data.md: O son of Kunti, thus in the Dvapara age men became degenerated on account of their impiety. In the Kali Yuga, only one quarter of virtue remains.

data.v: तामसं युगमासाद्य कृष्णो भवति केशवः । वेदाचाराः प्रशाम्यन्ति धर्मयज्ञक्रियास्तथा ।।
data.md: When this age appears, Keshava (Vishnu) assumes a black colour. The Vedas, the Institutes, the virtue, the sacrifices and religious observances all fall into disuse.

data.v: ईतयो व्याधयस्तन्द्री दोषाः क्रोधादयस्तथा । उपद्रवाश्च वर्तन्ते आधयो व्याधयस्तथा ।।
data.md: Then Ati (excessive rain), draught, rats, locusts, birds and king, diseases, lassitude, anger, deformities, natural calamities, anguish and fear of famine take possession of the world.

data.v: युगेष्वावर्तमानेषु धर्मो व्यावर्तते पुनः । धर्मे व्यावर्तमाने तु लोको व्यावर्तते पुनः ।।
लोके क्षीणे क्षयं यान्ति भावा लोकप्रवर्तकाः । युगक्षयकृता धर्माः प्रार्थनानि विकुर्वते ।।
एतत्कलियुगं नाम अचिराद्यत्प्रवर्तते । युगानुवर्तनं त्वेतत्कुर्वन्ति चिरजीविनः ।।
यच्च ते मत्परिज्ञाने कौतूहलमरिंदम । अनर्थकेषु को भावः पुरुषस्य विजानतः ।।
data.md: O chastiser of foes, as regards your curiosity to know me, I tell you this, why should a wise man be eager to learn a superfluous thing?

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि । युगसंख्यां महाबाहो स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि गम्यताम् ।।
data.md: O mighty-armed hero, I have thus told you all that you asked me about the different Yugas. May good come to you. Now return.

data.v: पूर्वरूपमदृष्ट्वा ते न यास्यामि कथंचन । यदि तेऽहमनुग्राह्यो दर्शयात्मानमात्मना ।।
data.md: Bhima said: I shall never go without seeing your former form. If you are pleased with me, show me your own form.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भीमेन स्मितं कृत्वा प्लवंगमः । तद्रूपं दर्शयामास यद्वै सागरलङ्घने ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having been thus addressed by Bhima, the monkey chief showed him the forin in which he jumped across the sea.

data.v: भ्रातुः प्रियमभीप्सन्वै चकार सुमहद्वपुः । देहस्तस्य ततोऽतीव वर्धत्यायामविस्तरैः ।।
data.md: Desiring to gratify his brother, he (Hanuman) assumed a gigantic body which both in length and breadth grew exceedingly huge.

data.v: तद्रूपं कदलीषण्डं छादयन्नमितद्युतिः । गिरेश्चोच्छ्रयमागम्य तस्थौ तत्र स वानरः ।।
data.md: That greatly effulgent monkey stood there covering the whole of the plantain forest, full of trees and rising to the height, reached by the Vindhya (mountain).

data.v: समुच्छ्रितमहाकायो द्वितीय इव पर्वतः । ताम्रेक्षणस्तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रो भृकुटीकृतलोचनः । दीर्घलाङ्गूलमाविध्य दिशो व्याप्य स्थितः कपिः ।।
data.md: Having attained to a lofty and gigantic body which looked like another mountain, (a body) furnished with coppery eyes and sharp teeth and a face marked by frowns, he lay covering all sides, lashing his long tail. That descendant of Kuru (Bhima), seeing his brother's that gigantic form.

data.v: तद्रूपं महदालक्ष्य भ्रातुः कौरवनन्दनः । विसिस्मिये तदा भीमो जहृषे च पुनः पुनः ।।
तमर्कमिव तेजोभिः सौवर्णमिव पर्वतम् । प्रदीप्तमिव चाकाशं दृष्ट्वा भीमो न्यमीलयत् ।।
data.md: Was greatly astonished and the down of his body again and again stood on end. Seeing him as blazing as the sun or the golden mountain or the blazing sky, Bhima closed his eyes. Then Hanuman smilingly thus spoke to Bhima.

data.v: आबभाषे च हनुमान्भीमसेनं स्मयन्निव । एतावदिह शक्तस्त्वं रूपं द्रष्टुं ममानघ ।।
वर्धेऽहं चाप्यतो भूयो यावन्मे मनसेप्सितम् । भीम शत्रुषु चात्यर्थं वर्धते मूर्तिरोजसा ।।
data.md: "O Bhima, O sinless one, you are capable of seeing my form up to this extent. I can go on swelling my body as long as I wish. Amidst foes, my size increases exceedingly by its own energy.

data.v: तदद्भुतं महारौद्रं विन्ध्यमन्दरसंनिभम् । दृष्ट्वा हनूमतो वर्ष्म संभ्रान्तः पवनात्मजः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Seeing that dreadful and wonderful body of Hanuman like the Vindhya mountain, the son of Pavana (Bhima) grew bewildered.

data.v: प्रत्युवाच ततो भीमः संप्रहृष्टतनूरुहः । कृताञ्जलिरदीनात्मा हनूमन्तमवस्थितम् ।।
data.md: His down standing on end, the high-souled Bhima with joined hands spoke thus to Hanuman who was standing (in that form).

data.v: दृष्टं प्रमाणं विपुलं शरीरस्यास्य ते विभो । संहरस्व महावीर्य स्वयमात्मानमात्मना ।।
data.md: "O lord, O greatly mighty one. I have seen the vast dimensions of your body. Now decrease it with your own prowess.

data.v: न हि शक्नोमि त्वां द्रष्टुं दिवाकरमिवोदितम् । अप्रमेयमनाधृष्यं मैनाकमिव पर्वतम् ।।
data.md: I am unable to look at you who look like the rising sun, who is immeasurable and irrepressible and who resemble the Mainaka mountain.

data.v: विस्मयश्चैव मे वीर सुमहान्मनसोऽद्य वै । यद्रामस्त्वयि पार्श्वस्थे स्वयं रावणमभ्यगात् ।।
data.md: O hero, this is my great wonder to day that when you were at the side of Rama, he had to fight personally with Ravana.

data.v: त्वमेव शक्तस्तां लङ्कां सयोधां सहवाहनाम् । स्वबाहुबलमाश्रित्य विनाशयितुमोजसा ।।
data.md: Depending on your own strength of arms, you were capable of instantly destroying Lanka, with its warriors, heroes, elephants and chariots.

data.v: न हि ते किंचिदप्राप्यं मारुतात्मज विद्यते । तव नैकस्य पर्याप्तो रावणः सगणो युधि ।।
data.md: O son of Vayu, there is nothing that is incapable of being achieved by you. Ravana together with his followers was no match for you in battle, though he fought you single handed.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भीमेन हनूमान्प्लवगर्षभः । प्रत्युवाच ततो वाक्यं स्निग्धगम्भीरया गिरा ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: Having been thus addressed by Bhima, that chief of monkeys, Hanuman replied in affectionate words and in solemn accents.

data.v: एवमेतन्महाबाहो यथा वदसि भारत । भीमसेन न पर्याप्तो ममासौ राक्षसाधमः ।।
data.md: Hanuman said: O mighty armed descendant of Bharata. O Bhimasena, it is as you say. That wretch of a Rakshasa (Ravana) was no match for me.

data.v: मया तु तस्मिन्निहते रावणे लोककण्टके । कीर्तिर्नश्येद्राघवस्य तत एतदुपेक्षितम् ।।
data.md: But if I had killed Ravana, that thorn of the worlds, the glory of Raghu's son (Rama) would have been obscured, for this I left him alone.

data.v: तेन वीरेण हत्वा तु सगणं राक्षसाधिपम् । आनीता स्वपुरं सीता लोके कीर्तिश्च स्थापिता ।।
data.md: By killing that lord of the Rakashasas together with his followers and bringing back Sita to his own city, that hero established his fame among men.

data.v: तद्गच्छ विपुलप्रज्ञ भ्रातुः प्रियहिते रतः । अरिष्टं क्षेममध्वानं वायुना परिरक्षितः ।।
data.md: O greatly wise one being intent on the welfare of your brothers and being protected by Vayu, go along a fortunate and blessed way.

data.v: एष पन्थाः कुरुश्रेष्ठ सौगन्धिकवनाय ते । द्रक्ष्यसे धनदोद्यानं रक्षितं यक्षराक्षसैः ।।
data.md: O foremost of Kurus, this way will lead you to Saugandhika (forest). You will see the gardens of Kubera, guarded by the Yakshasas and Rakshasas.

data.v: न च ते तरसा कार्यः कुसुमावचयः स्वयम् । दैवतानि हि मान्यानि पुरुषेण विशेषतः ।।
data.md: Do not pluck there any flowers by the force of your personal might, for the celestials deserve respect and regard from mortals,

data.v: बलिहोमनमस्कारैर्मन्त्रैश्च भरतर्षभ । दैवतानि प्रसादं हि भक्त्या कुर्वन्ति भारत ।।
data.md: O best of the Bharata race, O descendant of Bharata, men gratify the celestials by offerings, homas, sacrifices, reverential salutations, recitations of Mantras and veneration.

data.v: मा तात साहसं कार्षीः स्वधर्ममनुपालय । स्वधर्मस्थः परं धर्मं बुध्यस्वागमयस्व च ।।

ततस्तान्परिविश्वस्तान्वसतस्तत्र पाण्डवान् । गतेषु तेषु रक्षःसु भीमसेनात्मजेऽपि च ।।

चकोराः शतपत्राश्च मत्तकोकिलशारिकाः । पत्रिणः पुष्पितानेतान्संश्लिष्यन्ति महाद्रुमान् ।।

data.v: भुञ्जानाः सर्वभोज्यानि रसवन्ति फलानि च । वसध्वं पाण्डवश्रेष्ठा यावदर्जुनदर्शनम् ।।
data.md: O best of the Pandavas, remain here living on luscious fruits eaten by the sages, until you meet with Arjuna.

data.v: न तात चपलैर्भाव्यमिह प्राप्तैः कथंचन । उषित्वेह यथाकामं यथाश्रद्धं विहृत्य च । ततः शस्त्रभृतां श्रेष्ठ पृथिवीं पालयिष्यसि ।।
data.md: O affectionate one, do not betray any restless spirit while remaining here. Dwelling here quite at ease and amusing yourself as you choose, you shall, in the long run, crushing your foes, by the prowess of your weapons, govern the earth. ones

data.v: पाण्डोः पुत्रा महात्मानः सर्वे दिव्यपराक्रमाः । कियन्तं कालमवसन्पर्वते गन्धमादने ।।
कानि चाभ्यवहार्याणि तत्र तेषां महात्मनाम् । वसतां लोकवीराणामासंस्तद्ब्रूहि सत्तम ।।
data.md: Tell me, O excellent one, what these highsouled ones those heroes of the worlds subsist upon, while dwelling there?

data.v: विस्तरेण च मे शंस भीमसेनपराक्रमम् । यद्यच्चक्रे महाबाहुस्तस्मिन्हैमवते गिरौ । न खल्वासीत्पुनर्युद्धं तस्य यक्षैर्द्विजोत्तम ।।
data.md: Narrate to me also in detail of the prowess of Bhimasena and what that mighty armed one did in the mountain Himalaya.

data.v: कच्चित्समागमस्तेषामासीद्वैश्रवणेन च । तत्र ह्यायाति धनद आर्ष्टिषेणो यथाब्रवीत् ।।
एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं विस्तरेण तपोधन । न हि मे शृण्वतस्तृप्तिरस्ति तेषां विचेष्टितम् ।।
एतदात्महितं श्रुत्वा तस्याप्रतिमतेजसः । शासनं सततं चक्रुस्तथैव भरतर्षभाः ।।
भुञ्जाना मुनिभोज्यानि रसवन्ति फलानि च । शुद्धबाणहतानां च मृगाणां पिशितान्यपि ।।
मेध्यानि हिमवत्पृष्ठे मधूनि विविधानि च । एवं ते न्यवसंस्तत्र पाण्डवा भरतर्षभाः ।।
data.md: And various kinds of pure honey, the Pandavas-the most exalted of the Bharatasdwelt in the Himalayas.

data.v: तथा निवसतां तेषां पञ्चमं वर्षमभ्यगात् । शृण्वतां लोमशोक्तानि वाक्यानि विविधानि च ।।
data.md: Living in this way, they passed the fifth year listening to the various stories told by Lomasha

data.v: कृत्यकाल उपस्थास्य इति चोक्त्वा घटोत्कचः । राक्षसैः सहितः सर्वैः पूर्वमेव गतः प्रभो ।।
data.md: O Lord, Ghatotkacha together with all the Rakshasas had before this departed saying “I shall appear when occasion arises."

data.v: आर्ष्टिषेणाश्रमे तेषां वसतां वै महात्मनाम् । अगच्छन्बहवो मासाः पश्यतां महदद्भुतम् ।।
data.md: Thus, witnessing many wonders, these highsouled ones (Pandavas) spent several months in the hermitage of Arstisena.

data.v: तैस्तत्र रममाणैश्च विहरद्भिश्च पाण्डवैः । प्रीतिमन्तो महाभागा मुनयश्चारणास्तथा ।।
data.md: And when the Pandavas were sporting and playing there at ease, several contented and highly fortunate sages and Charanas,

data.v: आजग्मुः पाण्डवान्द्रष्टुं सिद्धात्मानो यतव्रताः । तैस्तैः सह कथाश्चक्रुर्दिव्या भरतसत्तमाः ।।
data.md: Of pure souls and observant of vows came there to see them. And those most exalted to the Bharatas talked with them on divine matters.

data.v: ततः कतिपयाहस्य महाह्रदनिवासिनम् । ऋद्धिमन्तं महानागं सुपर्णः सहसाहरत् ।।
data.md: When a few days had thus passed away, it so happened that Suparna carried off a mighty Nag (serpent) of great prosperity who lived in the great lake.

data.v: प्राकम्पत महाशैलः प्रामृद्यन्त महाद्रुमाः । ददृशुः सर्वभूतानि पाण्डवाश्च तदद्भुतम् ।।
data.md: (In consequence of which) the mighty mountain began to tremble and many huge trees were crushed. And the Pandavas together with all creatures witnessed that marvellous scene.

data.v: ततः शैलोत्तमस्याग्रात्पाण्डवान्प्रति मारुतः । अवहत्सर्वमाल्यानि गन्धवन्ति शुभानि च ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Then from the top of that excellent mountain several kinds of auspicious and fragrant flowers were carried along by the wind towards the Pandavas.

data.v: तत्र पुष्पाणि दिव्यानि सुहृद्भिः सह पाण्डवाः । ददृशुः पञ्च वर्णानि द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी ।।
data.md: And the Pandavas together with their friends and the renowned Draupadi beheld (those) heavenly flowers of five colours.

data.v: भीमसेनं ततः कृष्णा काले वचनमब्रवीत् । विविक्ते पर्वतोद्देशे सुखासीनं महाभुजम् ।।
data.md: And when Bhimasena of mighty arms was comfortably seated on a lonely spot on the

data.v: सुपर्णानिलवेगेन श्वसनेन महाबलात् । पञ्चवर्णानि पात्यन्ते पुष्पाणि भरतर्षभ । प्रत्यक्षं सर्वभूतानां नदीमश्वरथां प्रति ।।
data.md: "O the best of the Bharatas, it is witnessed by all the creatures that these flowers of five colours, driven by the force of the wind raised by Suparna, are falling (with a crushing force) towards the river Ashvaratha. (In the forest of) Khandava your high-souled brother (Arjuna), true to his promise baffled (the attempts) of the Gandharvas, the Uragyas, the Rakshasas and even of Vasava (Indra) and slew the furious Mayavis (who can assume any shape they choose) and also obtained the bow Gandiva."

data.v: खाण्डवे सत्यसंधेन भ्रात्रा तव नरेश्वर । गन्धर्वोरगरक्षांसि वासवश्च निवारितः । हता मायाविनश्चोग्रा धनुः प्राप्तं च गाण्डिवम् ।।
तवापि सुमहत्तेजो महद्बाहुबलं च ते । अविषह्यमनाधृष्यं शतक्रतुबलोपमम् ।।
data.md: You too, are possessed of as indomitable spirit and mighty arms as the powerful Sakra himself.

data.v: त्वद्बाहुबलवेगेन त्रासिताः सर्वराक्षसाः । हित्वा शैलं प्रपद्यन्तां भीमसेन दिशो दश ।।
data.md: (Therefore) O Bhimasena, let all the Rakshasas, terrified with the force of your mighty arms, fly towards the ten cardinal points, leaving this mountain.

data.v: ततः शैलोत्तमस्याग्रं चित्रमाल्यधरं शिवम् । व्यपेतभयसंमोहाः पश्यन्तु सुहृदस्तव ।।
data.md: Then let your friends devoid of all fear and affliction behold the auspicious top of this excellent mountain decorated with variegated flowers.

data.v: एवं प्रणिहितं भीम चिरात्प्रभृति मे मनः । द्रष्टुमिच्छामि शैलाग्रं त्वद्बाहुबलमाश्रिता ।।
data.md: O Bhima, I have cherished this thought in my mind for a long time, and I have a mind to behold the summit of this mountain protected by the force of your arms.

data.v: ततः क्षिप्तमिवात्मानं द्रौपद्या स परंतपः । नामृष्यत महाबाहुः प्रहारमिव सद्गवः ।।
data.md: Thereupon, the tormentor of his foes, Bhimasena of mighty arms, considering himself as conjured by Draupadi, looked like an wounded bull of excellent breed and could not brook (her remarks).

data.v: सिंहर्षभगतिः श्रीमानुदारः कनकप्रभः । मनस्वी बलवान्दृप्तो मानी शूरश्च पाण्डवः ।।
लोहिताक्षः पृथुव्यंसो मत्तवारणविक्रमः । सिंहदंष्ट्रो बृहत्स्कन्धः शालपोत इवोद्गतः ।।
महात्मा चारुसर्वाङ्गः कम्बुग्रीवो महाभुजः । रुक्मपृष्ठं धनुः खड्गं तूणांश्चापि परामृशत् ।।
केसरीव यथोत्सिक्तः प्रभिन्न इव वारणः । व्यपेतभयसंमोहः शैलमभ्यपतद्बली ।।
data.md: And that mighty one proud as a lion and looking like a mad elephant, rushed towards that cliff tree from all fear and affliction.

data.v: तं मृगेन्द्रमिवायान्तं प्रभिन्नमिव वारणम् । ददृशुः सर्वभूतानि बाणखड्गधनुर्धरम् ।।
data.md: And all the creatures beheld him appearing like a lion or a maddened bull furnished with bows and arrows.

data.v: द्रौपद्या वर्धयन्हर्षं गदामादाय पाण्डवः । व्यपेतभयसंमोहः शैलराजं समाविशत् ।।
data.md: And the Pandava devoid of all fear and affliction, proceeded to the mountain furnished with his club to the great delight of Draupadi.

data.v: न ग्लानिर्न च कातर्यं न वैक्लव्यं न मत्सरः । कदाचिज्जुषते पार्थमात्मजं मातरिश्वनः ।।
data.md: Neither fatigue, nor fear, nor lassitude nor the malice (of others) took possession of that son of Pritha and god of the wind.

data.v: तदेकायनमासाद्य विषमं भीमदर्शनम् । बहुतालोच्छ्रयं शृङ्गमारुरोह महाबलः ।।
data.md: Getting to a pass affording passage to a single individual only, that one of great prowess, ascended that ragged and terriblelooking summit, high as several palm trees.

data.v: स किंनरमहानागमुनिगन्धर्वराक्षसान् । हर्षयन्पर्वतस्याग्रमाससाद महाबलः ।।
data.md: Causing the delight of the Kinnaras, Mahanagas, sages and the Rakshasas, the best of the Bharatas, endowed with gigantic strength, ascended the summit of the movntain,

data.v: तत्र वैश्रवणावासं ददर्श भरतर्षभः । काञ्चनैः स्फाटिकाकारैर्वेश्मभिः समलंकृतम् ।।
data.md: And beheld therefrom the abode of Vaisravana adorned with golden and crystal buildings,

data.v: मोदयन्सर्वभूतानि गन्धमादनसंभवः । सर्वगन्धवहस्तत्र मारुतः सुसुखो ववौ ।।
data.md: A pleasurable breeze was blowing there, having its origin in the Gandhamadana, gladdening all creatures and carrying sweet odours of all kinds.

data.v: चित्रा विविधवर्णाभाश्चित्रमञ्जरिधारिणः । अचिन्त्या विविधास्तत्र द्रुमाः परमशोभनाः ।।
data.md: There were many superbly beautiful trees beyond all thought, decorated with variegated colour and bearing graceful blossoms.

data.v: रत्नजालपरिक्षिप्तं चित्रमाल्यधरं शिवम् । राक्षसाधिपतेः स्थानं ददर्श भरतर्षभः ।।
data.md: That best of the Bharatas then beheld the palace of Kubera covered on all sides with heaps of gems and decorated with variegated garlands.

data.v: गदाखड्गधनुष्पाणिः समभित्यक्तजीवितः । भीमसेनो महाबाहुस्तस्थौ गिरिरिवाचलः ।।
data.md: There stood Bhimasena of mighty-arms devoid of all thoughts of life, firm as a rock, with club, sword and bow in his hand.

data.v: ततः शङ्खमुपाध्मासीद्द्विषतां लोमहर्षणम् । ज्याघोषतलघोषं च कृत्वा भूतान्यमोहयत् ।।
data.md: Then blowing his conch which made the hair of his adversaries stand on the end and twangling his bow, striking his arms with his palms, he struck terror into the hearts of all the creatures.

data.v: ततः संहृष्टरोमाणः शब्दं तमभिदुद्रुवुः । यक्षराक्षसगन्धर्वाः पाण्डवस्य समीपतः ।।
data.md: (Infuriated) at this, the Yakshas, the Rakshasas and the Gandharvas with their hair standing erect, rushed towards the Pandava, following the direction of these sounds.

data.v: गदापरिघनिस्त्रिंशशक्तिशूलपरश्वधाः । प्रगृहीता व्यरोचन्त यक्षराक्षसबाहुभिः ।।
data.md: Then the maces, clubs, swords, spears, axes and the javelins carried in their arms by the Rakshasas, began to blaze.

data.v: ततः प्रववृते युद्धं तेषां तस्य च भारत । तैः प्रयुक्तान्महाकायैः शक्तिशूलपरश्वधान् । भल्लैर्भीमः प्रचिच्छेद भीमवेगतरैस्ततः ।।
अन्तरिक्षचराणां च भूमिष्ठानां च गर्जताम् । शरैर्विव्याध गात्राणि राक्षसानां महाबलः ।।
सा लोहितमहावृष्टिरभ्यवर्षन्महाबलम् । कायेभ्यः प्रच्युता धारा राक्षसानां समन्ततः ।।
भीमबाहुबलोत्सृष्टैर्बहुधा यक्षरक्षसाम् । विनिकृत्तान्यदृश्यन्त शरीराणि शिरांसि च ।।
data.md: And the heads and the bodies of the Rakshasas were seen cut off and mangled by the weapons hurled by the force of Bhima's arms.

data.v: प्रच्छाद्यमानं रक्षोभिः पाण्डवं प्रियदर्शनम् । ददृशुः सर्वभूतानि सूर्यमभ्रगणैरिव ।।
data.md: All the creatures, then, saw the good-looking Pandava hemmed in by the Rakshasas and appearing like the sun enveloped with clouds.

data.v: स रश्मिभिरिवादित्यः शरैररिनिघातिभिः । सर्वानार्छन्महाबाहुर्बलवान्सत्यविक्रमः ।।
data.md: And that mighty-armed and powerul one (Bhima) of true prowess covered all (the Rakshasas) with his arrows fatal to his enemies, as the sun shrouds all the creatures with his rays.

data.v: अभितर्जयमानाश्च रुवन्तश्च महारवान् । न मोहं भीमसेनस्य ददृशुः सर्वराक्षसाः ।।
data.md: Although uttering both loud yells and cries of victory, the Rakshasas did not see Bhima deprived of senses.

data.v: ते शरैः क्षतसर्वाङ्गा भीमसेनभयार्दिताः । भीममार्तस्वरं चक्रुर्विप्रकीर्णमहायुधाः ।।
data.md: And the Yakshas, with their bodies mangled all over, terrified by the fear of Bhimasena, began to utter frightful cries of distress leaving aside their weapons.

data.v: उत्सृज्य ते गदाशूलानसिशक्तिपरश्वधान् । दक्षिणां दिशमाजग्मुस्त्रासिता दृढधन्वना ।।
data.md: And then owing to the fear of that wielder of a strong bow, Bhimaseria, they fled southwards, forsaking their maces, spears, swords, clubs and axes.

data.v: तत्र शूलगदापाणिर्व्यूढोरस्को महाभुजः । सखा वैश्रवणस्यासीन्मणिमान्नाम राक्षसः ।।
data.md: On that side, stood the mighty-armed and broad-chested Rakshasa, Maniman, the friend of Kubera, armed with darts and maces.

data.v: अदर्शयदधीकारं पौरुषं च महाबलः । स तान्दृष्ट्वा परावृत्तान्स्मयमान इवाब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Displaying his masterdom and manliness, he, of gigantic strength, seeing them taking to heels, addressed them smilingly thus-

data.v: एकेन बहवः संख्ये मानुषेण पराजिताः । प्राप्य वैश्रवणावासं किं वक्ष्यथ धनेश्वरम् ।।
data.md: "Going to the abode of Vaisravana, how would you tell the lord of wealth that vast numbers (of Yakshas) have been slain by a single man."

data.v: एवमाभाष्य तान्सर्वान्न्यवर्तत स राक्षसः । शक्तिशूलगदापाणिरभ्यधावच्च पाण्डवम् ।।
data.md: Having addressed them thus, that Rakshasa, holding in the hands, clubs, javelins and maces, rushed against the Pandava.

data.v: तमापतन्तं वेगेन प्रभिन्नमिव वारणम् । वत्सदन्तैस्त्रिभिः पार्श्वे भीमसेनः समर्पयत् ।।
data.md: Beholding him approach with the fury of a maddened elephant, Bhimasena pierced his sides with three choice arrows.

data.v: मणिमानपि संक्रुद्धः प्रगृह्य महतीं गदाम् । प्राहिणोद्भीमसेनाय परिक्षिप्य महाबलः ।।
data.md: The mighty Maniman too, in wrath, taking and brandishing a tremendous mace, hurled it at him.

data.v: विद्युद्रूपां महाघोरामाकाशे महतीं गदाम् । शरैर्बहुभिरभ्यर्छद्भीमसेनः शिलाशितैः ।।
data.md: Bhimasena too, on his part, beset, with many arrows, sharpened on stones, that tremendous and dreadful mace in the sky resembling a lightning flash.

data.v: यानाहुर्ब्रह्मणः पुत्रान्मानसान्दक्षसप्तमान् । तेषामपि महामेरुः स्थानं शिवमनामयम् ।।
data.md: (This) Mahameru is the auspicious and blissful abode of Daksha and six others who are known as the mind-born sons of Brahma.

data.v: अत्रैव प्रतितिष्ठन्ति पुनरत्रोदयन्ति च । सप्त देवर्षयस्तात वसिष्ठप्रमुखाः सदा ।।
data.md: O child, here too the seven divine sages with Vasishtha at their head sit and rise again.

data.v: देशं विरजसं पश्य मेरोः शिखरमुत्तमम् । यत्रात्मतृप्तैरध्यास्ते देवैः सह पितामहः ।।
data.md: Behold that excellent summit of the Meru that bright region when the grandsire (Brahma) sits with the gods, happy in self-knowledge.

data.v: यमाहुः सर्वभूतानां प्रकृतेः प्रकृतिं ध्रुवम् । अनादिनिधनं देवं प्रभुं नारायणं परम् ।।
data.md: (And) next to the abode of Brahma appears the region of that original lord, the god Narayana who has neither beginning nor end and who is said to be the really first cause of the origin of the whole creation. Even the gods cannot behold that auspicious (place)) composed of all energies.

data.v: ब्रह्मणः सदनात्तस्य परं स्थानं प्रकाशते । देवाश्च यत्नात्पश्यन्ति दिव्यं तेजोमयं शिवम् ।।
अत्यर्कानलदीप्तं तत्स्थानं विष्णोर्महात्मनः । स्वयैव प्रभया राजन्दुष्प्रेक्ष्यं देवदानवैः ।।
data.md: (And) by reason of its own splendour surpassing the sun or fire in lustre, the place of the high-souled Vishnu is not visible to the gods and the Danavas.

data.v: तद्वै ज्योतींषि सर्वाणि प्राप्य भासन्ति नोऽपि च । स्वयं विभुरदीनात्मा तत्र ह्यभिविराजते ।।
यतयस्तत्र गच्छन्ति भक्त्या नारायणं हरिम् । परेण तपसा युक्ता भाविताः कर्मभिः शुभैः ।।
योगसिद्धा महात्मानस्तमोमोहविवर्जिताः । तत्र गत्वा पुनर्नेमं लोकमायान्ति भारत ।।
स्थानमेतन्महाभाग ध्रुवमक्षयमव्ययम् । ईश्वरस्य सदा ह्येतत्प्रणमात्र युधिष्ठिर ।।
data.md: O highly fortunate Yudhishthira, this place is eternal, without deterioration or end; because it is always the very life of that god.

data.v: एतं ज्योतींषि सर्वाणि प्रकर्षन्भगवानपि । कुरुते वितमस्कर्मा आदित्योऽभिप्रदक्षिणम् ।।
data.md: The god Aditya too, the dispeller of darkness, attracting all the luminaries, goes round this (Meru).

data.v: अस्तं प्राप्य ततः संध्यामतिक्रम्य दिवाकरः । उदीचीं भजते काष्ठां दिशमेष विभावसुः ।।
data.md: That author of the day, Vibhavasu, having gone down and then having passed the evening, takes the excellent northern point.

data.v: स मेरुमनुवृत्तः सन्पुनर्गच्छति पाण्डव । प्राङ्मुखः सविता देवः सर्वभूतहिते रतः ।।
data.md: O Pandava, that god Savita, bent on the welfare of all creatures, then coming near the Meru, again goes on his course facing the East.

data.v: स मासं विभजन्कालं बहुधा पर्वसंधिषु । तथैव भगवान्सोमो नक्षत्रैः सह गच्छति ।।
data.md: Similarly, the divine moon moves with the stars (round this mountain) dividing the mouth into many sections when he arrives at the Parvas.

data.v: एवमेष परिक्रम्य महामेरुमतन्द्रितः । भावयन्सर्वभूतानि पुनर्गच्छति मन्दरम् ।।
data.md: Thus crossing the Mahameru unerringly and nourishing all the creatures (the moon) goes back to the Mandara.

data.v: तथा तमिस्रहा देवो मयूखैर्भावयञ्जगत् । मार्गमेतदसंबाधमादित्यः परिवर्तते ।।
data.md: In a similar way, the god Aditya, the dispeller of darkness displaying the universe by his rays, moves round this unobstructed path.

data.v: सिसृक्षुः शिशिराण्येष दक्षिणां भजते दिशम् । ततः सर्वाणि भूतानि कालः शिशिरमृच्छति ।।
data.md: When he takes the southern direction with a view to cause dew, then the cold weather comes upon all the creatures.

data.v: स्थावराणां च भूतानां जङ्गमानां च तेजसा । तेजांसि समुपादत्ते निवृत्तः सन्विभावसुः ।।
data.md: (Then) turning back, he, by his own energy, withdraws the energy from all beings both mobile and immobile.

data.v: ततः स्वेदः क्लमस्तन्द्री ग्लानिश्च भजते नरान् । प्राणिभिः सततं स्वप्नो ह्यभीक्ष्णं च निषेव्यते ।।
data.md: In consequence of this perspiration, fatigue, drowsiness and lethargy comes upon men and all living beings always feel inclined to sleep.

data.v: एवमेतदनिर्देश्यं मार्गमावृत्य भानुमान् । पुनः सृजति वर्षाणि भगवान्भावयन्प्रजाः ।।
data.md: Then the god Bhanumana coursing that unknown path (i.e. the firmament) gives birth to rains reviving (all) creatures.

data.v: वृष्टिमारुतसंतापैः सुखैः स्थावरजङ्गमान् । वर्धयन्सुमहातेजाः पुनः प्रतिनिवर्तते ।।
data.md: And having nourished all (creatures) both mobile and immobile by the comfort caused by rain, wind and warmth, that one of mighty splendour resumes his (former) course.

data.v: एवमेष चरन्पार्थ कालचक्रमतन्द्रितः । प्रकर्षन्सर्वभूतानि सविता परिवर्तते ।।
data.md: Thus increasingly turning on the wheel of time and influencing all creatures, O Partha, Savita goes on his course.

data.v: संतता गतिरेतस्य नैष तिष्ठति पाण्डव । आदायैव तु भूतानां तेजो विसृजते पुनः ।।
data.md: O Pandava his course is unremitting and he never rests. And withdrawing the energy of (all) creatures, he gives it back.

data.v: विभजन्सर्वभूतानामायुः कर्म च भारत । अहोरात्रान्कलाः काष्ठाः सृजत्येष सदा विभुः ।।
data.md: O Bharata, the lord (sun), always imparting life and motion to all living creatures, creates day and night, Kala and Kashtha.

data.v: तस्मिन्नगेन्द्रे वसतां तु तेषां; महात्मनां सद्व्रतमास्थितानाम् । रतिः प्रमोदश्च बभूव तेषा;माकाङ्क्षतां दर्शनमर्जुनस्य ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Those noble-minded (Pandavas), the observers of pious vows, desirous of beholding Arjuna dwelling in that best of mountains, became passionately attached (to it) and got themselves amused.

data.v: तान्वीर्ययुक्तान्सुविशुद्धसत्त्वां;स्तेजस्विनः सत्यधृतिप्रधानान् । संप्रीयमाणा बहवोऽभिजग्मु;र्गन्धर्वसंघाश्च महर्षयश्च ।।
तं पादपैः पुष्पधरैरुपेतं; नगोत्तमं प्राप्य महारथानाम् । मनःप्रसादः परमो बभूव; यथा दिवं प्राप्य मरुद्गणानाम् ।।
data.md: Getting to that excellent mountain, adorned with blossoming trees, those mighty carwarriors were supremely glad at heart as the Maruts on reaching the heavenly regions.

data.v: मयूरहंसस्वननादितानि; पुष्पोपकीर्णानि महाचलस्य । शृङ्गाणि सानूनि च पश्यमाना; गिरेः परं हर्षमवाप्य तस्थुः ।।
data.md: Beholding the summit and the table-land of that mighty mountain, covered with flowers and ringing with the cries of peacocks and cranes, they remained there feeling great joy.

data.v: साक्षात्कुबेरेण कृताश्च तस्मि;न्नगोत्तमे संवृतकूलरोधसः । कादम्बकारण्डवहंसजुष्टाः; पद्माकुलाः पुष्करिणीरपश्यन् ।।
data.md: On that excellent mountain they beheld tanks, excavated by Kubera himself, full of lotuses and frequented by Kadamvas, Karandavas and swans and with their banks covered with (trees).

data.v: क्रीडाप्रदेशांश्च समृद्धरूपा;न्सुचित्रमाल्यावृतजातशोभान् । मणिप्रवेकान्सुमनोहरांश्च; यथा भवेयुर्धनदस्य राज्ञः ।।
data.md: (They beheld also) magnificent sporting grounds, pleasant to the mind and covered with arrays of beautiful and variegated garlands and studded with gems and suited to the taste of the king (Kubera), the giver of wealth.

data.v: अनेकवर्णैश्च सुगन्धिभिश्च; महाद्रुमैः संततमभ्रमालिभिः । तपःप्रधानाः सततं चरन्तः; शृङ्गं गिरेश्चिन्तयितुं न शेकुः ।।
data.md: The best of ascetics, always wandering (there) could not (sufficiently) comprehended (the sublimity) of that mountain summit furnished as it was with various many-coloured trees and covered with masses of clouds.

data.v: स्वतेजसा तस्य नगोत्तमस्य; महौषधीनां च तथा प्रभावात् । विभक्तभावो न बभूव कश्चि;दहर्निशानां पुरुषप्रवीर ।।
data.md: O great hero, by reason of the splendour of this excellent mountain itself and of the brilliancy of the annual herbs there was no difference between day and night.

data.v: यमास्थितः स्थावरजङ्गमानि; विभावसुर्भावयतेऽमितौजाः । तस्योदयं चास्तमयं च वीरा;स्तत्र स्थितास्ते ददृशुर्नृसिंहाः ।।
data.md: Those best of men saw the rising and setting of Vibhavasu of unrivalled splendour, while, dwelling in that mountain, remaining where he (the sun) nourishes all the mobile and the immobile (creatures).

data.v: रवेस्तमिस्रागमनिर्गमांस्ते; तथोदयं चास्तमयं च वीराः । समावृताः प्रेक्ष्य तमोनुदस्य; गभस्तिजालैः प्रदिशो दिशश्च ।।
data.md: Having witnessed the setting in and exit of darkness, the rising and the setting of the sun and all the cardinal points covered with his (sun's rays), those heroes,

data.v: स्वाध्यायवन्तः सततक्रियाश्च; धर्मप्रधानाश्च शुचिव्रताश्च । सत्ये स्थितास्तस्य महारथस्य; सत्यव्रतस्यागमनप्रतीक्षाः ।।
data.md: Awaiting the arrival of that mighty carwarrior, firm in truth and of true vows, were engaged in reciting the Vedas, constantly practising rituals, chiefly discharging the religious duties and observing pure vows.

data.v: इहैव हर्षोऽस्तु समागतानां; क्षिप्रं कृतास्त्रेण धनंजयेन । इति ब्रुवन्तः परमाशिषस्ते; पार्थास्तपोयोगपरा बभूवुः ।।
data.md: Saying "let all those assembled experience joy by meeting speedily here with Arjuna skilled in arms," those highly blessed Parthas became absorbed in Yoga.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा विचित्राणि गिरौ वनानि; किरीटिनं चिन्तयतामभीक्ष्णम् । बभूव रात्रिर्दिवसश्च तेषां; संवत्सरेणैव समानरूपः ।।
data.md: Inspite of beholding many romantic forests on the mountain, as they could not help constantly thinking of Arjuna, every day and night appeared to them (long) as a year.

data.v: यदैव धौम्यानुमते महात्मा; कृत्वा जटाः प्रव्रजितः स जिष्णुः । तदैव तेषां न बभूव हर्षः; कुतो रतिस्तद्गतमानसानाम् ।।
data.md: From that very moment when the nobleminded Vishnu, with Dhaumya's leave, matting his hair, went abroad, they (Pandavas) did not experience joy. How could they, lost in his thought, experience any happiness there (on that mountain however romantic it might be)?

data.v: भ्रातुर्नियोगात्तु युधिष्ठिरस्य; वनादसौ वारणमत्तगामी । यत्काम्यकात्प्रव्रजितः स जिष्णु;स्तदैव ते शोकहता बभूवुः ।।
data.md: Since the very moment when in accordance with the command of his brother Yudhishthira, Vishnu, endowed with the gait of an elephant (with exuberance of spirits), left the forest Kamyaka they became buried in deep sorrow.

data.v: तथा तु तं चिन्तयतां सिताश्व;मस्त्रार्थिनं वासवमभ्युपेतम् । मासोऽथ कृच्छ्रेण तदा व्यतीत;स्तस्मिन्नगे भारत भारतानाम् ।।
data.md: O Bharata, in this way the Bharatas passed a month with great difficulty on that mountain thinking of Sitasvha Arjuna, who had gone to Vasava, desirous of learning the (science of) arims.

data.v: ततः कदाचिद्धरिसंप्रयुक्तं; महेन्द्रवाहं सहसोपयातम् । विद्युत्प्रभं प्रेक्ष्य महारथानां; हर्षोऽर्जुनं चिन्तयतां बभूव ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Once upon a time, when those mighty carwarriors were thinking of Arjuna they were delighted at beholding the car of Mahendra, yoked with horses and bright as lightning ¡ approaching all on a sudden.

data.v: स दीप्यमानः सहसान्तरिक्षं; प्रकाशयन्मातलिसंगृहीतः । बभौ महोल्केव घनान्तरस्था; शिखेव चाग्नेर्ज्वलिता विधूमा ।।
data.md: That flaming car, driven by Matali, suddenly illuminating the firmament, appeared like a mighty meteor hidden in clouds or like the smokeless and blazing tongues of fire.

data.v: तमास्थितः संददृशे किरीटी; स्रग्वी वराण्याभरणानि बिभ्रत् । धनंजयो वज्रधरप्रभावः; श्रिया ज्वलन्पर्वतमाजगाम ।।
data.md: Placed in that car, appeared Kirita wearing garlands and fresh ornaments (Then) Dhananjaya, powerful as the wielder of the thunderbolt and blazing of beauty, alighted on (that) mountain,

data.v: स शैलमासाद्य किरीटमाली; महेन्द्रवाहादवरुह्य तस्मात् । धौम्यस्य पादावभिवाद्य पूर्व;मजातशत्रोस्तदनन्तरं च ।।
data.md: Arriving at the mountain and descending from the car of Mahendra, that intelligent, one wearing a coronet and garlands, saluted the feet of Dhaumya first and then those of Ajatshatru Yudhishthira.

data.v: वृकोदरस्यापि ववन्द पादौ; माद्रीसुताभ्यामभिवादितश्च । समेत्य कृष्णां परिसान्त्व्य चैनां; प्रह्वोऽभवद्भ्रातुरुपह्वरे सः ।।
data.md: He (Arjuna) also bowed down to the feet of Vrikodara and was himself saluted by the (twin) sons of Madri. (And then) going to Krishna and consoling her, he stood before his brother (Yudhishthira) with humility.

data.v: बभूव तेषां परमः प्रहर्ष;स्तेनाप्रमेयेण समागतानाम् । स चापि तान्प्रेक्ष्य किरीटमाली; ननन्द राजानमभिप्रशंसन् ।।
data.md: Those present (there) were highly delighted at being joined with that peerless man (Arjuna). (And) beholding them he (Arjuna) too, who wore a coronet and garlands, was delighted and began to eulogise the king.

data.v: यमास्थितः सप्त जघान पूगा;न्दितेः सुतानां नमुचेर्निहन्ता । तमिन्द्रवाहं समुपेत्य पार्थाः; प्रदक्षिणं चक्रुरदीनसत्त्वाः ।।
data.md: Beholding that car of Indra, placed in which the slayer of Namuchi had destroyed seven battalions of Diti's sons, those Parthas with rich spirits, went round it.

data.v: ते मातलेश्चक्रुरतीव हृष्टाः; सत्कारमग्र्यं सुरराजतुल्यम् । सर्वं यथावच्च दिवौकसस्ता;न्पप्रच्छुरेनं कुरुराजपुत्राः ।।
data.md: Those descendants of the king Kuru, being exceedingly delighted, paid excellent adoration to Matali, worthy of the lord of the celestials himself; and then duly inquired of him about the welfare of all the gods,

data.v: तानप्यसौ मातलिरभ्यनन्द;त्पितेव पुत्राननुशिष्य चैनान् । ययौ रथेनाप्रतिमप्रभेण; पुनः सकाशं त्रिदिवेश्वरस्य ।।
data.md: Matali too then greeted them and having instructed the Parthas as a father does his (own) sons, (he) returned to the lord of heaven, ascending that car of unrivalled splendour.

data.v: गते तु तस्मिन्वरदेववाहे; शक्रात्मजः सर्वरिपुप्रमाथी । शक्रेण दत्तानि ददौ महात्मा; महाधनान्युत्तमरूपवन्ति । दिवाकराभाणि विभूषणानि; प्रीतः प्रियायै सुतसोममात्रे ।।

data.v: पर्वतैश्छाद्यमानोऽहं निगृहीतैश्च वाजिभिः । अगच्छं परमामार्तिं मातलिस्तदलक्षयत् ।।
data.md: That I was sore afflicted on account of being surrounded by rocks and the steeds being hard pressed, was perceived by Matali.

data.v: लक्षयित्वा तु मां भीतमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् । अर्जुनार्जुन मा भैस्त्वं वज्रमस्त्रमुदीरय ।।
data.md: Seeing me terrified he spoke these words, "O Arjuna, O Arjuna, don't be afraid; discharge the weapon, Vajra (thunderbolt)."

data.v: ततोऽहं तस्य तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा वज्रमुदीरयम् । देवराजस्य दयितं वज्रमस्त्रं नराधिप ।।
data.md: Then, O lord of men, hearing these words of his, I let go that favourite weapon of the king of the celestials, the terrible Vajra (thunderbolt).

data.v: अचलं स्थानमासाद्य गाण्डीवमनुमन्त्र्य च । अमुञ्चं वज्रसंस्पर्शानायसान्निशिताञ्शरान् ।।
data.md: Inspiring the Gandiva with mantras and aiming at the locality of the rocks, I discharged sharpened iron darts having the touch of the thunderbolt.

data.v: ततो मायाश्च ताः सर्वा निवातकवचांश्च तान् । ते वज्रचोदिता बाणा वज्रभूताः समाविशन् ।।
data.md: And those arrows, turned into thunderbolt (on account of their) being shot from the Vajra, penetrated through the illusion and all the Nivatakavachas.

data.v: ते वज्रवेगाभिहता दानवाः पर्वतोपमाः । इतरेतरमाश्लिष्य न्यपतन्पृथिवीतले ।।
data.md: Then those Danavas, big as rocks smitten by the force of the thunder, fell on the ground clashing against one another,

data.v: अन्तर्भूमौ तु येऽगृह्णन्दानवा रथवाजिनः । अनुप्रविश्य तान्बाणाः प्राहिण्वन्यमसादनम् ।।
data.md: And the shafts, penetrating those Danavas, who entering into the bowels of the earth had seized the horses and the car, sent them to the abode of Yama.

data.v: हतैर्निवातकवचैर्निरस्तैः पर्वतोपमैः । समाच्छाद्यत देशः स विकीर्णैरिव पर्वतैः ।।
data.md: That place was completely filled with those Nivatakavachas looking like mountains, who were (either) killed or wounded and lying scattered like (so many) rocks.

data.v: न हयानां क्षतिः काचिन्न रथस्य न मातलेः । मम चादृश्यत तदा तदद्भुतमिवाभवत् ।।
data.md: And the fact, that neither did the horses, nor Matali, nor myself, suffer the least (by that event), appeared strange.

data.v: ततो मां प्रहसन्राजन्मातलिः प्रत्यभाषत । नैतदर्जुन देवेषु त्वयि वीर्यं यदीक्ष्यते ।।
data.md: Then, O king, Matali addressed me with a smile "the prowess displayed by you cannot be seen even among the gods.”

data.v: हतेष्वसुरसंघेषु दारास्तेषां तु सर्वशः । प्राक्रोशन्नगरे तस्मिन्यथा शरदि लक्ष्मणाः ।।
data.md: On the Danava hosts being slain all their wives in that city began to bewail like cranes in autumn.

data.v: ततो मातलिना सार्धमहं तत्पुरमभ्ययाम् । त्रासयन्रथघोषेण निवातकवचस्त्रियः ।।
data.md: Then accompanied by Matali, I entered that city, terrifying the females of the Nivatakavachas by the rattling noise of the car.

data.v: तान्दृष्ट्वा दशसाहस्रान्मयूरसदृशान्हयान् । रथं च रविसंकाशं प्राद्रवन्गणशः स्त्रियः ।।
data.md: Beholding those ten thousands of steeds resembling peacocks and that car of the splendour of the sun, the females began to flee in large numbers.

data.v: ताभिराभरणैः शब्दस्त्रासिताभिः समीरितः । शिलानामिव शैलेषु पतन्तीनामभूत्तदा ।।
data.md: Thereupon, there arose a sound of the falling of the ornaments (from the persons) of those terrified ladies like the sound of hail falling upon a mountain.

data.v: वित्रस्ता दैत्यनार्यस्ताः स्वानि वेश्मान्यथाविशन् । बहुरत्नविचित्राणि शातकुम्भमयानि च ।।
data.md: At last the affrighted ladies of the Daityas entered into their respective golden palaces decked with innumerable gems.

data.v: तदद्भुताकारमहं दृष्ट्वा नगरमुत्तमम् । विशिष्टं देवनगरादपृच्छं मातलिं ततः ।।
data.md: Then beholding that wonderful and excellent city, superior to that of the gods, I asked Matali,

data.v: इदमेवंविधं कस्माद्देवता नाविशन्त्युत । पुरंदरपुराद्धीदं विशिष्टमिति लक्षये ।।
data.md: “This city appears superior to that of Purandara. How is it that the Gods do not reside in such a place?"

data.v: आसीदिदं पुरा पार्थ देवराजस्य नः पुरम् । ततो निवातकवचैरितः प्रच्याविताः सुराः ।।
data.md: Matali answered O Partha, formerly it was the city of our lord of the gods. (But) afterwards the gods were expciled from here by the Nivatakavachas.

data.v: तपस्तप्त्वा महत्तीव्रं प्रसाद्य च पितामहम् । इदं वृतं निवासाय देवेभ्यश्चाभयं युधि ।।
data.md: Having pleased Brahma by the performance of rigid asceticism, they asked (of him) the boons, (namely), to dwell here and to be free from all fears of the gods in wars.

data.v: ततः शक्रेण भगवान्स्वयम्भूरभिचोदितः । विधत्तां भगवानत्रेत्यात्मनो हितकाम्यया ।।
data.md: Then the self-existent lord (Shiva) was thus addressed by Shakra. "O lord, keeping our welfare in view, do what you think proper."

data.v: तत उक्तो भगवता दिष्टमत्रेति वासवः । भवितान्तस्त्वमेवैषां देहेनान्येन वृत्रहन् ।।
data.md: Thereupon, O Bharata, the lord (Shiva) thus commanded Indra saying "O destroyer of foes, assuming another body you will kill these (demons).”

data.v: तत एषां वधार्थाय शक्रोऽस्त्राणि ददौ तव । न हि शक्याः सुरैर्हन्तुं य एते निहतास्त्वया ।।
data.md: Therefore, Shakra gave you the weapons for the destruction of these (demons). Even the gods had been unable to slay these that have been killed by you.

data.v: कालस्य परिणामेन ततस्त्वमिह भारत । एषामन्तकरः प्राप्तस्तत्त्वया च कृतं तथा ।।
data.md: O Bharata, as you have come hither just at the appointed time, you have been able to kill them.

data.v: दानवानां विनाशार्थं महास्त्राणां महद्बलम् । ग्राहितस्त्वं महेन्द्रेण पुरुषेन्द्र तदुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: O best of mortals, in order to destroy these Danavas, Mahendra conferred on you the energy (that belongs to the possessor) of those excellent weapons.

data.v: ततः प्रविश्य नगरं दानवांश्च निहत्य तान् । पुनर्मातलिना सार्धमगच्छं देवसद्म तत् ।।
data.md: Arjuna said : Having killed the Danavas and subdued (their) city, I returned to the abode of the celestials accompanied by Matali.

data.v: निवर्तमानेन मया महद्दृष्टं ततोऽपरम् । पुरं कामचरं दिव्यं पावकार्कसमप्रभम् ।।
data.md: Arjuna said: Then, while returning (to the abode of Indra), I beheld on my way a great celestials city, moving at will, endued with the splendour of the fire or the sun,

data.v: द्रुमै रत्नमयैश्चैत्रैर्भास्वरैश्च पतत्रिभिः । पौलोमैः कालकेयैश्च नित्यहृष्टैरधिष्ठितम् ।।
data.md: Containing trees made of jewels, teeming with many-coloured birds of sweet voice, inhabited by the Paulomas and the Kalakanja ever merry,

data.v: गोपुराट्टालकोपेतं चतुर्द्वारं दुरासदम् । सर्वरत्नमयं दिव्यमद्भुतोपमदर्शनम् । द्रुमैः पुष्पफलोपेतैर्दिव्यरत्नमयैर्वृतम् ।।
data.md: Adorned with gate-ways, towers and four gates, impregnable, made of all sorts of jewels celestials wonderful to look at,

data.v: तथा पतत्रिभिर्दिव्यैरुपेतं सुमनोहरैः । असुरैर्नित्यमुदितैः शूलर्ष्टिमुसलायुधैः । चापमुद्गरहस्तैश्च स्रग्विभिः सर्वतो वृतम् ।।
data.md: Surrounded on all sides by the Asuras, always cheerful, adorned with garlands and holding in their hands maces, swords, darts, bows and clubs.

data.v: तदहं प्रेक्ष्य दैत्यानां पुरमद्भुतदर्शनम् । अपृच्छं मातलिं राजन्किमिदं दृश्यतेति वै ।।
data.md: Beholding that city of the Daitya, wonderful to look at, O king, I asked Matali "What is it that looks so marvellous?"

data.v: पुलोमा नाम दैतेयी कालका च महासुरी । दिव्यं वर्षसहस्रं ते चेरतुः परमं तपः । तपसोऽन्ते ततस्ताभ्यां स्वयम्भूरददाद्वरम् ।।
data.md: Matali said : (Formerly) a Daitya-female, named Puloma and another great giantess, Kalaka (by name), practised severe austerities for a thousand celestials years.

data.v: अगृह्णीतां वरं ते तु सुतानामल्पदुःखताम् । अवध्यतां च राजेन्द्र सुरराक्षसपन्नगैः ।।
data.md: When they had finished their austerities, the self-existent (god) Svayambhu granted them boons. (And), O king of kings, they obtained the boons-viz., that their children might never suffer distress; that (they) might obtain a highly beautiful and an exceedingly splendid aerial city,

data.v: रमणीयं पुरं चेदं खचरं सुकृतप्रभम् । सर्वरत्नैः समुदितं दुर्धर्षममरैरपि । सयक्षगन्धर्वगणैः पन्नगासुरराक्षसैः ।।
data.md: Full of all sorts of gems, unassailable even by immortals, the Maharshis, the Yakshas, the Gandharvas, the Pannagas, the Asuras and the Rakshasas,

data.v: सर्वकामगुणोपेतं वीतशोकमनामयम् । ब्रह्मणा भरतश्रेष्ठ कालकेयकृते कृतम् ।।
data.md: Containing all the desirable objects and devoid of grief and desire. O best of the Bharatas, created by Brahma for the Kalakeyas,

data.v: तदेतत्खचरं दिव्यं चरत्यमरवर्जितम् । पौलोमाध्युषितं वीर कालकेयैश्च दानवैः ।।
data.md: This is that celestials city, devoid of gods, which is moving about. O hero, it is inhabited by the Pauloma and he Kalakeya Danavas.

data.v: हिरण्यपुरमित्येतत्ख्यायते नगरं महत् । रक्षितं कालकेयैश्च पौलोमैश्च महासुरैः ।।
data.md: This mighty city is called Hiranyapura and is guarded by the powerful Asuras, the Kalakeyas and the Paulomas.

data.v: त एते मुदिता नित्यमवध्याः सर्वदैवतैः । निवसन्त्यत्र राजेन्द्र गतोद्वेगा निरुत्सुकाः । मानुषो मृत्युरेतेषां निर्दिष्टो ब्रह्मणा पुरा ।।
data.md: O king of kings, there they dwell happily, indestructible by the gods, free from anxiety and having all their desires fulfilled.

data.v: सुरासुरैरवध्यांस्तानहं ज्ञात्वा ततः प्रभो । अब्रुवं मातलिं हृष्टो याह्येतत्पुरमञ्जसा ।।
data.md: Arjuna said: O lord of earth, learning that they were indestructible by the gods and Asuras. I gladly said to Matali "do you go to this city speedily.

data.v: त्रिदशेशद्विषो यावत्क्षयमस्त्रैर्नयाम्यहम् । न कथंचिद्धि मे पापा न वध्या ये सुरद्विषः ।।
data.md: I will bring about the destruction of all these enemies of the celestials with weapons. There exist no wicked enemies of the gods whom I do not consider my victims."

data.v: उवाह मां ततः शीघ्रं हिरण्यपुरमन्तिकात् । रथेन तेन दिव्येन हरियुक्तेन मातलिः ।।
data.md: Thereupon, Matali had me speedily conveyed by that celestials car, yoked with steeds, towards the-neighbourhood of Hiranyapura.

data.v: ते मामालक्ष्य दैतेया विचित्राभरणाम्बराः । समुत्पेतुर्महावेगा रथानास्थाय दंशिताः ।।
data.md: On beholding me, those sons of Diti, wearing various sorts of garments and mounted on chariots, rushed at me with great violence.

data.v: ततो नालीकनाराचैर्भल्लशक्त्यृष्टितोमरैः । अभ्यघ्नन्दानवेन्द्रा मां क्रुद्धास्तीव्रपराक्रमाः ।।
data.md: Then those foremost of the Danavas (possessed) of fiery prowess, angrily assailed me with Nalikas, Narachas, Bhallas, Maces, swords and Tomaras.

data.v: तदहं चास्त्रवर्षेण महता प्रत्यवारयम् । शस्त्रवर्षं महद्राजन्विद्याबलमुपाश्रितः ।।
data.md: Thereupon, O king, availing myself of the strength of my knowledge (in arms), I warded off that shower of weapons by mighty discharges of arrows;

data.v: व्यामोहयं च तान्सर्वान्रथमार्गैश्चरन्रणे । तेऽन्योन्यमभिसंमूढाः पातयन्ति स्म दानवाः ।।
data.md: And coursing through the field of battle on the car, bewildered them. Thus confounded, the Danavas began to fell down one another.

data.v: तेषामहं विमूढानामन्योन्यमभिधावताम् । शिरांसि विशिखैर्दीप्तैर्व्यहरं शतसंघशः ।।
data.md: (And) with blazing arrows I cut off, by hundreds, the heads of those who, getting confounded, were rushing at one another.

data.v: ते वध्यमाना दैतेयाः पुरमास्थाय तत्पुनः । खमुत्पेतुः सनगरा मायामास्थाय दानवीम् ।।
data.md: Thus smitten (by me) those sons of Diti, taking refuge in that city, again rose up in the air with it, by the help of illusion peculiar to the Danavas.

data.v: ततोऽहं शरवर्षेण महता प्रत्यवारयम् । मार्गमावृत्य दैत्यानां गतिं चैषामवारयम् ।।
data.md: Thereupon, O descendant of the Kurus, covering the passage of the Daityas by heavy shower of arrows, I obstructed their movement.

data.v: तत्पुरं खचरं दिव्यं कामगं दिव्यवर्चसम् । दैतेयैर्वरदानेन धार्यते स्म यथासुखम् ।।
data.md: (But) the sons of Diti, on the strength of their boon, easily supported themselves on that celestials and aerial city of sun-like splendour and moving at will.

data.v: अन्तर्भूमौ निपतितं पुनरूर्ध्वं प्रतिष्ठते । पुनस्तिर्यक्प्रयात्याशु पुनरप्सु निमज्जति ।।
data.md: At one time it plunged into the earth and then rose up in the air again, now it took a curved direction and then again submerged under water.

data.v: अमरावतिसंकाशं पुरं कामगमं तु तत् । अहमस्त्रैर्बहुविधैः प्रत्यगृह्णं नराधिप ।।
data.md: (Then), O tormentor of foes, I surrounded with various weapons that mighty moving about at will.

data.v: ततोऽहं शरजालेन दिव्यास्त्रमुदितेन च । न्यगृह्णं सह दैतेयैस्तत्पुरं भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: And, O best of the Bharatas, I assailed that city together with the Daityas by showers of arrows, shot from celestials weapons.

data.v: विक्षतं चायसैर्बाणैर्मत्प्रयुक्तैरजिह्मगैः । महीमभ्यपतद्राजन्प्रभग्नं पुरमासुरम् ।।
data.md: (And), O king, that city of the Asuras, riven and broken by straight-coursing steels darts shot by me, fell to the ground.

data.v: ते वध्यमाना मद्बाणैर्वज्रवेगैरयस्मयैः । पर्यभ्रमन्त वै राजन्नसुराः कालचोदिताः ।।
data.md: Those Asuras too, O king, wounded by my iron shafts, fleet as the thunder and propelled by Fate, began to rove about.

data.v: ततो मातलिरप्याशु पुरस्तान्निपतन्निव । महीमवातरत्क्षिप्रं रथेनादित्यवर्चसा ।।
data.md: Then, Matali, soaring to the heavens, as if taking a leap in front, speedily came down to the earth on that chariot effulgent as the sun.

data.v: ततो रथसहस्राणि षष्टिस्तेषाममर्षिणाम् । युयुत्सूनां मया सार्धं पर्यवर्तन्त भारत ।।
data.md: O Bharata, then, desirous of fighting with me, they furiously hemmed me in with sixty thousand cars. (But) I destroyed those (cars) by sharpened arrows adorned with vulture feathers.

data.v: तानहं निशितैर्बाणैर्व्यधमं गार्ध्रवाजितैः । ते युद्धे संन्यवर्तन्त समुद्रस्य यथोर्मयः ।।
नेमे शक्या मानुषेण युद्धेनेति प्रचिन्त्य वै । ततोऽहमानुपूर्व्येण सर्वाण्यस्त्राण्ययोजयम् ।।

ततो ब्रह्मर्षयश्चैव सिद्धाश्चैव सुरर्षयः । जङ्गमानि च भूतानि सर्वाण्येवावतस्थिरे ।।
राजर्षयश्च प्रवरास्तथैव च दिवौकसः । यक्षराक्षसगन्धर्वास्तथैव च पतत्रिणः ।।
ततः पितामहश्चैव लोकपालाश्च सर्वशः । भगवांश्च महादेवः सगणोऽभ्याययौ तदा ।।
data.md: Then Pitamaha (Brahma), all the Lokapalas (the guardians of the ten cardinal points), the divine Mahadeva, together with all their followers, made their appearance (at that spot).

data.v: ततो वायुर्महाराज दिव्यैर्माल्यैः सुगन्धिभिः । अभितः पाण्डवांश्चित्रैरवचक्रे समन्ततः ।।
data.md: (And) then, O mighty monarch, Vayu (the wind-god) bearing bearing variegated celestials flowers, began to strew them all around the Pandava (Arjuna).

data.v: जगुश्च गाथा विविधा गन्धर्वाः सुरचोदिताः । ननृतुः संघशश्चैव राजन्नप्सरसां गणाः ।।
data.md: O king, commissioned by the gods, the Gandharvas sang various melodies and multitudes of Apsaras danced there.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तु तुमुले काले नारदः सुरचोदितः । आगम्याह वचः पार्थं श्रवणीयमिदं नृप ।।
data.md: (And)O king, at that very time, Narada, sent by the celestials, arrived (there) and spoke to Partha these words grateful to the ear:

data.v: अर्जुनार्जुन मा युङ्क्ष्व दिव्यान्यस्त्राणि भारत । नैतानि निरधिष्ठाने प्रयुज्यन्ते कदाचन ।।
data.md: "O Arjuna, O Bharata, forebear discharging these celestials weapons. These (weapons) ought, by no means, to be hurled where there is no object to hit at.

data.v: अधिष्ठाने न वानार्तः प्रयुञ्जीत कदाचन । प्रयोगे सुमहान्दोषो ह्यस्त्राणां कुरुनन्दन ।।
data.md: And unless sore afflicted, one should not discharge these even if there is an object (present). O descendant of the Kurus, it will result in a terrible disaster, if these weapons are (causclessly) discharged.

data.v: एतानि रक्ष्यमाणानि धनंजय यथागमम् । बलवन्ति सुखार्हाणि भविष्यन्ति न संशयः ।।
data.md: O Dhananjaya, if these powerful weapons are duly kept, they will no doubt, lead to your happiness.

data.v: अरक्ष्यमाणान्येतानि त्रैलोक्यस्यापि पाण्डव । भवन्ति स्म विनाशाय मैवं भूयः कृथाः क्वचित् ।।
data.md: (But), O Pandava, if they are not (carefully) preserved, they will lead to the destruction of the three worlds. Therefore, do not attempt such a (rash) act again.

data.v: अजातशत्रो त्वं चैव द्रक्ष्यसे तानि संयुगे । योज्यमानानि पार्थेन द्विषतामवमर्दने ।।
data.md: O Ajatashatru (Yudhishthira), you will behold them when Partha will make use of them for the destruction of your enemies in battle."

data.v: निवार्याथ ततः पार्थं सर्वे देवा यथागतम् । जग्मुरन्ये च ये तत्र समाजग्मुर्नरर्षभ ।।
data.md: O the most exalted of mortals, having prevented Arjuna (from hurling these weapons), all the celestials and all other beings who had come there went to their respective abodes.

data.v: तेषु सर्वेषु कौरव्य प्रतियातेषु पाण्डवाः । तस्मिन्नेव वने हृष्टास्त ऊषुः सह कृष्णया ।।
data.md: O descendant of the Kurus, when all those had taken their departure, the Pandavas, together with Krishna, began to dwell cheerfully in that forest.

data.v: तस्मिन्कृतास्त्रे रथिनां प्रधाने; प्रत्यागते भवनाद्वृत्रहन्तुः । अतः परं किमकुर्वन्त पार्थाः; समेत्य शूरेण धनंजयेन ।।
data.md: Janamejaya said : On the return of that best of the car-warriors from the abode of the slayer of Vitra (Indra) being skilled in arms, what did the Parthas do in company with the heroic Dhananjaya.

data.v: वनेषु तेष्वेव तु ते नरेन्द्राः; सहार्जुनेनेन्द्रसमेन वीराः । तस्मिंश्च शैलप्रवरे सुरम्ये; धनेश्वराक्रीडगता विजह्रुः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Those foremost of men, brave as Indra, together with Arjuna, sported in the pleasuregardens of the lord of wealth (situated) in those forests on that excellent and beautiful mountain.

data.v: वेश्मानि तान्यप्रतिमानि पश्य;न्क्रीडाश्च नानाद्रुमसंनिकर्षाः । चचार धन्वी बहुधा नरेन्द्रः; सोऽस्त्रेषु यत्तः सततं किरीटी ।।
data.md: Beholding those peerless abodes and pleasure-gardens interspersed with trees, Kiriti, the foremost of men, with a relish for arms and bow in hand, ranged at large (among) those (woods).

data.v: अवाप्य वासं नरदेवपुत्राः; प्रसादजं वैश्रवणस्य राज्ञः । न प्राणिनां ते स्पृहयन्ति राज;ञ्शिवश्च कालः स बभूव तेषाम् ।।
data.md: O monarch, those sons of a king, having obtained a residence through the favour of king Vaisravana, did not long for the prosperity of earthly creatures, (in as much as) that period (of their lives) was (quite) a blessing (to them).

data.v: समेत्य पार्थेन यथैकरात्र;मूषुः समास्तत्र तदा चतस्रः । पूर्वाश्च षट्ता दश पाण्डवानां; शिवा बभूवुर्वसतां वनेषु ।।
data.md: In company with Partha they lived there for four years which appeared to them (short) as a single night. The former six years and these four together numbering ten of their forest life glided smoothly away.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीद्वायुसुतस्तरस्वी; जिष्णुश्च राजानमुपोपविश्य । यमौ च वीरौ सुरराजकल्पा;वेकान्तमास्थाय हितं प्रियं च ।।
data.md: Then (once upon a time) seated before the king (Yudhishthira), the intrepid son of Vayu (the wind-god), together with Vishnu and the heroic twins, resembling the king of the celestials, spoke in private these sweet and beneficial words.

data.v: तव प्रतिज्ञां कुरुराज सत्यां; चिकीर्षमाणास्त्वदनु प्रियं च । ततोऽनुगच्छाम वनान्यपास्य; सुयोधनं सानुचरं निहन्तुम् ।।
data.md: "O king of the Kurus, in order to make your promise bear fruit and to further your interests, we are not going to slay Suyodhana together with (all) his followers.

data.v: एकादशं वर्षमिदं वसामः; सुयोधनेनात्तसुखाः सुखार्हाः । तं वञ्चयित्वाधमबुद्धिशील;मज्ञातवासं सुखमाप्नुयामः ।।
तवाज्ञया पार्थिव निर्विशङ्का; विहाय मानं विचरन्वनानि । समीपवासेन विलोभितास्ते; ज्ञास्यन्ति नास्मानपकृष्टदेशान् ।।
data.md: In spite of our being deprived by Suyodhana of the happiness we deserve, we have been (hitherto happily) dwelling (in the woods) these eleven years. And hereafter too, O monarch, at your command, wandering in the forests regardless of our position, we shall easily spend the period of our incognits life, deluding that being of wicked mind and character. And (Suyodhana) being tempted by our residence in the neighbourhood will not be inclined to believe that we have removed to a distant country.

data.v: संवत्सरं तं तु विहृत्य गूढं; नराधमं तं सुखमुद्धरेम । निर्यात्य वैरं सफलं सपुष्पं; तस्मै नरेन्द्राधमपूरुषाय ।।
data.md: There O king, remaining in concealment for one year and (then) wrecking our vengeance on that worst of mortals, Suyodhana as well as his followers, we shall root out that vilest being (like a thorn) and regain our kingdom after the overthrow of our enemies. Therefore, O foremost of the virtuous, come down on earth. O king of mortals, if we continue to dwell in this country resembling heaven itself, we shall be able to forget our grief's.

data.v: सुयोधनायानुचरैर्वृताय; ततो महीमाहर धर्मराज । स्वर्गोपमं शैलमिमं चरद्भिः; शक्यो विहन्तुं नरदेव शोकः ।।
कीर्तिश्च ते भारत पुण्यगन्धा; नश्येत लोकेषु चराचरेषु । तत्प्राप्य राज्यं कुरुपुंगवानां; शक्यं महत्प्राप्तमथ क्रियाश्च ।।
data.md: But then, O Bharata, the sacred fragrance of your fame will disappear from (both) the mobile and the immobile worlds; (for) regaining the kingdom of the most exalted of the Kurus, you will be able to perform glorious deeds.

data.v: इदं तु शक्यं सततं नरेन्द्र; प्राप्तुं त्वया यल्लभसे कुबेरात् । कुरुष्व बुद्धिं द्विषतां वधाय; कृतागसां भारत निग्रहे च ।।
data.md: In that case, O monarch, you will always have what we already obtained from Kubera. (Therefore), O Bharata, direct your thoughts towards the punishment and destruction of your guilty enemies.

data.v: तेजस्तवोग्रं न सहेत राज;न्समेत्य साक्षादपि वज्रपाणिः । न हि व्यथां जातु करिष्यतस्तौ; समेत्य देवैरपि धर्मराज ।।
त्वदर्थसिद्ध्यर्थमभिप्रवृत्तौ; सुपर्णकेतुश्च शिनेश्च नप्ता । यथैव कृष्णोऽप्रतिमो बलेन; तथैव राजन्स शिनिप्रवीरः ।।
तवार्थसिद्ध्यर्थमभिप्रवृत्तौ; यथैव कृष्णः सह यादवैस्तैः । तथैव चावां नरदेववर्य; यमौ च वीरौ कृतिनौ प्रयोगे । त्वदर्थयोगप्रभवप्रधानाः; समं करिष्याम परान्समेत्य ।।
data.md: And, O king, as Krishna together with the Yadavas is eager for your welfare so am I. The twins also are brave and skilled in arms, (And) we, whose chief object consists in the advancement of your wealth and prosperity, encountering your enemies in battle, will kill them."

data.v: ततस्तदाज्ञाय मतं महात्मा; तेषां स धर्मस्य सुतो वरिष्ठः । प्रदक्षिणं वैश्रवणाधिवासं; चकार धर्मार्थविदुत्तमौजः ।।
आमन्त्र्य वेश्मानि नदीः सरांसि; सर्वाणि रक्षांसि च धर्मराजः । यथागतं मार्गमवेक्षमाणः; पुनर्गिरिं चैव निरीक्षमाणः ।।
समाप्तकर्मा सहितः सुहृद्भि;र्जित्वा सपत्नान्प्रतिलभ्य राज्यम् । शैलेन्द्र भूयस्तपसे धृतात्मा; द्रष्टा तवास्मीति मतिं चकार ।।
data.md: “Having performed my task, conquered my enemies and recovered my kingdom, may I, O lord of mountains, together with my friends, behold you again, for performing asceticism with subdued mind."

data.v: वृतः स सर्वैरनुजैर्द्विजैश्च; तेनैव मार्गेण पतिः कुरूणाम् । उवाह चैनान्सगणांस्तथैव; घटोत्कचः पर्वतनिर्झरेषु ।।
data.md: (And) when surrounded by all his brothers and the Brahmanas, the lord of the Kurus proceeded along the former path, he was carried across the mountain waterfalls by Ghatotkacha with his followers.

data.v: तान्प्रस्थितान्प्रीतिमना महर्षिः; पितेव पुत्राननुशिष्य सर्वान् । स लोमशः प्रीतमना जगाम; दिवौकसां पुण्यतमं निवासम् ।।
data.md: (And) when they were about to start (on their journey) the great sage, Lomasha, gave them instructions as a father gives to his own sons and then went to the most sacred region of the celestials.

data.v: तेनानुशिष्टार्ष्टिषेणेन चैव; तीर्थानि रम्याणि तपोवनानि । महान्ति चान्यानि सरांसि पार्थाः; संपश्यमानाः प्रययुर्नराग्र्याः ।।
data.md: Similarly advised by Arshtishena those foremost of men, the Parthas, proceeded along, beholding (on the way) various great and beautiful Tirthas (sacred places resorted to by pilgrims).

data.v: नगोत्तमं प्रस्रवणैरुपेतं; दिशां गजैः किंनरपक्षिभिश्च । सुखं निवासं जहतां हि तेषां; न प्रीतिरासीद्भरतर्षभाणाम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Those foremost of the Bharatas, on leaving their delightful abode on that excellent mountain with waterfalls, the elephants of eight quarters, the Kinnaras and birds, were not happy at heart.

data.v: ततस्तु तेषां पुनरेव हर्षः; कैलासमालोक्य महान्बभूव । कुबेरकान्तं भरतर्षभाणां; महीधरं वारिधरप्रकाशम् ।।
data.md: But those best of the Bharatas again experienced a great delight on beholding the favourite mountain of Kubera, the Kailasa looking (white as the clouds).

data.v: समुच्छ्रयान्पर्वतसंनिरोधा;न्गोष्ठान्गिरीणां गिरिसेतुमालाः । बहून्प्रपातांश्च समीक्ष्य वीराः; स्थलानि निम्नानि च तत्र तत्र ।।
data.md: And those heroes, the excellent of mortals, armed with bows and swords, felt a great delight, beholding (on their way) elevations and defiles, dens of lions, rows of craggy causeways, numerous waterfalls, low lands here and there and various other great forests inhabited by numerous deer, birds and elephants.

data.v: तथैव चान्यानि महावनानि; मृगद्विजानेकपसेवितानि । आलोकयन्तोऽभिययुः प्रतीता;स्ते धन्विनः खड्गधरा नराग्र्याः ।।
वनानि रम्याणि सरांसि नद्यो; गुहा गिरीणां गिरिगह्वराणि । एते निवासाः सततं बभूवु;र्निशानिशं प्राप्य नरर्षभाणाम् ।।
data.md: (And as they journeyed on), romantic forests, rivers, lakes, caves of mountain, mighty mountain, caverns-all these always, by day and night became the dwelling places of those most excellent men.

data.v: ते दुर्गवासं बहुधा निरुष्य; व्यतीत्य कैलासमचिन्त्यरूपम् । आसेदुरत्यर्थमनोरमं वै; तमाश्रमाग्र्यं वृषपर्वणस्ते ।।
data.md: (Thus) resting in many inaccessible places and crossing the mountain Kailasa of incomprehensible grandeur, they at length reached the exceedingly beautiful hermitage of Vrishaparva.

data.v: समेत्य राज्ञा वृषपर्वणस्ते; प्रत्यर्चितास्तेन च वीतमोहाः । शशंसिरे विस्तरशः प्रवासं; शिवं यथावद्वृषपर्वणस्ते ।।
data.md: Meeting with the king, Vrishaparva and being welcomed by him they recovered from fatigue and then they related to him) faithfully and fully the story of their stay in the mountains.

data.v: सुखोषितास्तत्र त एकरात्रं; पुण्याश्रमे देवमहर्षिजुष्टे । अभ्याययुस्ते बदरीं विशालां; सुखेन वीराः पुनरेव वासम् ।।
data.md: And having happily spent a night in that sacred hermitage frequented by the celestials and the Maharshis, those warriors gladly repaired to the great Jujube tree for a sojourn again.

data.v: ऊषुस्ततस्तत्र महानुभावा; नारायणस्थानगता नराग्र्याः । कुबेरकान्तां नलिनीं विशोकाः; संपश्यमानाः सुरसिद्धजुष्टाम् ।।
data.md: Then arriving at the place of Narayana, all those high-souled men, devoid of sorrow, began to dwell there, beholding the beloved lake of Kubera, frequented by the celestials and he Siddhas.

data.v: तां चाथ दृष्ट्वा नलिनीं विशोकाः; पाण्डोः सुताः सर्वनरप्रवीराः । ते रेमिरे नन्दनवासमेत्य; द्विजर्षयो वीतभया यथैव ।।
data.md: (And) seeing that lake, those sons of Pandu, the best of all men, devoid of sorrow, began to sport there, (just) as the sinless Brahmana sages do on getting a habitation in the garden of Nandana.

data.v: ततः क्रमेणोपययुर्नृवीरा; यथागतेनैव पथा समग्राः । विहृत्य मासं सुखिनो बदर्यां; किरातराज्ञो विषयं सुबाहोः ।।
data.md: Then having spent a month happily at Badari, all those heroes gradually proceeded towards the country of Subahu, the king of the Kiratas, along the same route by which they had come (before).

data.v: चीनांस्तुखारान्दरदान्सदार्वा;न्देशान्कुणिन्दस्य च भूरिरत्नान् । अतीत्य दुर्गं हिमवत्प्रदेशं; पुरं सुबाहोर्ददृशुर्नृवीराः ।।
