data.v: प्राङ्नाभिवर्धनात्पुंसो जातकर्म विधीयते । तत्रास्य माता सावित्री पिता त्वाचार्य उच्यते ।।
data.md: The natal ceremony of a male person is performed even before the severance of the navel chord. On that occasion his mother is designated Savitri and his father Acharya (priest).

data.v: वृत्त्या शूद्रसमो ह्येष यावद्वेदे न जायते । अस्मिन्नेवं मतिद्वैधे मनुः स्वायम्भुवोऽब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Before initiation into the Vedas every man is regarded as a Shudra. There being a difference of opinion on the point Svyambhuva Manu has laid down;

data.v: कृतकृत्याः पुनर्वर्णा यदि वृत्तं न विद्यते । संकरस्तत्र नागेन्द्र बलवान्प्रसमीक्षितः ।।
data.md: That if having gone through the purificatory rites (as laid down in the Vedas) the first three orders do not regulate their conduct, according to thein, in that case, O mightiest of serpents, the mixed castes should be considered as superior to them

data.v: यत्रेदानीं महासर्प संस्कृतं वृत्तमिष्यते । तं ब्राह्मणमहं पूर्वमुक्तवान्भुजगोत्तम ।।
data.md: O great Snake, O excellent Serpent, I have ere now designated him as a Brahmana who observes the principles of good behaviour.

data.v: श्रुतं विदितवेद्यस्य तव वाक्यं युधिष्ठिर । भक्षयेयमहं कस्माद्भ्रातरं ते वृकोदरम् ।।
data.md: The snake said: O Yudhishthira, I have listened to your words. You are acquainted with what ought to be known. (Therefore) how can I (now) devour your brother Vrikodara?

data.v: भवानेतादृशो लोके वेदवेदाङ्गपारगः । ब्रूहि किं कुर्वतः कर्म भवेद्गतिरनुत्तमा ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: (O Serpent), in this world, you are so superiority versed in the Vedas and the Vedangas, that I should like you will iell me, by what (sorts of) acts men can obtain heaven.

data.v: पात्रे दत्त्वा प्रियाण्युक्त्वा सत्यमुक्त्वा च भारत । अहिंसानिरतः स्वर्गं गच्छेदिति मतिर्मम ।।
data.md: The Serpent said : In my opinion, O Bharata, by bestowal of alims on deserving objects, endearing words, truthfulness and unenviousness one can have access to heaven.

data.v: दानाद्वा सर्प सत्याद्वा किमतो गुरु दृश्यते । अहिंसाप्रिययोश्चैव गुरुलाघवमुच्यताम् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: Snake, between benevolence and truthfulness, which is more praiseworthy? And tell me as regards unenviousness and good behaviour which is the more and which is the less important.

data.v: दाने रतत्वं सत्यं च अहिंसा प्रियमेव च । एषां कार्यगरीयस्त्वाद्दृश्यते गुरुलाघवम् ।।
data.md: The Snake replied The superiority or inferiority among charity, truthfulness, forbearance from malice and sweet speech is estimated at by the benefit which each of these tends to produce.

data.v: कस्माच्चिद्दानयोगाद्धि सत्यमेव विशिष्यते । सत्यवाक्याच्च राजेन्द्र किंचिद्दानं विशिष्यते ।।
data.md: Sometimes truthfulness is considered superior to some charitable acts. And, O king of kings, sometimes charity is deemed more praiseworthy than true speech.

data.v: एवमेव महेष्वास प्रियवाक्यान्महीपते । अहिंसा दृश्यते गुर्वी ततश्च प्रियमिष्यते ।।
data.md: And similarly, O lord of the earth, O mighty monarch, abstenance from malice is (sometimes) deemed superior to sweet speech and vice versa.

data.v: एवमेतद्भवेद्राजन्कार्यापेक्षमनन्तरम् । यदभिप्रेतमन्यत्ते ब्रूहि यावद्ब्रवीम्यहम् ।।
data.md: Thus, O monarch, (their superiority or inferiority) depends on their utility. Now if you have anything more to ask, speak out and I shall solve your doubts.

data.v: कथं स्वर्गे गतिः सर्प कर्मणां च फलं ध्रुवम् । अशरीरस्य दृश्येत विषयांश्च ब्रवीहि मे ।।
data.md: (Kindly) tell me O Serpent, how the access of a disembodied being to heaven, how his enjoyment of the rewards and endurance of the punishment consequent on its acts and how its perception through the senses, be conceived. can

data.v: तिस्रो वै गतयो राजन्परिदृष्टाः स्वकर्मभिः । मानुष्यं स्वर्गवासश्च तिर्यग्योनिश्च तत्त्रिधा ।।
data.md: The Snake replied O king, on account of their own (meritorious or evil) acts men are seen to attain one of the three conditions of rebirth as men, heavenly existence or birth among the lower animals.

data.v: तत्र वै मानुषाल्लोकाद्दानादिभिरतन्द्रितः । अहिंसार्थसमायुक्तैः कारणैः स्वर्गमश्नुते ।।
data.md: By charity, unenviousness, absence of slothfulness and by self-exertion one goes to heaven from this state of men.

data.v: विपरीतैश्च राजेन्द्र कारणैर्मानुषो भवेत् । तिर्यग्योनिस्तथा तात विशेषश्चात्र वक्ष्यते ।।
data.md: (But) by contrary acts, O king of kings, one is either reborn among men or among lower animals. (Therefore)O child, it is particularly laid in this subject,

data.v: कामक्रोधसमायुक्तो हिंसालोभसमन्वितः । मनुष्यत्वात्परिभ्रष्टस्तिर्यग्योनौ प्रसूयते ।।
data.md: That he who is subject to lust, anger malice and temptations, being degraded from the human state again takes his birth among the lower animals,

data.v: तिर्यग्योन्यां पृथग्भावो मनुष्यत्वे विधीयते । गवादिभ्यस्तथाश्वेभ्यो देवत्वमपि दृश्यते ।।
data.md: And as is laid down in the Vedas, gets rid of the existence among the lower animals in order to attain the human state again. And cows, cattle and horses and other animals are (even sometimes) seen to attain to divine life.

data.v: सोऽयमेता गतीः सर्वा जन्तुश्चरति कार्यवान् । नित्ये महति चात्मानमवस्थापयते नृप ।।
data.md: O child, such is the transmigration of a creature according to his (good or evil) actions. But he that is wise reposes his soul in the everlasting Spirit.

data.v: जातो जातश्च बलवान्भुङ्क्ते चात्मा स देहवान् । फलार्थस्तात निष्पृक्तः प्रजालक्षणभावनः ।।
data.md: The embodied spirit enchained by Fate and enjoying the pleasure or suffering the pain consequent on its acts, takes birth repeatedly. But he that has lost touch of his action is conscious of the destiny of all born creatures.

data.v: शब्दे स्पर्शे च रूपे च तथैव रसगन्धयोः । तस्याधिष्ठानमव्यग्रं ब्रूहि सर्प यथातथम् ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : Tell me, O Serpent, truly and without hurry how the spirit (parted from the corporeal frame) becomes cognisant of sound, touch, form, smell and taste.

data.v: किं न गृह्णासि विषयान्युगपत्त्वं महामते । एतावदुच्यतां चोक्तं सर्वं पन्नगसत्तम ।।
data.md: And, O high-minded being, do you not simultaneously feel the sensations of touch, taste, etc., by means of the senses? O best of Snakes, (kindly) answer all these questions of mine.

data.v: यदात्मद्रव्यमायुष्मन्देहसंश्रयणान्वितम् । करणाधिष्ठितं भोगानुपभुङ्क्ते यथाविधि ।।
data.md: The Snake replied O long-lived being, the thing termed Atman taking refuge in a physical frame and manifesting itself through the organs of sense, enjoys properly the perceptible objects.

data.v: ज्ञानं चैवात्र बुद्धिश्च मनश्च भरतर्षभ । तस्य भोगाधिकरणे करणानि निबोध मे ।।
data.md: O the best of the Bharatas, know that the senses, the mind and the intellect assisting the soul in its enjoyment of the perceptible objects are called Karanas.

data.v: मनसा तात पर्येति क्रमशो विषयानिमान् । विषयायतनस्थेन भूतात्मा क्षेत्रनिःसृतः ।।
data.md: O my child, the soul moving out of its proper place and assisted by the mind acting through the organs of sense-the recipients of all sensations-gradually perceives all the sensible objects.

data.v: अत्र चापि नरव्याघ्र मनो जन्तोर्विधीयते । तस्माद्युगपदस्यात्र ग्रहणं नोपपद्यते ।।
data.md: O the most exalted of men the mind of creatures is the cause of all perceptions; and therefore it cannot at one and the same time perceive a plurality of objects,

data.v: स आत्मा पुरुषव्याघ्र भ्रुवोरन्तरमाश्रितः । द्रव्येषु सृजते बुद्धिं विविधेषु परावराम् ।।
data.md: The Soul, O the most valiant of mortals stationing itself between the eye brows, sends the high and the low intellect to different objects (of sense).

data.v: बुद्धेरुत्तरकालं च वेदना दृश्यते बुधैः । एष वै राजशार्दूल विधिः क्षेत्रज्ञभावनः ।।
data.md: O best of kings, knowledge which the yogis drive from the operation of intelligence, manifests the action of the Soul.

data.v: मनसश्चापि बुद्धेश्च ब्रूहि मे लक्षणं परम् । एतदध्यात्मविदुषां परं कार्यं विधीयते ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : Tell me the (kindly) the prominent characteristics of the mind and the intellect (respectively); (because) the knowledge (of their functions) is said to be the principal requirements of those conversant with the Supreme being

data.v: बुद्धिरात्मानुगा तात उत्पातेन विधीयते । तदाश्रिता हि संज्ञैषा विधिस्तस्यैषणे भवेत् ।।
data.md: The Snake answered Through cloudiness of understanding the soul becomes subject to intellect. For this reason, though it (intellect) is known to be subordinate to the son, it guides the latter.

data.v: बुद्धेर्गुणविधिर्नास्ति मनस्तु गुणवद्भवेत् । बुद्धिरुत्पद्यते कार्ये मनस्तूत्पन्नमेव हि ।।
एतद्विशेषणं तात मनोबुद्ध्योर्मयेरितम् । त्वमप्यत्राभिसंबुद्धः कथं वा मन्यते भवान् ।।
data.md: O my child, these are the points of distinction between the mind and the intellect you are also conversant with this subject. What do you say?

data.v: अहो बुद्धिमतां श्रेष्ठ शुभा बुद्धिरियं तव । विदितं वेदितव्यं ते कस्मान्मामनुपृच्छसि ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: O the best of those endowed with intelligence, you have a superb intellect. Why (then) do you ask me this question, when you are well acquainted with all that should be known.

data.v: सर्वज्ञं त्वां कथं मोह आविशत्स्वर्गवासिनम् । एवमद्भुतकर्माणमिति मे संशयो महान् ।।
data.md: I am at a great loss to understand how you became subject to illusion who performed excellent deeds and obtained an abode in heaven.

data.v: सुप्रज्ञमपि चेच्छूरमृद्धिर्मोहयते नरम् । वर्तमानः सुखे सर्वो नावैतीति मतिर्मम ।।
data.md: The Serpent said : Even a highly intellectual and wise man is inflated with prosperity. And in my opinion those that are given to luxury lose their sense.

data.v: सोऽहमैश्वर्यमोहेन मदाविष्टो युधिष्ठिर । पतितः प्रतिसंबुद्धस्त्वां तु संबोधयाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: So, O Yudhishthira, I too, intoxicated with the drink of prosperity, have fallen into this degraded state and then having recovered my reason am addressed you thus.

data.v: कृतं कार्यं महाराज त्वया मम परंतप । क्षीणः शापः सुकृच्छ्रो मे त्वया संभाष्य साधुना ।।
data.md: O tormentor of foes, O mighty monarch, you have rendered me a good service. And by conversing with your pious self I have been freed from this dreadful curse.

data.v: अहं हि दिवि दिव्येन विमानेन चरन्पुरा । अभिमानेन मत्तः सन्कंचिन्नान्यमचिन्तयम् ।।
data.md: In days of yore when mounted on a celestials chariot I used to range through the heavens, elated with pride, I thought of nothing else.

data.v: ब्रह्मर्षिदेवगन्धर्वयक्षराक्षसकिंनराः । करान्मम प्रयच्छन्ति सर्वे त्रैलोक्यवासिनः ।।
data.md: The Brahmarshis, the celestials, the Gandharvas, the Yakshas, the Rakshasas, the Pannagas and all the inhabitants of the three worlds had to pay me taxes.

data.v: चक्षुषा यं प्रपश्यामि प्राणिनं पृथिवीपते । तस्य तेजो हराम्याशु तद्धि दृष्टिबलं मम ।।
data.md: Such, O king, was the mysmeric power of my eyes, that all whatever creature I cast my looks, I instantly withdrew all his energy.

data.v: ब्रह्मर्षीणां सहस्रं हि उवाह शिबिकां मम । स मामपनयो राजन्भ्रंशयामास वै श्रियः ।।
data.md: Thousands of Brahmarshis were engaged in drawing my palanquin. And O king, this sin on my part brought about my fall from my exalted position.

data.v: तत्र ह्यगस्त्यः पादेन वहन्स्पृष्टो मया मुनिः । अदृष्टेन ततोऽस्म्युक्तो ध्वंस सर्पेति वै रुषा ।।
data.md: One day when the sage Agastya was drawing my palanquin my feet touched his body. Thereupon Agastya cursed me in anger saying "ruin overtake you; do you turn into a snake."

data.v: ततस्तस्माद्विमानाग्रात्प्रच्युतश्च्युतभूषणः । प्रपतन्बुबुधेऽऽत्मानं व्यालीभूतमधोमुखम् ।।
data.md: Thus deprived of my prosperity I fell down from that conveyance. And in the course of my fall I found myself turned into a snake with my head downwards. (Then) I besought that Brahmana “Kindly free me from this curse.

data.v: अयाचं तमहं विप्रं शापस्यान्तो भवेदिति । अज्ञानात्संप्रवृत्तस्य भगवन्क्षन्तुमर्हसि ।।
ततः स मामुवाचेदं प्रपतन्तं कृपान्वितः । युधिष्ठिरो धर्मराजः शापात्त्वां मोक्षयिष्यति ।।
अभिमानस्य घोरस्य बलस्य च नराधिप । फले क्षीणे महाराज फलं पुण्यमवाप्स्यसि ।।
ततो मे विस्मयो जातस्तद्दृष्ट्वा तपसो बलम् । ब्रह्म च ब्राह्मणत्वं च येन त्वाहमचूचुदम् ।।
सत्यं दमस्तपो योगमहिंसा दाननित्यता । साधकानि सदा पुंसां न जातिर्न कुलं नृप ।।
अरिष्ट एष ते भ्राता भीमो मुक्तो महाभुजः । स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु महाराज गमिष्यामि दिवं पुनः ।।
data.md: O king and not race nor (illustrious) family, are the means by which persons must attain salvation. May your younger brother Bhimasena be all hail; and O mighty monarch, may you be happy. I shall now go to heaven again.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वाजगरं देहं त्यक्त्वा स नहुषो नृपः । दिव्यं वपुः समास्थाय गतस्त्रिदिवमेव ह ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having said this, the king Nahusha giving up his snake shape and assuming his celestials body returned to heaven.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरोऽपि धर्मात्मा भ्रात्रा भीमेन संगतः । धौम्येन सहितः श्रीमानाश्रमं पुनरभ्यगात् ।।
data.md: And the virtuous and prosperous Yudhishthira too, accompanied by Bhima and Dhaumya came back to his hermitage.

data.v: ततो द्विजेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यः समेतेभ्यो यथातथम् । कथयामास तत्सर्वं धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः ।।
data.md: Then Yudhishthira, the best of the virtuous, related, in detail, all that had happened, to the assembled Brahmanas.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा ते द्विजाः सर्वे भ्रातरश्चास्य ते त्रयः । आसन्सुव्रीडिता राजन्द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी ।।
data.md: Hearing all that, O king, all the Brahmanas, his three brothers and the renowned Draupadi were greatly amazed.

data.v: ते तु सर्वे द्विजश्रेष्ठाः पाण्डवानां हितेप्सया । मैवमित्यब्रुवन्भीमं गर्हयन्तोऽस्य साहसम् ।।
data.md: And those best of the Brahmanas desirous of the welfare of the Pandavas, condemning the rashness of Bhima, told him not to do such an act again.

data.v: पाण्डवास्तु भयान्मुक्तं प्रेक्ष्य भीमं महाबलम् । हर्षमाहारयां चक्रुर्विजह्रुश्च मुदा युताः ।।
data.md: The Pandavas too were greatly delighted at seeing the highly powerful Bhima out of danger and continued to dwell there happily.

data.v: निदाघान्तकरः कालः सर्वभूतसुखावहः । तत्रैव वसतां तेषां प्रावृट्समभिपद्यत ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: While they (the Pandavas) were living there, the rainy season, which puts an end to summer and is agreeable to all creatures, made its appearance.

data.v: छादयन्तो महाघोषाः खं दिशश्च बलाहकाः । प्रववर्षुर्दिवारात्रमसिताः सततं तदा ।।
data.md: Then, hundreds and thousands of sable clouds covering the entire) firmament and the cardinal points, emitting thundering roars and looking like (so many) awnings in the rainy season, incessantly poured down showers night and day. The effulgence of the sun disappeared from the earth; and its place was filled by the stainless splendour of lightning.

data.v: तपात्ययनिकेताश्च शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः । अपेतार्कप्रभाजालाः सविद्युद्विमलप्रभाः ।।
data.md: Then, hundreds and thousands of sable clouds covering the entire) firmament and the cardinal points, emitting thundering roars and looking like (so many) awnings in the rainy season, incessantly poured down showers night and day. The effulgence of the sun disappeared from the earth; and its place was filled by the stainless splendour of lightning.

data.v: विरूढशष्पा पृथिवी मत्तदंशसरीसृपा । बभूव पयसा सिक्ता शान्तधूमरजोऽरुणा ।।
data.md: And the earth, over grown with grass teeming with gnats and reptiles, maddened with joy and saturated with water, looked serene and became delightful to all.

data.v: न स्म प्रज्ञायते किंचिदम्भसा समवस्तृते । समं वा विषमं वापि नद्यो वा स्थावराणि वा ।।
data.md: When the (surface of the earth was flooded with water it could not be discerned whether the ground was even or uneven or whether there were rivers, ground.

data.v: क्षुब्धतोया महाघोषाः श्वसमाना इवाशुगाः । सिन्धवः शोभयां चक्रुः काननानि तपात्यये ।।
data.md: At the close of summer, the streams full of agitated waters and careering violently with a hissing noise like (flight of) arrows, lent a grace to the woods.

data.v: नदतां काननान्तेषु श्रूयन्ते विविधाः स्वनाः । वृष्टिभिस्ताड्यमानानां वराहमृगपक्षिणाम् ।।
data.md: The boars, the stage and the birds, drenched in water began to utter various sounds that could be heard in the forests.

data.v: स्तोककाः शिखिनश्चैव पुंस्कोकिलगणैः सह । मत्ताः परिपतन्ति स्म दर्दुराश्चैव दर्पिताः ।।
data.md: The Chatakas, .the peacocks, the male kokilas and the excited frogs all intoxicated (with joy) began to frolic about.

data.v: तथा बहुविधाकारा प्रावृण्मेघानुनादिता । अभ्यतीता शिवा तेषां चरतां मरुधन्वसु ।।
data.md: Thus, while the Pandavas were wandering about in dry sandy tracts at the neighbourhood of mountains the delightful rainy season so various in aspect and resounding with (the roar of) the clouds passed away.

data.v: क्रौञ्चहंसगणाकीर्णा शरत्प्रणिहिताभवत् । रूढकक्षवनप्रस्था प्रसन्नजलनिम्नगा ।।
data.md: Then came autumn, crowded with ganders and cranes, when the forest tracts were over grown with verdure and the streams became clear.

data.v: विमलाकाशनक्षत्रा शरत्तेषां शिवाभवत् । मृगद्विजसमाकीर्णा पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् ।।
data.md: The sky and the stars shone with a stainless lustre and the country was swarmed with beasts and birds. This season of autumn became auspicious to the high-souled sons of Pandu.

data.v: पश्यन्तः शान्तरजसः क्षपा जलदशीतलाः । ग्रहनक्षत्रसंघैश्च सोमेन च विराजिताः ।।
data.md: (Then) the nights free from dust and cool with clouds were adorned with numerous stars, planets and the moon.

data.v: कुमुदैः पुण्डरीकैश्च शीतवारिधराः शिवाः । नदीः पुष्करिणीश्चैव ददृशुः समलंकृताः ।।
data.md: And (the Pandavas) beheld the rivers and the tanks, full of cool water and beautified with lilies and lotuses and pleasant (to the eye)

data.v: आकाशनीकाशतटां नीपनीवारसंकुलाम् । बभूव चरतां हर्षः पुण्यतीर्थां सरस्वतीम् ।।
data.md: And they experienced a great delight in wandering along the sacred Sarasvati whose banks resemble the firmament and are covered with canes.

data.v: ते वै मुमुदिरे वीराः प्रसन्नसलिलां शिवाम् । पश्यन्तो दृढधन्वानः परिपूर्णां सरस्वतीम् ।।
data.md: And those wielders of strong bows were highly glad at seeing the auspicious Sarasvati full of limpid water.

data.v: तेषां पुण्यतमा रात्रिः पर्वसंधौ स्म शारदी । तत्रैव वसतामासीत्कार्त्तिकी जनमेजय ।।
data.md: O Janamejaya, while dwelling there they passed the most sacred night of the full moon in the month of Kartika.

data.v: पुण्यकृद्भिर्महासत्त्वैस्तापसैः सह पाण्डवाः । तत्सर्वं भरतश्रेष्ठाः समूहुर्योगमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: And in company with the righteous and high-souled ascetics, the Pandavas, the best of the Bharatas, spent that juncture in excellent devotion.

data.v: तमिस्राभ्युदये तस्मिन्धौम्येन सह पाण्डवाः । सूतैः पौरोगवैश्चैव काम्यकं प्रययुर्वनम् ।।
data.md: And when the dark fort-night set in immediately after, the sons of Pandu together with Dharma and their charioteers and cooks proceeded to the forest of Kamyaka.

data.v: काम्यकं प्राप्य कौन्तेया युधिष्ठिरपुरोगमाः । कृतातिथ्या मुनिगणैर्निषेदुः सह कृष्णया ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Arriving at (the forest of) Kamyaka and being hospitably received by the saints, Yudhishthira and the other Pandavas began to dwell there with Krishna.

data.v: ततस्तान्परिविश्वस्तान्वसतः पाण्डुनन्दनान् । ब्राह्मणा बहवस्तत्र समन्तात्पर्यवारयन् ।।
data.md: While those sons of Pandu were securely dwelling at that place they were surrounded by multitudes of Brahmanas.

data.v: अथाब्रवीद्द्विजः कश्चिदर्जुनस्य प्रियः सखा । एष्यतीह महाबाहुर्वशी शौरिरुदारधीः ।।
data.md: And a certain Brahmana said "Shauri, the dear friend of Arjuna, of mighty arms, possessed of self-restraint and endued with high intellect, will come (here).

data.v: विदिता हि हरेर्यूयमिहायाताः कुरूद्वहाः । सदा हि दर्शनाकाङ्क्षी श्रेयोऽन्वेषी च वो हरिः ।।
data.md: Because it is known to Hari that you the perpetuators of the Kuru race have arrived here; and he is always desirous of seeing you and secks your welfare.

data.v: बहुवत्सरजीवी च मार्कण्डेयो महातपाः । स्वाध्यायतपसा युक्तः क्षिप्रं युष्मान्समेष्यति ।।
data.md: and Markandeya, who has lived for ages, has performed severe austerities, has studied the Vedas and who is given to devotion, will very soon come and join you.”

data.v: तथैव तस्य ब्रुवतः प्रत्यदृश्यत केशवः । सैन्यसुग्रीवयुक्तेन रथेन रथिनां वरः ।।
मघवानिव पौलोम्या सहितः सत्यभामया । उपायाद्देवकीपुत्रो दिदृक्षुः कुरुसत्तमान् ।।
data.md: And at the very moment when the Brahmana was saying these he saw Keshava coming thither. And that foremost of car-warriors, the son of Devaki, desirous of seeing those most exalted of the Kurus, arrived on a chariot yoked with the horses named Saivya and Sugriva and accompanied by Satyabhama as Indra by the daughter of Puloma (Sachi).

data.v: अवतीर्य रथात्कृष्णो धर्मराजं यथाविधि । ववन्दे मुदितो धीमान्भीमं च बलिनां वरम् ।।
data.md: Getting down from the car, Krishna following the usual custom, greeted with great delight, the intellectual Dharmaraja and the highly powerful Bhima.

data.v: पूजयामास धौम्यं च यमाभ्यामभिवादितः । परिष्वज्य गुडाकेशं द्रौपदीं पर्यसान्त्वयत् ।।
data.md: He then paid his adoration to Dhaumya and (in his turn) was greeted by the twins. Then embracing Gudakesha (Arjuna of the curly hair) he spoke soothing words to Draupadi.

data.v: स दृष्ट्वा फल्गुनं वीरं चिरस्य प्रियमागतम् । पर्यष्वजत दाशार्हः पुनः पुनररिंदमम् ।।
data.md: And that tormentor of foes, the descendant of the Dasharhas, having met with his beloved and heroic Arjuna after a long time, embraced him again and again.

data.v: तथैव सत्यभामापि द्रौपदीं परिषस्वजे । पाण्डवानां प्रियां भार्यां कृष्णस्य महिषी प्रिया ।।
data.md: And similarly Satyabhama, the beloved queen of Krishna, embraced Draupadi, the dear wife of the Pandavas.

data.v: ततस्ते पाण्डवाः सर्वे सभार्याः सपुरोहिताः । आनर्चुः पुण्डरीकाक्षं परिवव्रुश्च सर्वशः ।।
data.md: Then the Pandavas together with their wife and priest paid then respects to the lotus-eyed (Krishna) and surrounded him on all sides.

data.v: कृष्णस्तु पार्थेन समेत्य विद्वा;न्धनंजयेनासुरतर्जनेन । बभौ यथा भूतपतिर्महात्मा; समेत्य साक्षाद्भगवान्गुहेन ।।
data.md: And the learned Krishna being joined with the Partha, Dhananjaya (winner of riches), the slayer of demons looked as, beautiful as that high-souled divine lord of all created beings (Shiva) when united with Kartikeya (his son).

data.v: ततः समस्तानि किरीटमाली; वनेषु वृत्तानि गदाग्रजाय । उक्त्वा यथावत्पुनरन्वपृच्छ;त्कथं सुभद्रा च तथाभिमन्युः ।।
data.md: Then he who wore a coronet on his head (Arjuna) having related in detail to the elder brother of Gada (Krishna) all the incidents in connection with their forest life asked how are Subhadra and Abhimanyu?

data.v: स पूजयित्वा मधुहा यथाव;त्पार्थांश्च कृष्णां च पुरोहितं च । उवाच राजानमभिप्रशंस;न्युधिष्ठिरं तत्र सहोपविश्य ।।
data.md: And the destroyer of (the demon) Madhu, having, in the usual manner greeted Arjuna, Draupadi and the priest (Dhaumya) and having eulogised the king Yudhishthira took his seat with them and spoke these words.

data.v: धर्मः परः पाण्डव राज्यलाभा;त्तस्यार्थमाहुस्तप एव राजन् । सत्यार्जवाभ्यां चरता स्वधर्मं; जितस्तवायं च परश्च लोकः ।।
data.md: "It is asserted (by the wise), O Pandava, that righteousness is superior to winning kingdoms and, O king, in order to foster it (virtue), asceticism is necessary. And you, who have performed your duties in strict obedience to truth and candour have conquered both this world and the next.

data.v: अधीतमग्रे चरता व्रतानि; सम्यग्धनुर्वेदमवाप्य कृत्स्नम् । क्षात्रेण धर्मेण वसूनि लब्ध्वा; सर्वे ह्यवाप्ताः क्रतवः पुराणाः ।।
data.md: You first studied (the Vedas) by observing the proper rites; you have next acquired mastery over the whole science of weapons; and then having obtained wealth by pursuing the methods followed by the Kshatriyas you have performed all the ancient sacrificial rites.

data.v: न ग्राम्यधर्मेषु रतिस्तवास्ति; कामान्न किंचित्कुरुषे नरेन्द्र । न चार्थलोभात्प्रजहासि धर्मं; तस्मात्स्वभावादसि धर्मराजः ।।
data.md: You are are neither addicted to sensual pleasures, nor, O king of kings, do you perform anything froin motives of self-interest nor do you subserve your duties to greed of wealth. It is (for these reasons) that you have been styled the virtuous King.

data.v: दानं च सत्यं च तपश्च राज;ञ्श्रद्धा च शान्तिश्च धृतिः क्षमा च । अवाप्य राष्ट्राणि वसूनि भोगा;नेषा परा पार्थ सदा रतिस्ते ।।
data.md: O King, although you have won kingdoms, wealth and are surrounded by all sorts of luxury, you are ever bent on charity, truthfulness, asceticism, faith, meditation, forgiveness and patience.

data.v: यदा जनौघः कुरुजाङ्गलानां; कृष्णां सभायामवशामपश्यत् । अपेतधर्मव्यवहारवृत्तं; सहेत तत्पाण्डव कस्त्वदन्यः ।।
data.md: When the inhabitants of Kuru Jangala beheld (the modesty of) Krishna outraged in the assembly hall, O Pandu who but yourself could brook that (beastly) conduct (on the part of the Kurus) so very odious to virtue and custom?

data.v: असंशयं सर्वसमृद्धकामः; क्षिप्रं प्रजाः पालयितासि सम्यक् । इमे वयं निग्रहणे कुरूणां; यदि प्रतिज्ञा भवतः समाप्ता ।।
data.md: It admits of no doubt that with all your desires gratified you will soon creditably govern your subjects. And when your promise (to spend twelve years in exile) will be fulfilled, we will try our utmost to chastise the Kurus."

data.v: धौम्यं च कृष्णां च युधिष्ठिरं च; यमौ च भीमं च दशार्हसिंहः । उवाच दिष्ट्या भवतां शिवेन; प्राप्तः किरीटी मुदितः कृतास्त्रः ।।
data.md: Then, the chief of the Dasharhas said to Dhaumya, Bhima, Yudhishthira, the twins (Nakula and Sahadeva) and Draupadi “it is by your good fortune that Kiriti (Arjuna who wears a coronet on his head) has returned with a merry mind after having been well-versed in the science of weapons."

data.v: प्रोवाच कृष्णामपि याज्ञसेनीं; दशार्हभर्ता सहितः सुहृद्भिः । कृष्णे धनुर्वेदरतिप्रधानाः; सत्यव्रतास्ते शिशवः सुशीलाः । सद्भिः सदैवाचरितं समाधिं; चरन्ति पुत्रास्तव याज्ञसेनि ।।
राज्येन राष्ट्रैश्च निमन्त्र्यमाणाः; पित्रा च कृष्णे तव सोदरैश्च । न यज्ञसेनस्य न मातुलानां; गृहेषु बाला रतिमाप्नुवन्ति ।।
data.md: And, O Krishna, although your father and your brothers try to tempt them with a kingdom and territories, the boys find no pleasure in the abodes of Yajnasena or of their maternal uncles.

data.v: आनर्तमेवाभिमुखाः शिवेन; गत्वा धनुर्वेदरतिप्रधानाः । तवात्मजा वृष्णिपुरं प्रविश्य; न दैवतेभ्यः स्पृहयन्ति कृष्णे ।।
data.md: And, O Krishna, safely proceeding towards the country of the Anartas when your sons, chiefly bent on the acquisition of arms, enter the city of the Vrishnis, they do not even long for celestials happiness.

data.v: यथा त्वमेवार्हसि तेषु वृत्तिं; प्रयोक्तुमार्या च यथैव कुन्ती । तेष्वप्रमादेन सदा करोति; तथा च भूयश्च तथा सुभद्रा ।।
data.md: And Subhadra always instructs them carefully to observe good manners as you yourself or the venerable Kunti would do.

data.v: यथानिरुद्धस्य यथाभिमन्यो;र्यथा सुनीथस्य यथैव भानोः । तथा विनेता च गतिश्च कृष्णे; तवात्मजानामपि रौक्मिणेयः ।।
data.md: O Krishna, as the son of Rukmani (Pradyumna) is the tutor and guide to Aniruddha, Abhimanyu Sunitha and Bhanu, so he is to your sons also.

data.v: गदासिचर्मग्रहणेषु शूरा;नस्त्रेषु शिक्षासु रथाश्वयाने । सम्यग्विनेता विनयत्यतन्द्री;स्तांश्चाभिमन्युः सततं कुमारः ।।
data.md: And Prince Abhimanyu, an able teacher always gives instructions to them brave and active as they are, in the arts of wielding maces, swords, buckles and other weapons and of driving cars and riding horses.

data.v: स चापि सम्यक्प्रणिधाय शिक्षा;मस्त्राणि चैषां गुरुवत्प्रदाय । तवात्मजानां च तथाभिमन्योः; पराक्रमैस्तुष्यति रौक्मिणेयः ।।
data.md: And the son of Rukmani, having thoroughly instructed and having duly conferred weapons upon them, takes much delight in witnessing the valour of your sons and of Abhimanyu.

data.v: यदा विहारं प्रसमीक्षमाणाः; प्रयान्ति पुत्रास्तव याज्ञसेनि । एकैकमेषामनुयान्ति तत्र; रथाश्च यानानि च दन्तिनश्च ।।
data.md: And O daughter of Yajnasena, when your sons go out for field sports, each of them is followed by cars, horses, vehicles and elephants."

data.v: अथाब्रवीद्धर्मराजं तु कृष्णो; दशार्हयोधाः कुकुरान्धकाश्च । एते निदेशं तव पालयन्ति; तिष्ठन्ति यत्रेच्छसि तत्र राजन् ।।
data.md: Krishna, then addressing the Dharmaraja, said “O king, let the Dasharha warrior, the Kukuras and the Andhakas, obeying your orders remain wherever you wish.

data.v: आवर्ततां कार्मुकवेगवाता; हलायुधप्रग्रहणा मधूनाम् । सेना तवार्थेषु नरेन्द्र यत्ता; ससादिपत्त्यश्वरथा सनागा ।।
data.md: O monarch, let the army of the Madhus, the strength of whose bows is as impetuous as the wind and led by Halayudha (the wielder of the plough) and consisting of cavalry, infantry, horses, chariots and elephants, prepare to carry out your commands.

data.v: प्रस्थाप्यतां पाण्डव धार्तराष्ट्रः; सुयोधनः पापकृतां वरिष्ठः । स सानुबन्धः ससुहृद्गणश्च; सौभस्य सौभाधिपतेश्च मार्गम् ।।
data.md: O Pandava, send Suyodhana, the son of Dhritarashtra, the vilest of sinners together with his friends and followers to the path of the lord of Subha (Soila) the son of the earth.

data.v: कामं तथा तिष्ठ नरेन्द्र तस्मि;न्यथा कृतस्ते समयः सभायाम् । दाशार्हयोधैस्तु ससादियोधं; प्रतीक्षतां नागपुरं भवन्तम् ।।
data.md: Dwell where you please, O monarch, during the period appointed by you in the assembly hall; but at the end of which let the city Nagpur (Hastina) await your arrival therein when the Dasharha warriors have cut down the forces of your enemies.

data.v: व्यपेतमन्युर्व्यपनीतपाप्मा; विहृत्य यत्रेच्छसि तत्र कामम् । ततः समृद्धं प्रथमं विशोकः; प्रपत्स्यसे नागपुरं सराष्ट्रम् ।।
data.md: (During the appointed period) abandoning your sorrow and getting rid of your sin, wander at pleasure wherever you like; and then with a merry heart you will enter the renowned city of Hastina and also your principality.”

data.v: ततस्तदाज्ञाय मतं महात्मा; यथावदुक्तं पुरुषोत्तमेन । प्रशस्य विप्रेक्ष्य च धर्मराजः; कृताञ्जलिः केशवमित्युवाच ।।
data.md: Then the high-souled Dharmaraja, being informed of the views thus clearly expressed by that best of men and praising the same and looking at Krishna spoke these words with joined hands to him.

data.v: असंशयं केशव पाण्डवानां; भवान्गतिस्त्वच्छरणा हि पार्थाः । कालोदये तच्च ततश्च भूयः; कर्ता भवान्कर्म न संशयोऽस्ति ।।
data.md: "O Keshava, it admits of no doubt that you are the refuge of the Pandavas; and the Parthas are under your protection. When the time for action will arrive, you will undoubtedly do all that you have just said.

data.v: यथाप्रतिज्ञं विहृतश्च कालः; सर्वाः समा द्वादश निर्जनेषु । अज्ञातचर्यां विधिवत्समाप्य; भवद्गताः केशव पाण्डवेयाः ।।
data.md: We will spend the period of twelve years, as we have promised, in lonely forests. And then having duly completed the period of our are incognito life, O Keshava, the sons of Pandu will place themselves under your protection.

data.v: तथा वदति वार्ष्णेये धर्मराजे च भारत । अथ पश्चात्तपोवृद्धो बहुवर्षसहस्रधृक् । प्रत्यदृश्यत धर्मात्मा मार्कण्डेयो महातपाः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: O Bharata, when the descendant of the Vrishnis and the Dharmaraja were thus conversing, the high-souled Markandeya, of great devotion, grown wise by austerities, who had lived many thousands of years, was seen to approach (there). Being immortal and without signs of senility, endued with beauty and magnanimity.

data.v: तमागतमृषिं वृद्धं बहुवर्षसहस्रिणम् । आनर्चुर्ब्राह्मणाः सर्वे कृष्णश्च सह पाण्डवैः ।।
तमर्चितं सुविश्वस्तमासीनमृषिसत्तमम् । ब्राह्मणानां मतेनाह पाण्डवानां च केशवः ।।
data.md: All the Brahmanas and the Pandavas together with Krishna paid their adoration to him. And when that most exalted of saints, thus honoured, was peacefully seated, Keshava giving expression to the views of the Brahmanas and the Pandavas thus addressed him.

data.v: शुश्रूषवः पाण्डवास्ते ब्राह्मणाश्च समागताः । द्रौपदी सत्यभामा च तथाहं परमं वचः ।।
data.md: Krishna said : The Pandavas, the assembled Brahmanas, Draupadi, Satyablama as well as myself are all desirous of hearing your most excellent words.

data.v: पुरावृत्ताः कथाः पुण्याः सदाचाराः सनातनाः । राज्ञां स्त्रीणामृषीणां च मार्कण्डेय विचक्ष्व नः ।।
data.md: (Graciously) narrate to us (therefore) the sacred events of ancient ages and the eternal rules of righteous conduct by which kings, women and saints should be guided.

data.v: तेषु तत्रोपविष्टेषु देवर्षिरपि नारदः । आजगाम विशुद्धात्मा पाण्डवानवलोककः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : When they were all seated the divine saint Narada too, of pure soul, came there to see the Pandavas.

data.v: तमप्यथ महात्मानं सर्वे तु पुरुषर्षभाः । पाद्यार्घ्याभ्यां यथान्यायमुपतस्थुर्मनीषिणम् ।।
data.md: Then, all those highly intellectual and most exalted of mortals, honoured that magnanimous saint by offering him, according to the usual custom, water to wash his feet and the oblation called Arghya.

data.v: नारदस्त्वथ देवर्षिर्ज्ञात्वा तांस्तु कृतक्षणान् । मार्कण्डेयस्य वदतस्तां कथामन्वमोदत ।।
data.md: Learning that they were about to hear the words of Markandeya, the divine saint Narada signified his assent to the proposal.

data.v: उवाच चैनं कालज्ञः स्मयन्निव स नारदः । ब्रह्मर्षे कथ्यतां यत्ते पाण्डवेषु विवक्षितम् ।।
data.md: Then the eternal Krishna, who knows well what is the convenient moment, spoke to Markandeya, with a smile "O Brahmarshi, kindly relate to the Pandavas whatever you wish to say"

data.v: एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच मार्कण्डेयो महातपाः । क्षणं कुरुध्वं विपुलमाख्यातव्यं भविष्यति ।।
data.md: Thus addressed, Markandeya, of great austerities replied “wait a moment. I will relate lots of events."

data.v: एवमुक्ताः क्षणं चक्रुः पाण्डवाः सह तैर्द्विजैः । मध्यंदिने यथादित्यं प्रेक्षन्तस्तं महामुनिम् ।।
data.md: Thus spoken to, the Pandavas together with the Brahmanas waited a little looking at that great saint glorious as the noon-day sun.

data.v: तं विवक्षन्तमालक्ष्य कुरुराजो महामुनिम् । कथासंजननार्थाय चोदयामास पाण्डवः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said: (Then) the son of Pandu, the king of the Kurus, seeing that the great sage was desirous of speaking, asked him, with the intention of suggesting topics for narration.

data.v: भवान्दैवतदैत्यानामृषीणां च महात्मनाम् । राजर्षीणां च सर्वेषां चरितज्ञः सनातनः ।।
data.md: “You are ancient in age and are therefore conversant with the events relating to all the gods, the demons, the high-souled sages and the royal saints.

data.v: सेव्यश्चोपासितव्यश्च मतो नः काङ्क्षितश्चिरम् । अयं च देवकीपुत्रः प्राप्तोऽस्मानवलोककः ।।
data.md: We consider you deserve all honour and adoration; and we have, for a long time, been desirous of seeing you. This son of Devaki too has come here to pay us a visit.

data.v: भवत्येव हि मे बुद्धिर्दृष्ट्वात्मानं सुखाच्च्युतम् । धार्तराष्ट्रांश्च दुर्वृत्तानृध्यतः प्रेक्ष्य सर्वशः ।।
data.md: When I consider that I have been deprived of happiness for no fault of mine and when I see the wicked sons of Dhritarashtra prospering in every respect it strikes me that man is the agent of his meritorious or wicked acts and that he reaps the fruits of his own deeds. How can then God be the agent?

data.v: कर्मणः पुरुषः कर्ता शुभस्याप्यशुभस्य च । स्वफलं तदुपाश्नाति कथं कर्ता स्विदीश्वरः ।।
अथ वा सुखदुःखेषु नृणां ब्रह्मविदां वर । इह वा कृतमन्वेति परदेहेऽथ वा पुनः ।।
data.md: And O the best of those conversant with the Supreme Being, why does man become subject to pleasure or pain? Is it in this world or in another existence that he reaps the fruits of his acts?

data.v: देही च देहं संत्यज्य मृग्यमाणः शुभाशुभैः । कथं संयुज्यते प्रेत्य इह वा द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: O best of Brahmanas, how is it that the consequences of the good or evil acts of an embodied being follow him in this world or after his death in the next?

data.v: ऐहलौकिकमेवैतदुताहो पारलौकिकम् । क्व च कर्माणि तिष्ठन्ति जन्तोः प्रेतस्य भार्गव ।।
data.md: Do we reap the fruits of our acts in this life or in another existence? And O descendant of Bhrigu, where do the results of the acts of an animated creature rest after his death?”

data.v: त्वद्युक्तोऽयमनुप्रश्नो यथावद्वदतां वर । विदितं वेदितव्यं ते स्थित्यर्थमनुपृच्छसि ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : "O the best of speakers, this question is worthy of you and is just what you should ask. You are well informed of whatever is fit to be known But it is for the sake of form that you are asking the question.

data.v: अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि तदिहैकमनाः शृणु । यथेहामुत्र च नरः सुखदुःखमुपाश्नुते ।।
data.md: I will now narrate to you how men experience pleasure and pain in this world and in the next. Listen to me with an undivided attention.

data.v: निर्मलानि शरीराणि विशुद्धानि शरीरिणाम् । ससर्ज धर्मतन्त्राणि पूर्वोत्पन्नः प्रजापतिः ।।
data.md: Prajapati (the lord of all created beings) who first sprang into existence, created for the corporeal beings, bodies, stainless, pure and given to virtue.

data.v: अमोघबलसंकल्पाः सुव्रताः सत्यवादिनः । ब्रह्मभूता नराः पुण्याः पुराणाः कुरुनन्दन ।।
data.md: O the most exalted of the Kurus, the primary men had all their desires gratified, were given to virtuous deeds and were truthful, godly and pure.

data.v: सर्वे देवैः समायान्ति स्वच्छन्देन नभस्तलम् । ततश्च पुनरायान्ति सर्वे स्वच्छन्दचारिणः ।।
data.md: They were all as good as the gods themselves, could soar to the heavens, come down again and range at pleasure wherever they liked.

data.v: स्वच्छन्दमरणाश्चासन्नराः स्वच्छन्दजीविनः । अल्पबाधा निरातङ्का सिद्धार्था निरुपद्रवाः ।।
data.md: They had control over their life and death, had few difficulties and no fear had all their desires gratified, were free from troubles.

data.v: द्रष्टारो देवसंघानामृषीणां च महात्मनाम् । प्रत्यक्षाः सर्वधर्माणां दान्ता विगतमत्सराः ।।
data.md: Could visit the high-souled gods and the saints; were well-versed in all the religious ordinances; had self-control and were devoid of envy.

data.v: आसन्वर्षसहस्राणि तथा पुत्रसहस्रिणः । ततः कालान्तरेऽन्यस्मिन्पृथिवीतलचारिणः ।।
data.md: They lived for a thousand years and had as many sons. But in process of time their powers, were limited to walking solely on the earth's surface.

data.v: कामक्रोधाभिभूतास्ते मायाव्याजोपजीविनः । लोभमोहाभिभूताश्च त्यक्ता देवैस्ततो नराः ।।
data.md: And they became subject to lust and anger, practised falsehood and duplicity for subsistence and were overpowered by greed and ignorance. And when these (wicked) men died,

data.v: अशुभैः कर्मभिः पापास्तिर्यङ्नरकगामिनः । संसारेषु विचित्रेषु पच्यमानाः पुनः पुनः ।।
data.md: They were born among lower animals or driven to hell and again and again had to suffer the pain of rebirth in this wonderful world on account of their vicious deeds.

data.v: मोघेष्टा मोघसंकल्पा मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः । सर्वातिशङ्किनश्चैव संवृत्ताः क्लेशभागिनः । अशुभैः कर्मभिश्चापि प्रायशः परिचिह्निताः ।।
data.md: Then their desires, their aims, their knowledge and their rituals bore up fruit; They were afraid of everything their reason was clouded and they were oppressed with sorrow.

data.v: दौष्कुल्या व्याधिबहुला दुरात्मानोऽप्रतापिनः । भवन्त्यल्पायुषः पापा रौद्रकर्मफलोदयाः । नाथन्तः सर्वकामानां नास्तिका भिन्नसेतवः ।।
data.md: Their life became short and wicked and they paid the penalty of their terrible deeds; were covetous of everything, became atheists and indifferent in mind.

data.v: जन्तोः प्रेतस्य कौन्तेय गतिः स्वैरिह कर्मभिः । प्राज्ञस्य हीनबुद्धेश्च कर्मकोशः क्व तिष्ठति ।।
data.md: O son of Kunti, the fate of a creature after death depends upon his acts in this world. As regards your question as to where the treasure of the acts of the wise and the ignorant remains,

data.v: क्वस्थस्तत्समुपाश्नाति सुकृतं यदि वेतरत् । इति ते दर्शनं यच्च तत्राप्यनुनयं शृणु ।।
data.md: And where they reap the fruits of their own meritorious or vicious deeds, hear the decisions on the subject.

data.v: अयमादिशरीरेण देवसृष्टेन मानवः । शुभानामशुभानां च कुरुते संचयं महत् ।।
data.md: Man by his original subtle frame, made by the creator, accumulates a great store of good and evil deeds.

data.v: आयुषोऽन्ते प्रहायेदं क्षीणप्रायं कलेवरम् । संभवत्येव युगपद्योनौ नास्त्यन्तराभवः ।।
data.md: When his days are numbered he leaves this frail body and is immediately born among another order of creation, and he never remains disembodied even for a single moment.

data.v: तत्रास्य स्वकृतं कर्म छायेवानुगतं सदा । फलत्यथ सुखार्हो वा दुःखार्हो वापि जायते ।।
data.md: In that new existence his (good and evil) acts always follow him like his shadow and the consequences thereof make his existence either pleasurable or painful.

data.v: कृतान्तविधिसंयुक्तः स जन्तुर्लक्षणैः शुभैः । अशुभैर्वा निरादानो लक्ष्यते ज्ञानदृष्टिभिः ।।
data.md: The wise only by means of spiritual insight know that every creature is chained to an unchangeable fate by the destroyer (Yama) for his virtue or vice and that he is unable to get rid of the consequences of his acts in good or evil fortune.

data.v: एषा तावदबुद्धीनां गतिरुक्ता युधिष्ठिर । अतः परं ज्ञानवतां निबोध गतिमुत्तमाम् ।।
data.md: O Yudhishthira, I have related (to you) the fate of those whose intelligence has been clouded with ignorance. Now hear of the excellent state attained to by the wise.

data.v: मनुष्यास्तप्ततपसः सर्वागमपरायणाः । स्थिरव्रताः सत्यपरा गुरुशुश्रूषणे रताः ।।
data.md: These men are of great ascetic merits, learned in all the religious books (i.e. the Vedas and the Tantras), firm in duty, devoted to truth, engaged in ministering to the comforts of their elders;

data.v: सुशीलाः शुक्लजातीयाः क्षान्ता दान्ताः सुतेजसः । शुभयोन्यन्तरगताः प्रायशः शुभलक्षणाः ।।
data.md: Are well behaved, given to the practice of yoga, of forgiving spirit, self-controlled, energetic, well-born and are endowed with the signs of greatness.

data.v: जितेन्द्रियत्वाद्वशिनः शुक्लत्वान्मन्दरोगिणः । अल्पबाधपरित्रासाद्भवन्ति निरुपद्रवाः ।।
data.md: Owing to their control over their passions they are well-governed in mind; by practising Yoga they are devoid of disease and by the absence of sorrow and fear they are free from (mental troubles).

data.v: च्यवन्तं जायमानं च गर्भस्थं चैव सर्वशः । स्वमात्मानं परं चैव बुध्यन्ते ज्ञानचक्षुषः । कर्मभूमिमिमां प्राप्य पुनर्यान्ति सुरालयम् ।।
data.md: In course of birth whether timely or premature or while confined in the womb, (in short) in every state, they know the relation subsisting between their own souls and the eternal spirit, by spiritual insight.

data.v: किंचिद्दैवाद्धठात्किंचित्किंचिदेव स्वकर्मभिः । प्राप्नुवन्ति नरा राजन्मा तेऽस्त्वन्या विचारणा ।।
data.md: O monarch, by practising Yoga or by Destiny or by their own acts, men attain to (happiness or misery). Do not thing otherwise.

data.v: इमामत्रोपमां चापि निबोध वदतां वर । मनुष्यलोके यच्छ्रेयः परं मन्ये युधिष्ठिर ।।
data.md: O the best of speakers, O Yudhishthira, hear an instance of what I deem to be the highest good in this world.

data.v: इह वैकस्य नामुत्र अमुत्रैकस्य नो इह । इह चामुत्र चैकस्य नामुत्रैकस्य नो इह ।।
data.md: Some men enjoy happiness in this world but not in the next; some attain it in the next world but not in this; while others neither in this world nor in that to come.

data.v: धनानि येषां विपुलानि सन्ति; नित्यं रमन्ते सुविभूषिताङ्गाः । तेषामयं शत्रुवरघ्न लोको; नासौ सदा देहसुखे रतानाम् ।।
data.md: They, that possess vast wealth, sport themselves every day richly adorning their persons (with ornaments and dresses). Such men, O destroyer of powerful enemies being addicted to physical enjoyment, attain to happiness in this world but not in the next.

data.v: ये योगयुक्तास्तपसि प्रसक्ताः; स्वाध्यायशीला जरयन्ति देहान् । जितेन्द्रिया भूतहिते निविष्टा;स्तेषामसौ नायमरिघ्न लोकः ।।
data.md: O slayer of foes, those who are absorbed in spiritual thoughts, devoted to asceticism, engaged in the study of the Vedas and who mortify their bodies, have a control over their passions and abstain from killing animals, enjoy happiness in the next world but not in this.

data.v: ये धर्ममेव प्रथमं चरन्ति; धर्मेण लब्ध्वा च धनानि काले । दारानवाप्य क्रतुभिर्यजन्ते; तेषामयं चैव परश्च लोकः ।।
data.md: Those that first lead a virtuous life and honestly acquire wealth in due time and then marry and perform sacrificial rites, attain happiness both in this world and in that to come.

data.v: ये नैव विद्यां न तपो न दानं; न चापि मूढाः प्रजने यतन्ते । न चाधिगच्छन्ति सुखान्यभाग्या;स्तेषामयं चैव परश्च नास्ति ।।
data.md: And those stupid persons who have neither learning nor asceticism, nor charity and who do not multiply their kind and are not given to worldly joys attain to happiness neither in this world nor in the next.

data.v: सर्वे भवन्तस्त्वतिवीर्यसत्त्वा; दिव्यौजसः संहननोपपन्नाः । लोकादमुष्मादवनिं प्रपन्नाः; स्वधीतविद्याः सुरकार्यहेतोः ।।
data.md: You are highly powerful, vigorous, endued with celestials energy, well read and in order to serve the purpose of the gods have come down (from the heavens) and been born in this world for the extirpation (of the wicked people).

data.v: कृत्वैव कर्माणि महान्ति शूरा;स्तपोदमाचारविहारशीलाः । देवानृषीन्प्रेतगणांश्च सर्वा;न्संतर्पयित्वा विधिना परेण ।।
data.md: Having achieved glorious deeds and having gratified all the gods, the saints and the Pitris, you, who are so heroic, devoted to spiritual meditation, self-controlled, given to purity and engaged in self-extertion will at length in due course.

data.v: स्वर्गं परं पुण्यकृतां निवासं; क्रमेण संप्राप्स्यथ कर्मभिः स्वैः । मा भूद्विशङ्का तव कौरवेन्द्र; दृष्ट्वात्मनः क्लेशमिमं सुखार्ह ।।
data.md: Gradually attain to that excellent heavenly region, the abode of the virtuous, by means of your own (meritorious) deeds. O the lord of the Kurus, let no doubt, trouble your mind on account of your misfortune, for this affliction will lead to your (ultimate) happiness.

data.v: मार्कण्डेयं महात्मानमूचुः पाण्डुसुतास्तदा । माहात्म्यं द्विजमुख्यानां श्रोतुमिच्छाम कथ्यताम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Then the sons of Pandu said to the magnanimous Markandeya “(kindly) narrate to us of the greatness of the Brahmanas which we are very desirous of hearing."

data.v: एवमुक्तः स भगवान्मार्कण्डेयो महातपाः । उवाच सुमहातेजाः सर्वशास्त्रविशारदः ।।
data.md: Thus addressed, the highly energetic and divine Markandeya of great austerities and well versed in all the departments of religious writs replied (to them).

data.v: हैहयानां कुलकरो राजा परपुरंजयः । कुमारो रूपसंपन्नो मृगयामचरद्बली ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Once upon a time a handsome and vigorous young prince of the Haihaya race, conqueror of enemies' cities, went out to hunt.

data.v: चरमाणस्तु सोऽरण्ये तृणवीरुत्समावृते । कृष्णाजिनोत्तरासङ्गं ददर्श मुनिमन्तिके । स तेन निहतोऽरण्ये मन्यमानेन वै मृगम् ।।
data.md: While he was wandering in the forest covered with grass and creepers he saw near (him) a Muni wrapped up in an antelope's skin which served as an upper garment.

data.v: व्यथितः कर्म तत्कृत्वा शोकोपहतचेतनः । जगाम हैहयानां वै सकाशं प्रथितात्मनाम् ।।
राज्ञां राजीवनेत्रोसौ कुमारः पृथिवीपते । तेषां च तद्यथावृत्तं कथयामास वै तदा ।।
data.md: The lotus-eyed prince went to the distinguished Haihaya Chiefs and informed them of the matter,

data.v: तं चापि हिंसितं तात मुनिं मूलफलाशिनम् । श्रुत्वा दृष्ट्वा च ते तत्र बभूवुर्दीनमानसाः ।।
data.md: O child, on hearing of it and seeing the (dead body) of the Muni who lived on fruits and roots they became sick at heart.

data.v: कस्यायमिति ते सर्वे मार्गमाणास्ततस्ततः । जग्मुश्चारिष्टनेमेस्ते तार्क्ष्यस्याश्रममञ्जसा ।।
data.md: Then all those (kings) making enquiries here and there as to whose son the Muni was, soon arrived at the hermitage of Arishtanemi, the son of Kashyapa.

data.v: तेऽभिवाद्य महात्मानं तं मुनिं संशितव्रतम् । तस्थुः सर्वे स तु मुनिस्तेषां पूजामथाहरत् ।।
data.md: And bowing down to that high-souled sage constantly engaged in austerities they remained standing there and the Muni 10O busied himself to welcome them.

data.v: ते तमूचुर्महात्मानं न वयं सत्क्रियां मुने । त्वत्तोऽर्हाः कर्मदोषेण ब्राह्मणो हिंसितो हि नः ।।
data.md: They then said to that magnanimous sage, "we are no longer worthy of your reception in as much as we have unfortunately killed a Brahmana."

data.v: तानब्रवीत्स विप्रर्षिः कथं वो ब्राह्मणो हतः । क्व चासौ ब्रूत सहिताः पश्यध्वं मे तपोबलम् ।।
data.md: And that Brahmanical sage said to them "how have you killed a Brahmana? Say where he is; and you all behold the power of my devotional exercise."

data.v: ते तु तत्सर्वमखिलमाख्यायास्मै यथातथम् । नापश्यंस्तमृषिं तत्र गतासुं ते समागताः । अन्वेषमाणाः सव्रीडाः स्वप्नवद्गतमानसाः ।।
data.md: The chiefs, then having truly related to him all that had taken place and having returned to the place (where the corpse of the Rishi was) did not find it there.

data.v: तानब्रवीत्तत्र मुनिस्तार्क्ष्यः परपुरंजयः । स्यादयं ब्राह्मणः सोऽथ यो युष्माभिर्विनाशितः । पुत्रो ह्ययं मम नृपास्तपोबलसमन्वितः ।।
data.md: "O kings, is this the Brahmana who was killed by you? He is indeed my son devoted to great austerities."

data.v: ते तु दृष्ट्वैव तमृषिं विस्मयं परमं गताः । महदाश्चर्यमिति वै विब्रुवाणा महीपते ।।
data.md: And O king, beholding that Rishi they were highly amazed and they all exclaimed “it is indeed highly wonderful.

data.v: मृतो ह्ययमतो दृष्टः कथं जीवितमाप्तवान् । किमेतत्तपसो वीर्यं येनायं जीवितः पुनः । श्रोतुमिच्छाम विप्रर्षे यदि श्रोतव्यमित्युत ।।
data.md: How has the dead been restored to life? Is it by the strength of asceticism that he has been brought to life again?

data.v: स तानुवाच नास्माकं मृत्युः प्रभवते नृपाः । कारणं वः प्रवक्ष्यामि हेतुयोगं समासतः ।।
सत्यमेवाभिजानीमो नानृते कुर्महे मनः । स्वधर्ममनुतिष्ठामस्तस्मान्मृत्युभयं न नः ।।
data.md: I will relate to you the reason here of briefly and argumentatively. As we strictly adhere to our own duties, we are not afraid of death.

data.v: यद्ब्राह्मणानां कुशलं तदेषां कथयामहे । नैषां दुश्चरितं ब्रूमस्तस्मान्मृत्युभयं न नः ।।
data.md: We speak well of the Brahmanas and never vilify them; therefore we do not fear death.

data.v: अतिथीनन्नपानेन भृत्यानत्यशनेन च । तेजस्विदेशवासाच्च तस्मान्मृत्युभयं न नः ।।
data.md: As we entertain our guests with food and drink and regale our dependents with plenty of food and then eat what is left; so we have no fear of death.

data.v: एतद्वै लेशमात्रं वः समाख्यातं विमत्सराः । गच्छध्वं सहिताः सर्वे न पापाद्भयमस्ति वः ।।
data.md: I have told you a bit only (of our devotional power). Now devoid of pride and vanity you all return together (to your homes).

data.v: एवमस्त्विति ते सर्वे प्रतिपूज्य महामुनिम् । स्वदेशमगमन्हृष्टा राजानो भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: O best of the Bharatas, (then) those kings, saying "be it so" and bowing down to that great sage returned cheerfully to their country.

data.v: भूय एव तु माहात्म्यं ब्राह्मणानां निबोध मे । वैन्यो नामेह राजर्षिरश्वमेधाय दीक्षितः । तमत्रिर्गन्तुमारेभे वित्तार्थमिति नः श्रुतम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Hear from me again of the great glory of the Brahmanas. We have heard that a royal sage Vainya by name was engaged in celebrating the horse-sacrifice and that Atri was prepared to go to him for alms. But at last actuated by religious motives he abandoned his desire for riches.

data.v: भूयोऽथ नानुरुध्यत्स धर्मव्यक्तिनिदर्शनात् । संचिन्त्य स महातेजा वनमेवान्वरोचयत् । धर्मपत्नीं समाहूय पुत्रांश्चेदमुवाच ह ।।
data.md: After much deliberation (as to what he should do) that highly energetic (sage) became desirous of living in the forests and calling his wedded wife and sons together spoke to them thus

data.v: प्राप्स्यामः फलमत्यन्तं बहुलं निरुपद्रवम् । अरण्यगमनं क्षिप्रं रोचतां वो गुणाधिकम् ।।
data.md: May it be your inclination to go to the forests soon; because (by repairing there) we shall attain the highly blissful and tranquil fulfillment (of our desires).

data.v: तं भार्या प्रत्युवाचेदं धर्ममेवानुरुध्यती । वैन्यं गत्वा महात्मानमर्थयस्व धनं बहु । स ते दास्यति राजर्षिर्यजमानोऽर्थिने धनम् ।।
data.md: To this his wife, actuated by virtuous motives, also replied “go to the high-souled Vainya and beg of him immense wealth.

data.v: तत आदाय विप्रर्षे प्रतिगृह्य धनं बहु । भृत्यान्सुतान्संविभज्य ततो व्रज यथेप्सितम् । एष वै परमो धर्मो धर्मविद्भिरुदाहृतः ।।
data.md: And having distributed it among the sons and the attendants, you may go whither you like. This is the highest virtue as instanced by men versed in religion.

data.v: कथितो मे महाभागे गौतमेन महात्मना । वैन्यो धर्मार्थसंयुक्तः सत्यव्रतसमन्वितः ।।
data.md: Atri said: O highly fortunate (wife), I have been told by the noble-minded Gautama that Vainya is religious, conversant with (the principles of the science of) profit and devoted to truth.

data.v: किं त्वस्ति तत्र द्वेष्टारो निवसन्ति हि मे द्विजाः । यथा मे गौतमः प्राह ततो न व्यवसाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: But he is surrounded by Brahmanas who are very envious of me. As Gautama has informed me of this I dare not go there.

data.v: तत्र स्म वाचं कल्याणीं धर्मकामार्थसंहिताम् । मयोक्तामन्यथा ब्रूयुस्ततस्ते वै निरर्थकाम् ।।
data.md: For even if I speak these (highly) beneficial and religious words calculated to bring about the fulfillment of one's desires they will oppose me with speeches productive of no good.

data.v: गमिष्यामि महाप्राज्ञे रोचते मे वचस्तव । गाश्च मे दास्यते वैन्यः प्रभूतं चार्थसंचयम् ।।
data.md: But, O highly wise (wife), I relish your proposal and will (therefore) go there. Vainya will bestow on me cows and immense wealth.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा जगामाशु वैन्ययज्ञं महातपाः । गत्वा च यज्ञायतनमत्रिस्तुष्टाव तं नृपम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya continued Saying this, that sage of great devotion, soon repaired to Vainya's sacrifice. And reaching the sacrificial altar he eulogised the king. With noble speeches and then said these words.

data.v: राजन्वैन्य त्वमीशश्च भुवि त्वं प्रथमो नृपः । स्तुवन्ति त्वां मुनिगणास्त्वदन्यो नास्ति धर्मवित् ।।
तमब्रवीदृषिस्तत्र वचः क्रुद्धो महातपाः । मैवमत्रे पुनर्ब्रूया न ते प्रज्ञा समाहिता । अत्र नः प्रथमं स्थाता महेन्द्रो वै प्रजापतिः ।।
data.md: Gautama said: O Atri, do you not repeat such (foolish words) again. Your understanding is not yet matured. In this world, Mahendra, the lord of all creatures, is the greatest monarch.

data.v: अथात्रिरपि राजेन्द्र गौतमं प्रत्यभाषत । अयमेव विधाता च यथैवेन्द्रः प्रजापतिः । त्वमेव मुह्यसे मोहान्न प्रज्ञानं तवास्ति ह ।।
data.md: O king of kings, thereupon, Atri replied to Gautama “this king is as much the dispenser of our destiny as Indra, the lord of all creatures. Your intellect is clouded with ignorance and you have no sense at (all)."

data.v: जानामि नाहं मुह्यामि त्वं विवक्षुर्विमुह्यसे । स्तोष्यसेऽभ्युदयप्रेप्सुस्तस्य दर्शनसंश्रयात् ।।
न वेत्थ परमं धर्मं न चावैषि प्रयोजनम् । बालस्त्वमसि मूढश्च वृद्धः केनापि हेतुना ।।
data.md: You are not conversant with what is the highest duty nor do feel any need for it. You are ignorant as a child; why then have you grown so old in years?

data.v: विवदन्तौ तथा तौ तु मुनीनां दर्शने स्थितौ । ये तस्य यज्ञे संवृत्तास्तेऽपृच्छन्त कथं त्विमौ ।।
data.md: Markandeya continued When they were thus quarreling before the Munis who were engaged in the sacrifice, the latter enquired "What is the matter with these two men?

data.v: प्रवेशः केन दत्तोऽयमनयोर्वैन्यसंसदि । उच्चैः समभिभाषन्तौ केन कार्येण विष्ठितौ ।।
data.md: Who did admit them to the court of Vainya? What is it that they are clamouring for?”

data.v: ततः परमधर्मात्मा काश्यपः सर्वधर्मवित् । विवादिनावनुप्राप्तौ तावुभौ प्रत्यवेदयत् ।।
data.md: Then the highly righteous Kashyapa versed in all duties stepping between the disputants inquired of them the cause of their quarrel.

data.v: अथाब्रवीत्सदस्यांस्तु गौतमो मुनिसत्तमान् । आवयोर्व्याहृतं प्रश्नं शृणुत द्विजपुंगवाः । वैन्यो विधातेत्याहात्रिरत्र नः संशयो महान् ।।
data.md: Thereupon, Gautama addressing that assembly of the most exalted sages said. "O the best of Brahmanas, hear the cause of our dispute.

data.v: श्रुत्वैव तु महात्मानो मुनयोऽभ्यद्रवन्द्रुतम् । सनत्कुमारं धर्मज्ञं संशयच्छेदनाय वै ।।
स च तेषां वचः श्रुत्वा यथातत्त्वं महातपाः । प्रत्युवाचाथ तानेवं धर्मार्थसहितं वचः ।।
data.md: The righteous Sanatkumara in order to solve their doubt. And he (Sanatkumara) of great devotional spirit, hearing their their words, addressed them with these words of true religious import..

data.v: ब्रह्म क्षत्रेण सहितं क्षत्रं च ब्रह्मणा सह । राजा वै प्रथमो धर्मः प्रजानां पतिरेव च । स एव शक्रः शुक्रश्च स धाता स बृहस्पतिः ।।
data.md: The king is noted for establishing religion and he is the protector of his subjects. He is (like) Indra (a protector of all beings) like Shukra (a propounder of morals) like Brihaspati (an adviser) and (therefore) he is (justly) styled the ruler of our destiny.

data.v: प्रजापतिर्विराट्सम्राट्क्षत्रियो भूपतिर्नृपः । य एभिः स्तूयते शब्दैः कस्तं नार्चितुमर्हति ।।
data.md: Is there (therefore) anybody who considers himself above worshipping the individual to whom such appellations as 'Prajapati' (the lord of all creatures), 'Virata', 'Emperor', 'Kshatriya' (one who preserves from pain), 'lord of earth,' and 'Monarch', are applied in praise?

data.v: पुरायोनिर्युधाजिच्च अभिया मुदितो भवः । स्वर्णेता सहजिद्बभ्रुरिति राजाभिधीयते ।।
data.md: The monarch is further styled 'the prime cause,' (of social order), 'the conqueror of battles,' (and therefore) the preserver of the (peace), 'the watchman', 'the contented', 'the lord', 'guide to heaven,' 'the easily victorious', 'Vishnu like.'

data.v: सत्यमन्युर्युधाजीवः सत्यधर्मप्रवर्तकः । अधर्मादृषयो भीता बलं क्षत्रे समादधन् ।।
data.md: 'Of effective wrath,' 'the victorious in wars' and 'the introducer of true religion.' The Rishis afraid of committing sins made over the (temporal) powers to the Kshatriyas.

data.v: आदित्यो दिवि देवेषु तमो नुदति तेजसा । तथैव नृपतिर्भूमावधर्मं नुदते भृशम् ।।
data.md: Like the sun among the gods in heaven who destroys darkness by his rays the king among men eradicates sin from the earth.

data.v: अतो राज्ञः प्रधानत्वं शास्त्रप्रामाण्यदर्शनात् । उत्तरः सिध्यते पक्षो येन राजेति भाषितम् ।।
data.md: Therefore by the authority of the Shastras the greatness of the king is established. And I declare for him who has spoken in favour of the king.

अल्पावशिष्टे तु तदा युगान्ते भरतर्षभ । सहस्रान्ते नराः सर्वे प्रायशोऽनृतवादिनः ।।
यज्ञप्रतिनिधिः पार्थ दानप्रतिनिधिस्तथा । व्रतप्रतिनिधिश्चैव तस्मिन्काले प्रवर्तते ।।
ब्राह्मणाः शूद्रकर्माणस्तथा शूद्रा धनार्जकाः । क्षत्रधर्मेण वाप्यत्र वर्तयन्ति गते युगे ।।
निवृत्तयज्ञस्वाध्यायाः पिण्डोदकविवर्जिताः । ब्राह्मणाः सर्वभक्षाश्च भविष्यन्ति कलौ युगे ।।
data.md: The Kshatriyas also adopt the practices of the Brahmanas. In the Kali Yuga the Brahmanas will abstain from sacrifices and the study of the Vedas. They will give up their staff and deer skin and they will eat everything. O child, the Brahmanas will give up prayer and the Shudras will betake themselves to these.

data.v: अजपा ब्राह्मणास्तात शूद्रा जपपरायणाः । विपरीते तदा लोके पूर्वरूपं क्षयस्य तत् ।।
बहवो म्लेच्छराजानः पृथिव्यां मनुजाधिप । मिथ्यानुशासिनः पापा मृषावादपरायणाः ।।
आन्ध्राः शकाः पुलिन्दाश्च यवनाश्च नराधिपाः । काम्बोजा और्णिकाः शूद्रास्तथाभीरा नरोत्तम ।।
न तदा ब्राह्मणः कश्चित्स्वधर्ममुपजीवति । क्षत्रिया अपि वैश्याश्च विकर्मस्था नराधिप ।।
अल्पायुषः स्वल्पबला अल्पतेजःपराक्रमाः । अल्पदेहाल्पसाराश्च तथा सत्याल्पभाषिणः ।।
बहुशून्या जनपदा मृगव्यालावृता दिशः । युगान्ते समनुप्राप्ते वृथा च ब्रह्मचारिणः । भोवादिनस्तथा शूद्रा ब्राह्मणाश्चार्यवादिनः ।।
data.md: When the end of the Yuga comes, the uttering of the Vedas become futile. The Shudras address (others) saying “Bho;" while the Brahinanas address (others) saying "Noble Sir."

data.v: युगान्ते मनुजव्याघ्र भवन्ति बहुजन्तवः । न तथा घ्राणयुक्ताश्च सर्वगन्धा विशां पते । रसाश्च मनुजव्याघ्र न तथा स्वादुयोगिनः ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, at the end of the Yuga animals enormously increase. O rulers of men, perfumes even do not become agreeable to our sense of smell.

data.v: बहुप्रजा ह्रस्वदेहाः शीलाचारविवर्जिताः । मुखेभगाः स्त्रियो राजन्भविष्यन्ति युगक्षये ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, the tastes of things do not become so agreeable to our sense of taste as at other times. Women give birth to numerous children who become of diminutive body, destitute of good conduct and good manners. O king at the end of the Yuga women's mouth serves the purpose of intercourse.

data.v: अट्टशूला जनपदाः शिवशूलाश्चतुष्पथाः । केशशूलाः स्त्रियो राजन्भविष्यन्ति युगक्षये ।।
data.md: O king, at the end of the Yuga, famine ravages the habitations of men and the highways are infested by women of ill fame. O king, all women become hostile to their husbands and destitute of all modesty.

data.v: अल्पक्षीरास्तथा गावो भविष्यन्ति जनाधिप । अल्पपुष्पफलाश्चापि पादपा बहुवायसाः ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, cows yield little milk; trees are crowded with swarms of crows; they do not produce any fruits and flowers.

data.v: ब्रह्मवध्यावलिप्तानां तथा मिथ्याभिशंसिनाम् । नृपाणां पृथिवीपाल प्रतिगृह्णन्ति वै द्विजाः ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, the Brahmanas, polluted with the sin of killing the twice-born, accept gifts from kings who are addicted to falsehood.

data.v: लोभमोहपरीताश्च मिथ्याधर्मध्वजावृताः । भिक्षार्थं पृथिवीपाल चञ्चूर्यन्ते द्विजैर्दिशः ।।
data.md: Filled with covetousness and ignorance; and bearing the outward symbols of religion, the Brahınanas afflicting the people of the earth rove about for alms.

data.v: करभारभयात्पुंसो गृहस्थाः परिमोषकाः । मुनिच्छद्माकृतिच्छन्ना वाणिज्यमुपजीवते ।।
मिथ्या च नखरोमाणि धारयन्ति नरास्तदा । अर्थलोभान्नरव्याघ्र वृथा च ब्रह्मचारिणः ।।
आश्रमेषु वृथाचाराः पानपा गुरुतल्पगाः । ऐहलौकिकमीहन्ते मांसशोणितवर्धनम् ।।
data.md: O king, men at such a time behave contrary to the mode of life to which they belong; they become addicted to intoxicating drinks, they become capable of violating even the bed of their preceptors. They are deluded with the desires of this world and they pursue things that only give pleasure ministering to flesh and blood.

data.v: बहुपाषण्डसंकीर्णाः परान्नगुणवादिनः । आश्रमा मनुजव्याघ्र न भवन्ति युगक्षये ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, at the end of the Yuga the hermitage of ascetics becomes crowded with sinful and insolent wretches who always praise the life of dependence.

data.v: यथर्तुवर्षी भगवान्न तथा पाकशासनः । न तदा सर्वबीजानि सम्यग्रोहन्ति भारत । अधर्मफलमत्यर्थं तदा भवति चानघ ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, the illustrious chastiser of Paka (Indra) never showers rain according to the season. The seeds that are scattered on earth never spring forth.

data.v: तथा च पृथिवीपाल यो भवेद्धर्मसंयुतः । अल्पायुः स हि मन्तव्यो न हि धर्मोऽस्ति कश्चन ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, he who becomes virtuous in such periods does not at all live long. The earth becomes devoid of virtue in every shape.

data.v: भूयिष्ठं कूटमानैश्च पण्यं विक्रीणते जनाः । वणिजश्च नरव्याघ्र बहुमाया भवन्त्युत ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, traders, becoming full of deceit, sell their goods with false weights and measures.

data.v: धर्मिष्ठाः परिहीयन्ते पापीयान्वर्धते जनः । धर्मस्य बलहानिः स्यादधर्मश्च बली तथा ।।
data.md: The virtuous men do not prosper, only the sinful men then exceedingly prosper. Virtue then loses her strength and sin becomes all powerful.

data.v: अल्पायुषो दरिद्राश्च धर्मिष्ठा मानवास्तदा । दीर्घायुषः समृद्धाश्च विधर्माणो युगक्षये ।।
data.md: Those that are devoted to virtue then become poor and short-lived. At the end of the Yuga those that are sinful become wealthy and longlived.

data.v: अधर्मिष्ठैरुपायैश्च प्रजा व्यवहरन्त्युत । संचयेनापि चाल्पेन भवन्त्याढ्या मदान्विताः ।।
धनं विश्वासतो न्यस्तं मिथो भूयिष्ठशो नराः । हर्तुं व्यवसिता राजन्मायाचारसमन्विताः ।।
data.md: Having earned fortunes that are really small, men become intoxicated with the pride of wealth. O king, many men at the end of Yuga try to rob the wealth that has been secretly deposited with them by others out of trust. Full of sinful practices, they shamelessly declare, "they have nothing in deposit.”

data.v: पुरुषादानि सत्त्वानि पक्षिणोऽथ मृगास्तथा । नगराणां विहारेषु चैत्येष्वपि च शेरते ।।
data.md: Beast of prey and other animals and birds are seen to lie down in places of public entertainments, in cities and towns, as well as in sacred temples.

data.v: सप्तवर्षाष्टवर्षाश्च स्त्रियो गर्भधरा नृप । दशद्वादशवर्षाणां पुंसां पुत्रः प्रजायते ।।
data.md: O king, girls of seven and eight years of age, give birth to children and boys of ten or twelve years beget offspring.

data.v: भवन्ति षोडशे वर्षे नराः पलितिनस्तथा । आयुःक्षयो मनुष्याणां क्षिप्रमेव प्रपद्यते ।।
data.md: In their sixteenth year men are over-taken by decripitude. And a man's life is soon run out.

data.v: क्षीणे युगे महाराज तरुणा वृद्धशीलिनः । तरुणानां च यच्छीलं तद्वृद्धेषु प्रजायते ।।
data.md: O great king, when men become so shortlived, mere youths act like old men, while all that is seen in the youths is seen in old men.

data.v: विपरीतास्तदा नार्यो वञ्चयित्वा रहः पतीन् । व्युच्चरन्त्यपि दुःशीला दासैः पशुभिरेव च ।।
data.md: Women, prone to impropriety of conduct and distinguished by bad manners, deceive even the best of husbands and forget themselves with servants and slaves, even with animals,

data.v: तस्मिन्युगसहस्रान्ते संप्राप्ते चायुषः क्षये । अनावृष्टिर्महाराज जायते बहुवार्षिकी ।।
data.md: O king, at the end of those thousands of years and when men become so short-lived, a draught takes place which extends for many years.

data.v: ततस्तान्यल्पसाराणि सत्त्वानि क्षुधितानि च । प्रलयं यान्ति भूयिष्ठं पृथिव्यां पृथिवीपते ।।
data.md: O lord of earth, then men and (other) creatures, possessing but little strength and vitality, die of starvation by thousands.

data.v: ततो दिनकरैर्दीप्तैः सप्तभिर्मनुजाधिप । पीयते सलिलं सर्वं समुद्रेषु सरित्सु च ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, seven blazing suns then appear in the sky and drink up all the waters of the earth that are in the rivers and in the scas.

data.v: यच्च काष्ठं तृणं चापि शुष्कं चार्द्रं च भारत । सर्वं तद्भस्मसाद्भूतं दृश्यते भरतर्षभ ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, O best of the Bharata race, then everything of the nature of wood and grass, whether dry or wet, is burnt down and reduced to ashes.

data.v: ततः संवर्तको वह्निर्वायुना सह भारत । लोकमाविशते पूर्वमादित्यैरुपशोषितम् ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, then the fire (called) Samvartaka helped by the wind appears on earth which has been already burnt (to ashes) by the seven suns.

data.v: ततः स पृथिवीं भित्त्वा समाविश्य रसातलम् । देवदानवयक्षाणां भयं जनयते महत् ।।
data.md: Thereupon it (fire), penetrating the earth and reaching the nether region, creates great terror to the celestials, the Danavas and the Rakshasas.

data.v: निर्दहन्नागलोकं च यच्च किंचित्क्षिताविह । अधस्तात्पृथिवीपाल सर्वं नाशयते क्षणात् ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, burning down the nether region and also everything on this earth, that fire then destroys all things in a moment.

data.v: ततो योजनविंशानां सहस्राणि शतानि च । निर्दहत्यशिवो वायुः स च संवर्तकोऽनलः ।।
data.md: That Samvartaka fire, helped by that inauspicious wind, consume this world which extends for hundreds of thousands of yojanas.

data.v: सदेवासुरगन्धर्वं सयक्षोरगराक्षसम् । ततो दहति दीप्तः स सर्वमेव जगद्विभुः ।।
data.md: That lord of all things, that fire, blazing forth in great effulgence, burns down this universe with the celestials, the Asuras, the Gandharvas, the Yakshas, the Nagas and the Rakshasas.

data.v: ततो गजकुलप्रख्यास्तडिन्मालाविभूषिताः । उत्तिष्ठन्ति महामेघा नभस्यद्भुतदर्शनाः ।।
data.md: Then there rise in the sky great masses of clouds resembling herds of elephants all adorned with garlands of lightning beautiful to look at.

data.v: केचिन्नीलोत्पलश्यामाः केचित्कुमुदसंनिभाः । केचित्किञ्जल्कसंकाशाः केचित्पीताः पयोधराः ।।
data.md: Some of them are of the colour of blue lotus, some like lilies, some like the colour of the filaments of the lotus and some are red.

data.v: केचिद्धारिद्रसंकाशाः काकाण्डकनिभास्तथा । केचित्कमलपत्राभाः केचिद्धिङ्गुलकप्रभाः ।।
data.md: Some are yellow as turmeric, some are of the colour of a crow's egg, some are like that of the lotus leaves and some red as Vermilion.

data.v: केचित्पुरवराकाराः केचिद्गजकुलोपमाः । केचिदञ्जनसंकाशाः केचिन्मकरसंस्थिताः । विद्युन्मालापिनद्धाङ्गाः समुत्तिष्ठन्ति वै घनाः ।।
data.md: Some in shape are like palatial cities, some resemble herds of elephants, some are in the form of lizards and some of crocodiles and sharks.

data.v: घोररूपा महाराज घोरस्वननिनादिताः । ततो जलधराः सर्वे व्याप्नुवन्ति नभस्तलम् ।।
data.md: O great king, the clouds adorned with garlands of lightning that gather in the sky on that occasion, are terrible to behold and they fearfully roar. Those masses of clouds charged with rain soon cover the whole of the firmament.

data.v: तैरियं पृथिवी सर्वा सपर्वतवनाकरा । आपूर्यते महाराज सलिलौघपरिप्लुता ।।
data.md: O great king, those masses of clouds then flood with water the whole earth with her mountains, forests and mines.

data.v: ततस्ते जलदा घोरा राविणः पुरुषर्षभ । सर्वतः प्लावयन्त्याशु चोदिताः परमेष्ठिना ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, then commanded by Parameshthi (Brahma) those clouds roaring fearfully soon flood all places.

data.v: वर्षमाणा महत्तोयं पूरयन्तो वसुंधराम् । सुघोरमशिवं रौद्रं नाशयन्ति च पावकम् ।।
data.md: Pouring a great quantity of water and filling the whole earth (with it), they extinguish that fearful, terrible and in auspicious fire.

data.v: ततो द्वादश वर्षाणि पयोदास्त उपप्लवे । धाराभिः पूरयन्तो वै चोद्यमाना महात्मना ।।
data.md: Commanded by the supreme lord, they shower continually for twelve years and fill the earth with their downpour.

data.v: ततः समुद्रः स्वां वेलामतिक्रामति भारत । पर्वताश्च विशीर्यन्ते मही चापि विशीर्यते ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, the ocean then over-floods it bounds; the mountains fall down in fragments and the earth sinks under the increasing flood.

data.v: सर्वतः सहसा भ्रान्तास्ते पयोदा नभस्तलम् । संवेष्टयित्वा नश्यन्ति वायुवेगपराहताः ।।
data.md: Then suddenly moved by the wind, those cloud go over the entire expanse of the sky and then disappear from the view.

data.v: ततस्तं मारुतं घोरं स्वयम्भूर्मनुजाधिप । आदिपद्मालयो देवः पीत्वा स्वपिति भारत ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, O descendant of Bharata, the Self Create, lord, the first cause, the deity who so abode is the lotus (Lakshmi) drinks up these fearful winds and goes then to sleep.

data.v: तस्मिन्नेकार्णवे घोरे नष्टे स्थावरजङ्गमे । नष्टे देवासुरगणे यक्षराक्षसवर्जिते ।।
data.md: Then when earth becomes one great ocean, when all mobile and immobile creatures have been destroyed, when the celestials and the Asuras are annihilated, when the Yakshas and the Rakshasas are no more,

data.v: निर्मनुष्ये महीपाल निःश्वापदमहीरुहे । अनन्तरिक्षे लोकेऽस्मिन्भ्रमाम्येकोऽहमादृतः ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, when there is no human being, when trees and wild animals have disappeared, when the firmament itself has ceased to exist, I alone in affliction rove about.

data.v: एकार्णवे जले घोरे विचरन्पार्थिवोत्तम । अपश्यन्सर्वभूतानि वैक्लव्यमगमं परम् ।।
data.md: O foremost of kings, once thus roving over that one great ocean, my heart was filled with great affliction on not seeing any creature.

data.v: ततः सुदीर्घं गत्वा तु प्लवमानो नराधिप । श्रान्तः क्वचिन्न शरणं लभाम्यहमतन्द्रितः ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, then thus roving about for a long time, I became fatigued; but I did not get any resting place.

data.v: ततः कदाचित्पश्यामि तस्मिन्सलिलसंप्लवे । न्यग्रोधं सुमहान्तं वै विशालं पृथिवीपते ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, thereupon one day I saw in that great expanse of water a great and wide extending banian tree.

data.v: शाखायां तस्य वृक्षस्य विस्तीर्णायां नराधिप । पर्यङ्के पृथिवीपाल दिव्यास्तरणसंस्तृते ।।
data.md: O great king, O descendant of Bharata, I then saw seated on a cot overlaid with a celestials bed and attached to one of the farextending boughs of that banian trce.

data.v: उपविष्टं महाराज पूर्णेन्दुसदृशाननम् । फुल्लपद्मविशालाक्षं बालं पश्यामि भारत ।।
data.md: A boy with a face as beautiful as the lotus or the moon, O ruler of men, with eyes as large as the petals of full blown lotuses.

data.v: ततो मे पृथिवीपाल विस्मयः सुमहानभूत् । कथं त्वयं शिशुः शेते लोके नाशमुपागते ।।
data.md: O ruler of earth, thereupon I was filled with great astonishment and (I asked myself) "how can this child alone lie here when all the world is destroyed.”

data.v: तपसा चिन्तयंश्चापि तं शिशुं नोपलक्षये । भूतं भव्यं भविष्यच्च जानन्नपि नराधिप ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, though I knew the Present, the Past and the Future and though I took the help of ascetic meditation, I could not learn anything about the boy.

data.v: अतसीपुष्पवर्णाभः श्रीवत्सकृतलक्षणः । साक्षाल्लक्ष्म्या इवावासः स तदा प्रतिभाति मे ।।
data.md: Possessing the lustre of the Atasi flower and adorned with the mark of Srivatsa, he appeared to me as if he were the abode of Lakshmi.

data.v: ततो मामब्रवीद्बालः स पद्मनिभलोचनः । श्रीवत्सधारी द्युतिमान्वाक्यं श्रुतिसुखावहम् ।।
data.md: That lotus-eyed and greatly effulgent boy with the mark of Srivatsa then thus spoke to me in words highly pleasant to the ear.

data.v: जानामि त्वा परिश्रान्तं तात विश्रामकाङ्क्षिणम् । मार्कण्डेय इहास्स्व त्वं यावदिच्छसि भार्गव ।।
data.md: "O child, I know you are fatigued and you are eager for rest. O descendant of Bhrigu, O Markandeya, rest here as long as you like.

data.v: अभ्यन्तरं शरीरं मे प्रविश्य मुनिसत्तम । आस्स्व भो विहितो वासः प्रसादस्ते कृतो मया ।।
data.md: foremost of Rishis, enter into my body and rest there. That is the place assigned to you by me. I am gratified with you."

data.v: ततो बालेन तेनैवमुक्तस्यासीत्तदा मम । निर्वेदो जीविते दीर्घे मनुष्यत्वे च भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, thus addressed by that boy, a sense of total disregard possessed me in respect both of my long life and state of manhood.

data.v: ततो बालेन तेनास्यं सहसा विवृतं कृतम् । तस्याहमवशो वक्त्रं दैवयोगात्प्रवेशितः ।।
data.md: Then suddenly that boy opened his mouth and as fate would have it, I having lost all power of locomotion, entered his mouth.

data.v: ततः प्रविष्टस्तत्कुक्षिं सहसा मनुजाधिप । सराष्ट्रनगराकीर्णां कृत्स्नां पश्यामि मेदिनीम् ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, thus suddenly entering his stomach, I beheld the whole earth (there within it) with all its cities and kingdoms.

data.v: गङ्गां शतद्रुं सीतां च यमुनामथ कौशिकीम् । चर्मण्वतीं वेत्रवतीं चन्द्रभागां सरस्वतीम् ।।
सिन्धुं चैव विपाशां च नदीं गोदावरीमपि । वस्वोकसारां नलिनीं नर्मदां चैव भारत ।।
नदीं ताम्रां च वेण्णां च पुण्यतोयां शुभावहाम् । सुवेणां कृष्णवेणां च इरामां च महानदीम् । शोणं च पुरुषव्याघ्र विशल्यां कम्पुनामपि ।।
एताश्चान्याश्च नद्योऽहं पृथिव्यां या नरोत्तम । परिक्रामन्प्रपश्यामि तस्य कुक्षौ महात्मनः ।।
ततः समुद्रं पश्यामि यादोगणनिषेवितम् । रत्नाकरममित्रघ्न निधानं पयसो महत् ।।
data.md: O chastiser of foes, I saw there also the ocean inhabited by alligators and sharks, that mine of gems, that excellent abode of waters.

data.v: ततः पश्यामि गगनं चन्द्रसूर्यविराजितम् । जाज्वल्यमानं तेजोभिः पावकार्कसमप्रभैः । पश्यामि च महीं राजन्काननैरुपशोभिताम् ।।
data.md: I saw there also the sky adorned with the sun and the moon, blazing in great effulgence and possessing the lustre of the sun.

data.v: यजन्ते हि तदा राजन्ब्राह्मणा बहुभिः सवैः । क्षत्रियाश्च प्रवर्तन्ते सर्ववर्णानुरञ्जने ।।
वैश्याः कृषिं यथान्यायं कारयन्ति नराधिप । शुश्रूषायां च निरता द्विजानां वृषलास्तथा ।।
data.md: Many Kshatriyas engaged in doing good to all the other orders, many Vaishyas engaged in the pursuits of agriculture and many Shudras engaged in serving the Brahmanas. Then wandering in the stomach of that high-souled being,

data.v: ततः परिपतन्राजंस्तस्य कुक्षौ महात्मनः । हिमवन्तं च पश्यामि हेमकूटं च पर्वतम् ।।
निषधं चापि पश्यामि श्वेतं च रजताचितम् । पश्यामि च महीपाल पर्वतं गन्धमादनम् ।।
मन्दरं मनुजव्याघ्र नीलं चापि महागिरिम् । पश्यामि च महाराज मेरुं कनकपर्वतम् ।।
महेन्द्रं चैव पश्यामि विन्ध्यं च गिरिमुत्तमम् । मलयं चापि पश्यामि पारियात्रं च पर्वतम् ।।
एते चान्ये च बहवो यावन्तः पृथिवीधराः । तस्योदरे मया दृष्टाः सर्वरत्नविभूषिताः ।।
सिंहान्व्याघ्रान्वराहांश्च नागांश्च मनुजाधिप । पृथिव्यां यानि चान्यानि सत्त्वानि जगतीपते । तानि सर्वाण्यहं तत्र पश्यन्पर्यचरं तदा ।।
data.md: O ruler of the earth, all the other creatures that are on earth were all seen by me in his stomach as I was wandering about there.

data.v: कुक्षौ तस्य नरव्याघ्र प्रविष्टः संचरन्दिशः । शक्रादींश्चापि पश्यामि कृत्स्नान्देवगणांस्तथा ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, having entered his stomach, as I wandered about, I saw the whole race of the celestials, Indra and others,
