data.md: Whoever with a heart full of gratitude and free from malice try to do what is good, obtain wealth, virtue, happiness and heaven.

data.v: संस्कृतस्य हि दान्तस्य नियतस्य यतात्मनः । प्राज्ञस्यानन्तरा वृत्तिरिह लोके परत्र च ।।
data.md: Those who are freed from sin, those who are wise, forbearing, righteous and self-controlled enjoy continuous bliss in this world and in the world next.

data.v: सतां धर्मेण वर्तेत क्रियां शिष्टवदाचरेत् । असंक्लेशेन लोकस्य वृत्तिं लिप्सेत वै द्विज ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, man must follow the standard of virtue of the good; and in his acts he must imitate the example of the virtuous. There are virtuous men learned in the holy Shastras and conversant in all moralities. Man's proper duty consists in his following his own proper avocations such being the case, these avocations never become confused and mixed up.

data.v: सन्ति ह्यागतविज्ञानाः शिष्टाः शास्त्रविचक्षणाः । स्वधर्मेण क्रिया लोके कर्मणः सोऽप्यसंकरः ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, man must follow the standard of virtue of the good; and in his acts he must imitate the example of the virtuous. There are virtuous men learned in the holy Shastras and conversant in all moralities. Man's proper duty consists in his following his own proper avocations such being the case, these avocations never become confused and mixed up.

data.v: प्राज्ञो धर्मेण रमते धर्मं चैवोपजीवति । तस्य धर्मादवाप्तेषु धनेषु द्विजसत्तम । तस्यैव सिञ्चते मूलं गुणान्पश्यति यत्र वै ।।
data.md: The wise man delights in virtue and he lives by virtue. O foremost of Brahmanas, such a man with the wealth of virtue which he thus acquires waters the root of the plant (particular righteousness) in which he finds most virtue. The virtuous man thus acts and his mind becomes thus calin.

data.v: धर्मात्मा भवति ह्येवं चित्तं चास्य प्रसीदति । स मैत्रजनसंतुष्ट इह प्रेत्य च नन्दति ।।
शब्दं स्पर्शं तथा रूपं गन्धानिष्टांश्च सत्तम । प्रभुत्वं लभते चापि धर्मस्यैतत्फलं विदुः ।।
data.md: He is pleased with his friend, in this world and he also enjoys happiness in the world next. O excellent one, know, virtuous men acquire sovereignty over all and obtain (the pleasure) of beauty, flavour, sound and touch according to their desire. O Brahmana, (an enlightened) man is not satisfied with the fruits of virtue.

data.v: धर्मस्य च फलं लब्ध्वा न तृप्यति महाद्विज । अतृप्यमाणो निर्वेदमादत्ते ज्ञानचक्षुषा ।।
प्रज्ञाचक्षुर्नर इह दोषं नैवानुरुध्यते । विरज्यति यथाकामं न च धर्मं विमुञ्चति ।।
सर्वत्यागे च यतते दृष्ट्वा लोकं क्षयात्मकम् । ततो मोक्षे प्रयतते नानुपायादुपायतः ।।
एवं निर्वेदमादत्ते पापं कर्म जहाति च । धार्मिकश्चापि भवति मोक्षं च लभते परम् ।।
तपो निःश्रेयसं जन्तोस्तस्य मूलं शमो दमः । तेन सर्वानवाप्नोति कामान्यान्मनसेच्छति ।।
इन्द्रियाणां निरोधेन सत्येन च दमेन च । ब्रह्मणः पदमाप्नोति यत्परं द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: By this means he obtains all the objects of his desire. By subduing his senses and by means of truthfulness and forbearness, O foremost of Brahmanas, he obtains the supreme state of Brahma.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि तु यान्याहुः कानि तानि यतव्रत । निग्रहश्च कथं कार्यो निग्रहस्य च किं फलम् ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: O foremost of all virtuous and vowobserving men, you talk of the senses; what are they? How might they be subdued? What is the good of subduing them? How does a creature obtain the fruits of doing it? I eagerly desire to kuow all about these matters.

data.v: कथं च फलमाप्नोति तेषां धर्मभृतां वर । एतदिच्छामि तत्त्वेन धर्मं ज्ञातुं सुधार्मिक ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: O foremost of all virtuous and vowobserving men, you talk of the senses; what are they? How might they be subdued? What is the good of subduing them? How does a creature obtain the fruits of doing it? I eagerly desire to kuow all about these matters.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु विप्रेण धर्मव्याधो युधिष्ठिर । प्रत्युवाच यथा विप्रं तच्छृणुष्व नराधिप ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : O Yudhishthira, O ruler of men, hear what the virtuous fowler said to that Brahmana when he was thus asked by him.

data.v: विज्ञानार्थं मनुष्याणां मनः पूर्वं प्रवर्तते । तत्प्राप्य कामं भजते क्रोधं च द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: The Fowler said : O foremost of Brahmanas, men's minds are first bent towards acquiring knowledge. When that is acquired, they indulge in their desires and anger.

data.v: ततस्तदर्थं यतते कर्म चारभते महत् । इष्टानां रूपगन्धानामभ्यासं च निषेवते ।।
data.md: For that end, they labour and perform great works and indulge in their much desired pleasures of beauty, of flavour.

data.v: ततो रागः प्रभवति द्वेषश्च तदनन्तरम् । ततो लोभः प्रभवति मोहश्च तदनन्तरम् ।।
data.md: The mind of one possessed by greed and mistake and affected by attachment and hatred is never bent to virtue. One then begins with hypocrisy to do deeds which are good.

data.v: तस्य लोभाभिभूतस्य रागद्वेषहतस्य च । न धर्मे जायते बुद्धिर्व्याजाद्धर्मं करोति च ।।
data.md: When men are thus influenced by avarice, envy and attachment, their understanding does not lean towards virtue; and they then practise the very mockery of virtue.

data.v: व्याजेन चरते धर्ममर्थं व्याजेन रोचते । व्याजेन सिध्यमानेषु धनेषु द्विजसत्तम । तत्रैव रमते बुद्धिस्ततः पापं चिकीर्षति ।।
data.md: O foremost of Brahmanas, practising virtue with hypocracy, they remain satisfied in acquiring wealth by dishonourable means. And with the wealth thus acquired, their intelligence becomes attached to the evil ways; they were then filled with the desire to commit sins. O foremost of Brahmanas, when their friends and the learned men remonstrate.

data.v: सुहृद्भिर्वार्यमाणश्च पण्डितैश्च द्विजोत्तम । उत्तरं श्रुतिसंबद्धं ब्रवीति श्रुतियोजितम् ।।
अधर्मस्त्रिविधस्तस्य वर्धते रागदोषतः । पापं चिन्तयते चापि ब्रवीति च करोति च ।।
तस्याधर्मप्रवृत्तस्य गुणा नश्यन्ति साधवः । एकशीलाश्च मित्रत्वं भजन्ते पापकर्मिणः ।।
स तेनासुखमाप्नोति परत्र च विहन्यते । पापात्मा भवति ह्येवं धर्मलाभं तु मे शृणु ।।
यस्त्वेतान्प्रज्ञया दोषान्पूर्वमेवानुपश्यति । कुशलः सुखदुःखेषु साधूंश्चाप्युपसेवते । तस्य साधुसमारम्भाद्बुद्धिर्धर्मेषु जायते ।।
data.md: All sinful men are of this nature. Now hear about the virtuous man. He discerns evils by means of his spiritual sight. He is able to discriminate between happiness and misery. He is full of respectful attention to men of virtue; and by practising virtues, his mind becomes inclined to virtue.

data.v: ब्रवीषि सूनृतं धर्मं यस्य वक्ता न विद्यते । दिव्यप्रभावः सुमहानृषिरेव मतोऽसि मे ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said : You have given a true exposition of virtue which none else is able to do. Your spiritual power is great and you appear to me to be a great Rishi.

data.v: ब्राह्मणा वै महाभागाः पितरोऽग्रभुजः सदा । तेषां सर्वात्मना कार्यं प्रियं लोके मनीषिणा ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: are The greatly powerful Brahmanas worshipped with the same honours as our ancestors. They are before others always propitiated with offerings of food. Wisemen in this world do what is pleasing to them with all their heart.

data.v: यत्तेषां च प्रियं तत्ते वक्ष्यामि द्विजसत्तम । नमस्कृत्वा ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ब्राह्मीं विद्यां निबोध मे ।।
data.md: O foremost of Brahmanas, after having bowed down to Brahmanas as a class I shall now tell you what is pleasing to them. Learn now the Brahma Philosophy,

data.v: इदं विश्वं जगत्सर्वमजय्यं चापि सर्वशः । महाभूतात्मकं ब्रह्मन्नातः परतरं भवेत् ।।
data.md: This whole universe, which is unconquerable and which abounds in great elements, is Brahma (himself). There is nothing high than this.

data.v: महाभूतानि खं वायुरग्निरापस्तथा च भूः । शब्दः स्पर्शश्च रूपं च रसो गन्धश्च तद्गुणाः ।।
data.md: Earth, air, water and sky are the great elements. Form, flavour, sound, touch and taste are their characteristic properties.

data.v: तेषामपि गुणाः सर्वे गुणवृत्तिः परस्परम् । पूर्वपूर्वगुणाः सर्वे क्रमशो गुणिषु त्रिषु ।।
data.md: These latter also have their (own peculiar) properties correlated to each other. Of the three qualities they are characterised by each in order of priority.

data.v: षष्ठस्तु चेतना नाम मन इत्यभिधीयते । सप्तमी तु भवेद्बुद्धिरहंकारस्ततः परम् ।।
data.md: The sixth property is consciousness which is called mind. The seventh is intelligence and then follows Egoism,

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि च पञ्चैव रजः सत्त्वं तमस्तथा । इत्येष सप्तदशको राशिरव्यक्तसंज्ञकः ।।
सर्वैरिहेन्द्रियार्थैस्तु व्यक्ताव्यक्तैः सुसंवृतः । चतुर्विंशक इत्येष व्यक्ताव्यक्तमयो गुणः । एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं किं भूयो श्रोतुमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: Then are the five senses, then the soul, then the moral qualities, called, Sattva, Raja and Tama. These seventeen are said to be the unknown or incomprehensible qualities. I have told you all this, what else do you wish to know?

data.v: एवमुक्तः स विप्रस्तु धर्मव्याधेन भारत । कथामकथयद्भूयो मनसः प्रीतिवर्धनीम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : O descendant of Bharata, having been thus addressed by that Brahmana, the virtuous fowler again began to speak (on things) so pleasing to the mind.

data.v: महाभूतानि यान्याहुः पञ्च धर्मविदां वर । एकैकस्य गुणान्सम्यक्पञ्चानामपि मे वद ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said : O foremost of all virtuous men, it is said that there are five great elements. Will you describe to me in detail the properties of those five (elements)?

data.v: भूमिरापस्तथा ज्योतिर्वायुराकाशमेव च । गुणोत्तराणि सर्वाणि तेषां वक्ष्यामि ते गुणान् ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: The earth, water, fire, air and sky, all have properties enter-lapping each other. I shall describe them to you.

data.v: भूमिः पञ्चगुणा ब्रह्मन्नुदकं च चतुर्गुणम् । गुणास्त्रयस्तेजसि च त्रयश्चाकाशवातयोः ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, the earth has five qualities, water four, fire three and the air and the sky together three.

data.v: शब्दः स्पर्शश्च रूपं च रसो गन्धश्च पञ्चमः । एते गुणाः पञ्च भूमेः सर्वेभ्यो गुणवत्तराः ।।
data.md: Sound, touch, form, flavour and taste, these five qualities belong to earth.

data.v: शब्दः स्पर्शश्च रूपं च रसश्चापि द्विजोत्तम । अपामेते गुणा ब्रह्मन्कीर्तितास्तव सुव्रत ।।
data.md: Sound, touch, form, flavour and taste, these five qualities belong to earth.

data.v: शब्दः स्पर्शश्च रूपं च तेजसोऽथ गुणास्त्रयः । शब्दः स्पर्शश्च वायौ तु शब्द आकाश एव च ।।
data.md: Sound, touch and form are the three properties of fire; sound and touch are the two properties of the air; and sound is the property of the sky.

data.v: एते पञ्चदश ब्रह्मन्गुणा भूतेषु पञ्चसु । वर्तन्ते सर्वभूतेषु येषु लोकाः प्रतिष्ठिताः । अन्योन्यं नातिवर्तन्ते संपच्च भवति द्विज ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, these fifteen fifteen properties inherent in five elements, exist in all substances of which this universe is composed.

data.v: यदा तु विषमीभावमाचरन्ति चराचराः । तदा देही देहमन्यं व्यतिरोहति कालतः ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, they are not opposed to one another; they exist in proper combination. When this universe is thrown into a state of chaos then every corporeal being in proper time assumes another body. It perishes also in due order.

data.v: आनुपूर्व्या विनश्यन्ति जायन्ते चानुपूर्वशः । तत्र तत्र हि दृश्यन्ते धातवः पाञ्चभौतिकाः । यैरावृतमिदं सर्वं जगत्स्थावरजङ्गमम् ।।
data.md: There (everlastingly) exist the five elementary substances of which all the mobile and immobile world is composed. Whatever is perceptible by the senses is called Vyakta (manifest) and whatever is not perceptible by the senses is called Avyakta (not manifest).

data.v: इन्द्रियैः सृज्यते यद्यत्तत्तद्व्यक्तमिति स्मृतम् । अव्यक्तमिति विज्ञेयं लिङ्गग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम् ।।
data.md: There (everlastingly) exist the five elementary substances of which all the mobile and immobile world is composed. Whatever is perceptible by the senses is called Vyakta (manifest) and whatever is not perceptible by the senses is called Avyakta (not manifest).

data.v: यथास्वं ग्राहकान्येषां शब्दादीनामिमानि तु । इन्द्रियाणि यदा देही धारयन्निह तप्यते ।।
data.md: When a person engages in Tapa after having duly subdued his senses which have their own proper objective play in the external conditions of sound, form, then he sees that his own spirit pervades the whole universe and the universe is also reflected in him.

data.v: लोके विततमात्मानं लोकं चात्मनि पश्यति । परावरज्ञः सक्तः सन्सर्वभूतानि पश्यति ।।
data.md: When a person engages in Tapa after having duly subdued his senses which have their own proper objective play in the external conditions of sound, form, then he sees that his own spirit pervades the whole universe and the universe is also reflected in him.

data.v: पश्यतः सर्वभूतानि सर्वावस्थासु सर्वदा । ब्रह्मभूतस्य संयोगो नाशुभेनोपपद्यते ।।
ज्ञानमूलात्मकं क्लेशमतिवृत्तस्य मोहजम् । लोको बुद्धिप्रकाशेन ज्ञेयमार्गेण दृश्यते ।।
अनादिनिधनं जन्तुमात्मयोनिं सदाव्ययम् । अनौपम्यममूर्तं च भगवानाह बुद्धिमान् । तपोमूलमिदं सर्वं यन्मां विप्रानुपृच्छसि ।।
इन्द्रियाण्येव तत्सर्वं यत्स्वर्गनरकावुभौ । निगृहीतविसृष्टानि स्वर्गाय नरकाय च ।।
data.md: Heaven and hell both are dependent on our senses. When subdued, they lead us to heaven and when indulged in, they lead us to hell.

data.v: एष योगविधिः कृत्स्नो यावदिन्द्रियधारणम् । एतन्मूलं हि तपसः कृत्स्नस्य नरकस्य च ।।
data.md: This subjugation of the senses is the highest means of attaining spiritual advancement; it is also at the root of all our spiritual degradation.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणां प्रसङ्गेन दोषमृच्छत्यसंशयम् । संनियम्य तु तान्येव ततः सिद्धिमवाप्नुते ।।
data.md: By indulging in them, a person contracts vices and by bringing them under control, he attains salvation.

data.v: षण्णामात्मनि नित्यानामैश्वर्यं योऽधिगच्छति । न स पापैः कुतोऽनर्थैर्युज्यते विजितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.md: The self-controlled man who acquires over his six senses is never tainted with win; and consequently evil has no power over him.

data.v: रथः शरीरं पुरुषस्य दृष्ट;मात्मा नियन्तेन्द्रियाण्याहुरश्वान् । तैरप्रमत्तः कुशली सदश्वै;र्दान्तैः सुखं याति रथीव धीरः ।।
data.md: Man's body has been compared with a chariot, his soul with a charioteer and his senses with the horses. A skillful man drives about without confusion, like an able charioteer with well-broken horses.

data.v: षण्णामात्मनि नित्यानामिन्द्रियाणां प्रमाथिनाम् । यो धीरो धारयेद्रश्मीन्स स्यात्परमसारथिः ।।
data.md: That man is an excellent driver who knows how to patiently wield the reins of these and horses, namely the six senses inherent in our nature.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणां प्रसृष्टानां हयानामिव वर्त्मसु । धृतिं कुर्वीत सारथ्ये धृत्या तानि जयेद्ध्रुवम् ।।
data.md: When our senses become ungovernable like horses on the road, we must patiently rein them in, for with patience we are sure to get the better of them.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणां हि चरतां यन्मनोऽनुविधीयते । तदस्य हरते बुद्धिं नावं वायुरिवाम्भसि ।।
data.md: When man's mind is overpowered by any one of these senses running wild, he loses his reason and becomes like a ship tossed by the tempest in the sea.

data.v: येषु विप्रतिपद्यन्ते षट्सु मोहात्फलागमे । तेष्वध्यवसिताध्यायी विन्दते ध्यानजं फलम् ।।
data.md: Men are deceived by illusion in hoping to reap the fruit of those six things the effects of which are studied by persons of spiritual insight who thereby reap the fruits of their clear perception.

data.v: एवं तु सूक्ष्मे कथिते धर्मव्याधेन भारत । ब्राह्मणः स पुनः सूक्ष्मं पप्रच्छ सुसमाहितः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : O descendant of Bharata, when the fowler expounded these abstruse points, the Brahmana with great attention asked about other subtle points.

data.v: सत्त्वस्य रजसश्चैव तमसश्च यथातथम् । गुणांस्तत्त्वेन मे ब्रूहि यथावदिह पृच्छतः ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: Truly describe to me who duly now ask you tne respective virtues of the three qualities, namely Sattva, Raja and Tama.

data.v: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि । एषां गुणान्पृथक्त्वेन निबोध गदतो मम ।।
data.md: I shall tell you what you ask me. I shall separately describe to you their respective virtues. Listen to them.

data.v: मोहात्मकं तमस्तेषां रज एषां प्रवर्तकम् । प्रकाशबहुलत्वाच्च सत्त्वं ज्याय इहोच्यते ।।
data.md: Tama is characterised by illusion, Raja incites men to action, Sattva is of great splendour and therefore it is called the greatest of them all.

data.v: अविद्याबहुलो मूढः स्वप्नशीलो विचेतनः । दुर्दृशीकस्तमोध्वस्तः सक्रोधस्तामसोऽलसः ।।
data.md: He who is greatly under the influence of spiritual ignorance, who is foolish, senseless and given to (day) dreaming, who is idle, unenergetic, full of anger and haughtiness, is said to be under the influence of Tama.

data.v: प्रवृत्तवाक्यो मन्त्री च योऽनुराग्यभ्यसूयकः । विवित्समानो विप्रर्षे स्तब्धो मानी स राजसः ।।
data.md: O Brahmana Rishi, that excellent man who is agreeable in speech, thoughtful, free from envy, industrious in action from an eager desire to reap its fruits and of warm temperament, is said to be under the influence of Raja.

data.v: प्रकाशबहुलो धीरो निर्विवित्सोऽनसूयकः । अक्रोधनो नरो धीमान्दान्तश्चैव स सात्त्विकः ।।
data.md: He who is resolute, patient, not subject to anger, free from malice and is not skillful in action from want of a selfish desire to reap its fruits and who is wise and forbearing, is said to be under the influence of Sattva.

data.v: सात्त्विकस्त्वथ संबुद्धो लोकवृत्तेन क्लिश्यते । यदा बुध्यति बोद्धव्यं लोकवृत्तं जुगुप्सते ।।
वैराग्यस्य हि रूपं तु पूर्वमेव प्रवर्तते । मृदुर्भवत्यहंकारः प्रसीदत्यार्जवं च यत् ।।
ततोऽस्य सर्वद्वंद्वानि प्रशाम्यन्ति परस्परम् । न चास्य संयमो नाम क्वचिद्भवति कश्चन ।।
शूद्रयोनौ हि जातस्य सद्गुणानुपतिष्ठतः । वैश्यत्वं भवति ब्रह्मन्क्षत्रियत्वं तथैव च ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, a man may be born as a Shudra but if he is endued with good qualities, he may attain to the state of a Vaishya. Similarly that of a Kshatriya and if he is steadfast in rectitude he may even become a Brahmana. I have described to you all these virtues, what else do you wish to learn.

data.v: आर्जवे वर्तमानस्य ब्राह्मण्यमभिजायते । गुणास्ते कीर्तिताः सर्वे किं भूयः श्रोतुमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, a man may be born as a Shudra but if he is endued with good qualities, he may attain to the state of a Vaishya. Similarly that of a Kshatriya and if he is steadfast in rectitude he may even become a Brahmana. I have described to you all these virtues, what else do you wish to learn.

data.v: पार्थिवं धातुमासाद्य शारीरोऽग्निः कथं भवेत् । अवकाशविशेषेण कथं वर्तयतेऽनिलः ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: How is it that the (vital) fire in combination with the earthly elements (matter) becomes the corporeal (living creatures)? And how does the (vital) air (the breath) according to the nature of its seat excites to action (the corporeal living creatures)?

data.v: प्रश्नमेतं समुद्दिष्टं ब्राह्मणेन युधिष्ठिर । व्याधः स कथयामास ब्राह्मणाय महात्मने ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : O Yudhishthira, this question being put to the fowler by the Brahmana, the fowler thus replied to that high-souled Brahmana.

data.v: मूर्धानमाश्रितो वह्निः शरीरं परिपालयन् । प्राणो मूर्धनि चाग्नौ च वर्तमानो विचेष्टते । भूतं भव्यं भविष्यच्च सर्वं प्राणे प्रतिष्ठितम् ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: The vital spirit manifesting itself it seat the consciousness causes the action of the corporeal frame. The soul being present in both of these acts.

data.v: श्रेष्ठं तदेव भूतानां ब्रह्मज्योतिरुपास्महे । स जन्तुः सर्वभूतात्मा पुरुषः स सनातनः । मनो बुद्धिरहंकारो भूतानां विषयश्च सः ।।
data.md: It is the animating principle of all creatures, it is the eternal Purusha. It is great, it is the intelligence and it is the Ego, it is the seat of all elements.

data.v: एवं त्विह स सर्वत्र प्राणेन परिपाल्यते । पृष्ठतस्तु समानेन स्वां स्वां गतिमुपाश्रितः ।।
data.md: Thus while seated here (in the corporeal form), it is sustained in all its external or internal relations by the subtle eternal air called Prana and afterwards each creature goes its own way by the action of another subtle air called Samana.

data.v: बस्तिमूले गुदे चैव पावकः समुपाश्रितः । वहन्मूत्रं पुरीषं चाप्यपानः परिवर्तते ।।
data.md: This (Samana) transforming itself to Apana air and supported by the head of the stomach carries the refuge matter of the body, such as urine to the kidneys and intestines.

data.v: प्रयत्ने कर्मणि बले य एकस्त्रिषु वर्तते । उदान इति तं प्राहुरध्यात्मविदुषो जनाः ।।
data.md: It is present in the three elements of actions, exertion and power and then in that state is called Udana by men learned in the physical science.

data.v: संधौ संधौ संनिविष्टः सर्वेष्वपि तथानिलः । शरीरेषु मनुष्याणां व्यान इत्युपदिष्यते ।।
data.md: When it manifests itself by its presence at all the junction points of the system, it is known by the name of Vyana.

data.v: धातुष्वग्निस्तु विततः स तु वायुसमीरितः । रसान्धातूंश्च दोषांश्च वर्तयन्परिधावति ।।
data.md: The internal heat is diffused over all the tissues of our system and supported by these kinds of air, it transforms our food and the tissues and the humours of our system.

data.v: प्राणानां संनिपातात्तु संनिपातः प्रजायते । ऊष्मा चाग्निरिति ज्ञेयो योऽन्नं पचति देहिनाम् ।।
data.md: By the coalition of Prana and other airs, a reaction ensues and the heat generated thereby is known as the internal heat of the human system which causes digestion of food.

data.v: अपानोदानयोर्मध्ये प्राणव्यानौ समाहितौ । समन्वितस्त्वधिष्ठानं सम्यक्पचति पावकः ।।
data.md: The Prana and the Apana airs are interposed within the Samana and the Udana airs. The heat generated by their coalition causes the growth of the body.

data.v: तस्यापि पायुपर्यन्तस्तथा स्याद्गुदसंज्ञितः । स्रोतांसि तस्माज्जायन्ते सर्वप्राणेषु देहिनाम् ।।
अग्निवेगवहः प्राणो गुदान्ते प्रतिहन्यते । स ऊर्ध्वमागम्य पुनः समुत्क्षिपति पावकम् ।।
पक्वाशयस्त्वधो नाभ्या ऊर्ध्वमामाशयः स्थितः । नाभिमध्ये शरीरस्य प्राणाः सर्वे प्रतिष्ठिताः ।।
प्रवृत्ता हृदयात्सर्वास्तिर्यगूर्ध्वमधस्तथा । वहन्त्यन्नरसान्नाड्यो दश प्राणप्रचोदिताः ।।
data.md: The arteries issuing from the heart run upwards and downwards and also in oblique directions, they carry the best essence of our food and are acted upon by the ten Prana airs.

data.v: योगिनामेष मार्गस्तु येन गच्छन्ति तत्परम् । जितक्लमासना धीरा मूर्धन्यात्मानमादधुः । एवं सर्वेषु विततौ प्राणापानौ हि देहिषु ।।
data.md: This is the way, by which go to the highest state, the Yogis who have overcome all difficulties who are patient and self-controlled and who have their souls seated in their brains. The Prana and Apana are thus present in all creatures.

data.v: एकादशविकारात्मा कलासंभारसंभृतः । मूर्तिमन्तं हि तं विद्धि नित्यं कर्मजितात्मकम् ।।
तस्मिन्यः संस्थितो ह्यग्निर्नित्यं स्थाल्यामिवाहितः । आत्मानं तं विजानीहि नित्यं योगजितात्मकम् ।।
देवो यः संस्थितस्तस्मिन्नब्बिन्दुरिव पुष्करे । क्षेत्रज्ञं तं विजानीहि नित्यं त्यागजितात्मकम् ।।
जीवात्मकानि जानीहि रजः सत्त्वं तमस्तथा । जीवमात्मगुणं विद्धि तथात्मानं परात्मकम् ।।
सचेतनं जीवगुणं वदन्ति; स चेष्टते चेष्टयते च सर्वम् । ततः परं क्षेत्रविदो वदन्ति; प्राकल्पयद्यो भुवनानि सप्त ।।
data.md: Inert and insensible matter is the seat of the living principle which is active in itself and induces activity in others. That by which the seven worlds are incited to action is called the most high by men of high spiritual insight.

data.v: एवं सर्वेषु भूतेषु भूतात्मा न प्रकाशते । दृश्यते त्वग्र्यया बुद्ध्या सूक्ष्मया ज्ञानवेदिभिः ।।
data.md: Thus in all these elements the eternal spirit does not show itself, but is perceived by the learned in spiritual science by reason of their high and keen perception.

data.v: चित्तस्य हि प्रसादेन हन्ति कर्म शुभाशुभम् । प्रसन्नात्मात्मनि स्थित्वा सुखमानन्त्यमश्नुते ।।
data.md: A pure-minded man, by purifying his heart, is able to destroy the good and evil effects of his actions and obtains eternal bliss by the enlightenment of his inner spirit.

data.v: लक्षणं तु प्रसादस्य यथा तृप्तः सुखं स्वपेत् । निवाते वा यथा दीपो दीप्येत्कुशलदीपितः ।।
data.md: This state of peace and purification of heart is likened to the state of a person who, in a cheerful state of mind, sleeps soundly or to the brilliance of a lamp trimmed by a skillful hand.

data.v: पूर्वरात्रे परे चैव युञ्जानः सततं मनः । लघ्वाहारो विशुद्धात्मा पश्यन्नात्मानमात्मनि ।।
data.md: Such a pure-minded man living on frugal diet perceives the supreme spirit reflected in his own mind and by practising concentration of mind in the evening and early in the morning sees the Supreme Spirit which has no attributes, in the light of his heart, shining like a dazzling lamp and thus he obtains salvation.

data.v: प्रदीप्तेनेव दीपेन मनोदीपेन पश्यति । दृष्ट्वात्मानं निरात्मानं तदा स तु विमुच्यते ।।
data.md: Such a pure-minded man living on frugal diet perceives the supreme spirit reflected in his own mind and by practising concentration of mind in the evening and early in the morning sees the Supreme Spirit which has no attributes, in the light of his heart, shining like a dazzling lamp and thus he obtains salvation.

data.v: सर्वोपायैस्तु लोभस्य क्रोधस्य च विनिग्रहः । एतत्पवित्रं यज्ञानां तपो वै संक्रमो मतः ।।
data.md: Avarice and anger must be subdued by all means, for this constitutes the most sacred virtue that people can practice. It is considered to be the means by which men cross over to the other side of this sea of misery and pair.

data.v: नित्यं क्रोधात्तपो रक्षेच्छ्रियं रक्षेत मत्सरात् । विद्यां मानापमानाभ्यामात्मानं तु प्रमादतः ।।
data.md: A man must preserve his virtue, being overcome by anger, his righteousness by pride, his learning by vanity and his soul by illusion.

data.v: आनृशंस्यं परो धर्मः क्षमा च परमं बलम् । आत्मज्ञानं परं ज्ञानं परं सत्यव्रतं व्रतम् ।।
data.md: Leniency is the best of virtues and forbearance is the best of the powers; the knowledge of the spirit is the best of all knowledge and truthfulness is the best of religious vows.

data.v: सत्यस्य वचनं श्रेयः सत्यं ज्ञानं हितं भवेत् । यद्भूतहितमत्यन्तं तद्वै सत्यं परं मतम् ।।
data.md: To tell the truth is good and the knowledge of truth also is good, but what conduces to the greatest good of all creatures is known as the highest truth.

data.v: यस्य सर्वे समारम्भाः निराशीर्बन्धनाः सदा । त्यागे यस्य हुतं सर्वं स त्यागी स च बुद्धिमान् ।।
data.md: He whose actions are performed not with the object of securing any reward or blessing, who has sacrificed all to the requirements of his renunciation is a real Sanyasi and is really wise.

data.v: यतो न गुरुरप्येनं च्यावयेदुपपादयन् । तं विद्याद्ब्रह्मणो योगं वियोगं योगसंज्ञितम् ।।
data.md: Communion with Brahma cannot be taught to us even by our spiritual preceptor; he can only give us a clue to the mystery; renunciation of things of the material world is called Yoga.

data.v: न हिंस्यात्सर्वभूतानि मैत्रायणगतश्चरेत् । नेदं जीवितमासाद्य वैरं कुर्वीत केनचित् ।।
data.md: We must not do harm to any creature and must live in amity with all. In this our present existence we must not avenge ourselves on any creature.

data.v: आकिंचन्यं सुसंतोषो निराशित्वमचापलम् । एतदेव परं ज्ञानं सदात्मज्ञानमुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Self-abnegation, peace of mind, renunciation of hope and equanimity, these are the ways by which spiritual enlightenment can always be secured. The knowledge of self is the best of all knowledge.

data.v: परिग्रहं परित्यज्य भव बुद्ध्या यतव्रतः । अशोकं स्थानमातिष्ठेन्निश्चलं प्रेत्य चेह च ।।
data.md: It this world as well as in the next, renouncing all worldly desires and assuming a stolid indifference, in which all suffering is at rest, people should fulfill their religious duties with the aid of their intelligence.

data.v: तपोनित्येन दान्तेन मुनिना संयतात्मना । अजितं जेतुकामेन भाव्यं सङ्गेष्वसङ्गिना ।।
data.md: One who wishes to conquer that which is unconquerable should live giving himself up to penances, to self-control, to taciturnity, to a subjugation of the soul. Such a person should live in the midst of attachments without being attached thereto.

data.v: गुणागुणमनासङ्गमेककार्यमनन्तरम् । एतद्ब्राह्मण ते वृत्तमाहुरेकपदं सुखम् ।।
data.md: The attributes that are perceptible in us become non-attributes in Him. He is not bound by anything. He is perceptible only by the expansion and development of our spiritual vision. As soon as the illusion of ignorance is dispelled, this supreme and unalloyed bliss is obtained. By foregoing the objects of both pleasure and pain and by renouncing the feeling which binds him to the things of the earth, one attains to Brahma.

data.v: परित्यजति यो दुःखं सुखं चाप्युभयं नरः । ब्रह्म प्राप्नोति सोऽत्यन्तमसङ्गेन च गच्छति ।।
data.md: The attributes that are perceptible in us become non-attributes in Him. He is not bound by anything. He is perceptible only by the expansion and development of our spiritual vision. As soon as the illusion of ignorance is dispelled, this supreme and unalloyed bliss is obtained. By foregoing the objects of both pleasure and pain and by renouncing the feeling which binds him to the things of the earth, one attains to Brahma.

data.v: यथाश्रुतमिदं सर्वं समासेन द्विजोत्तम । एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं किं भूयः श्रोतुमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: O excellent Brahmana, I have told you in brief all that I have heard. What else do you desire to hear.

data.v: एवं संकथिते कृत्स्ने मोक्षधर्मे युधिष्ठिर । दृढं प्रीतमना विप्रो धर्मव्याधमुवाच ह ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : O Yudhishthira, when all this about the mystery of salvation was told to the Brahmana, he was highly pleased. He then thus spoke to the virtuous Fowler.

data.v: न्याययुक्तमिदं सर्वं भवता परिकीर्तितम् । न तेऽस्त्यविदितं किंचिद्धर्मेष्विह हि दृश्यते ।।
data.md: The Brahmanas said: All this that you have told me is rational. It appears that there is nothing in connection with the mysteries of religion which you do not know.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं मम यो धर्मस्तं पश्य द्विजसत्तम । येन सिद्धिरियं प्राप्ता मया ब्राह्मणपुंगव ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: O foremost of Brahmanas, chief of the twice-born, behold with your own eyes all the virtues that I possess and by reason of which I have attained to this success (blissful state).

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ भगवन्क्षिप्रं प्रविश्याभ्यन्तरं गृहम् । द्रष्टुमर्हसि धर्मज्ञ मातरं पितरं च मे ।।
data.md: O exalted one, arise, soon enter this inner apartment. O virtuous one, you should see (first) my father and my mother.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स प्रविश्याथ ददर्श परमार्चितम् । सौधं हृद्यं चतुःशालमतीव च मनोहरम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Having been thus addressed, he went in and saw a magnificent and charming house, divided in suits of rooms, resembling the abode of the celestials adorned by the gods. It was furnished with seats and beds and filled with excellent perfumes.

data.v: देवतागृहसंकाशं दैवतैश्च सुपूजितम् । शयनासनसंबाधं गन्धैश्च परमैर्युतम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Having been thus addressed, he went in and saw a magnificent and charming house, divided in suits of rooms, resembling the abode of the celestials adorned by the gods. It was furnished with seats and beds and filled with excellent perfumes.

data.v: तत्र शुक्लाम्बरधरौ पितरावस्य पूजितौ । कृताहारौ सुतुष्टौ तावुपविष्टौ वरासने । धर्मव्याधस्तु तौ दृष्ट्वा पादेषु शिरसापतत् ।।
data.md: His adorable parents, after their meal, were comfortably seated there on excellent seats, with white robes on. Seeing them the Fowler prostrated himself before them with his head at their feet.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठोत्तिष्ठ धर्मज्ञ धर्मस्त्वामभिरक्षतु । प्रीतौ स्वस्तव शौचेन दीर्घमायुरवाप्नुहि । सत्पुत्रेण त्वया पुत्र नित्यकालं सुपूजितौ ।।
data.md: The Aged ones said: O virtuous one, arise, arise, may virtue protect you. We are much pleased with your virtue. Be blessed with a long life,

data.v: न तेऽन्यद्दैवतं किंचिद्दैवतेष्वपि वर्तते । प्रयतत्वाद्द्विजातीनां दमेनासि समन्वितः ।।
data.md: There is not even among the celestials such a one as to deserve worship from you. By always subduing your senses you have acquired the self-control of the twice born.

data.v: पितुः पितामहा ये च तथैव प्रपितामहाः । प्रीतास्ते सततं पुत्र दमेनावां च पूजया ।।
data.md: Your father, grand-father and great grandfathers are, O son, always pleased with you, for your (great) self-control and for your reverence for us.

data.v: मनसा कर्मणा वाचा शुश्रूषा नैव हीयते । न चान्या वितथा बुद्धिर्दृश्यते सांप्रतं तव ।।
data.md: In thought, in word or in action, your attention to us never flags and it appears, even at present, that you have no other thought in your mind.

data.v: जामदग्न्येन रामेण यथा वृद्धौ सुपूजितौ । तथा त्वया कृतं सर्वं तद्विशिष्टं च पुत्रक ।।
data.md: O son, as the son of Jamadagni, Rama tried to serve his old parents, so have you done to please us, nay you have done more.

data.v: ततस्तं ब्राह्मणं ताभ्यां धर्मव्याधो न्यवेदयत् । तौ स्वागतेन तं विप्रमर्चयामासतुस्तदा ।।
data.md: Then the virtuous Fowler introduced the Brahmana to his parents; they received him with the usual salutation of welcome.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च तां पूजां द्विजः पप्रच्छ तावुभौ । सपुत्राभ्यां सभृत्याभ्यां कच्चिद्वां कुशलं गृहे । अनामयं च वां कच्चित्सदैवेह शरीरयोः ।।
data.md: The Brahmana accepting their welcome, enquired if they with their children and servants were well and if they were always enjoying good health.

data.v: कुशलं नो गृहे विप्र भृत्यवर्गे च सर्वशः । कच्चित्त्वमप्यविघ्नेन संप्राप्तो भगवन्निह ।।
data.md: The aged ones said : O Brahmana, we are all well in our home with all our servants. O exalted, one, have you come here without any difficulty?

data.v: बाढमित्येव तौ विप्रः प्रत्युवाच मुदान्वितः । धर्मव्याधस्तु तं विप्रमर्थवद्वाक्यमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : The Brahmana replied in gladness by saying, “Yes, I am not face any difficulty". Then the virtuous Fowler thus spoke to the Brahmana.

data.v: पिता माता च भगवन्नेतौ मे दैवतं परम् । यद्दैवतेभ्यः कर्तव्यं तदेताभ्यां करोम्यहम् ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: O exalted one, these my father and mother are the idols I worship with whatever adoration due to the gods.

data.v: त्रयस्त्रिंशद्यथा देवाः सर्वे शक्रपुरोगमाः । संपूज्याः सर्वलोकस्य तथा वृद्धाविमौ मम ।।
data.md: Thirty three million gods with Indra at their head, are worshipped by all men, so are these aged parents of mine worshipped by me.

data.v: उपहारानाहरन्तो देवतानां यथा द्विजाः । कुर्वते तद्वदेताभ्यां करोम्यहमतन्द्रितः ।।
data.md: As the Brahmanas try to procure offerings for their gods, so do I, with diligence for these two (my aged parents).

data.v: एतौ मे परमं ब्रह्मन्पिता माता च दैवतम् । एतौ पुष्पैः फलै रत्नैस्तोषयामि सदा द्विज ।।
data.md: O Brahmana, these my father and mother are my supreme gods. O twice-born one, I always try to gratify them with the offering of fruits, flowers and gems.

data.v: एतावेवाग्नयो मह्यं यान्वदन्ति मनीषिणः । यज्ञा वेदाश्च चत्वारः सर्वमेतौ मम द्विज ।।
data.md: To me they are like the three sacred fires mentioned by the learned. O Brahmana, they are to me as the sacrifices in the four Vedas.

data.v: एतदर्थं मम प्राणा भार्या पुत्राः सुहृज्जनाः । सपुत्रदारः शुश्रूषां नित्यमेव करोम्यहम् ।।
data.md: My five vital airs, my wife, children and friends are all for them. With my wife and my children, I always serve them.

data.v: स्वयं च स्नापयाम्येतौ तथा पादौ प्रधावये । आहारं संप्रयच्छामि स्वयं च द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: O foremost of Brahmanas, with my own hands I assist them in bathing; I also wash their feet, I give them food.

data.v: अनुकूलाः कथा वच्मि विप्रियं परिवर्जयन् । अधर्मेणापि संयुक्तं प्रियमाभ्यां करोम्यहम् ।।
data.md: I speak to them only what is agreeable, avoiding all that is unpleasant and disagreeable. I even do that which is not virtuous, to please them.

data.v: धर्ममेव गुरुं ज्ञात्वा करोमि द्विजसत्तम । अतन्द्रितः सदा विप्र शुश्रूषां वै करोम्यहम् ।।
पञ्चैव गुरवो ब्रह्मन्पुरुषस्य बुभूषतः । पिता माताग्निरात्मा च गुरुश्च द्विजसत्तम ।।
एतेषु यस्तु वर्तेत सम्यगेव द्विजोत्तम । भवेयुरग्नयस्तस्य परिचीर्णास्तु नित्यशः । गार्हस्थ्ये वर्तमानस्य धर्म एष सनातनः ।।
data.md: O foremost of the twice-born, O Brahmanas, I am always diligent in always waiting upon them. The parents, the sacred, fire, the soul, the preceptor, these five. O foremost of Brahmanas deserve the highest worship from a person who seeks prosperity. By properly serving them, one acquires the merit of perpetually keeping up the sacred fires. It is the eternal and invariable duty of all who lead domestic life.

data.v: गुरू निवेद्य विप्राय तौ मातापितरावुभौ । पुनरेव स धर्मात्मा व्याधो ब्राह्मणमब्रवीत् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Having introduced both of his parents to that Brahmanas as his highest Gurus that virtuousminded fowler again thus spoke to the Brahmana.

data.v: प्रवृत्तचक्षुर्जातोऽस्मि संपश्य तपसो बलम् । यदर्थमुक्तोऽसि तया गच्छस्व मिथिलामिति ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: Behold the power of my this virtue by which iny spiritual vision has extended. For this reason you were told by that self-controlled and truthful and chaste lady, 'Go to Mithila, there lives a Fowler who will explain to you the mysteries of religion.'

data.v: पतिशुश्रूषपरया दान्तया सत्यशीलया । मिथिलायां वसन्व्याधः स ते धर्मान्प्रवक्ष्यति ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: Behold the power of my this virtue by which iny spiritual vision has extended. For this reason you were told by that self-controlled and truthful and chaste lady, 'Go to Mithila, there lives a Fowler who will explain to you the mysteries of religion.'

data.v: पतिव्रतायाः सत्यायाः शीलाढ्याया यतव्रत । संस्मृत्य वाक्यं धर्मज्ञ गुणवानसि मे मतः ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: O virtuous and vow-observing man, thinking of what that truthful, well-behaved and chaste lady told me, I am of opinion, that you really possess very high qualities.

data.v: यत्तदा त्वं द्विजश्रेष्ठ तयोक्तो मां प्रति प्रभो । दृष्टमेतत्तया सम्यगेकपत्न्या न संशयः ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: O foremost of Brahmanas, O Lord, what that chaste lady told you about me, was certainly said with full knowledge of the facts.

data.v: त्वदनुग्रहबुद्ध्या तु विप्रैतद्दर्शितं मया । वाक्यं च शृणु मे तात यत्ते वक्ष्ये हितं द्विज ।।
data.md: O sire, I have explained to you all this as a matter of favour. O Brahmana, hear what will be good for you.

data.v: त्वया विनिकृता माता पिता च द्विजसत्तम । अनिसृष्टोऽसि निष्क्रान्तो गृहात्ताभ्यामनिन्दित । वेदोच्चारणकार्यार्थमयुक्तं तत्त्वया कृतम् ।।
data.md: O foremost of Brahmanas, O faultless one, you have wronged your father and mother, for you have left home for learning the Vedas without their permission.

data.v: तव शोकेन वृद्धौ तावन्धौ जातौ तपस्विनौ । तौ प्रसादयितुं गच्छ मा त्वा धर्मोऽत्यगान्महान् ।।
data.md: Go back to please them. May this virtue never forsake you. You are an ascetic, you are high-souled; you are always devoted to your religion,

data.v: तपस्वी त्वं महात्मा च धर्मे च निरतः सदा । सर्वमेतदपार्थं ते क्षिप्रं तौ संप्रसादय ।।
श्रद्दधस्व मम ब्रह्मन्नान्यथा कर्तुमर्हसि । गम्यतामद्य विप्रर्षे श्रेयस्ते कथयाम्यहम् ।।
data.md: But all has become in vain, therefore soon go back to console your parents. Have regard for my words and do not act in any other way. I tell you what is good for you, O Brahmana return even today.

data.v: यदेतदुक्तं भवता सर्वं सत्यमसंशयम् । प्रीतोऽस्मि तव धर्मज्ञ साध्वाचार गुणान्वित ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: man of virtuous practices, what you have said is certainly true. Be blessed, I am much pleased with you.

data.v: दैवतप्रतिमो हि त्वं यस्त्वं धर्ममनुव्रतः । पुराणं शाश्वतं दिव्यं दुष्प्रापमकृतात्मभिः ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: O foremost of Brahmanas, as you assiduously practise these divine, ancient and eternal virtues which are so difficult to be acquired even by pure-minded men, you seem to be a divine being. Return soon to the side of your parents and be quick and diligent in honouring your father and mother, for I do not know, if there is any virtue higher than this.

data.v: अतन्द्रितः कुरु क्षिप्रं मातापित्रोर्हि पूजनम् । अतः परमहं धर्मं नान्यं पश्यामि कंचन ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: O foremost of Brahmanas, as you assiduously practise these divine, ancient and eternal virtues which are so difficult to be acquired even by pure-minded men, you seem to be a divine being. Return soon to the side of your parents and be quick and diligent in honouring your father and mother, for I do not know, if there is any virtue higher than this.

data.v: इहाहमागतो दिष्ट्या दिष्ट्या मे संगतं त्वया । ईदृशा दुर्लभा लोके नरा धर्मप्रदर्शकाः ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: By good luck, I have come here and by good luck I have met with you. Such expounders of religion are difficult to get in this world.

data.v: एको नरसहस्रेषु धर्मविद्विद्यते न वा । प्रीतोऽस्मि तव सत्येन भद्रं ते पुरुषोत्तम ।।
data.md: There is hardly one man amongst one thousand, who is leaned in the mysteries of religion. O foremost of men, I am highly pleased with you. Let prosperity and good fortune be yours.

data.v: पतमानो हि नरके भवतास्मि समुद्धृतः । भवितव्यमथैवं च यद्दृष्टोऽसि मयानघ ।।
data.md: O sinless one, I was at the point of falling into hell, but I have been saved by you. It was ordained and therefore I did meet you.

data.v: राजा ययातिर्दौहित्रैः पतितस्तारितो यथा । सद्भिः पुरुषशार्दूल तथाहं भवता त्विह ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, as the fallen king Yayati was saved by his virtuous grandson, so have I now been saved by you.

data.v: मातापितृभ्यां शुश्रूषां करिष्ये वचनात्तव । नाकृतात्मा वेदयति धर्माधर्मविनिश्चयम् ।।
data.md: I shall serve my father and mother at your command. No vicious-minded man can ever expound the mysteries of virtue and vice.

data.v: दुर्ज्ञेयः शाश्वतो धर्मः शूद्रयोनौ हि वर्तता । न त्वां शूद्रमहं मन्ये भवितव्यं हि कारणम् । येन कर्मविपाकेन प्राप्तेयं शूद्रता त्वया ।।
data.md: As it is very difficult for a Shudra to learn the mysteries of eternal religion. I do not consider you to be a Shudra. There must be some reason for all this.

data.v: एतदिच्छामि विज्ञातुं तत्त्वेन हि महामते । कामया ब्रूहि मे तथ्यं सर्वं त्वं प्रयतात्मवान् ।।
data.md: You must have been born as a Shudra as a result of your past Karma (in a previous birth). O high-souled one, I eagerly desire to learn truth of this matter. Tell this to me with attention and according to your inclination.

data.v: अनतिक्रमणीया हि ब्राह्मणा वै द्विजोत्तम । शृणु सर्वमिदं वृत्तं पूर्वदेहे ममानघ ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: O foremost of the Brahmanas, O sinless one, Brahmanas are worthy of all respect from me, hear about the story of my previous existence.

data.v: अहं हि ब्राह्मणः पूर्वमासं द्विजवरात्मज । वेदाध्यायी सुकुशलो वेदाङ्गानां च पारगः । आत्मदोषकृतैर्ब्रह्मन्नवस्थां प्राप्तवानिमाम् ।।
data.md: O son of the best of Brahmanas, I was a Brahmana previously (in my another birth); I was well-read in the Vedas and earned in the Vedangas.

data.v: कश्चिद्राजा मम सखा धनुर्वेदपरायणः । संसर्गाद्धनुषि श्रेष्ठस्ततोऽहमभवं द्विज ।।
एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु मृगयां निर्गतो नृपः । सहितो योधमुख्यैश्च मन्त्रिभिश्च सुसंवृतः । ततोऽभ्यहन्मृगांस्तत्र सुबहूनाश्रमं प्रति ।।
data.md: Surrounded by his ministers and followed by his best warriors. He killed many deer near a hermitage.

data.v: अथ क्षिप्तः शरो घोरो मयापि द्विजसत्तम । ताडितश्च मुनिस्तेन शरेणानतपर्वणा ।।
data.md: O foremost of Brahmanas, I too shot a swift and fearful arrow. A Rishi was wounded by that arrow with head bent.

data.v: भूमौ निपतितो ब्रह्मन्नुवाच प्रतिनादयन् । नापराध्याम्यहं किंचित्केन पापमिदं कृतम् ।।
data.md: The Brahmana fell down on the ground and screaming aloud said "I have done no wrong, what wretch has done this?

data.v: मन्वानस्तं मृगं चाहं संप्राप्तः सहसा मुनिम् । अपश्यं तमृषिं विद्धं शरेणानतपर्वणा । तमुग्रतपसं विप्रं निष्टनन्तं महीतले ।।
data.md: O lord, taking him for a deer I soon went near him and saw that Rishi pierced by my that arrow with head bent.

data.v: अकार्यकरणाच्चापि भृशं मे व्यथितं मनः । अजानता कृतमिदं मयेत्यथ तमब्रुवम् । क्षन्तुमर्हसि मे ब्रह्मन्निति चोक्तो मया मुनिः ।।
data.md: For my wicked deed I was very much aggrieved in my mind. I said to that Rishi of severe austerities who was loudly crying lying on the ground, “I have unconsciously done this." I again said to that Rishi “you should pardon ine for this sinful act.”

data.v: ततः प्रत्यब्रवीद्वाक्यमृषिर्मां क्रोधमूर्छितः । व्याधस्त्वं भविता क्रूर शूद्रयोनाविति द्विज ।।
data.md: But the Brahmana, becoming exceedingly angry said, “You shall be born as a cruel fowler in the Shudra order."

data.v: एवं शप्तोऽहमृषिणा तदा द्विजवरोत्तम । अभिप्रसादयमृषिं गिरा वाक्यविशारदम् ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: O foremost of the best of Brahmanas, having been thus cursed by the Rishi, I said "Pardon me, O Rishi, I have unconsciously done this wicked act. You should pardon all (my fault). Oexalted Rishi, be graceful (to me).

data.v: अजानता मयाकार्यमिदमद्य कृतं मुने । क्षन्तुमर्हसि तत्सर्वं प्रसीद भगवन्निति ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: O foremost of the best of Brahmanas, having been thus cursed by the Rishi, I said "Pardon me, O Rishi, I have unconsciously done this wicked act. You should pardon all (my fault). Oexalted Rishi, be graceful (to me).

data.v: नान्यथा भविता शाप एवमेतदसंशयम् । आनृशंस्यादहं किंचित्कर्तानुग्रहमद्य ते ।।
data.md: The Rishi said : The curse that I have pronounced can never be falsified. This is certain. But for kindness I shall do you a favour.

data.v: शूद्रयोनौ वर्तमानो धर्मज्ञो भविता ह्यसि । मातापित्रोश्च शुश्रूषां करिष्यसि न संशयः ।।
data.md: Even taking your birth as a Shudra, you will be virtuous, you shall certainly serve and wait upon your parents.

data.v: तया शुश्रूषया सिद्धिं महतीं समवाप्स्यसि । जातिस्मरश्च भविता स्वर्गं चैव गमिष्यसि । शापक्षयान्ते निर्वृत्ते भवितासि पुनर्द्विजः ।।
data.md: By (thus) serving them, you will acquire great success. You shall also remember the events of your past life and shall go to heaven.

data.v: एवं शप्तः पुरा तेन ऋषिणास्म्युग्रतेजसा । प्रसादश्च कृतस्तेन ममैवं द्विपदां वर ।।
शरं चोद्धृतवानस्मि तस्य वै द्विजसत्तम । आश्रमं च मया नीतो न च प्राणैर्व्ययुज्यत ।।
एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथा मम पुराभवत् । अभितश्चापि गन्तव्यं मया स्वर्गं द्विजोत्तम ।।
data.md: I took him to the hermitage, but he was not deprived of his life, (he recovered from the । wound). I have thus narrated to you all that happened to me before. O foremost of men and also now I can go to heaven hereafter.

data.v: एवमेतानि पुरुषा दुःखानि च सुखानि च । प्राप्नुवन्ति महाबुद्धे नोत्कण्ठां कर्तुमर्हसि । दुष्करं हि कृतं तात जानता जातिमात्मनः ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: O greatly intelligent one, all men are thus subject to happiness or misery. You should not therefore grieve for it.

data.v: कर्मदोषश्च वै विद्वन्नात्मजातिकृतेन वै । कंचित्कालं मृष्यतां वै ततोऽसि भविता द्विजः । सांप्रतं च मतो मेऽसि ब्राह्मणो नात्र संशयः ।।
data.md: These being the duties of your profession, the stain of evil Karma will not attach to you. After living here for sometime you shall again become a Brahmana.

data.v: ब्राह्मणः पतनीयेषु वर्तमानो विकर्मसु । दाम्भिको दुष्कृतप्रायः शूद्रेण सदृशो भवेत् ।।
data.md: There is no doubt that even now I consider you to be a Brahmana, for the Brahmana who is vain and haughty who is sinful and evilminded and who is fond of degraded practices, is no better than a Shudra.

data.v: यस्तु शूद्रो दमे सत्ये धर्मे च सततोत्थितः । तं ब्राह्मणमहं मन्ये वृत्तेन हि भवेद्द्विजः ।।
data.md: The Shudra who is, endued with righteousness, self-control and truthfulness, is considered by me as a Brahmana. A man becomes a Brahmana by his own good act.

data.v: कर्मदोषेण विषमां गतिमाप्नोति दारुणाम् । क्षीणदोषमहं मन्ये चाभितस्त्वां नरोत्तम ।।
data.md: By his own evil Karma a man meets with an evil and terrible doom. O foremost of men, 1 believe that all your sin is destroyed.

data.v: कर्तुमर्हसि नोत्कण्ठां त्वद्विधा ह्यविषादिनः । लोकवृत्तान्तवृत्तज्ञा नित्यं धर्मपरायणाः ।।
data.md: O virtuous man, O man learned in the ways of the world, in obedience to the customs of your present caste (Fowler), you have pursued these wicked ways.

data.v: प्रज्ञया मानसं दुःखं हन्याच्छारीरमौषधैः । एतद्विज्ञानसामर्थ्यं न बालैः समतां व्रजेत् ।।
data.md: The Fowler said: The bodily disease should be cured with medicines and the mental ones by spiritual wisdom. This is the power of knowledge. Knowing this, the wise should not behave like boys.

data.v: अनिष्टसंप्रयोगाच्च विप्रयोगात्प्रियस्य च । मानुषा मानसैर्दुःखैर्युज्यन्ते अल्पबुद्धयः ।।
गुणैर्भूतानि युज्यन्ते वियुज्यन्ते तथैव च । सर्वाणि नैतदेकस्य शोकस्थानं हि विद्यते ।।
अनिष्टेनान्वितं पश्यंस्तथा क्षिप्रं विरज्यते । ततश्च प्रतिकुर्वन्ति यदि पश्यन्त्युपक्रमम् । शोचतो न भवेत्किंचित्केवलं परितप्यते ।।
परित्यजन्ति ये दुःखं सुखं वाप्युभयं नराः । त एव सुखमेधन्ते ज्ञानतृप्ता मनीषिणः ।।
data.md: Whoever grieves for it, only makes himself miserable. Those wise men whose knowledge has made them happy and contented and who are indifferent to happiness and misery, are really happy. The wise are always contented and the foolish are always discontented.

data.v: असंतोषपरा मूढाः संतोषं यान्ति पण्डिताः । असंतोषस्य नास्त्यन्तस्तुष्टिस्तु परमं सुखम् । न शोचन्ति गताध्वानः पश्यन्तः परमां गतिम् ।।
data.md: There is not end to to discontent and contentment is the highest happiness. The man who has attained the highest state does not grieve. They are always conscious of the final destruction of all creatures. One must not give way to discontent, for it is like a virulently poisonous snake. It kills persons of undeveloped intelligence just as a child is killed by an enraged snake.

data.v: न विषादे मनः कार्यं विषादो विषमुत्तमम् । मारयत्यकृतप्रज्ञं बालं क्रुद्ध इवोरगः ।।
data.md: There is not end to to discontent and contentment is the highest happiness. The man who has attained the highest state does not grieve. They are always conscious of the final destruction of all creatures. One must not give way to discontent, for it is like a virulently poisonous snake. It kills persons of undeveloped intelligence just as a child is killed by an enraged snake.

data.v: यं विषादोऽभिभवति विषमे समुपस्थिते । तेजसा तस्य हीनस्य पुरुषार्थो न विद्यते ।।
data.md: That man has no manliness whose energies do abandon him and who is overpowered with perplexity, when an occasion for displaying vigour presents itself.

data.v: अवश्यं क्रियमाणस्य कर्मणो दृश्यते फलम् । न हि निर्वेदमागम्य किंचित्प्राप्नोति शोभनम् ।।
data.md: Our actions are with certainty followed by their effects. Whoever merely gives himself up to passive indifference (to worldly affairs) accomplishes no good.

data.v: अथाप्युपायं पश्येत दुःखस्य परिमोक्षणे । अशोचन्नारभेतैव युक्तश्चाव्यसनी भवेत् ।।
data.md: Instead of gruinbling, one must try to find out the means by which he can be freed from all misery.

data.v: भूतेष्वभावं संचिन्त्य ये तु बुद्धेः परं गताः । न शोचन्ति कृतप्रज्ञाः पश्यन्तः परमां गतिम् ।।
data.md: He who has attained the highest state, being conscious of the great deficiency of all matter and seeing before him the final doom, never grieves.

data.v: न शोचामि च वै विद्वन्कालाकाङ्क्षी स्थितोऽस्म्यहम् । एतैर्निदर्शनैर्ब्रह्मन्नावसीदामि सत्तम ।।
data.md: O excellent man, O learned one, I too do not grieve. I wait abiding my time. For this reason I am not confined (in any way).

data.v: कृतप्रज्ञोऽसि मेधावी बुद्धिश्च विपुला तव । नाहं भवन्तं शोचामि ज्ञानतृप्तोऽसि धर्मवित् ।।
data.md: The Brahmana said: You are wise great in knowledge and vast in your intelligence; O virtuous one, you are content with your wisdom. I have nothing to complain in you.

data.v: आपृच्छे त्वां स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु धर्मस्त्वा परिरक्षतु । अप्रमादस्तु कर्तव्यो धर्मे धर्मभृतां वर ।।
data.md: O foremost of all virtuous men, (now) farewell. May prosperity come to you, may virtue protect you and may you be ever steady in the practice of virtuc.

data.v: बाढमित्येव तं व्याधः कृताञ्जलिरुवाच ह । प्रदक्षिणमथो कृत्वा प्रस्थितो द्विजसत्तमः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : The Fowler with joined hands said to him, "So be it.” That foremost of Brahmanas then walked round him and went away.

data.v: स तु गत्वा द्विजः सर्वां शुश्रूषां कृतवांस्तदा । मातापितृभ्यां वृद्धाभ्यां यथान्यायं सुसंशितः ।।
data.md: When the Brahmana returned home he assiduously and duly began to serve his old father and mother.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं निखिलेन युधिष्ठिर । पृष्टवानसि यं तात धर्मं धर्मभृतां वर ।।
data.md: O Yudhishthira, O child, O foremost of virtuous men, I have thus told you in detail all that you asked me:

data.v: पतिव्रताया माहात्म्यं ब्राह्मणस्य च सत्तम । मातापित्रोश्च शुश्रूषा व्याधे धर्मश्च कीर्तितः ।।
data.md: The virtue of women's devotion to their husbands and the filial piety as described to the Brahmana by the virtuous fowler.

data.v: अत्यद्भुतमिदं ब्रह्मन्धर्माख्यानमनुत्तमम् । सर्वधर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठ कथितं द्विजसत्तम ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: O foremost of all virtuous men, O best of Rishis, O Brahmana, wonderful is this excellent moral story.

data.v: सुखश्रव्यतया विद्वन्मुहूर्तमिव मे गतम् । न हि तृप्तोऽस्मि भगवञ्शृण्वानो धर्ममुत्तमम् ।।
data.md: Listening to you, O learned man, O exalted one, my time has passed away as if it were but a (fleeting) moment. But I am not as yet satiated with hearing about Dharma.

data.v: श्रुत्वेमां धर्मसंयुक्तां धर्मराजः कथां शुभाम् । पुनः पप्रच्छ तमृषिं मार्कण्डेयं तपस्विनम् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having heard this excellent discourse on religion, Dharmaraja (Yudhishthira) again

data.v: कथमग्निर्वनं यातः कथं चाप्यङ्गिराः पुरा । नष्टेऽग्नौ हव्यमवहदग्निर्भूत्वा महानृषिः ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said: Why did in the days of yore, Agni hide himself in water and why did the greatly effulgent Angirasa convey the oblations by becoming Agni, when Agni had disappeared?

data.v: अग्निर्यदा त्वेक एव बहुत्वं चास्य कर्मसु । दृश्यते भगवन्सर्वमेतदिच्छामि वेदितुम् ।।
data.md: O exalted one, there is but one fire, but it is seen, according to the nature of its actions as many. I desire to hear all this.

data.v: कुमारश्च यथोत्पन्नो यथा चाग्नेः सुतोऽभवत् । यथा रुद्राच्च संभूतो गङ्गायां कृत्तिकासु च ।।
data.md: How Kumara (Kartikeya) was born, how he came to be known as the son of Agni and how he was begotten by Rudra (Shiva) on Ganga and Krittika?

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं त्वत्तः श्रोतुं भार्गवनन्दन । कौतूहलसमाविष्टो यथातथ्यं महामुने ।।
data.md: O best of the Bhrigu race, O great Rishi, I desire to hear all this in detail. I am filled with great curiosity.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । यथा क्रुद्धो हुतवहस्तपस्तप्तुं वनं गतः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : This is the old history cited as an instance, in which (is related) why Agni in wrath went to the forest to perform asceticismi.

data.v: यथा च भगवानग्निः स्वयमेवाङ्गिराभवत् । संतापयन्स्वप्रभया नाशयंस्तिमिराणि च ।।
data.md: And why the exalted, Angirasa, transforming himself into Agni, destroyed all the darkness and distress (the world) by his splendour.

data.v: आश्रमस्थो महाभागो हव्यवाहं विशेषयन् । तथा स भूत्वा तु तदा जगत्सर्वं प्रकाशयन् ।।
data.md: O mighty-armed hero, in the days of yore Angiras performed severe asceticism in his herinitage. That highly exalted one even excelled Agni. Becoming such he illuminated the whole universe.

data.v: तपश्चरंश्च हुतभुक्संतप्तस्तस्य तेजसा । भृशं ग्लानश्च तेजस्वी न स किंचित्प्रजज्ञिवान् ।।
data.md: Agni was then performing asceticism and he became greatly aggrieved with that effulgence. That greatly powerful deity was greatly sorry, but he did not know what to do.

data.v: अथ संचिन्तयामास भगवान्हव्यवाहनः । अन्योऽग्निरिह लोकानां ब्रह्मणा संप्रवर्तितः । अग्नित्वं विप्रनष्टं हि तप्यमानस्य मे तपः ।।
data.md: The exalted one thus reflected, “Another Agni was created by Brahma.

data.v: कथमग्निः पुनरहं भवेयमिति चिन्त्य सः । अपश्यदग्निवल्लोकांस्तापयन्तं महामुनिम् ।।
सोपासर्पच्छनैर्भीतस्तमुवाच तदाङ्गिराः । शीघ्रमेव भवस्वाग्निस्त्वं पुनर्लोकभावनः । विज्ञातश्चासि लोकेषु त्रिषु संस्थानचारिषु ।।
data.md: "Soon become Agni, the protector of the world, you are celebrated over the three stable worlds.

data.v: त्वमग्ने प्रथमः सृष्टो ब्रह्मणा तिमिरापहः । स्वस्थानं प्रतिपद्यस्व शीघ्रमेव तमोनुद ।।
data.md: You Agni was first created by Brahma to dispel darkness. O destroyer of darkness, do you quickly occupy your own place."

data.v: नष्टकीर्तिरहं लोके भवाञ्जातो हुताशनः । भवन्तमेव ज्ञास्यन्ति पावकं न तु मां जनाः ।।
data.md: Agni said : My reputation has been destroyed in this world, you have become the fire, people will know you as Agni and not me.

data.v: निक्षिपाम्यहमग्नित्वं त्वमग्निः प्रथमो भव । भविष्यामि द्वितीयोऽहं प्राजापत्यक एव च ।।
data.md: I have relinquished my god-hood of fire, do you become primeval fire. I shall act as the second Prajapatya fire.

data.v: कुरु पुण्यं प्रजास्वर्ग्यं भवाग्निस्तिमिरापहः । मां च देव कुरुष्वाग्ने प्रथमं पुत्रमञ्जसा ।।
data.md: Angiras said: O deity of fire, do you become the fire-god and the destroyer of darkness. Do you attend to your sacred duty of clearing people's way to heaven. O god, make me your first child.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वाङ्गिरसो वाक्यं जातवेदास्तथाकरोत् । राजन्बृहस्पतिर्नाम तस्याप्यङ्गिरसः सुतः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : O king, having heard the words of Angiras, Agni did as desired; Angiras had a son, named Brihaspati.

data.v: ज्ञात्वा प्रथमजं तं तु वह्नेराङ्गिरसं सुतम् । उपेत्य देवाः पप्रच्छुः कारणं तत्र भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, knowing him to be the first son of Angiras by Agni, the celestials came and enquired about the mystery.

data.v: स तु पृष्टस्तदा देवैस्ततः कारणमब्रवीत् । प्रत्यगृह्णंस्तु देवाश्च तद्वचोऽङ्गिरसस्तदा ।।
data.md: Having been thus addressed by the celestials, he told them the reason; and the celestials accepted the explanation of Angiras.

data.v: अत्र नानाविधानग्नीन्प्रवक्ष्यामि महाप्रभान् । कर्मभिर्बहुभिः ख्यातान्नानात्वं ब्राह्मणेष्विह ।।
data.md: I shall (now) describe to you various sorts of fire of great effulgence which are known to the Brahmanas by their respective names.

data.v: ब्रह्मणो यस्तृतीयस्तु पुत्रः कुरुकुलोद्वह । तस्यापवसुता भार्या प्रजास्तस्यापि मे शृणु ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : O perpetuator of the Kuru race, he who was the third son of Brahma had a wife named Subha. Hear about her sons.

data.v: बृहज्ज्योतिर्बृहत्कीर्तिर्बृहद्ब्रह्मा बृहन्मनाः । बृहन्मन्त्रो बृहद्भासस्तथा राजन्बृहस्पतिः ।।
data.md: O King, his son Brihaspati was very famous, high-souled and vigorous. His genius and learning were very great. He was highly renowned as a counsellor.

data.v: प्रजासु तासु सर्वासु रूपेणाप्रतिमाभवत् । देवी भानुमती नाम प्रथमाङ्गिरसः सुता ।।
data.md: Bhanumati was the name of his eldest daughter; she was the most beautiful of all his children.

data.v: भूतानामेव सर्वेषां यस्यां रागस्तदाभवत् । रागाद्रागेति यामाहुर्द्वितीयाङ्गिरसः सुता ।।
data.md: Angira's second daughter was called Raga, she was so named because she was the source of all creatures' love.

data.v: यां कपर्दिसुतामाहुर्दृश्यादृश्येति देहिनः । तनुत्वात्सा सिनीवाली तृतीयाङ्गिरसः सुता ।।
data.md: Sinivali was the third daughter of Angiras. Her body was of such slender make, that she was visible at one time and invisible at another and therefore she was likened to the daughter of Rudra.

data.v: पश्यत्यर्चिष्मती भाभिर्हविर्भिश्च हविष्मती । षष्ठीमङ्गिरसः कन्यां पुण्यामाहुर्हविष्मतीम् ।।
data.md: Archishmati was his fourth daughter, she was so named because of her great effulgence; the fifth was Havishmati, so named from her accepting Havish (oblations); the sixth daughter of Angiras was named Mahishmati, whe was very pious.

data.v: महामखेष्वाङ्गिरसी दीप्तिमत्सु महामती । महामतीति विख्याता सप्तमी कथ्यते सुता ।।
data.md: O high-minded one, his seventh daughter was named Mahamati; she was always present at sacrifices of great splendour and that adorable daughter of Angiras whom they called matchless and about whom me cried kuhu, kuhu, in wonder was called Kuhu.

data.v: यां तु दृष्ट्वा भगवतीं जनः कुहुकुहायते । एकानंशेति यामाहुः कुहूमङ्गिरसः सुताम् ।।
data.md: O high-minded one, his seventh daughter was named Mahamati; she was always present at sacrifices of great splendour and that adorable daughter of Angiras whom they called matchless and about whom me cried kuhu, kuhu, in wonder was called Kuhu.

data.v: बृहस्पतेश्चान्द्रमसी भार्याभूद्या यशस्विनी । अग्नीन्साजनयत्पुण्यान्षडेकां चापि पुत्रिकाम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Brihaspati had a celebrated wife belonging to the lunar world. He begot on her six sons, all of them by different fires and one daughter.

data.v: आहुतिष्वेव यस्याग्नेर्हविषाज्यं विधीयते । सोऽग्निर्बृहस्पतेः पुत्रः शंयुर्नाम महाप्रभः ।।
data.md: The fire in which oblations of ghee are offered at the Paurnamashya and at other sacrifices was a son of Brihaspati and that high-souled one is called Shanyu.

data.v: चातुर्मास्येषु यस्येष्ट्यामश्वमेधेऽग्रजः पशुः । दीप्तो ज्वालैरनेकाभैरग्निरेकोऽथ वीर्यवान् ।।
data.md: At the Chaturmasya and the Ashvamedha sacrifices, animals are first offered in his honour; this powerful fire is indicated by numerous flames.

data.v: शंयोरप्रतिमा भार्या सत्या सत्या च धर्मजा । अग्निस्तस्य सुतो दीप्तस्तिस्रः कन्याश्च सुव्रताः ।।
data.md: Shanyu's wife was called Satya; she was of matchless beauty; she sprang from Dharma for the sake of truth, the blazing fire was his son and he had three daughters of great religious merit.

data.v: प्रथमेनाज्यभागेन पूज्यते योऽग्निरध्वरे । अग्निस्तस्य भरद्वाजः प्रथमः पुत्र उच्यते ।।
data.md: The fire which is honoured with the first oblations at sacrifices is his first son called Bharadvaja, the second son of Shanyu is called Bharata in whose honour oblations of Ghee are offered with the sacrificial laddle at all the Paurnamasya sacrifices.

data.v: पौर्णमास्येषु सर्वेषु हविषाज्यं स्रुवोद्यतम् । भरतो नामतः सोऽग्निर्द्वितीयः शंयुतः सुतः ।।
data.md: The fire which is honoured with the first oblations at sacrifices is his first son called Bharadvaja, the second son of Shanyu is called Bharata in whose honour oblations of Ghee are offered with the sacrificial laddle at all the Paurnamasya sacrifices.

data.v: तिस्रः कन्या भवन्त्यन्या यासां स भरतः पतिः । भरतस्तु सुतस्तस्य भरत्येका च पुत्रिका ।।
data.md: Besides these, there were then other sons, of whom Bharata was the eldest. He had a son named Bharata and a daughter called Bharati.

data.v: भरतो भरतस्याग्नेः पावकस्तु प्रजापतेः । महानत्यर्थमहितस्तथा भरतसत्तम ।।
data.md: The Bharata Agni was the son of Prajapati Bharata Agni. O best of the Bharata race, because he was greatly honoured, therefore he was called “great".

data.v: भरद्वाजस्य भार्या तु वीरा वीरश्च पिण्डदः । प्राहुराज्येन तस्येज्यां सोमस्येव द्विजाः शनैः ।।
data.md: Vira was the wife of Bharadvaja, she gave birth to Vira. It is said by the Brahmanas that he is worshipped like Soma with offering of Ghee.

data.v: हविषा यो द्वितीयेन सोमेन सह युज्यते । रथप्रभू रथध्वानः कुम्भरेताः स उच्यते ।।
data.md: He is joined with Soma in the secondary oblations of Ghee and is called Rathaprabhu and Rathadhvana and Kumbhareta.

data.v: सरय्वां जनयत्सिद्धिं भानुं भाभिः समावृणोत् । आग्नेयमानयन्नित्यमाह्वानेष्वेष कथ्यते ।।
data.md: He begot a son on his wife Sarayu named Siddhi and covered the Sun with his splendour. As he is the presiding genius of fire, he is always mentioned in all fire hymn.

data.v: यस्तु न च्यवते नित्यं यशसा वर्चसा श्रिया । अग्निर्निश्च्यवनो नाम पृथिवीं स्तौति केवलम् ।।
data.md: The fire Nischyavana only praises the earth; he never suffers in reputation, splendour and prosperity.

data.v: विपाप्मा कलुषैर्मुक्तो विशुद्धश्चार्चिषा ज्वलन् । विपापोऽग्निः सुतस्तस्य सत्यः समयकर्मसु ।।
data.md: The sinless fire Satya blazing with pure flame was his son. He is free from all stain, he is not defiled by sin, he is the regulator of time.

data.v: आक्रोशतां हि भूतानां यः करोति हि निष्कृतिम् । अग्निः स निष्कृतिर्नाम शोभयत्यभिसेवितः ।।
data.md: That fire has another name called Nishkriti, because he accomplishes the Nishkriti of all creatures, when properly worshipped, he gives good fortune.

data.v: अनुकूजन्ति येनेह वेदनार्ताः स्वयं जनाः । तस्य पुत्रः स्वनो नाम पावकः स रुजस्करः ।।
data.md: Son of Satya is called Svana who is the generator of all diseases, he inflicts severe sufferings on men for which they loudly cry. He moves in the intelligence of all creatures; the other fire is called Vishvajit by mean of spiritual wisdom.

data.v: यस्तु विश्वस्य जगतो बुद्धिमाक्रम्य तिष्ठति । तं प्राहुरध्यात्मविदो विश्वजिन्नाम पावकम् ।।
data.md: Son of Satya is called Svana who is the generator of all diseases, he inflicts severe sufferings on men for which they loudly cry. He moves in the intelligence of all creatures; the other fire is called Vishvajit by mean of spiritual wisdom.

data.v: अन्तराग्निः श्रितो यो हि भुक्तं पचति देहिनाम् । स यज्ञे विश्वभुङ्नाम सर्वलोकेषु भारत ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, the fire, which is known as the internal heat by which all foods are digested, is called Sarvabhuk and was begotten by him.

data.v: ब्रह्मचारी यतात्मा च सततं विपुलव्रतः । ब्राह्मणाः पूजयन्त्येनं पाकयज्ञेषु पावकम् ।।
data.md: He is self-controlled, he is of great religious merit, he is a Brahmachari and he is worshipped by the Brahmanas at the Paka sacrifice.

data.v: प्रथितो गोपतिर्नाम नदी यस्याभवत्प्रिया । तस्मिन्सर्वाणि कर्माणि क्रियन्ते कर्मकर्तृभिः ।।
data.md: The sacred river Gomati was his wife and by him all religious-minded men perform their sacrifices.

data.v: वडवामुखः पिबत्यम्भो योऽसौ परमदारुणः । ऊर्ध्वभागूर्ध्वभाङ्नाम कविः प्राणाश्रितस्तु सः ।।
data.md: That terrible water-drinking sea fire called Vadava has the tendency to go upwards and hence it is called Urdhvabhaga, It stands in the Prana.

data.v: उदग्द्वारं हविर्यस्य गृहे नित्यं प्रदीयते । ततः स्विष्टं भवेदाज्यं स्विष्टकृत्परमः स्मृतः ।।
