भवेम सर्वलोकस्य वयं मातर उत्तमाः । प्रसादात्तव पूज्याश्च प्रियमेतत्कुरुष्व नः ।।
सोऽब्रवीद्बाढमित्येवं भविष्यध्वं पृथग्विधाः । अशिवाश्च शिवाश्चैव पुनः पुनरुदारधीः ।।
ततः संकल्प्य पुत्रत्वे स्कंदं मातृगणोऽगमत् । काकी च हलिमा चैव रुद्राथ बृहली तथा । आर्या पलाला वै मित्रा सप्तैताः शिशुमातरः ।।
data.md: Kaki, Halima, Malini, Brinhata, Arya, Palala and Vaimitra, these were the seven mothers of Shishu.

data.v: एतासां वीर्यसंपन्नः शिशुर्नामातिदारुणः । स्कन्दप्रसादजः पुत्रो लोहिताक्षो भयंकरः ।।
data.md: They had a powerful, red-eyed, terrific and very turbulent son, named Shishu, born by the blessings of Skanda.

data.v: एष वीराष्टकः प्रोक्तः स्कन्दमातृगणोद्भवः । छागवक्त्रेण सहितो नवकः परिकीर्त्यते ।।
data.md: He was regarded as the eighth hero born of the mothers of Skanda called 'Virashtaka. But he is known also as the Vira-navaka when the being with the face of a goat is included.

data.v: षष्ठं छागमयं वक्त्रं स्कन्दस्यैवेति विद्धि तत् । षट्शिरोऽभ्यन्तरं राजन्नित्यं मातृगणार्चितम् ।।
data.md: Know that the sixth face of Skanda was that of a goat. That face, O king, is situated in the middle of the sixth. It is always adored by the mothers.

data.v: षण्णां तु प्रवरं तस्य शीर्षाणामिह शब्द्यते । शक्तिं येनासृजद्दिव्यां भद्रशाख इति स्म ह ।।
data.md: That head by which Bhadrashakha created the celestial energy and prowess is considered to be the best (of all his heads). O lord of men, these holy and wonderful events all took place on the fifth day of the bright fortninght of the lunar month and on the sixth day a very fearful battle was fought at that place.

data.v: इत्येतद्विविधाकारं वृत्तं शुक्लस्य पञ्चमीम् । तत्र युद्धं महाघोरं वृत्तं षष्ठ्यां जनाधिप ।।
data.md: That head by which Bhadrashakha created the celestial energy and prowess is considered to be the best (of all his heads). O lord of men, these holy and wonderful events all took place on the fifth day of the bright fortninght of the lunar month and on the sixth day a very fearful battle was fought at that place.

data.v: उपविष्टं ततः स्कन्दं हिरण्यकवचस्रजम् । हिरण्यचूडमुकुटं हिरण्याक्षं महाप्रभम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Skanda was adorned with a golden armlet and garland; he wore a crest and crown of gold; his eyes were gold coloured and they were very bright.

data.v: लोहिताम्बरसंवीतं तीक्ष्णदंष्ट्रं मनोरमम् । सर्वलक्षणसंपन्नं त्रैलोक्यस्यापि सुप्रियम् ।।
data.md: He had sharp teeth, he was clad in a red garment, he looked very handsome, he had a most charming appearance, he possessed all good characteristics, he was the favorite of the three worlds.

data.v: ततस्तं वरदं शूरं युवानं मृष्टकुण्डलम् । अभजत्पद्मरूपा श्रीः स्वयमेव शरीरिणी ।।
data.md: He was a giver of boons, he was brave and youthful and he was adorned with ear-rings. When he was resting, the goddess of wealth, looking like a lotus and assuming a body, came to him.

data.v: श्रिया जुष्टः पृथुयशाः स कुमारवरस्तदा । निषण्णो दृश्यते भूतैः पौर्णमास्यां यथा शशी ।।
data.md: When he became thus possessed of the goddess of wealth, that illustrious and delicate being looked like the full moon.

data.v: अपूजयन्महात्मानो ब्राह्मणास्तं महाबलम् । इदमाहुस्तदा चैव स्कन्दं तत्र महर्षयः ।।
data.md: The high-souled Brahmanas worshipped that greatly powerful one and the great Rishis spoke thus to Skanda.

data.v: हिरण्यवर्ण भद्रं ते लोकानां शंकरो भव । त्वया षड्रात्रजातेन सर्वे लोका वशीकृताः ।।
data.md: The Rishis said: O golden egg-born one, may prosperity come to you. May you be the cause of doing good to the world. Though you have been born in six nights, all the worlds have come to your subjection.

data.v: अभयं च पुनर्दत्तं त्वयैवैषां सुरोत्तम । तस्मादिन्द्रो भवानस्तु त्रैलोक्यस्याभयंकरः ।।
data.md: O foremost of celestials, you have removed all their fears, therefore become the Indra of the three worlds and thus remove their cause of apprehension.

data.v: किमिन्द्रः सर्वलोकानां करोतीह तपोधनाः । कथं देवगणांश्चैव पाति नित्यं सुरेश्वरः ।।
data.md: Skanda said: O great ascetics, what Indra does with all this worlds? How does that lord of the celestials unceasingly protect the hosts of gods?

data.v: इन्द्रो दिशति भूतानां बलं तेजः प्रजाः सुखम् । तुष्टः प्रयच्छति तथा सर्वान्दायान्सुरेश्वरः ।।
data.md: The Rishis said: Indra gives strength, power, effspring and happiness to all beings. When propetiated that lord of the celestials bestows on all creatures all the objects of their desire.

data.v: दुर्वृत्तानां संहरति वृत्तस्थानां प्रयच्छति । अनुशास्ति च भूतानि कार्येषु बलसूदनः ।।
असूर्ये च भवेत्सूर्यस्तथाचन्द्रे च चन्द्रमाः । भवत्यग्निश्च वायुश्च पृथिव्यापश्च कारणैः ।।
एतदिन्द्रेण कर्तव्यमिन्द्रे हि विपुलं बलम् । त्वं च वीर बलश्रेष्ठस्तस्मादिन्द्रो भवस्व नः ।।
भवस्वेन्द्रो महाबाहो सर्वेषां नः सुखावहः । अभिषिच्यस्व चैवाद्य प्राप्तरूपोऽसि सत्तम ।।
data.md: Indra said: O mighty armed one, O excellent being, make us happy by becoming the lord of all of us. You are worthy of the honour; therefore we shall instal you this very day.

data.v: शाधि त्वमेव त्रैलोक्यमव्यग्रो विजये रतः । अहं ते किंकरः शक्र न ममेन्द्रत्वमीप्सितम् ।।
data.md: Skanda said: O Indra, continue to rule over the three worlds with self-possession and with a desire for (new) conquests. I shall remain your humble servant. I do not desire to get your sovereignity.

data.v: बलं तवाद्भुतं वीर त्वं देवानामरीञ्जहि । अवज्ञास्यन्ति मां लोका वीर्येण तव विस्मिताः ।।
data.md: Indra said: O hero, your prowess is wonderful. Therefore vanquish the enemies of the celestials. People have been greatly astonished to see your unirivalled prowess.

data.v: इन्द्रत्वेऽपि स्थितं वीर बलहीनं पराजितम् । आवयोश्च मिथो भेदे प्रयतिष्यन्त्यतन्द्रिताः ।।
data.md: I have been bereft of my prowess. Defeated as I am by you, if I am now to act as Indra, I will not be able to command the respect of all creatures. Every one would be busy to bring about disunion, then O lord, they would be the partisans of one or other of us.

data.v: भेदिते च त्वयि विभो लोको द्वैधमुपेष्यति । द्विधाभूतेषु लोकेषु निश्चितेष्वावयोस्तथा । विग्रहः संप्रवर्तेत भूतभेदान्महाबल ।।
data.md: I have been bereft of my prowess. Defeated as I am by you, if I am now to act as Indra, I will not be able to command the respect of all creatures. Every one would be busy to bring about disunion, then O lord, they would be the partisans of one or other of us.

data.v: तत्र त्वं मां रणे तात यथाश्रद्धं विजेष्यसि । तस्मादिन्द्रो भवानद्य भविता मा विचारय ।।
data.md: O greatly powerful one, when they will form themselves into two distinct factions, war as before would be the result of that disunion. In that war you will undoubtedly be able to defeat me at your pleasure and then to become the lord of all the worlds. Don't think on this subject.

data.v: त्वमेव राजा भद्रं ते त्रैलोक्यस्य ममैव च । करोमि किं च ते शक्र शासनं तद्ब्रवीहि मे ।।
data.md: Skanda said: O Indra, you are my king as well as that of the three worlds. May prosperity come to you. Tell me if I can obey any of your commands.

data.v: यदि सत्यमिदं वाक्यं निश्चयाद्भाषितं त्वया । यदि वा शासनं स्कन्द कर्तुमिच्छसि मे शृणु ।।
data.md: Indra said: O greatly powerful one, O Skanda, at your command I shall continue to act as Indra. If you have said this deliberately and earnestly then hear me how you can gratify your desire to serve me. Become the generallissimo of the celestial army.

data.v: अभिषिच्यस्व देवानां सेनापत्ये महाबल । अहमिन्द्रो भविष्यामि तव वाक्यान्महाबल ।।
दानवानां विनाशाय देवानामर्थसिद्धये । गोब्राह्मणस्य त्राणार्थं सेनापत्येऽभिषिञ्च माम् ।।
data.md: Skand said: Instal me (then) as the generallisimo (of the celestial army) for the destruction of the Danavas, for the good of the celestials and for the well-being of Brahmanas and kine.

data.v: सोऽभिषिक्तो मघवता सर्वैर्देवगणैः सह । अतीव शुशुभे तत्र पूज्यमानो महर्षिभिः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Thus having been installed by Indra and all the other celestials and honoured by the great Rishis, he looked exceedingly grand. The golden umbrella (held over his head) looked like a halo of blazing fire.

data.v: तस्य तत्काञ्चनं छत्रं ध्रियमाणं व्यरोचत । यथैव सुसमिद्धस्य पावकस्यात्ममण्डलम् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Thus having been installed by Indra and all the other celestials and honoured by the great Rishis, he looked exceedingly grand. The golden umbrella (held over his head) looked like a halo of blazing fire.

data.v: विश्वकर्मकृता चास्य दिव्या माला हिरण्मयी । आबद्धा त्रिपुरघ्नेन स्वयमेव यशस्विना ।।
data.md: O foremost of men, that illustrious deity, the vanquisher of Tripura (Indra) Lord Shiva with his wife came there and put round his neck the celestial garland of gold mady by Vishwakarma.

data.v: आगम्य मनुजव्याघ्र सह देव्या परंतप । अर्चयामास सुप्रीतो भगवान्गोवृषध्वजः ।।
रुद्रमग्निं द्विजाः प्राहू रुद्रसूनुस्ततस्तु सः । रुद्रेण शुक्रमुत्सृष्टं तच्छ्वेतः पर्वतोऽभवत् । पावकस्येन्द्रियं श्वेते कृत्तिकाभिः कृतं नगे ।।
data.md: The semen ejaculated by Rudra converted in the form of a white mountain. The constalations Krittikas etc. had transmitted the was fire semen at that white mountain made of Rudras semen.

data.v: पूज्यमानं तु रुद्रेण दृष्ट्वा सर्वे दिवौकसः । रुद्रसूनुं ततः प्राहुर्गुहं गुणवतां वरम् ।।
data.md: As Rudra was seen by all the dwellers of heaven to honour Guha (Skanda), the foremost of all accomplished beings is for this reason called the son of Rudra.

data.v: अनुप्रविश्य रुद्रेण वह्निं जातो ह्ययं शिशुः । तत्र जातस्ततः स्कन्दो रुद्रसूनुस्ततोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: The child had his birth from the action of Rudra entering into the constitution of the deity of fire and for this reasort Skanda is called the son of Rudra.

data.v: रुद्रस्य वह्नेः स्वाहायाः षण्णां स्त्रीणां च तेजसा । जातः स्कन्दः सुरश्रेष्ठो रुद्रसूनुस्ततोऽभवत् ।।
data.md: O descendant of Bharata, as Rudra, that fire god, (Skanda) Svaha and the six wives (of the seven Rishis) were the cause of the birth of the great deity Skanda, so was he for that reason called the son of Rudra.

data.v: अरजे वाससी रक्ते वसानः पावकात्मजः । भाति दीप्तवपुः श्रीमान्रक्ताभ्राभ्यामिवांशुमान् ।।
data.md: That son of the deity of fire was clad in a pair of red cloths. He thus looked like the sun peeing from behind a mass of red clouds.

data.v: कुक्कुटश्चाग्निना दत्तस्तस्य केतुरलंकृतः । रथे समुच्छ्रितो भाति कालाग्निरिव लोहितः ।।
data.md: The red cock given to him by the fire god became his sign. When sitting on the flag-staff of his car it looked like the very image of the all destroying fire.

data.v: विवेश कवचं चास्य शरीरं सहजं ततः । युध्यमानस्य देवस्य प्रादुर्भवति तत्सदा ।।
शक्तिर्वर्म बलं तेजः कान्तत्वं सत्यमक्षतिः । ब्रह्मण्यत्वमसंमोहो भक्तानां परिरक्षणम् ।।
निकृन्तनं च शत्रूणां लोकानां चाभिरक्षणम् । स्कन्देन सह जातानि सर्वाण्येव जनाधिप ।।
एवं देवगणैः सर्वैः सोऽभिषिक्तः स्वलंकृतः । बभौ प्रतीतः सुमनाः परिपूर्णेन्दुदर्शनः ।।
data.md: Thus installed by all the celestial, he looked pleased and complacient. Dressed in his best style, he looked as beautiful as the full moon.

data.v: इष्टैः स्वाध्यायघोषैश्च देवतूर्यरवैरपि । देवगन्धर्वगीतैश्च सर्वैरप्सरसां गणैः ।।
data.md: The much esteemed incantation of the Vedic hymns, the music of the celestial musicians, the songs of the celestial and the Gandharvas then rose on all sides.

data.v: एतैश्चान्यैश्च विविधैर्हृष्टतुष्टैरलंकृतैः । क्रीडन्निव तदा देवैरभिषिक्तः स पावकिः ।।
अभिषिक्तं महासेनमपश्यन्त दिवौकसः । विनिहत्य तमः सूर्यं यथेहाभ्युदितं तथा ।।
अथैनमभ्ययुः सर्वा देवसेनाः सहस्रशः । अस्माकं त्वं पतिरिति ब्रुवाणाः सर्वतोदिशम् ।।
ताः समासाद्य भगवान्सर्वभूतगणैर्वृतः । अर्चितश्च स्तुतश्चैव सान्त्वयामास ता अपि ।।
data.md: Saying “You are our lord”, came to him from all directions. That exalted one, surrounded by all creatures and praised and with honoured by them, encouraged them in return. Satakratu (Indra) also, after having installed Skanda as the generallissimo of the celestial army.

data.v: शतक्रतुश्चाभिषिच्य स्कन्दं सेनापतिं तदा । सस्मार तां देवसेनां या सा तेन विमोक्षिता ।।
अयं तस्याः पतिर्नूनं विहितो ब्रह्मणा स्वयम् । इति चिन्त्यानयामास देवसेनां स्वलंकृताम् ।।
स्कन्दं चोवाच बलभिदियं कन्या सुरोत्तम । अजाते त्वयि निर्दिष्टा तव पत्नी स्वयंभुवा ।।
तस्मात्त्वमस्या विधिवत्पाणिं मन्त्रपुरस्कृतम् । गृहाण दक्षिणं देव्याः पाणिना पद्मवर्चसम् ।।
एवमुक्तः स जग्राह तस्याः पाणिं यथाविधि । बृहस्पतिर्मन्त्रविधिं जजाप च जुहाव च ।।
एवं स्कन्दस्य महिषीं देवसेनां विदुर्बुधाः । षष्ठीं यां ब्राह्मणाः प्राहुर्लक्ष्मीमाशां सुखप्रदाम् । सिनीवालीं कुहूं चैव सद्वृत्तिमपराजिताम् ।।
data.md: She was also called by the Brahmanas as Shashti, Lakshmi, Asha, Sukhaprada, Sinivali, Kuhu, Sadvritti and Aprajita.

data.v: यदा स्कन्दः पतिर्लब्धः शाश्वतो देवसेनया । तदा तमाश्रयल्लक्ष्मीः स्वयं देवी शरीरिणी ।।
data.md: When Skanda was married to Devasena, the goddess of wealth in her embodied form waited upon him with diligence. As Skanda attained celebrity on the fifth lunar day, it was called Sripanchami; and as he obtained his object in the sixth, that day was considered to be a great tihi.

data.v: श्रीजुष्टः पञ्चमीं स्कन्दस्तस्माच्छ्रीपञ्चमी स्मृता । षष्ठ्यां कृतार्थोऽभूद्यस्मात्तस्मात्षष्ठी महातिथिः ।।
data.md: When Skanda was married to Devasena, the goddess of wealth in her embodied form waited upon him with diligence. As Skanda attained celebrity on the fifth lunar day, it was called Sripanchami; and as he obtained his object in the sixth, that day was considered to be a great tihi.

data.v: श्रिया जुष्टं महासेनं देवसेनापतिं कृतम् । सप्तर्षिपत्न्यः षड्देव्यस्तत्सकाशमथागमन् ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Those six ladies, the wives of the seven Rishis, when they learnt that Mahasena had been blessed with good fortune and he had been made the generallissimo of the celestial army, all came to him.

data.v: ऋषिभिः संपरित्यक्ता धर्मयुक्ता महाव्रताः । द्रुतमागम्य चोचुस्ता देवसेनापतिं प्रभुम् ।।
data.md: Those virtuous and vow-observing ones, having been abandoned by the Rishis, came to the celestial and exalted generallisimo and spoke to him thus.

data.v: वयं पुत्र परित्यक्ता भर्तृभिर्देवसंमितैः । अकारणाद्रुषा तात पुण्यस्थानात्परिच्युताः ।।
data.md: “O son, we have been abandoned by our celestial like husbands without any cause. Some spread the remour that we gave birth to you. Believing this story, they beacme angry and they banished us from our holy places. You should save us from this infamy.

data.v: अस्माभिः किल जातस्त्वमिति केनाप्युदाहृतम् । असत्यमेतत्संश्रुत्य तस्मान्नस्त्रातुमर्हसि ।।
data.md: “O son, we have been abandoned by our celestial like husbands without any cause. Some spread the remour that we gave birth to you. Believing this story, they beacme angry and they banished us from our holy places. You should save us from this infamy.

data.v: अक्षयश्च भवेत्स्वर्गस्त्वत्प्रसादाद्धि नः प्रभो । त्वां पुत्रं चाप्यभीप्सामः कृत्वैतदनृणो भव ।।
data.md: We desire to adopt you as our son, so that, O lord, everlasting bliss might be secured to us through your favour. Repay thus the obligation you owe to us.

data.v: मातरो हि भवत्यो मे सुतो वोऽहमनिन्दिताः । यच्चाभीप्सथ तत्सर्वं संभविष्यति वस्तथा ।।
data.md: Skanda said: Ofurltless ones, become my mothers. I am your son. You will obtain all the desires of your mind.

data.v: एवमुक्ते ततः शक्रं किं कार्यमिति सोऽब्रवीत् । उक्तः स्कन्देन ब्रूहीति सोऽब्रवीद्वासवस्ततः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Thereupon Shakra (Indra), having expressed his desire to say something to Skanda, the latter said, "What is it? Tell it to me.” Being thus told by Skanda, Vasava thus spoke.

data.v: अभिजित्स्पर्धमाना तु रोहिण्या कन्यसी स्वसा । इच्छन्ती ज्येष्ठतां देवी तपस्तप्तुं वनं गता ।।
data.md: "The lady Abhijit, the younger sister of Rohini, being jealous and desirous of becoming the eldest, has gone to the forest to perform asceticism.

data.v: तत्र मूढोऽस्मि भद्रं ते नक्षत्रं गगनाच्च्युतम् । कालं त्विमं परं स्कन्द ब्रह्मणा सह चिन्तय ।।
data.md: I amn at a loss to find out one to replace that fallen star. O Skanda, be blessed. Consult with Brahma about this matter.

data.v: धनिष्ठादिस्तदा कालो ब्रह्मणा परिनिर्मितः । रोहिण्याद्योऽभवत्पूर्वमेवं संख्या समाभवत् ।।
data.md: Dhanishtha and other constellations were created by Brahma. Rohini was one of them and with her their number was full."

data.v: एवमुक्ते तु शक्रेण त्रिदिवं कृत्तिका गताः । नक्षत्रं शकटाकारं भाति तद्वह्निदैवतम् ।।
data.md: Having been thus addressed (by Indra), Skanda sent Kritika. She was placed in heavens. That star, presided over by Agni, shone as if with seven heads.

data.v: विनता चाब्रवीत्स्कन्दं मम त्वं पिण्डदः सुतः । इच्छामि नित्यमेवाहं त्वया पुत्र सहासितुम् ।।
data.md: Vinata also said to Skanda, “You are my son entitled to offer me oblations. O son, I desire to live with you always."

data.v: एवमस्तु नमस्तेऽस्तु पुत्रस्नेहात्प्रशाधि माम् । स्नुषया पूज्यमाना वै देवि वत्स्यसि नित्यदा ।।
data.md: Skanda said: "So be it. I bow my head to you. Guide me with a mother's affection. Respected by your daughter-in-law, you will always live with me.

data.v: अथ मातृगणः सर्वः स्कन्दं वचनमब्रवीत् । वयं सर्वस्य लोकस्य मातरः कविभिः स्तुताः । इच्छामो मातरस्तुभ्यं भवितुं पूजयस्व नः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Thereupon the great mothers thus spoke to Skanda, “We are called by the learned as the mothers of all creatures. But we desire to be your mother; therefore honour and respect us.

data.v: मातरस्तु भवत्यो मे भवतीनामहं सुतः । उच्यतां यन्मया कार्यं भवतीनामथेप्सितम् ।।
data.md: Skanda said: Become mothers to me and let me be your son. Tell me what I can do to please you.

data.v: यास्तु ता मातरः पूर्वं लोकस्यास्य प्रकल्पिताः । अस्माकं तद्भवेत्स्थानं तासां चैव न तद्भवेत् ।।
भवेम पूज्या लोकस्य न ताः पूज्याः सुरर्षभ । प्रजास्माकं हृतास्ताभिस्त्वत्कृते ताः प्रयच्छ नः ।।
data.md: The mothers said: in the days of your, the ladies were appointed as the mothers of creatures. O foremost of deities, we desire that they are disposed of that dignity. Let us be installed in their place. Let us be worshipped instead of them by all the worlds. Restore us our those progeny whom we have been deprived of by thein.

data.v: दत्ताः प्रजा न ताः शक्या भवतीभिर्निषेवितुम् । अन्यां वः कां प्रयच्छामि प्रजां यां मनसेच्छथ ।।
data.md: Skanda said: You shall not get back those offsprings that have been once given away. But if you like, I can give you (new) progeny.

data.v: इच्छाम तासां मातॄणां प्रजा भोक्तुं प्रयच्छ नः । त्वया सह पृथग्भूता ये च तासामथेश्वराः ।।
data.md: The mothers said : We desire that while living with you we may be able to eat up the progeny of those mothers and their grandsons by assuming different shapes. Grant us this favour.

data.v: प्रजा वो दद्मि कष्टं तु भवतीभिरुदाहृतम् । परिरक्षत भद्रं वः प्रजाः साधु नमस्कृताः ।।
data.md: Skanda said: I can grant you progeny. But what you ask is very painful. Be blessed. O mothers, I bow my head to you, do give them your protection and care.

data.v: परिरक्षाम भद्रं ते प्रजाः स्कन्द यथेच्छसि । त्वया नो रोचते स्कन्द सहवासश्चिरं प्रभो ।।
data.md: The mothers said: O Skanda, we shall protect them as you desire. Be blessed, O lord Skanda, we desire to live with you always.

data.v: यावत्षोडश वर्षाणि भवन्ति तरुणाः प्रजाः । प्रबाधत मनुष्याणां तावद्रूपैः पृथग्विधैः ।।
data.md: Skanda said: So long the children of the human race do not attain the youthful state in their sixteenth year, you will afflict them inyour various forms. I shall bestow on you a fearful and inexhaustible spirit; with this you shall live happily and you shall also be worshipped by all.

data.v: अहं च वः प्रदास्यामि रौद्रमात्मानमव्ययम् । परमं तेन सहिता सुखं वत्स्यथ पूजिताः ।।
data.md: Skanda said: So long the children of the human race do not attain the youthful state in their sixteenth year, you will afflict them inyour various forms. I shall bestow on you a fearful and inexhaustible spirit; with this you shall live happily and you shall also be worshipped by all.

data.v: ततः शरीरात्स्कन्दस्य पुरुषः काञ्चनप्रभः । भोक्तुं प्रजाः स मर्त्यानां निष्पपात महाबलः ।।
data.md: Markandeya said : Then a mighty fiery-being sprang up from the body of Skanda to devour the progeny of the human beings.

data.v: अपतत्स तदा भूमौ विसंज्ञोऽथ क्षुधान्वितः । स्कन्देन सोऽभ्यनुज्ञातो रौद्ररूपोऽभवद्ग्रहः । स्कन्दापस्मारमित्याहुर्ग्रहं तं द्विजसत्तमाः ।।
data.md: He fell down upon the ground senseless and hungry. At the command of Skanda, that evil spirit assumed a fearful form.

data.v: विनता तु महारौद्रा कथ्यते शकुनिग्रहः । पूतनां राक्षसीं प्राहुस्तं विद्यात्पूतनाग्रहम् ।।
कष्टा दारुणरूपेण घोररूपा निशाचरी । पिशाची दारुणाकारा कथ्यते शीतपूतना । गर्भान्सा मानुषीणां तु हरते घोरदर्शना ।।
data.md: She, who is known as Putana Rakshashi by the learned, is the Graha called Putana. That fearful and terrible Rakshashi of a hideous form is called the Pishachi Shita Putana. That fearful spirit causes abortion in women.

data.v: अदितिं रेवतीं प्राहुर्ग्रहस्तस्यास्तु रैवतः । सोऽपि बालाञ्शिशून्घोरो बाधते वै महाग्रहः ।।
data.md: Aditi is also known by the name of Revati; her spirits are called Raivata. That Graha also afflicts children.

data.v: दैत्यानां या दितिर्माता तामाहुर्मुखमण्डिकाम् । अत्यर्थं शिशुमांसेन संप्रहृष्टा दुरासदा ।।
data.md: O descendant of Kuru, Diti, the mother of the Daityas, is also called Mukhamandika. That fearful spirit is very fond of little children's flesh. Those male and female children, who are said to have been begotten by Skanda, are also evil spirits; and they all destroy the fetus in the womb.

data.v: कुमाराश्च कुमार्यश्च ये प्रोक्ताः स्कन्दसंभवाः । तेऽपि गर्भभुजः सर्वे कौरव्य सुमहाग्रहाः ।।
data.md: O descendant of Kuru, Diti, the mother of the Daityas, is also called Mukhamandika. That fearful spirit is very fond of little children's flesh. Those male and female children, who are said to have been begotten by Skanda, are also evil spirits; and they all destroy the fetus in the womb.

data.v: तासामेव कुमारीणां पतयस्ते प्रकीर्तिताः । अज्ञायमाना गृह्णन्ति बालकान्रौद्रकर्मिणः ।।
data.md: They are known as the husbands of these female spirits. Children are unawares attacked by these female creatures.

data.v: गवां माता तु या प्राज्ञैः कथ्यते सुरभिर्नृप । शकुनिस्तामथारुह्य सह भुङ्क्ते शिशून्भुवि ।।
data.md: O king, Surabhi, who is called the mother of all animals of the bovine species, is ridden by Shakuni who along with her devours children on earth.

data.v: सरमा नाम या माता शुनां देवी जनाधिप । सापि गर्भान्समादत्ते मानुषीणां सदैव हि ।।
data.md: O ruler of men, Sarama the mother of gods, also habitually kills all children when they remain in the womb.

data.v: पादपानां च या माता करञ्जनिलया हि सा । करञ्जे तां नमस्यन्ति तस्मात्पुत्रार्थिनो नराः ।।
data.md: She, who is the mother of all trees, dwells in a Karanja tree. She is a giver of boons, she has a placid countenance and she is always favourably disposed towards all creatures.

data.v: इमे त्वष्टादशान्ये वै ग्रहा मांसमधुप्रियाः । द्विपञ्चरात्रं तिष्ठन्ति सततं सूतिकागृहे ।।
data.md: Those who desire to have children bow down to her who seats on Karanja tree. Those eighteen evil spirits, fond of meat and wine and also other food of the same kind, live for ten days in the lyings in room. Kadru assuming a subtle form enters into the womb of a woman. And she there destroys the fetus. The mother is thus made to give birth to a Naga.

data.v: कद्रूः सूक्ष्मवपुर्भूत्वा गर्भिणीं प्रविशेद्यदा । भुङ्क्ते सा तत्र तं गर्भं सा तु नागं प्रसूयते ।।
गन्धर्वाणां तु या माता सा गर्भं गृह्य गच्छति । ततो विलीनगर्भा सा मानुषी भुवि दृश्यते ।।
data.md: She who is the mother of the Gandharvas takes away the fetus. And thus the woman is seen on the earth to have an abhortive conception.

data.v: या जनित्री त्वप्सरसां गर्भमास्ते प्रगृह्य सा । उपविष्टं ततो गर्भं कथयन्ति मनीषिणः ।।
data.md: She who is the mother of the Apsaras removes the fetus from the womb. And then the learned men say that the conception has become stationary.

data.v: लोहितस्योदधेः कन्या धात्री स्कन्दस्य सा स्मृता । लोहितायनिरित्येवं कदम्बे सा हि पूज्यते ।।
data.md: The daughter of the deity of blood is said to be the nurse of Skanda. She is therefore worshipped under the name of Lohitayani on Kadamba trees.

data.v: पुरुषेषु यथा रुद्रस्तथार्या प्रमदास्वपि । आर्या माता कुमारस्य पृथक्कामार्थमिज्यते ।।
data.md: This revered goddess acts the same part among the females as does Rudra among the males. She is the mother of all children; she is specially worshipped for their welfare. I have thus described to you all the evil spirits that preside over the destiny of children. Until children attain their sixteenth year, these spirits exercise their influence for evil and after that for good.

data.v: एवमेते कुमाराणां मया प्रोक्ता महाग्रहाः । यावत्षोडश वर्षाणि अशिवास्ते शिवास्ततः ।।
data.md: This revered goddess acts the same part among the females as does Rudra among the males. She is the mother of all children; she is specially worshipped for their welfare. I have thus described to you all the evil spirits that preside over the destiny of children. data.v: ये च मातृगणाः प्रोक्ताः पुरुषाश्चैव ये ग्रहाः । सर्वे स्कन्दग्रहा नाम ज्ञेया नित्यं शरीरिभिः ।।
data.md: The male and female spirits that I have described to you are always called by men as the spirits of Skanda.

data.v: तेषां प्रशमनं कार्यं स्नानं धूपमथाञ्जनम् । बलिकर्मोपहारश्च स्कन्दस्येज्या विशेषतः ।।
data.md: They are propitiated with burnt offerings, ablutions, unguents, sacrifices and other offerings and particularly by the worship of Skanda.

data.v: एवमेतेऽर्चिताः सर्वे प्रयच्छन्ति शुभं नृणाम् । आयुर्वीर्यं च राजेन्द्र सम्यक्पूजानमस्कृताः ।।
data.md: O king of kings, when they are respected and honoured in due form, they bestow on men whatever is good for them and also valour and long life. Having made due salutation to the great god, I shall now describe to you the nature of those spirits that influence the destinies of men after they have attained their sixteenth year.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं तु षोडशाद्वर्षाद्ये भवन्ति ग्रहा नृणाम् । तानहं संप्रवक्ष्यामि नमस्कृत्य महेश्वरम् ।।
data.md: O king of kings, when they are respected and honoured in due form, they bestow on men whatever is good for them and also valour and long life. Having made due salutation to the great god, I shall now describe to you the nature of those spirits that influence the destinies of men after they have attained their sixteenth year.

data.v: यः पश्यति नरो देवाञ्जाग्रद्वा शयितोऽपि वा । उन्माद्यति स तु क्षिप्रं तं तु देवग्रहं विदुः ।।
data.md: The man who sees the celestials while sleeping or while he is awake soon turn mad. The spirits under whose influence this happens, are called the celestial spirits.

data.md: The man who sees the celestials while sleeping or while he is awake soon turn mad. The spirits under whose influence this happens, are called the celestial spirits.

data.v: अवमन्यति यः सिद्धान्क्रुद्धाश्चापि शपन्ति यम् । उन्माद्यति स तु क्षिप्रं ज्ञेयः सिद्धग्रहस्तु सः ।।
data.md: The man who sees the celestials while sleeping or while he is awake soon turn mad. The spirits under whose influence this happens, are called the celestial spirits.

data.v: उपाघ्राति च यो गन्धान्रसांश्चापि पृथग्विधान् । उन्माद्यति स तु क्षिप्रं स ज्ञेयो राक्षसो ग्रहः ।।
data.md: The man who sees the celestials while sleeping or while he is awake soon turn mad. The spirits under whose influence this happens, are called the celestial spirits.

data.v: गन्धर्वाश्चापि यं दिव्याः संस्पृशन्ति नरं भुवि । उन्माद्यति स तु क्षिप्रं ग्रहो गान्धर्व एव सः ।।
data.md: The man who shows disrespect to the Siddhas and who is cursed by them in return soon turns mad. The evil spirit who causes this is called the Siddha spirit.

data.v: आविशन्ति च यं यक्षाः पुरुषं कालपर्यये । उन्माद्यति स तु क्षिप्रं ज्ञेयो यक्षग्रहस्तु सः ।।
data.md: The man who shows disrespect to the Siddhas and who is cursed by them in return soon turns mad. The evil spirit who causes this is called the Siddha spirit.

data.v: अधिरोहन्ति यं नित्यं पिशाचाः पुरुषं क्वचित् । उन्माद्यति स तु क्षिप्रं पैशाचं तं ग्रहं विदुः ।।
data.md: The man who sees the celestials while sleeping or while he is awake soon turn mad. The spirits under whose influence this happens, are called the celestial spirits.

data.md: When a man sees his deceased ancestors while he is comfortably seated or while he is lying in his bed, he turns mad. The spirit who causes this is called ancestral spirit.

data.v: राजन्नद्यावगच्छामि तवेह लघुसत्त्वताम् । किमत्र चित्रं यद्वीर मोक्षितः पाण्डवैरसि । सद्यो वशं समापन्नः शत्रूणां शत्रुकर्शन ।।
data.md: Karna said.: O king, your today's conduct is childish. O hero, what is to be wondered at in all this, that you were rescued by the Pandavas.

data.md: O lord of men, it is the certain duty of those who live in a king's dominion to do which is agreeable to that king, what is there then to be Sorry for?

data.md: That they did not follow you when you marched to battle at the head of your troops. They have long before come under your power by becoming your slaves. Endued as they are with courage and prowess and incapable as they are to turn back from the field of battle they are bound to help you. You are now enjoying all the rich possessions of the Pandavas; O king, see, the Pandavas are yet active. They have not resolved to die by fasting. Rise, () king, be blessed; you should not grieve.

data.md: O lord of men, it is the certain duty of those who live in a king's dominion to do which is agreeable to that king, what is there then to be Sorry for?

data.v: मद्वाक्यमेतद्राजेन्द्र यद्येवं न करिष्यसि । स्थास्यामीह भवत्पादौ शुश्रूषन्नरिमर्दन ।।
data.md: O king of kings, O chastiser of foes, if you do not act as I say, I shall then stay here and serve at your feet with all respect.

data.v: नोत्सहे जीवितुमहं त्वद्विहीनो नरर्षभ । प्रायोपविष्टस्तु नृप राज्ञां हास्यो भविष्यसि ।।
data.md: O forernost of men, O king, I do not desire to live without you. If you resolve to die by fasting, you will simply be the laughing-stock of all other kings.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु कर्णेन राजा दुर्योधनस्तदा । नैवोत्थातुं मनश्चक्रे स्वर्गाय कृतनिश्चयः ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having been thus addressed by Karna, king Duryodhana, being firmly resolved to die, determined not to rise from the place where he sat.

data.v: प्रायोपविष्टं राजानं दुर्योधनममर्षणम् । उवाच सान्त्वयन्राजञ्शकुनिः सौबलस्तदा ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : O king, seeing Duryodhana who is always incapable of putting up with an insult, seated with the determination of dying by starvation, the son of Subala, Shakuni, spoke thus.

data.v: सम्यगुक्तं हि कर्णेन तच्छ्रुतं कौरव त्वया । मयाहृतां श्रियं स्फीतां मोहात्समपहाय किम् । त्वमबुद्ध्या नृपवर प्राणानुत्स्रष्टुमिच्छसि ।।
data.md: Shakuni said: O descendant of Kuru, you have heard that Karna has said. His words are indeed full of wisdom. O king, why should you foolishly throw away the great prosperity that I won for you by abandoning your life today through mere silliness? It appears to me today that you never waited upon (wise) old men.

data.v: अद्य चाप्यवगच्छामि न वृद्धाः सेवितास्त्वया । यः समुत्पतितं हर्षं दैन्यं वा न नियच्छति । स नश्यति श्रियं प्राप्य पात्रमाममिवाम्भसि ।।
data.md: Like an unburnt earthen vessel in water, he, who is incapable of controlling sudden occasions of joy or grief, is lost even if he obtains prosperity.

data.v: अतिभीरुमतिक्लीबं दीर्घसूत्रं प्रमादिनम् । व्यसनाद्विषयाक्रान्तं न भजन्ति नृपं श्रियः ।।
data.md: The king who is entirely destitute of courage, no has no spark of manliness, who is the slave of procrastination and who is addicted to sensual pleasures is never respected by his subjects.

data.v: सत्कृतस्य हि ते शोको विपरीते कथं भवेत् । मा कृतं शोभनं पार्थैः शोकमालम्ब्य नाशय ।।
data.md: Befitted as you have been, whence is this unseasonable grief of yours? Do not undo this graceful act done by the sons of Pritha by indulging in grief.

data.v: यत्र हर्षस्त्वया कार्यः सत्कर्तव्याश्च पाण्डवाः । तत्र शोचसि राजेन्द्र विपरीतमिदं तव ।।
data.md: O king of kings, when you should express your joy and reward the Pandavas, you are grieving. Your this behaviour is very inconsistent.

data.v: प्रसीद मा त्यजात्मानं तुष्टश्च सुकृतं स्मर । प्रयच्छ राज्यं पार्थानां यशो धर्ममवाप्नुहि ।।
data.md: Be cheerful; do not abandon your life. But with a very pleased heart think of the good work they have done to you. Give back to the sons of Pritha their kingdom and win both virtue and renown by your this act.

data.v: क्रियामेतां समाज्ञाय कृतघ्नो न भविष्यसि । सौभ्रात्रं पाण्डवैः कृत्वा समवस्थाप्य चैव तान् । पित्र्यं राज्यं प्रयच्छैषां ततः सुखमवाप्नुहि ।।
data.md: Establishing brotherly relations with the Pandavas, become their friends and make them your friends, give them back their paternal kingdom, for you will then be happy.

data.v: शकुनेस्तु वचः श्रुत्वा दुःशासनमवेक्ष्य च । पादयोः पतितं वीरं विक्लवं भ्रातृसौहृदात् ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having heard the words of Shakuni and having seen Dushashana lying at the feet of the king (Duryodhana) unmanned by fraternal affection, the king raised Dushashana and clasping him in his well formed arms he smelt his head.

data.v: बाहुभ्यां साधुजाताभ्यां दुःशासनमरिंदमम् । उत्थाप्य संपरिष्वज्य प्रीत्याजिघ्रत मूर्धनि ।।
data.md: Vaishampayana said : Having heard the words of Shakuni and having seen Dushashana lying at the feet of the king (Duryodhana) unmanned by fraternal affection, the king raised Dushashana and clasping him in his well formed arms he smelt his head.

data.v: कर्णसौबलयोश्चापि संस्मृत्य वचनान्यसौ । निर्वेदं परमं गत्वा राजा दुर्योधनस्तदा । व्रीडयाभिपरीतात्मा नैराश्यमगमत्परम् ।।
data.md: Having heard the words of Karna and Subala's son (Shakuni), the king Duryodhana was overwhelmed with shame. He lost heart more than ever and utter despair overtook his soul.

data.v: सुहृदां चैव तच्छ्रुत्वा समन्युरिदमब्रवीत् । न धर्मधनसौख्येन नैश्वर्येण न चाज्ञया । नैव भोगैश्च मे कार्यं मा विहन्यत गच्छत ।।
data.md: Having heard all that his friends said, he thus again spoke in sorrow, "I have nothing more to do with virtue, wealth, friendship, affluence, sovereignty and enjoyments. Do not oppose me; leave me all of you. I am firmly resolved to abandon my life by fasting. Go back to the city and worship all my Gurus with respect."

data.v: निश्चितेयं मम मतिः स्थिता प्रायोपवेशने । गच्छध्वं नगरं सर्वे पूज्याश्च गुरवो मम ।।
data.md: Having heard all that his friends said, he thus again spoke in sorrow, "I have nothing more to do with virtue, wealth, friendship, affluence, sovereignty and enjoyments. data.v: त एवमुक्ताः प्रत्यूचू राजानमरिमर्दनम् । या गतिस्तव राजेन्द्र सास्माकमपि भारत । कथं वा संप्रवेक्ष्यामस्त्वद्विहीनाः पुरं वयम् ।।
data.md: Having been thus addressed by him, they thus replied to that royal chastiser of foes, “O king of kings, O descendant of Bharata, the course that is yours is also ours. How can we enter the city without you?”

data.md: Vaishampayana said : Though addressed in all manner of ways by his friends and counsellors and brothers and relatives, the king waved not from his firm resolve.

data.md: In accordance with his resolve, he spread Kusha grass on the ground and purifying himself by touching water, he sat down on it. Clad in rags and Kusha grass, he engaged in observing the greatest vow. That foremost of kings, with the desire of going to heaven, stopped all speech. He began to pray and worship internally and he suspended all external intercourse.

data.v: अथ तं निश्चयं तस्य बुद्ध्वा दैतेयदानवाः । पातालवासिनो रौद्राः पूर्वं देवैर्विनिर्जिताः ।।

data.md: On learning his resolve, the sons of Diti and the Danavas, who live in the nether region and who were once defeated by the celestials, fearing that their party would be destroyed without Duryodhana, began a sacrifice with fire to summon him before them. Mantraknowing men then commenced with the formulae of Brihaspati and Ushana. Those rites that are indicated in the Atharvaveda and the Upanishadas and which are capable of being achieved by mantras and prayers.

data.md: With well-pleased hearts the Daityas commanded her by saying, “Bring here the king, the son of Dhritarashtra, who is now engaged in a vow of fasting."

data.md: Thus commanded, she went away saying, "So be it.” In a moment she came to the place where the king, Duryodhana, was.

data.md: Taking up the king, she brought him to the nether world and within a moment she came back to the Danavas and told them (that she had brought the king). data.md: The Danavas said: O king of kings, O perpetuator of the Bharata race, O Duryodhana, you are always surrounded by heroes and illustrious men.

data.md: Why have you then taken this rash step such as this vow of starvation? Suicide always leads (a man) to hell. It becomes the subject of calumnious speech.

data.v: न हि कार्यविरुद्धेषु बह्वपायेषु कर्मसु । मूलघातिषु सज्जन्ते बुद्धिमन्तो भवद्विधाः ।।
data.md: Intelligent men like you never engage in acts that are sinful and opposed to their best interests and which strike at the very root of their purposes.

data.md: O king, therefore restrain your this resolve. It is destructive of morality, profit and happiness and of fame, prowess and energy. It enhances the joy of one's enemies.

data.md: O king, of lord, know the truth, the celestials origin of your birth and the make up of your body; and then assume patience.

data.md: O king, in the days of yore, we obtained you from Maheshvara by ascetic austerities. The upper part of your body is wholly made of Vajra (thunder).

data.md: On sinless one, therefore it is invincible to weapons of every description. The lower part of your body, capable of captivating the female heart by its comeliness, was made of flowers by the goddess herself.

data.v: एवमीश्वरसंयुक्तस्तव देहो नृपोत्तम । देव्या च राजशार्दूल दिव्यस्त्वं हि न मानुषः ।।
data.md: O foremost of kings, thus your body was created by Ishvara himself and the goddess. Therefore, O best of kings, your origin is celestials and not human.

data.md: Other greatly powerful Kshatriyas headed by Bhagadatta, all learned in the celestials weapons, will kill your enemies.

data.md: Therefore there is not need for you grief. You have no cause for fear. In order to help you, many heroic Danavas have been born on earth.

data.v: भीष्मद्रोणकृपादींश्च प्रवेक्ष्यन्त्यपरेऽसुराः । यैराविष्टा घृणां त्यक्त्वा योत्स्यन्ते तव वैरिभिः ।।
data.md: Other Asura will possess Bhishma, Drona and Karna and others. Possessed by the Asuras, those heroes will cast away their kindness and fight with your enemies.

data.v: अधर्मरुचयो मूढास्तिर्यग्गतिपरायणाः । कृच्छ्रां योनिमनुप्राप्य न सुखं विन्दते जनाः ।।
data.md: Foolish persons, addicted to vice and bestial ways, obtain the birth of beasts in after life and they never enjoy happiness.

data.v: इह यत्क्रियते कर्म तत्परत्रोपभुज्यते । तस्माच्छरीरं युञ्जीत तपसा नियमेन च ।।
data.md: The fruits of acts done in this world are obtained in the next world. Therefore one restrains his body by asceticism and the observance of vows.

data.v: यथाशक्ति प्रयच्छेच्च संपूज्याभिप्रणम्य च । काले पात्रे च हृष्टात्मा राजन्विगतमत्सरः ।।
data.md: O king, being free from guile and with a cheerful spirit, one, according to his power, bestows gifts after bowing down to the recipient and paying him homage.

data.v: सत्यवादी लभेतायुरनायासमथार्जवी । अक्रोधनोऽनसूयश्च निर्वृतिं लभते पराम् ।।
data.md: A truthful man obtains a life which is free from all trouble. A person, free from anger, attains to sincerity and one free from malice obtains supreme contentments. A man who has subdued his senses and his inner faculties never knows tribulation, nor is a person of subdued senses affected by sorrow at the sight of other's prosperity.

data.v: दान्तः शमपरः शश्वत्परिक्लेशं न विन्दति । न च तप्यति दान्तात्मा दृष्ट्वा परगतां श्रियम् ।।
data.md: A truthful man obtains a life which is free from all trouble. A person, free from anger, attains to sincerity and one free from malice obtains supreme contentments. A man who has subdued his senses and his inner faculties never knows tribulation, nor is a person of subdued senses affected by sorrow at the sight of other's prosperity.

data.v: संविभक्ता च दाता च भोगवान्सुखवान्नरः । भवत्यहिंसकश्चैव परमारोग्यमश्नुते ।।
data.md: A man who gives every one his due and he who gives boons obtains happiness and every object of enjoyment, while a man who is free from envy reaps perfect ease.

data.v: मान्यान्मानयिता जन्म कुले महति विन्दति । व्यसनैर्न तु संयोगं प्राप्नोति विजितेन्द्रियः ।।
data.md: He who honours those to whom honour is due obtains birth in an illustrious family and he who has subdued his senses never mects with any misfortune.

data.v: शुभानुशयबुद्धिर्हि संयुक्तः कालधर्मणा । प्रादुर्भवति तद्योगात्कल्याणमतिरेव सः ।।
data.md: A man whose mind follows good after death is born on that account possessing a virtuous mind.

data.v: भगवन्दानधर्माणां तपसो वा महामुने । किं स्विद्बहुगुणं प्रेत्य किं वा दुष्करमुच्यते ।।
data.md: Yudhishthira said : O great Rishi, O exalted one, of the bestowal of gifts and asceticism which is of greater efficacy in the next world and which is more difficult to be practised.
